Name: Business Analyst
Description: OUR AGENCYMake a DifferenceSWIB enables forward thinking professionals opportunities to grow, develop and build excellence with a global investor making a difference in the lives of Wisconsin public employees.With more than $117 billion in total assets, SWIB is one of the world's largest institutional investors. As an independent state agency, SWIB is responsible for managing assets of the Wisconsin Retirement System (WRS) in addition to six separately managed funds. SWIB generates returns for more than 622,000 participants. SWIB has long been considered an investment industry leader because of its ability to grow and protect the WRS assets that its constituents count on for a more secure financial future.Be a World Class LeaderThe WRS is nearly 100 percent funded, making it one of the countrys best funded public employee retirement systems. It is the 9th largest public pension fund in the U.S. and 25th largest public or pension fund in the world. SWIBs performance for the WRS beat the one -, five- and ten-year benchmarks as of Dec. 31, 2017. As an innovative organization SWIB is committed to professional development. Approximately 50 percent of SWIBs investment professionals are Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) charterholders.About the TeamThe Operations Strategy, Planning and Coordination Team is responsible for providing internal consultancy, coordination, and oversight services to support SWIBs investment mandate. The primary functions of the team include providing strategic guidance and direction related to industry trends and practices through a forward-looking lens, coordinating the execution of requests for enhanced investment capabilities and process optimization in the current state, and providing oversight and control of the end-to-end operational process. The team seeks a Business Analyst to leverage broad asset management industry experience to drive a culture focused on continuously improving and innovating support for SWIBs investment capabilities.The Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for driving business unit priorities forward with actionable and executable results. The BA role serves as the primary liaison between each of the investment management teams and the resources (internal and external) necessary to deliver the requested work efforts.Essential activities:Act as the primary relationship manager between the business and operational teams to ensure the business needs are being met.Lead, facilitate and coordinate team meetings to prioritize work requests in partnership with the delegates from assigned business units.Develop a deep understanding of applicable operational processes, procedures, and controls.Build and lead coalition teams to address work efforts approved by the work alignment team and assigned for planning and execution.Draft business requirements at the appropriate level of detail for each work effort, ensuring the cross-functional impacts and any required coordination/integration effort has been identified ahead of the solution.Work with internal and external stakeholders to gather and validate business requirements and assist with the functional design of solutions.Partner with the systems architect role in IT to provide input into the functional aspects of solutions design.In partnership with the Systems Architect, perform functional testing of system enhancements/changes resulting from the work effort.Develop, execute, and document user test plans and organize and oversee end-user testing and acceptance.Develop, or assist in the development, of end-user training materials and coordinate / conduct user training.The Ideal Candidate:Bachelors degree in Information Systems, Business Management or Finance.Minimum of 5 years of experience within the investment management industry.Substantial knowledge of the end-to-end operational lifecycle, including the processes, workflows, systems, and investment tools e.g., Charles River, Eagle PACE, MarkIt, eFront, FactSet, MSCI and/or BlackRock Aladdin to support SWIBs investment business.Substantial knowledge of capital markets and the investment management industry through the lens of SWIBs investment mandate and mission.Detailed exposure to various investment types, security types and asset classes, with a solid understanding of what makes each unique and its intended application within the investment strategy.Detailed familiarity with investment management industry best practice workflows.SWIB Offers:Competitive McLagan-base salaryMeaningful performance-based incentive compensationA comprehensive benefit packageEducational and training opportunitiesTuition reimbursementChallenging work in a professional environmentThe position requires U.S. work authorization and residency in, or willingness to relocate to the Madison, Wisconsin area. SWIB is prepared to offer relocation assistance as needed.Join HIGHER PERFORMERSHome to Top TalentSWIBs professionals shape sophisticated investment management strategies, drive forward looking technologies and deliver strong internal asset management. SWIBs internal team invests approximately 62 percent of its assets under management. As a result, Institutional Investor recognizes SWIB as home to top talent in American public investing.The organization has earned a reputation for investment excellence in part by running much of its portfolio successfully in-house versus outsourcing to Wall Street Institutional Investor.

Name: Business Analyst Managed Services
Description: The Business Analyst works closely with Managed Services management and our supporting Finance team to provide expanded financial analysis and is proactive in taking actions needed to help improve our financial performance. The Business Analyst coordinates Managed Services forecasting and provides detailed analysis on key financial metrics, providing management with timely information needed to set direction and effectively run the business.  Key Areas of Responsibility Analyze financial results, identify opportunities for improved performance, and take action to increase revenue and reduce expenses.Track and report on key revenue and expense items, e.g., closed business, pending customer cancellations, significant expenditures, etc.Provide expanded financial reporting to management and maintain the Managed Services Financial Dashboard.Coordinate the Managed Services forecast and forecasting process.Maintain the forecast model, provide monthly updates to management and Finance, and provide input to Outlook 2 / Outlook 3 projections.Build strong relationships with stakeholders and subject matter experts and help improve financial performance in all areas of the business.Create and maintain a financial model to calculate profit for service offerings / service groups.Document current processes and provide recommendations for improvement.Contribute to business justifications and return on investment measures for significant projects.Provide regular updates on key initiatives and their progress.Identify financial areas of concern early and review with management.Remain current in industry trends, tools, and best practices.Assist with other business management functions including contracts management, exceptions and approvals, pricing, and reporting. Other Responsibilities Maintain the commission database.Track closed pipeline activities and update all associated commission reports.Update commissions splits manager each month with all changes to AE/AM account assignments and commission percentages.Maintain AIM commission reports with payout details and contract expiration dates.Provide recommendations on updates to commission plans.Respond to ad hoc request for commission plan information and payout details.Coordinate the exceptions process and the associated manual commission adjustments.Qualifications Minimum Qualifications Bachelors degree in Business or related field, or equivalent experience Preferred Qualifications Strong analytical and financial modeling skillsInnate problem-solverExperience with Microsoft Excel and other related toolsWorking knowledge of business financeFamiliarity with cost/benefit and ROI data analysis Other Required Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with all stakeholdersAbility to effectively facilitate and lead meetings, tailoring messages to the given audienceExperience in evaluating information, identifying risks and opportunities, while possessing creative problem-solving skills with an understanding of business concepts and models.Demonstrated negotiation and persuasion skills, with the ability to enable mutually beneficial outcomesHistory of balancing multiple priorities simultaneously with the ability to adapt to the changing needs of the business while meeting deadlinesCritical attention to detail and solid creative problem-solving skillsDemonstrated knowledge of the business, organization and solutions that are the back bone of the organizationAbility to adapt to changing conditions, strategies and organizational directionAbility to work in a high performing team environment

Name: Business Analyst II or Sr
Description: Business Analyst II or Sr11/14/201812/14/2018Job ResponsibilitiesAssists in building and maintaining business systems through a system development life cycle (SDLC).Following established procedures, ensures systems are operating as designed, evaluates requests for changes to the system, provides routine system maintenance (e.g., table maintenance and configuration), documents system processes and procedures, suggests system improvements and makes daily decisions involving direct application of technical knowledge to system issues.Typically works on simple to moderately complex and smaller and more defined system projects to assess and refine user requirements and specifications, formulate solutions, develop test plans, conduct testing, and implement systems and system improvements.Articulates customer and technology requirements into structured documents and communications with customers and IT specialists such that the requirements from the customer and from IT can clearly be understood by the other.Typically assists more experienced business analysts in developing business cases for improving and/or developing systems.Maintains relationships with other IT areas. May assist in managing relationships with outside vendors.Follows standard procedures to ensure business systems are operating at an acceptable level of quality. Regularly monitors the use of routine controls (i.e., system uptime, batches, reports, queries), and assists end users in developing reports and/or database queries.Handles simple inquiries regarding the technical aspects of business systems by providing assistance to and coordinating work with IT staff and other business units (e.g., front-end ticket response).Follows standard procedures to provide functional and end-user support including end-user assistance, system maintenance, and troubleshooting.Assists in developing and rolling out system application training materials for technical, departmental and end users.Maintains system documentation that supports system initiatives through manuals, lesson plans and procedures. As a liaison between the IT development group and the Customer Contact Divisions, you provide support in the development and implementation of new business systems and enhancement of current systems, to align with new IT developments and evolving business needs.This role can be based in either Cedar Rapids, IA or Madison, WIThis position can be filled at a level II or Sr. Analyst depending on candidate experience.Applications will be accepted until a qualified pool of candidates is received.Alliant Energy will not provide sponsorship for an employment visa (e.g., H-1B visa) now or in the required.Sr. Analyst: This position requires a four year degree from an accredited college or university, with emphasis in business administration, information systems, or related area and five years of related experienceIn the absence of a degree seven years of related experience is required.Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:Demonstrated ability to work with and maintain highly confidential information.Demonstrated effective interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.Demonstrated ability to lead a project team to the successful conclusion of simple technology initiatives preferred.Demonstrated ability to use computer software programs (e.g., e-mail, word processing, spreadsheet, and project management) and ability to work with new technologies.Demonstrated ability with database query tools (i.e., SQL), automating testing tools (i.e., Winrunner, SQA), workflow diagramming, and reporting and retention tools (i.e., Vista, SAR, Crystal Reports, Infomaker) preferred.Strong organizational skills. Name: Systems Analyst
Description: Company DescriptionRenaissance® is the leader in K-12 learning analytics------enabling teachers, curriculum creators, and educators to drive phenomenal student growth. Renaissances solutions help educators analyze, customize, and plan personalized learning paths for students, allowing time for what matters------creating energizing learning experiences in the classroom. Founded by parents, upheld by educators, and enriched by data scientists, Renaissance knows learning is a continual journey------from year to year, and for a lifetime.  For more information, visit www.renaissance.com.Job DescriptionRenaissance is seeking a Systems Analystwho will be responsible for supporting assigned information systems and related internal applications. Plans, coordinates and monitors the development, implementation, evaluation, and maintenance of business applications and projects. Works as a liaison to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate requirements for changes to processes, policies and information systems. The systems analyst understands business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements and recommends solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Analyzes the business issues and data challenges within business operations, identifying strengths and weaknesses, offering suggested areas for improvement.Assists in planning, coordinating and monitoring the development, implementation, evaluation, and maintenance of business and/or administrative applications and projects to meet project goals and allotted timelines.Develops and maintains applications and solutions in accordance with established standards and procedures.Coordinates and facilitates communication between teams within the IS department and business operations departments.Acts as technological resource to project team. Researches solutions, reporting findings to team. Advises team on possible impact on other systems and processes.Lead testing efforts ensuring issues are identified, tracked, reported on, and resolved in a timely manner.Evaluate and improve existing BI systems.Schedule: M-F 8am-4:30pm while also meeting business needs  QualificationsMinimum Education Required:  Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university or a 2-year Associate Degree: or equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum Related Experience Required:5 years experience with tools to store data (e.g. OLAP cubes) and supporting data analytics platforms ( e.g. Tableau)Experience in business or in an IT applications environment working with business systems and/or in project managementPossesses understanding in the areas of database management, system design, querying, and report-writing skills.Exhibits confidence with the ability to design, implement, and evaluate most effective business solution.Analytical mindset with sharp judgment and attention to details.Possess excellent communication, critical thinking, and decision making skills. Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Employment Category: Regular Full Time Exempt Reports to: Project Manager Travel: Up to 50%  Primary Function/Position Summary  As an Enterprise Business Analyst, you will be part of a team that is responsible for requirements elicitation, process analysis, documentation, configuration, and implementation of Workloud software. Name: Compliance Solutions Analyst
Description: DescriptionRole Purpose: The Compliance Solutions Analyst is responsible for working with Compliance Department Management to ensure Dean Health Plan's (DHP) compliance with state and federal regulatory requirements (e.g. Wisconsin insurance law, federal health care reform, federal ERISA, HIPAA privacy and security, Medicaid, and Medicare managed care). Duties may include, subject to the direction and concurrence of Compliance Management: communicating to the business compliance requirements, assessing likely risks and recommending compliant solutions that support business goals, and actively working with all areas of the business to implement those solutions; and facilitating resolution of compliance issues identified though all channels (e.g. direct reports, external and discretionary audits, government programs oversight, etc.). Essential Job Duties: 1. Represent the Compliance Department and actively participate on business implementation teams by effectively communicating and ensuring adherence to compliance requirements and recommending compliant solutions that support business goals.  2. Communicate compliance issues to the impacted business areas and assist in the development of value-added services through process improvements and best practice policies, at the direction of Compliance Management, to make recommendations for process improvements to ensure compliance and facilitates working to solutions that support business goals.  3. Document compliance issue resolution through the established program or process.  4. Prepare formal updates on compliance issues for reporting to the DHI/DHP Compliance Committee.  5. Partner with other areas of DHP as appropriate to establish and maintain a high level of compliance.  6. Raise internal awareness of legal/regulatory changes impacting DHPs products.  7. Coordinate defined external audits. This includes: researching audit materials, communicating with external regulators for information requests, preparing audit materials for regulators, communicating with business partners, collaborating with the Compliance Specialist (or designee), to verify documentation, and completing necessary audit papers and providing formal reporting to Compliance Management.  8. Assist in workforce education activities; support compliance education initiatives within the business areas.  9. Support vendor oversight activities within the business areas.  10. Assist the HIPAA Privacy Officer in the execution of duties performed in that capacity, including fostering awareness of the importance of safeguarding Protected Health Information (PHI).  11. Assist the Corporate Compliance Officer in the execution of duties performed in that capacity, including supporting the DHP/DHI Corporate Compliance Committee and all sub-committees.QualificationsRequired: 1. A bachelor's degree in business or related field and 3-5 years relevant work experience.  2. Familiarity with Wisconsins managed care environment, DHPs products, the Affordable Care Act and/or the HIPAA Privacy Rule.  3. Strong analytical and problem solving skills.  4. Able to independently research, understand and apply regulatory requirements in a corporate setting.  5. Able to draft insurance policy/benefit language, corporate policies and procedures and proposed legislation.  6. Detail-oriented, organized, and able to manage multiple priorities to effectively meet production and regulatory deadlines in a fast-paced work environment.  7. Works well both independently and in a high-producing team environment.  8. Works with other departments to foster collaborative relationships with peers that promotes corporate compliance.  9. Able to write clearly for the general workforce, corporate decision makers and regulators.  10. Strong verbal communication skills.  11. Strong PC skills in Windows environment (including Word and Excel).  12. Valid drivers license and personal, reliable vehicle is required for work related travel in order to fulfill position responsibilities. Preferred: 1. Experience working with state and/or federal regulators.  2. At least two years of direct experience working on cross-functional teams in a health insurance setting.  3. At least two years of experience with the legislative or administrative process in the State of Wisconsin. Essential Physical Functions: 1. Job tasks are primarily sedentary in nature.  2. Ability to perform fine motor skills while using the computer or writing. Computer use may occur for extended periods.  3. Ability to hear and converse on the phone and in person.  4. Ability to continuously perform fine motor tasks, such as computer, writing or phone tasks.  5. Ability to perform occasional tasks that involve crouching, twisting, overhead or climbing stairs. Dean Health Plan, Inc.- Established in 1983, Dean Health Plan is the insurance services subsidiary of Dean and SSM Health. It maintains a position of leadership in insurance services through a physician-led integrated health system that improves the health of its members and delivers a superior level of service and care. We're looking for talented individuals committed to improving the health of community through innovation, partnership and integrity.

Name: Entry Level Business Analyst
Description: Job Description Entry level jobs are available to those candidates with little or no experience. Such positions provide training and the prospect of future advancement. Entry-level business analysts work under supervision and perform a variety of tasks including developing and maintaining various databases, generating reports, and receiving continuous training while working on a variety of projects.  The primary responsibility of an entry-level business analyst includes supporting data gathering and providing review and analysis of data. Other day-to-day duties include ensuring data integrity, participating in data quality control and validation, and producing requirements documents for various business development activities. An entry-level business analyst may also create and execute test scripts under supervision. POSITION RESPONSIBILITIESAnalyze reports to identify operational issues.Conduct ad hoc analyses on specific areas of the operation.Develop recommendations to improve performance.Manage small operational process improvement projects.Maintain databases and develop reports.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTSMasters degree.Microsoft Office experience.Excellent communication and organizational skills.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business AnalystWe are in need of a Business Analyst for a 12-month consulting assignment, with a possible one-year extension, based in Madison, WI. This position will focus on producing communication deliverables and conducting stakeholder interviews for a large scale initiative implementing new federal Background Check requirements.  The Business Analyst will be the face representing the licensing and certification program on the Background Check project to key staff members and executive management. This individual must have strong technical writing skills as well as excellent communication and customer service skills. The individual in this position will: Conduct external stakeholder engagement – attend and present background check changes at provider meetings and conferences throughout Wisconsin.  Conduct internal stakeholder engagement – provide regular project updates to management  Produce written communication deliverables– draft informational memoranda, update background check web pages and FAQs, and ensure stakeholder presentation content is up to date. Review all communication content to ensure policy decisions are communicated and provider questions are answered.  Identify and propose new avenues for presenting background check related information to stakeholders (e.g. providers, other states). Examples include short instructional videos, brochures, and new web page content tailored to audience, such as out-of-state requests.  Lead communication work stream – schedule work group meetings and discuss team deliverables. Report status of communication deliverables to Executives.  Travel outside of Madison will be required, but all travel will be within the State of Wisconsin.  If this position describes you, please send us your resume for immediate consideration. Selected candidate will receive a generous compensation package, including salary, health care benefits, PTO, life and disability insurance.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: AE Business Solutions has multiple Business Analyst Openings! We are looking for 3 BAs for our large, National Client headquarter on the East Side of Madison! This is a 12 month contract opportunity.  As a Business Analyst on this team, you will participate with the business in the creation/completion of project charters for automation projects. Youll gain an understanding of the business problem and helps define the problem. Youll validates project scope and leverages validated scope to maintain project focus. Also, Determine how to capture and document requirements based on the development methodology used for the business system. Responsibilities:Solution Requirements (20%)Develops requirements for solution and solution component design.Derives requirements that result from architectural/design decisions.Defines quality attributes, constraints and other non-functional requirements.Collaborates with developers & business subject matter experts to analyze requirements and design tradeoffs.Establishes and maintain relationship between requirements for consideration during change management and requirements allocation.Allocates solution component requirements.Documents relationship among allocated requirements.Identifies and develops requirements for interfaces.Acts as a knowledge source for architects, developers and testers.Requirements Analysis and Validation (20%)Evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.Analyzes requirements to determine whether they satisfy the objectives of higher level requirements.Analyzes requirements to ensure that they are complete, feasible, realizable and verifiable.Identifies key requirements that have a strong influence on cost, schedule, functionality, risk, or performance.Represents requirements textually as well as via visual models and graphical form, in order to communicate the requirements effectively to the required audience.Analyzes operational concepts and scenarios to refine the business needs, constraints, and interfaces and to discover new requirements.Defect and Requirements Management and Communication (20%)Establishes criteria for evaluation and acceptance of requirements.Obtains commitment to the requirements from the project participants, including the elicitation of requirements prioritization.Manages requirements scope.Manages requirement changes as they evolve during the project.Maintains traceability from requirements through testing.Identifies project work and requirements inconsistencies.Assesses change requests as either expanded scope or missed requirements and places them in the change control process.Application Testing Planning and Defect Tracking (10%)Collaborates with testing lead to develop requirements-based testing considerations and strategies that will validate resolution of the business problem and realization of business requirements.Manages defects by assessing their disposition and assigning them to the appropriate process for resolution.Business Analysis Planning and Monitoring (5%)Builds trustworthy business relationships with stakeholders and business management.Resolves problems as needed to ensure that clients receive prompt and efficient service.Maintains awareness of technology trends and vendor applications in the market.Identifies stakeholders and plans communications with those stakeholders.Defines roles and responsibilities of stakeholders in the business analysis effort.Develops estimates for business analysis tasks.Plans how requirements will be approached, traced, and prioritized.Remains an active participant on assigned projects all the way to closure.Business Analysis Center of Excellence (5%)Participates in the establishment and implementation of a standard set of operating procedures for effective requirements engineering, including use and continuous improvement of a requirements process.Participates in creating recommendations for tools and processes to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of all Business Analysts.Implements ways to reuse requirements across projects.Participates in peer reviews to assure ongoing consistency in requirements work product.Assists in determining the metrics for monitoring business analysis work.Mentors less experienced business analysts to drive consistency and growth within the COE. Send your resume to Kelly Roethe for immediate consideration  AE is an EO/AA Employer  Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Name: Business Analyst
Description: DescriptionBusiness AnalystMust be able to interview in-person*candidates must complete a background check and drug screen upon offer*Description: We are seeking a highly motivated Senior Business Analyst, that will work to build the next generation of robust platforms that lay the foundation for our agent and broker product lines. As a member of the Brand Digital Marketing team the Business Analyst will be responsible for one or more business products and expected to collaborate with the other business analysts to coordinate across product. We are looking for an individual with a strong understanding of Business Analysis who has a demonstrated track record of defining and driving technology-based solutions to implement strategic solutions while bridging the divide between business and technical knowledge. This resource must be a clear articulate communicator, proficient in presenting to all levels.  The Business Analyst is responsible for developing solutions that support business ideas and product concepts through gathering and translating testable requirements into application software solutions. They must be a critical thinker capable of contributing independently and collaborating to drive sound solutions with a diverse team including product managers, software developers, testers, program managers, scrum masters and teams across the organization. They will serve as a liaison between the customer/business community and the software development team, working with them to obtain requirements through various avenues both Agile and Waterfall using interviews, document analysis, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, road maps, workflow analysis and use cases etc. They will need to leverage excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to mentor, coach, lead as well as direct the work of others. Responsibilities:Create and maintain standard processes, templates, workflows and proceduresConduct interviews, requirements workshops with a cross-discipline team to elicit understanding of business needsCollaborate with key stakeholders to help design and drive the functional definition of a solution that meets the program level objectives and visionWrite unambiguous, testable user stories with clear acceptance criteria; an integrated scrum team member to assure requirements are understood fully; & define non-functional requirementsWork with Product Management to write business cases and acceptance criteriaWork with Business Product Owners to facilitate creation and maintenance of product roadmaps and backlogs.Assist team to troubleshoot issues; evaluate existing application products which could address client requirements and develops recommendations where appropriatePartner with cross-functional teams to analyze, decompose and map current state processes and pain points, then determine improvement opportunities including creation of target operating modelsTake ownership to lead solutions from concept to implementation by partnering with Technology and Business to ensure requirements are satisfied and delivered on timeBuild and develop business relationships vital to the success of the projectDeliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholdersRequirements: Bachelor's degree; advanced degree, Computer Science, Information Technology, Science5+ years of experience in Business AnalysisHands-on experience in an Agile development environment, ideally Scrum.Proven experience in eliciting requirements, creating user stories, test cases, and wireframesExperience in facilitating the elicitation and evaluation of business requirements for delivering new or enhanced software systems, and measuring the success of the associated initiativesAbility to independently and quickly ramp up on new business and technical conceptsExperienced in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions using data visualization techniques and tools. Documenting systems design, creating specifications, flow charts, and other related diagrams based on user or system design specifications.Advanced knowledge in generating process documentationExcellent verbal, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; is a team player.Very strong written skills showing the ability to convey details accurately in a well-structured and precise manner that describe end user problems and solutions.Solid experience in and understanding of Scrum Agile development or Scaled Agile Framework, Waterfall, and SDLC processesExperience with Balsamiq or similar toolJIRA knowledgeProven problem-solving skills, is logical and analytical.Experience in working with distributed, offshore teams.Experience in managing and mentoring team.Preferred CBAP (Certified Business Analyst Professional) or PMI-PBA (PMI Professional in Business Analysis)Preferred previous experience in Content Management Systems (CMS) and specifically Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)Proficient in Visio, MS Excel, PowerPoint and other Office applications to build process flows and presentations #Low  #LI-PT1Horizontal Integration is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We seek to provide employment opportunities to talented, qualified candidates regardless of race, color, sex/gender including gender identity and/or expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under federal, state or local law. In addition, Horizontal Integration will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need to request a reasonable accommodation in order to complete the application or interview process, please contact hr@horizontalintegration.com. All applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the country of employment.

Name: Senior Data Analyst
Description: PerBlue is looking for a talented Senior Data Analyst to join our team. We’re a quickly growing independent studio whose free-to-play midcore mobile games have been played by millions people around the world, including our recently launched Disney Heroes: Battle Mode game. We’re looking for an ambitious data lover who can help us dig through mountains of video game data, analyze it, find actionable insights, and present them to everyone else in the team. Responsibilities This highly cross-functional role interacts regularly with marketing, live-ops, development, product, and management teams. You’ll be a key addition to our BI team and be involved in the full lifecycle of our data infrastructure - everything from designing database schemas and writing SQL queries, to creating and presenting succinct and informative dashboards and visualizations.  Our ideal candidate is a quick learner who is very detail-oriented, goal driven, and truly loves analyzing numbers and making sense of large amounts of data. You should have a strong motivation to work with data and technology in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Requirements and QualificationsBachelor's degree or higher in Statistics, Mathematics, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related fieldMinimum 2 years experience in data-related roleMinimum 2 years experience writing analytic SQL queries (emphasis on SELECTs using JOINs, not so much INSERTs/UPDATEs)Ability to effectively communicate with a variety of stakeholdersSelf motivated and resourceful with the ability to work autonomouslyClose attention to detail, process driven, and results-focusedProactive and able to take ownership of tasks and projectsStrong desire to learn new thingsPreferred Skills and ExperienceExperience with Postgres and/or Snowflake/Redshift cloud database queryingExperience with Tableau or other popular data exploration, visualization and dashboarding softwareExperience data modelingExperience doing basic statistical analyses (AB testing, confidence intervals, etc)Experience with mobile and/or online games industry a big plusRegression experience a plusMachine learning and other prediction/classification methods a plusObject oriented programming, specifically Python a plusKey Duties Will IncludeDevelop a strong understanding of our games, game design principles, core metrics and underlying assumptions, so they can be effectively questioned, tested, and proven/disproven.Break down requests for data/analysis into smaller, actionable plans to guarantee the end user will get their real questions answered.Improve existing Tableau dashboards and create new ones with a keen eye toward end user experience (ease of understanding, clarity, dashboard responsiveness, consistency, etc)Writing SQL for data exploration, quick question-answer, and for more in-depth analysis via Tableau Data Sources, statistical software, etc.Do more thorough analyses when needed, including coming up with your own hypotheses, testing, revising, and ultimately providing data-driven, evidenced recommendations.Effectively provide key summaries of actionable takeaways while also providing deeper evidence and analysis for end users wanting deeper insight.Compensation and Benefits We offer 6+ weeks of paid vacation and health, dental, and vision insurance as well as a well-matched 401k. We have a catered lunch program, a snack-stocked kitchen, and a refrigerator full of liquid refreshments. You'll get membership to our local hackerspace Sector67 and enjoy our regular socials. You'll be part of an energetic and collaborative environment, and work with a great team. We have flexible hours and are located in a vibrant neighborhood in beautiful downtown Madison.  PerBlue is an independent game development studio based in Madison, WI with a highly skilled team of amazingly talented people. We’ve been named a “Top Developer” by Google, a “Best Place to Work” by Madison Magazine, and “Madison's Favorite Tech Startup” by the Isthmus.  This is a full time position based in Madison, WI. Compensation is competitive and based on experience.

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of a Technical Business Analyst in Madison, WI. Overview: The Technical Analyst will be a self-starter that works with minimal supervision who supports business strategy and utilize strong facilitation skills to elicit requirements and business needs from cross-functional teams across all levels of the organization, including vendors. The Technical Analyst will help define solution, scope and objectives and/or process improvements to meet business needs. They will optimize business functions, business and system process, understand impact of systems on business capability. They will also be responsible for ensuring the quality of IT solutions through testing activities (reusability, performance, automation, etc.) and understand defect tracking and remediation. They will also serve as a liaison between IT and business units to resolve technology issues, they will understand and support complex and cross-functional assignments using various methodologies. The Technical Analyst will also gain confidence of stakeholders at all levels of the organization in the problem solving and decision-making analysis approach through effective leadership of these activities that result in appropriate solutions to underlying problems. This position could be training users and clearly communicated changes and impacts on processes and policies. They may be required to work outside of core hours for production support rotation and/or project implementations. They may be required to travel to sites where needed. Key Tasks:  Requirements Management Software testing (Creation, Execution and Tracking) System Support and Analysis Operational Process ImprovementREQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree with 3-5 years of relevant experience; or Associate degree or 2 years of continuing education or training with 5-7 years of relevant experience Solid communication, organization and interpersonal skills Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills and appropriate escalation skills Willingness to be collaborative to achieve business objectives Demonstration of strong team work skills Self-Starter- quickly learn systems/processes and assigned work Flexible with change, pivot and redirect as needed to meet objectives Business Process Knowledge/system knowledge Requirements modeling Test case development Familiar with SQL and test automation Experience with requirements gathering techniques Ability to quickly gain familiarity with systems, processes and assigned work Experience working with data integration or experience working with visual requirements including but not limited to: logical data and process models, workflow diagrams, context diagrams and/or user interface mock-ups Professional demeanor with the ability to model dedication and support for company goals Preferred:  Experience serving in a business or functional role in the healthcare or healthcare insurance industry Familiarity with business analysis activities, such as elicitation, requirement documentation and communication and resolution assessment and validation Experience working with HIPAA transactions Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: IT Quality/Business Analyst
Description: The IT Quality/Business Analyst is a member of the IT Quality Team. This role fulfills both the business analyst and quality analyst roles for applications and systems development. The Quality/Business Analyst contributes to shaping technology demands and driving quality among the Exact Sciences business community.  The quality/business analyst acts as an intermediary between IT project teams and business partners to define, analyze, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design (using appropriate tools and models) from which applications and solutions are developed. This role functions as the stakeholder and user advocates by understanding their requirements, by representing their interests when working with the implementation teams, and by executing the test strategy to provide objective evidence that system and application requirements are met. This role is hands-on and requires strategic thinking and planning to ensure all requirements are met for overall quality of the intended solutions both functionally and technically. Maintains on-going relationships with business partners to drive satisfaction with IT.Works to elicit high-level requirements and capture business needs through dialogue with business partners.Clearly articulates and documents business requirements.Translates business requirements into functional requirements utilizing a structured process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing change).Maintains project requirements according to requirements management plan.Supports applications and solutions delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate requirements and validate proposed solutions.Reviews product design documentation to ensure that requirements are correct, unambiguous, and verifiable.Assists in generating use cases/user stories to ensure that all functional requirements are captured.Assesses the risks of various solutions.Recommends solutions based on cost vs benefit analysis.Develops and executes test plans.Plans and supports user acceptance testing and user training.Creates documentation to describe program evaluation, testing, correction, and objective evidence of meeting requirements.Ensures all prerequisite tasks are complete and ready for deployment.Provides Level 3 systems and applications support.Participates in system and data triage as necessary.Monitors program performance after implementation to prevent reoccurrence of program operating problems and ensure efficiency of operation.Proactively provides process improvement recommendations within a quickly evolving company.Proactively resolves customer satisfaction issues.Works with outside vendors to deliver solutions.Conducts compatibility tests with vendor and non-vendor-provided programs.Minimum RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science/MIS, science, healthcare-related science, or other degree in combination with relevant work experience.One (1) or more years of experience in a hands-on technical role supporting laboratory order management systems through systems development, systems implementation, quality assurance, or similar experience.Two (2) or more years of professional work experience interfacing with customers directly and problem solvingStrong analytical skills, prioritization skills, business intuition, and organizational ability.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, ability to operate in a cross cultural and complex matrix environment, and ability to build consensus across functions.Adaptable, open to change and able to work in ambiguous situations and respond to new information or unexpected circumstances.Demonstrated capacity for decision making in complex scenarios and for holding one-self and others accountable to those decisions.Desired CharacteristicsExperience working as business analyst, quality analyst, or product owner on technology development projects.Experience working under SDLC or other software-specific project management process.Experience with User Centered Design.Experience working with laboratory order cycle management, revenue cycle management, or healthcare engagement and communication systems.Fast and enthusiastic learner.Physical RequirementsAbility to work in an office setting, operate telephony devices, and a computer. #LI-KE1 Exact Sciences is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, disability, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other status protected by applicable local, state or federal law. Applicable portions of the Company’s affirmative action program is available to any applicant or employee for inspection upon request.

Name: EDI Analyst
Description: Who We AreWe are a leading not-for-profit health insurer in Wisconsin, and our services have grown to reach active-duty and retired military personnel, seniors, and families in Wisconsin, across the U.S., and around the world. Learn more!WPS receives World's Most Ethical Company Award for 9th Year in a Row- 2018 Most Ethical Companies AnnouncementAt Our CoreWPS Health Solutions has earned a reputation as a leader in the insurance and benefits administration industry through our commitment to excellence and high-quality service. Our corporate values reflect the core of who we are and how we conduct business every day.Customer FocusedI recognize how my actions impact internal and external customers by being responsible for the customer experience. I look beyond the immediate issue to recognize and solve the problem.Individual ResponsibilityI own my actions. I am accountable and dedicated to achieving the best results for WPS Health Solutions and our customers. I embrace my role in helping the company achieve a high-performance workplace.Mutual RespectI lead by example and act ethically, honestly and am trustworthy. I show appreciation for others by giving and taking constructive feedback and encouragement. Driven and PassionateI approach my work with enthusiasm, and personal commitment to the success of our business. I keep the importance of the work we do for our customers alive in my attitude and interactions with others, and demonstrate pride in the worthiness of our purpose.Position SummaryAnalyst EDI will coordinate development and testing of new or existing Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) software and acceptable data formats across lines of business as required by defined business needs. Will coordinate support activities for current EDI trading partners and testers. Will identify and resolve EDI processing discrepancies or problems.In this role you will:Assist with daily maintenance of EDI front-end gateways, Secure EDI applications, as well as EDI front-end processes.Ensure quality monitoring of incoming and outgoing data formats.Create EDI transaction testing scenarios, perform tests, report issues, and approve releases into production environments.Coordinate assistance to submitters in Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) problem areas and resolution. Serve as resource for EDI Help Deskstaff as related to EDI data requirements and formats for all applicable lines of WPS business. Communicate directly with providers and submitters as needed.Oversee use/upgrades of acceptable EDI data formats with EDI operations staff, claims divisions, Information Systems staff, and EDI front-end vendor.Support development/upgrade of EDI software by serving as liaison between claims areas, Information Systems divisions, and EDI front-end vendor.Ensure effective use and upgrades of ANSI X12 transaction files through the EDI front-end software. Coordinate revisions/corrections as needed while serving as primary client contact for ANSI X12 data file questions/problems.Assist with installations/upgrades of all EDI front-end software.Develop and maintain high-level understanding of UNIX environment as it relates to EDI front-end hardware/software.Support setup/installation, training, and administration of EDI software packages, both off-site and at WPS, by serving as resource expert.Serve as primary contact for Multi Carrier System (MCS), Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), and TRICARE DHA concerning system problems/changes as related to accurate functionality for EDI as applicable.Serve as resource expert for administration and support of Secure-EDI file transfers and messages.Assemble teams with various departments to support current EDI transactions and implement new transactions to utilize electronic capabilities within WPS lines of business.Coordinate monthly invoices from trading partners, including billing services and Medicare’s Coordination of Benefits Contractor (COBC).Serve as resource expert for development and execution of system reports for applicable WPS lines of business.Maintain updates to corporate code sets.* This job profile is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties or responsibilities associated with the job. Other job-related duties may be assigned.You should have:U.S. citizenship is required for this position due to U.S. Department of Defense restrictions Associate’s degree in Business, Computer Science, or related field OR equivalent post high school education and/or work-related experienceTwo (2) years working with claims adjudication system and/or EDI business flows, includingTwo (2) years progressive responsibility in health insurance claims, administration, or customer service where employee provided service to provider or billing vendor on complex issuesIn addition, we prefer:Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, or related fieldAdvanced knowledge of computer concepts, experience with EDI, including procedures, goals, objectives, administrative practices and systems, EDI products, and business flowsStay connected: Join ourTalent Community! FOLLOW US!FacebookTwitterLinkedIn

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Job Title: Senior Financial Operations Analyst Reports To: VP Finance Essential Job Functions:The Senior Financial Operations Analyst will provide proactive business partner support to the the Modular Division of Cupertino Electric. (CEI), founded in 1954, is one of the largest, well-established electrical contractors in the nation. Sponsorship will not be considered for this position• Relocation assistance is availableResponsibilities:Specialized Knowledge & Skills RequirementsDemonstrated experience providing customer-driven solutions, support or service.Demonstrated experience communicating complicated ideas in verbal and written explanations.Demonstrated experience with analysis of complex financial and business data.Extensive knowledge and understanding of financial and data analysis and reporting techniques.Solid knowledge and understanding of analytic and data visualization tools, with emphasis on SAS, Tableau, and Greenplum.Travel RequirementsThis position requires travel up to 5% of the timeAdditional Job Information:Job Description:Primary Accountabilities Works with team members to research, analyze, report, and communicate key product performance metrics.Responsible for leading data projects with limited direction.Executes the development, analysis, maintenance and reporting of performance scorecards.Develops the programming of scalable and flexible data reporting and analysis solutions to fulfill the needs of the team.Research key business data using statistical analysis and data mining to understand historical patterns that can be utilized to improve business performance.Implements vendor performance metrics and analysis for the Personal Lines division.Documents programs, queries, and dashboards for reliable future use; automates useful reports and solutions.Collaborates with IS to uphold data integrity measures.Serves as subject matter expert for Personal Lines Product on key data that informs management`s decisions.Works with Personal Lines business partners and IS to ensure Personal Lines data is captured and stored appropriately and readily available for use.Recognizes potential system opportunities or issues during data analysis and collaborates with Business Technology partners as appropriate.Stay connected: Join our Talent Community!LI:JM1

Name: Business Analyst
Description: OUR AGENCYMake a DifferenceSWIB enables forward thinking professionals opportunities to grow, develop and build excellence with a global investor making a difference in the lives of Wisconsin public employees.With more than $117 billion in total assets, SWIB is one of the world's largest institutional investors. As an independent state agency, SWIB is responsible for managing assets of the Wisconsin Retirement System (WRS) in addition to six separately managed funds. SWIB generates returns for more than 622,000 participants. SWIB has long been considered an investment industry leader because of its ability to grow and protect the WRS assets that its constituents count on for a more secure financial future.Be a World Class LeaderThe WRS is nearly 100 percent funded, making it one of the countrys best funded public employee retirement systems. It is the 9th largest public pension fund in the U.S. and 25th largest public or pension fund in the world. SWIBs performance for the WRS beat the one -, five- and ten-year benchmarks as of Dec. 31, 2017. As an innovative organization SWIB is committed to professional development. Approximately 50 percent of SWIBs investment professionals are Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) charterholders.About the TeamThe Operations Strategy, Planning and Coordination Team is responsible for providing internal consultancy, coordination, and oversight services to support SWIBs investment mandate. The primary functions of the team include providing strategic guidance and direction related to industry trends and practices through a forward-looking lens, coordinating the execution of requests for enhanced investment capabilities and process optimization in the current state, and providing oversight and control of the end-to-end operational process. The team seeks a Business Analyst to leverage broad asset management industry experience to drive a culture focused on continuously improving and innovating support for SWIBs investment capabilities.The Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for driving business unit priorities forward with actionable and executable results. The BA role serves as the primary liaison between each of the investment management teams and the resources (internal and external) necessary to deliver the requested work efforts.Essential activities:Act as the primary relationship manager between the business and operational teams to ensure the business needs are being met.Lead, facilitate and coordinate team meetings to prioritize work requests in partnership with the delegates from assigned business units.Develop a deep understanding of applicable operational processes, procedures, and controls.Build and lead coalition teams to address work efforts approved by the work alignment team and assigned for planning and execution.Draft business requirements at the appropriate level of detail for each work effort, ensuring the cross-functional impacts and any required coordination/integration effort has been identified ahead of the solution.Work with internal and external stakeholders to gather and validate business requirements and assist with the functional design of solutions.Partner with the systems architect role in IT to provide input into the functional aspects of solutions design.In partnership with the Systems Architect, perform functional testing of system enhancements/changes resulting from the work effort.Develop, execute, and document user test plans and organize and oversee end-user testing and acceptance.Develop, or assist in the development, of end-user training materials and coordinate / conduct user training.The Ideal Candidate:Bachelors degree in Information Systems, Business Management or Finance.Minimum of 5 years of experience within the investment management industry.Substantial knowledge of the end-to-end operational lifecycle, including the processes, workflows, systems, and investment tools e.g., Charles River, Eagle PACE, MarkIt, eFront, FactSet, MSCI and/or BlackRock Aladdin to support SWIBs investment business.Substantial knowledge of capital markets and the investment management industry through the lens of SWIBs investment mandate and mission.Detailed exposure to various investment types, security types and asset classes, with a solid understanding of what makes each unique and its intended application within the investment strategy.Detailed familiarity with investment management industry best practice workflows.SWIB Offers:Competitive McLagan-base salaryMeaningful performance-based incentive compensationA comprehensive benefit packageEducational and training opportunitiesTuition reimbursementChallenging work in a professional environmentThe position requires U.S. work authorization and residency in, or willingness to relocate to the Madison, Wisconsin area. SWIB is prepared to offer relocation assistance as needed.Join HIGHER PERFORMERSHome to Top TalentSWIBs professionals shape sophisticated investment management strategies, drive forward looking technologies and deliver strong internal asset management. SWIBs internal team invests approximately 62 percent of its assets under management. As a result, Institutional Investor recognizes SWIB as home to top talent in American public investing.The organization has earned a reputation for investment excellence in part by running much of its portfolio successfully in-house versus outsourcing to Wall Street Institutional Investor.

Name: Business Analyst Managed Services
Description: The Business Analyst works closely with Managed Services management and our supporting Finance team to provide expanded financial analysis and is proactive in taking actions needed to help improve our financial performance. The Business Analyst coordinates Managed Services forecasting and provides detailed analysis on key financial metrics, providing management with timely information needed to set direction and effectively run the business.  Key Areas of Responsibility Analyze financial results, identify opportunities for improved performance, and take action to increase revenue and reduce expenses.Track and report on key revenue and expense items, e.g., closed business, pending customer cancellations, significant expenditures, etc.Provide expanded financial reporting to management and maintain the Managed Services Financial Dashboard.Coordinate the Managed Services forecast and forecasting process.Maintain the forecast model, provide monthly updates to management and Finance, and provide input to Outlook 2 / Outlook 3 projections.Build strong relationships with stakeholders and subject matter experts and help improve financial performance in all areas of the business.Create and maintain a financial model to calculate profit for service offerings / service groups.Document current processes and provide recommendations for improvement.Contribute to business justifications and return on investment measures for significant projects.Provide regular updates on key initiatives and their progress.Identify financial areas of concern early and review with management.Remain current in industry trends, tools, and best practices.Assist with other business management functions including contracts management, exceptions and approvals, pricing, and reporting. Other Responsibilities Maintain the commission database.Track closed pipeline activities and update all associated commission reports.Update commissions splits manager each month with all changes to AE/AM account assignments and commission percentages.Maintain AIM commission reports with payout details and contract expiration dates.Provide recommendations on updates to commission plans.Respond to ad hoc request for commission plan information and payout details.Coordinate the exceptions process and the associated manual commission adjustments.Qualifications Minimum Qualifications Bachelors degree in Business or related field, or equivalent experience Preferred Qualifications Strong analytical and financial modeling skillsInnate problem-solverExperience with Microsoft Excel and other related toolsWorking knowledge of business financeFamiliarity with cost/benefit and ROI data analysis Other Required Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with all stakeholdersAbility to effectively facilitate and lead meetings, tailoring messages to the given audienceExperience in evaluating information, identifying risks and opportunities, while possessing creative problem-solving skills with an understanding of business concepts and models.Demonstrated negotiation and persuasion skills, with the ability to enable mutually beneficial outcomesHistory of balancing multiple priorities simultaneously with the ability to adapt to the changing needs of the business while meeting deadlinesCritical attention to detail and solid creative problem-solving skillsDemonstrated knowledge of the business, organization and solutions that are the back bone of the organizationAbility to adapt to changing conditions, strategies and organizational directionAbility to work in a high performing team environment

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: The technical business analyst is an active thought partner who contributes to shaping the technology demand among the Exact Sciences business community.  The technical business analyst acts as an intermediary between IT project teams and business partners to collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design (using appropriate tools and models) from which applications and solutions are developed. The technical business analyst functions as the stakeholders’ advocate by providing objective evidence that system and application requirements are met.  This role will support the business functional areas that include logistics, distributions and the company’s electronic data interchange systems (EDI) used in our order management system. They are responsible for analyzing and designing specifications used for enhancements and extensions in EDI applications, interfaces, and mappings. They will coordinate all EDI testing, implementations, and upgrades. Additionally, the EDI business analyst facilitates communication business any data-trading partners to service existing EDI interfaces and ensure compliance to guidelines and specifications for data exchange. Maintains on-going relationships with business partners to drive satisfaction with IT.Works to elicit high-level requirements and capture business needs through dialogue with business partners. Clearly articulates and documents business requirements.Translates business requirements into functional requirements utilizing a structured process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing change).Maintains project requirements according to requirements management plan.Supports applications and solutions delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate requirements and validate proposed solutions. Reviews product design documentation to ensure that requirements are correct, unambiguous, and verifiable.Assists in generating use cases/user stories to ensure that all functional requirements are captured.Assesses the risks of various solutions.Recommends solutions based on cost vs benefit analysis.Develops and executes test plans. Plans and supports user acceptance testing and user training.Creates documentation to describe program evaluation, testing, correction, and objective evidence of meeting requirements.Provides Level 3 systems and applications support. Participates in system and data triage as necessary.Monitors program performance after implementation to prevent reoccurrence of program operating problems and ensure efficiency of operation.Proactively provides process improvement recommendations within a quickly evolving company.Proactively resolves customer satisfaction issues.Work with outside vendors to deliver solutions.Conducts compatibility tests with vendor and non-vendor-provided programs.Minimum RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science/MIS, science, healthcare-related science, or other degree in combination with relevant work experience.Two (2) or more years of professional work experience interfacing with customers directly and problem solvingOne (1) or more years of experience in a hands-on technical role supporting business systems specific to the departments this role supports through Strong analytical skills, prioritization skills, business intuition, and organizational ability.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, ability to operate in a cross cultural and complex matrix environment, and ability to build consensus across functions.Adaptable, open to change and able to work in ambiguous situations and respond to new information or unexpected circumstances.Demonstrated capacity for decision making in complex scenarios and for holding one-self and others accountable to those decisions.Desired CharacteristicsExperience working as business analyst, quality analyst, or product owner on technology development projects.Experience working under SDLC or other software-specific project management process.Experience working with laboratory order cycle management, revenue cycle management, or healthcare engagement and communication systems.Fast and enthusiastic learner.Physical RequirementsAbility to work in an office setting, operate telephony devices, and a computer. #LI-MF1 Exact Sciences is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, disability, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other status protected by applicable local, state or federal law. Applicable portions of the Company’s affirmative action program is available to any applicant or employee for inspection upon request.

In this role you will:Research potential new products and business ventures as directed.Analyze experience, underwriting guidelines and claims procedures and their effect on pricing and reserving.Coordinate the generation of the monthly reserves calculations, documentation, analysis and initial reserve recommendations using generally accepted actuarial principles, accounting for variances in corporate production, inventory, enrollment, and coverage variancesCoordinate the preparation, calculation, and management reporting of health care and utilization trends.Maintain corporate rate formulas and rating systems for small group, individual, ancillary and Medicare-related products.Research and test adequacy of coverage base rates, credibility factors, age/sex factors, and pooling charges.Assist in the preparation and coordination of all rate filings necessary for the Commissioner of Insurance.Assist in the monitoring of forecasted results as they compare to actuals.Perform the Individual renewal process.Incorporate rating history and trend experience, growth, market changes and loss ratio assumptions into models, testing multiple approaches to generate best estimates.Report enrollment and financial experience by line of business, type of contract, type of coverage, type of benefit, etc, as requested by management * This job profile is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties or responsibilities associated with the job. Other job-related duties may be assigned. Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Technical Business Analyst Experience working within an Agile/Scrum environment and having strong communication skills will be extremely important. You will work with others to define the scope of project initiatives and understand the technical specs and the impact they will have on their existing environment. Requirements Elicitation and Documentation (20%) Participates with the business in the creation/completion of project charters for automation projects. Gains an understanding of the business problem and helps define the problem. Validates project scope and leverages validated scope to maintain project focus. Determines how to capture & document requirements based on the development methodology used for the business system. Meets with stakeholders, subject matter experts, process owners and users to elicit and document needs, expectations, constraints and external interfaces using various methods (e.g., brainstorming, document analysis, facilitated meetings, focus groups, interface analysis, interviews, observation, prototyping, requirements workshops, reverse engineering, survey questionnaire). Asks the right questions to surface essential requirements information. Defines constraints for verification and validation. Builds consensus among stakeholder group regarding the true business issue and requirements. Develops the business requirements by translating the needs, expectations, constraints and interfaces into a format understandable to both clients and technologists. Completes activities according to best practices, standard operating procedures, and team member guidance, consistently meeting quality standards and striving to add value in each activity. Solution Requirements (20%) Develops requirements for solution and solution component design. Derives requirements that result from architectural/design decisions. Defines quality attributes, constraints and other non-functional requirements. Collaborates with developers and business subject matter experts to analyze requirements and design tradeoffs and priorities. Establishes and maintain relationship between requirements for consideration during change management and requirements allocation. Allocates solution component requirements. Documents relationship among allocated requirements. Identifies and develops requirements for interfaces Acts as a knowledge source for architects, developers and testers. Requirements Analysis and Validation (20%) Evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. Analyzes requirements to determine whether they satisfy the objectives of higher level requirements. Analyzes requirements to ensure that they are complete, feasible, realizable and verifiable. Identifies key requirements that have a strong influence on cost, schedule, functionality, risk, or performance. Represents requirements textually as well as via visual models and graphical form, in order to communicate the requirements effectively to the required audience. Analyzes operational concepts and scenarios to refine the business needs, constraints, and interfaces and to discover new requirements. Defect and Requirements Management and Communication (20%) Establishes criteria for evaluation and acceptance of requirements. Obtains commitment to the requirements from the project participants, including the elicitation of requirements prioritization. Manages requirements scope. Manages requirement changes as they evolve during the project. Maintains traceability from requirements through testing. Identifies project work and requirements inconsistencies. Assesses change requests as either expanded scope or missed requirements and places them in the change control process. Application Testing Planning and Defect Tracking (10%) Collaborates with testing lead to develop requirements-based testing considerations and strategies that will validate resolution of the business problem and realization of business requirements. Manages defects by assessing their disposition and assigning them to the appropriate process for resolution. - provided by DiceJira, Microsoft OneNote, ServiceNow, business stakeholders, development
