Experience:Experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development.Experience with development and implementation of software solutions, systems, or products.Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language.Experience with core software applications, including Microsoft Word and Excel required; Microsoft PowerPoint and Visio preferredHealthcare industry practices and HIPAA knowledge would be a plus.Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.Key Skills/Competencies:Able to communicate effectively with non-technical staff and with members of interdisciplinary teams.Able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it.Analytical and creative problem-solving skills.Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language.Highly self-motivated and directed.Logical and efficient approach to project work, with keen attention to detail.Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure, fast paced environment.Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.Ability to learn software systems quickly.Strong customer service orientation.On-call availability.Some travel may be required.#LI-POST Job Description:Job Summary: The Business Analyst ensures efforts are in alignment with the Information Technology department to support customer-focused objectives and the IT Vision, a collaborative partner delivering innovative ideas, solutions and services to simplify people's lives. The Business Analyst role is to elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs for various Navitus projects. This includes interviewing stakeholders/sponsors, gathering and compiling requirements to convey to development teams throughout the software lifecycle. This Business Analyst will also have communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help support the development process and to ensure that project deliverables are met according to specifications. The Business Analyst will constantly assess user requirements to communicate to development teams throughout the software lifecycle, plan and schedule projects for roll-out consistent with strategic vision and goals and evaluate project effectiveness on a retrospective, concurrent, and prospective basis. Job Responsibilities:Ensure efforts delight the customer.Provide superior customer service utilizing a high-touch, customer centric approach focused on collaboration and communication.Contribute to a positive team atmosphere.Innovate and create value for the customer.Collaborate with project managers and project sponsors to determine enhancement scope and vision.Define and document requirements along with ensuring proper sign-offs are received from business sponsor.Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers and the project team. Where necessary, create process flow models, specifications, diagrams, and charts.Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.Create and execute test plans to ensure system enhancement meets the requirements.Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary by communicating enhancements and/or modifications verbally or through written documentation.Manage issue/defect requests and resolution for assigned projects.Communicate to the Training and Development Instructor to ensure that enhancements are reflected in the internal and external training materials.Research, review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements -- gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.Perform other duties as assigned.

Name: Senior Technical Business Analyst CRM
Description: The Senior Technical Business Analyst - CRM provides strategic business analysis services to the business by acting as an intermediary between with IT project teams and business partners to collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual deign (using appropriate tools and models) from which applications and solutions are developed. The focus of this position is to work closely with the business units to gain in-depth understanding of business strategy, processes, services, roadmap and the context in which the business operates.  This role will support the sales and marketing organization through CRM system implementation and integration. Works to elicit high-level requirements and capture business needs through dialogue with business sponsors. Clearly articulates and documents business requirements.Translates business needs into requirements utilizing a structured process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing change) to assess and recommend solutions based on cost vs benefit analysis.Assesses the risks of various solutions and prioritizes competing business demands.Coordinates project delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions.Develops test plans and assists in testing of software solutions. Participate in user acceptance testing and user training.Manages ongoing relationship with business partner to drive satisfaction with IT.Proactively provides process improvement recommendations within a quickly evolving company.Proactively resolves customer satisfaction issues.Work with outside vendors to deliver solutions. Monitors and manages vendor relationship and performance.Provide leadership assistance to other analysts by modeling best-practices and approaches and serving as a coach to more junior colleagues.Minimum RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science/MIS, healthcare-related science or related degree.3+ years of experience as a business analyst.5+ years in a hands-on technical role implementing or supporting business applications specific to the business function this role supports through technical project management, sytems development, or quality assurance.Strong analytical skills, prioritization skills, business intuition, and organizational ability.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, ability to operate in a cross cultural and complex matrix environment, and ability to build consensus across functions.Adaptable, open to change and able to work in ambiguous situations and respond to new information or unexpected circumstances.Demonstrated capacity for decision making in complex scenarios and for holding one-self and others accountable to those decisions.Desired CharacteristicsPast experience with business analysis.Past experience working under SDLC or other software-specific project management process.Experience working as a team and/or project leader.Experience working in order cycle management or revenue cycle management.Fast and enthusiastic learner.Physical RequirementsAbility to work in an office setting, operate telephony devices, and a computer. #LI-KE1 Exact Sciences is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, disability, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other status protected by applicable local, state or federal law. Applicable portions of the Company’s affirmative action program is available to any applicant or employee for inspection upon request.

Name: SAP Business Analyst - SD
Description: Job DescriptionWhen you join us at Thermo Fisher Scientific, youll be part of a smart, driven team that shares your passion for exploration and discovery. With revenues of $20 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world. SUMMARY: A Business Analyst conducts research, monitors, maintains, and optimizes business solutions.  Knowledge of business processes and SAP within a specific area(s) of responsibility, defined by the position. Directly support users and corporate processes in the assigned area. Researches gaps in functionality, gathers requirements of users and presents recommendations to teams both technical and business.  Excellent grasp of industry and subject matter best practices, trends, and concepts. Ability to apply these concepts into the SAP environment and business process. Strong Leadership skills, especially in the handling of Organization Change Management are strongly desired. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Support SAP ECC and related software.Knowledge of Sales and Distribution techniques, methods, and tools. Subject matter best practices.Knowledge of SAP reporting capabilities.Develop IT and end-user documentation for processes and procedures.Participate in Service Desk function to resolve user related support calls.Prepare and execute test plans for new functionality.Publish communication related to the deployment of new functionality.Translate user requests into user requirements and program specifications.Work with Enterprise Shared Services and programmers to assure compliance to program specificationsDevelop training outlines for end-users and collaborate with documentation specialistsLiaise with Divisional Management to understand direction within their functional area of responsibilityMonitor compliance with Service Level Agreements for site.Support business initiatives utilizing Project Management expertise.Maintain security in compliance with ThermoFisher Security directives.Ensure compliance to Thermo Fisher IT Policies and Guidelines.Travel can range from 25%-50%.Gather user requirements to develop solutions and alternatives.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.Translate high-level information into details as well as summarize detailed information.Communicate and collaborate with users to analyze information needs and functional requirements.Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.Work with users to define concepts under direction of project leaders.Serve as the conduit between the user community and the software development team through which requirements flow.Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates.Liaise between the business, technology teams and support teams.Comply with companys Global IT Policies & Procedures.Other duties as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:Excellent knowledge of business processes and best practices.Knowledge of SAP in specified area.Knowledge of Thermo Fisher SAP Template a plus.3-7 years of business experience in functional area.2-4 years of SAP experience.4 year degree or 5-7 years experience in related area.Relevant technical certificates a plus.4+ years of related technical work experience.Strong interpersonal and excellent documentation skills are a must.Able to assume and complete assignments independently.Ability to explain and champion technical concepts to a broad audience.Excellent customer service skills required.Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.Strong project management skills and understanding of project management lifecycle.Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.FUNCTIONS WITHIN ISO:To understand the quality policy and objectives for quality.Perform duties and responsibilities according to the documented quality system.Recommend and implement improvements to activities and processes within the quality system.Have awareness of ITIL and other related quality/IT processes. At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 65,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular missionenabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.  Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Name: Business Analyst-Advanced
Description: DescriptionRole Purpose: The IT Business Analyst (BA) Advanced will be a self-starter that works with minimal supervision who supports business strategy and utilize strong facilitation skills to elicit requirements and business needs from cross-functional team across all levels of the organization, including vendors and will also serve as a mentor to new team members. The IT Business Analyst-Advanced will help define solution, scope and objectives and / or process improvements to meet business needs. They will optimize business functions, business and system process, understand impact of systems on business capability. Will also be responsible for ensuring the quality of IT solutions through testing activities (reusability, performance, automation, etc.) and understand defect tracking and remediation. They will also serve as a liaison between IT and business units to resolve system and process issues, they will understand, support, guide and direct complex and cross-functional assignments using various methodologies.  The IT BA- Advanced will also gain confidence of stakeholders at all levels of the organization (including executive leadership) in the problem solving and decision making analysis approach through effective leadership of these activities that result in appropriate solutions to underlying problems. In this position could be training users and clearly communicating changes and impacts on processes and policies. May be required to work outside of core hours for production support rotation and / or project implementations. May be required to travel to sites where needed. Essential Job Duties: 1. Requirements Management  • Conduct elicitation sessions using various methods.  • Mentor team members on tools, techniques, standards and methodologies (lean, SAFe, etc.)  • Analyze, specify and create user stories or other documentation that captures requirements for system and process changes.  • Verify requirements and gain business and technical approval during sprint demonstrations or other meetings.  • Facilitate workshops on process (business and system)improvement initiatives  • Evaluate and present recommendations for process improvements  2. Software Testing (Creation, Execution and Tracking)  • Develop, execute and maintain test designs, including test cases and test scripts. Use automation and Behavior Driven Development (BDD) when appropriate.  • Conduct testing to ensure that functionality, usability, reliability and performance of solutions are consistent with requirements.  • Report and manage issues and defects and troubleshoot to determine root cause to ensure all issues are resolved  • Develop and / or execute test scenarios and validate against acceptance criteria to ensure high quality products are delivered  • Understand and execute system integration testing  3. System Support and Analysis  • Provide release, implementation and production support to the organization.  • Assist with user documentation of process and procedures.  • Manage and coordinate resolution of system problems and provide support after system implementation  • Strong problem solving and ability to think on feet to restore services, address concerns  • Translate assignments received into the form of objectives to specific tasks, features, stories, ceremonies and overall work needed  • Work with vendors as needed to address issues or implement changes  • Knowledge of core system and processes across multiple business and system areas  • Effectively communicate at all levels (including executive leadership) both technical and non-technical audiences.  4. Operational Process Improvement  • Understand and follow project delivery methodologies (Agile / SAFe).  • Lead and coordinate (inter and intra) team work and project efforts / activities and process improvement initiatives  • Influence policy and procedures with in an agile team or business analysis team and have appropriate transparency with leadership on process improvement initiatives (taking initiative to point out and correct issues where needed)  • Collaborate with business partners and IT teams to develop procedural material and training (user or technical documentation)  5. Coaching and mentoring  • Serve as a new employee mentor and coach on processes and best practices  • Serve as a consultant on solution designs efforts  6. Other duties as assigned.QualificationsRequired: 1. Bachelors degree with 3-5 years of relevant experience; OR Associate Degree or 2 years of continuing education and/or training with 6-8 years of relevant experience; a high school diploma or equivalent with 7-9 years of relevant experience.  2. Solid communication, organization and interpersonal skills  3. Strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills  4. Willingness to be collaborative to achieve business objectives  5. Demonstration strong team work skills  6. Self-Starter- quickly learn systems/processes and assigned work.  7. Be flexible with change, pivot and redirect as needed to meet the objectives  8. Business Process Knowledge / system knowledge of health insurance or related field  9. Requirements modeling  10. Test case development  11. Familiar with SQL and test automation  12. Strong problem solving skills  13. Experience with requirements gathering techniques  14. Ability to quickly gain familiarity with systems, processes and assigned work  15. Experience working with data integration or experience working with visual requirements including but not limited to: logical data and process models, workflow diagrams, context diagrams and / or user interface mock-ups  16. Professional demeanor with the ability to model dedication and support for DHP Goals  17. Experience being a change agent in an organization. Preferred: 1. Bachelors Degree  2. Experience serving in a business or functional role in the healthcare or healthcare insurance industry  3. Familiarity with business analysis activities, such as elicitation, requirement documentation and communication and resolution assessment and validation  4. Experience writing user stories, Agile and Lean process experience  5. Experience working with HIPAA transaction  6. Technical proficiency in relevant technologies: Oracle, Informatica, TIBCO, .NET, Sharepoint, MetaVance, MS Office Suite, Version One QNXT  7. Experience working with Web Services or Data Warehousing  8. Experience performing business analysis tasks for data integration and EDI transactions efforts. Dean Health Plan, Inc.- Established in 1983, Dean Health Plan is the insurance services subsidiary of Dean and SSM Health. It maintains a position of leadership in insurance services through a physician-led integrated health system that improves the health of its members and delivers a superior level of service and care. We're looking for talented individuals committed to improving the health of community through innovation, partnership and integrity.

Description: Sr Business Analyst with AEM Madison, NJ 07940 1-year contract Candidates without AEM (Adobe Experience Manager) NEED NOT APPLY FOR THIS ROLE Onsite interview is REQUIRED, no Skype/WebEx is available Responsibilities Create and maintain standard processes, templates, workflows and procedures Conduct interviews, requirements workshops with a cross-discipline team to elicit understanding of business needs Collaborate with key stakeholders to help design and drive the functional definition of a solution that meets the program level objectives and vision Write unambiguous, testable user stories with clear acceptance criteria; an integrated scrum team member to assure requirements are understood fully; & define non-functional requirements Work with Product Management to write business cases and acceptance criteria Work with Business Product Owners to facilitate creation and maintenance of product roadmaps and backlogs. Mastery in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions using data visualization techniques & tools; documenting systems design, creating specifications, flow charts, and other related diagrams based on user or system design specifications. EXCEPTIONAL verbal, written, presentation & interpersonal skills. Experience with Balsamiq or similar tool. Strong knowledge in JIRA. Proven problem-solving, logical & analytical skills. Prior/current experience working with distributed, offshore teams. Some experience in leading/mentoring team. CBAP or PMI-PBA certification is HIGHLY DESIRED. Proficient in Visio, MS Excel, PowerPoint & other MS Office applications to build process flows & presentations. Name: Live Operations Producer / Analyst
Description: Location: Madison,Wisconsin,United StatesPerBlue is looking for a talented Live Operations Producer (aka Live Operations Analyst)to join our team. We’re a quickly growing independent studio whose free-to-play midcore mobile games have been played by millions people around the world, including our recently launched Disney Heroes: Battle Mode game. We’re looking for a detail oriented, optimization driven, and results-focused individual with a passion for free-to-play game economies and player communities.  As a Live Operations Producer, you will play a key role that will directly impact hundreds of thousands of players daily. You’ll work directly with our Chief Product Officer and be responsible for maximizing game KPIs and player experiences. You’ll drive retention and monetization of our player bases by designing, testing, and optimizing sales and events through analysis of our in-game economies and other data sources. This highly cross-functional and influential role interacts regularly with management, marketing, business intelligence, community support, and development teams.  Our ideal candidate is extremely efficient, proactive, and effectively able to take ownership of multiple processes and projects at one time. You should thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You’ll become the go-to expert on the health and state of our games, and you should be motivated to get to know the ins and outs of every detail of our in-game economies, game mechanics, and player communities. Requirements and QualificationsBachelor’s degree (or higher such as MBA) in Business, Economics, Psychology, Statistics, Engineering, or related field.Experience running free-to-play game economies and communities strongly preferredExperience with monetization and MMO / RPG / Strategy game mechanics preferredStrong interpersonal and communication skillsAbility to effectively communicate with producers, developers, and managementGood technical, problem solving, and analytical skillsFamiliar with Tableau and ExcelDetails & Perks We offer 6+ weeks of paid vacation and health, dental, and vision insurance as well as a well-matched 401k. We have a catered lunch program, a snack-stocked kitchen, and a refrigerator full of liquid refreshments. You'll get membership to our local hackerspace Sector67 and enjoy our regular socials. You'll be part of an energetic and collaborative environment, and work with a great team. We have flexible hours and are located in a vibrant neighborhood in beautiful downtown Madison.  PerBlue is an independent game development studio based in Madison, WI with a highly skilled team of amazingly talented people. We’ve been named a “Top Developer” by Google, a “Best Place to Work” by Madison Magazine, and “Madison's Favorite Tech Startup” by the Isthmus.  This is a full time position based in Madison, WI. Compensation is competitive and based on experience. Apply to this job

Name: Senior HRIS Analyst - Workday
Description: The HR Business Application Analyst will support our HR Systems primarily including, but not limited to, Workday (Human Capital Management). A key responsibility of this role is to develop and continuously improve HR system processes to increase user adoption, ensure compliance with policy and regulations, and improve business performance.  This role will work closely with the Human Resources and Payroll teams to continually enhance and support HCM systems and processes. General working knowledge of all HR disciplines (Benefits, Recruiting, Compensation, Learning, Talent, and HR Self-Service) is critical to success in this role.  As part of the HR team, this role will collaborate regularly with team colleagues, HR stakeholders, and other business partners to ensure that business processes are optimized to align with the technology and provide an excellent user experience with the systems supported. Assist with the day-to-day operation of the HR systems (primarily Workday). This includes, but is not limited to business process configuration/improvement, data entry, report creation & reporting, data analysis, user help and communications.Work with key stakeholders (employees, managers, HR business partners, payroll, benefits resources, etc.) to identify and refine business requirements for the HR systems supported (primarily Workday).Assist with implementation and upgrades for Workday including the change management process, training and communication plans.Actively participate in the design and implementation of new Workday functionality as business needs justify the enhancements.Assist with the process to design, deliver and support Workday integrations (with support from IT (internal or external) resources as necessary).Create test scripts, document test scenarios and perform testing activities of HR systems upon upgrade or launch of new features.Execute data conversion and data validation activities, resolve issues and defects reported and monitor health, usage and overall compliance of HR systems.Create reports that support metrics needed for the business and provide analysis as necessary.Work with internal resources to develop user procedures, guidelines, and documentation. Assist in development and training of internal customers on internal processes.Create andmaintain documentation for training.Minimum RequirementsBachelor’s degree or equivalent working experience in business or technology-related field.3+ years of Workday experience required.HRIS application administration experience, specifically with Workday HCM.Demonstrated experience working with or supporting core human resource business processes (performance management, employee on- or off-boarding, compensation planning, promotions, rehires, etc.).Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills with demonstrated experience effectively reporting data in an understandable way for a variety of audiences ranging from technical to senior leadership.Strong documentation, communication, and collaboration skills.Flexible and able to adapt to a rapidly changing environment.Positive, self-motivated individual who can complete goals independently.Demonstrates a customer-service oriented approach to problem solving and gathering feedback to determine continuous improvements.Desired CharacteristicsExperience with Workday HCM, Business Process Framework and Reporting required.Experience with one or more Workday modules (Benefits, Compensation, Time Off & Absence or Security) is preferred.Strong HR and business acumen.Experience with capturing requirements and documenting business processes.Experience managing enterprise application implementation projects.Experience working in a highly regulated environment (including SOX, HIPAA).Physical RequirementsAbility to work in an office setting, operate telephony devices, and a computer. #LI-MF1 Exact Sciences is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, disability, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other status protected by applicable local, state or federal law. Applicable portions of the Company’s affirmative action program is available to any applicant or employee for inspection upon request.

Name: SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST
Description: Job DescriptionLeading Web Services and E-Commerce company seeking a full-time Business Analyst to complement our growing team in Madison, Wisconsin. Wisconsin Interactive Network, LLC, a Madison-based subsidiary of eGovernment firm NIC (NASDAQ: EGOV), helps Wisconsin government entities Web-enable their information services. Our electronic government solutions use technology to increase efficiency and reduce costs for governments and their constituents.  We are seeking an enthusiastic and motivated candidate who thrives in a fast-paced environment to join our team as a Senior Business Analyst. This position will oversee all aspects of discovery, requirements gathering and documentation of functional and technical software requirements. The selected candidate will have the opportunity to work with a team of highly versatile and talented project managers, developers and designers and at various levels of state government.  The best qualified candidates will have at least four years of real world experience as a business analyst. Familiarity with Web applications and Internet technology, strong communication and writing skills are a must. A strong work ethic, great attitude and dedication to success are expected. Our team members are self-motivated professionals who enjoy the challenge of implementing project management and business solutions in a high-pressure, client-services entrepreneurial environment.  Who we are: Our growing Madison team is dynamic, energetic and brings a wealth of experience from NIC partners in other states as well as other companies. Our mission is to knock the socks off our Wisconsin clients as well as the citizens they serve. To do this we need a rock star Business Analyst to keep the hundreds of moving parts going full steam ahead in perfect unison.  People often say that Government should serve its constituents more like businesses serve their customers. At NIC, we make that ideal a reality by removing technology as a barrier and helping government engage with citizens in a meaningful way online twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week.  We are a premier provider of Internet-based, electronic government services that help government entities use the Internet to reduce costs and provide a higher level of service to businesses and citizens. We contract with governments and design, build and operate websites, web, and mobile applications for government. We allow businesses and citizens to access information and complete transactions such as applying for permits or renewing licenses online. NIC’s unique business model allows us to reduce our government clients' financial and technology risks and obtain revenue by sharing in the fees generated by electronic services.  Our government clients benefit from a centralized, manageable, customer-focused presence on the Internet. Businesses and citizens benefit from faster, more convenient and cost-effective interactions with government. Job duties in a few tidy bullet points:Manage a small team of Business Analysts to include performance management, skill development, training and input into hiring decisions for your teamRefine and reinforce consistency in processes and artifacts for business analysis and requirements gathering, and collaborate with development staff to develop and improve organizational standardsLead customer interview sessions with state agencies to elicit and validate functional and technical requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirement workshops, surveys, site visits, business process description, use cases, scenarios, task and workflow analysisCritically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low level information to a general understanding and distinguish user requests from underlying needsIdentify workflow and process improvement opportunities, and perform analysis of new changed processes, and clearly document and communicate themCollaborate with state agencies, development staff and user interface designers to define requirements and acceptance criteria for implementation Create detailed and effective project specification documentation, including user scenarios, screen mock-ups, business rules, and acceptance criteriaCreate test plans and scripts for user testingPerform internal testing and other quality assurance activitiesResponsible for validation of requirements with key stakeholdersProvide hands-on participation throughout the development life cycleDevelop trusted relationships with state agency subject matter expertsYou will definitely need all this:Undergraduate degree in information systems, business, computer science or equivalent work experience in business analysis with a preference for Certification of Competency in Business Analysis or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)Minimum two years of job related experienceExperience with formal requirements syntaxMust display a positive attitude and patience in dealing with customers with varying technical experience or knowledgeSelf-motivated with the ability to multi-task, prioritize tasks and deliver results to meet customer expectations Desire and ability to work in a fast-paced, highly flexible and entrepreneurial environmentMust enjoy working both independently and within project teamsMust possess strong analytical and problem-solving abilities and pay obsessive attention to detailWhy work for us?Your work product will be used by thousands if not millions of peopleWe offer the excitement of a start-up AND the benefits/support of a big companyBenefits:Competitive compensation programNo-cost group medical/dental insuranceVision insuranceStock purchase planMatching 401(k) contributions with 100% vestingDisability insuranceLife insuranceCompany wellness programCasual and fun office environmentPaid State holidays/vacationTuition reimbursement Company DescriptionDo you want to work for a company that makes lives easier every day? Are you interested in developing innovative technologies to improve government?  Then NIC is the perfect place for you! NIC works every day to make government more accessible and efficient for all. We are the leading provider of digital government solutions for more than 4,500 federal, state, and local agencies in the United States. Forbes has even named NIC as one of the 100 Best Small Companies in America several years in a row. Come work for one of the best, and together we'll make good government great.

Name: Senior Procurement Services Analyst
Description: Who We Are We are a leading not-for-profit health insurer in Wisconsin, and our services have grown to reach active-duty and retired military personnel, seniors, and families in Wisconsin, across the U.S., and around the world. Learn more!  WPS receives World's Most Ethical Company Award for 9th Year in a Row-2018 Most Ethical Companies AnnouncementAt Our Core WPS Health Solutions has earned a reputation as a leader in the insurance and benefits administration industry through our commitment to excellence and high-quality service. Our corporate values reflect the core of who we are and how we conduct business every day.Customer FocusedI recognize how my actions impact internal and external customers by being responsible for the customer experience. I look beyond the immediate issue to recognize and solve the problem. Individual ResponsibilityI own my actions. I am accountable and dedicated to achieving the best results for WPS Health Solutions and our customers. I embrace my role in helping the company achieve a high-performance workplace.Mutual RespectI lead by example and act ethically, honestly and am trustworthy. I show appreciation for others by giving and taking constructive feedback and encouragement. Driven and PassionateI approach my work with enthusiasm, and personal commitment to the success of our business. I keep the importance of the work we do for our customers alive in my attitude and interactions with others, and demonstrate pride in the worthiness of our purpose.Position Summary TheSenior Procurement Services Analyst is responsible for using planning, reporting, and data analysis to support the WPS procurement team and processes with the ultimate goal of increasing the quality and decreasing the cost of WPS purchases. This includes managing and monitoring procurement spend, vendor management system, small business subcontracting program and data collection in accordance with company policies and procedures and, when applicable, federal government laws and regulations. In this role you will:Procurement Services (55%)Review, track, analyze, and manage purchase order requests, spend data, and trends, including procurement cost-savings.Manage and maintain procurement spend data by various spend categories.Manage monthly and annual procurement reports, prepare department metrics, and generate reports to present to stakeholders.Maintain and monitor vendor management system that includes vendor profiles and scorecards, and generate reports used in decision-making for future procurements.Assist other staff with vetting out suppliers in support of procurements.Create and develop pricing models for fair price and reasonableness.Assist and support procurement team with price and cost analysis for procurements.Develop and present training to procurement team and stakeholders relating to procurement metrics and trends.Support internal and external audits, serving as a key participant as appropriate.Identify and implement process improvements to drive simplicity, efficiency and transparency in the WPS procurement process.Attend meetings, training, and seminars to maintain and enhance job knowledge and appropriate skillsets.Small Business Reporting (25%)Complete research to assist in achieving WPS small business subcontracting goals.Prepare small business subcontracting plans, monitor goals, as well as generate reports and analytics to support small business subcontracting goals in accordance with federal government laws and regulations.Customer Service (10%)Provide advice and assistance in procurement planning and pricing matters to procurement team and internal WPS customers.Serve as a subject matter expert for procurement systems, including Deltek Costpoint, Deltek Expense, and Hyland OnBase IA and REQ Connect.Leadership (10%)Develop supported conclusions and recommendations based on data.Provide guidance to less experienced staff.You should have:Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Procurement, or related field OR equivalent post high school education and/or work-related experience4 or more years of experience with any combination of procurement, vendor management, small business reporting, price analysis, or accounting-related activitiesIn addition, we prefer:Experience working with Deltek Expense, Deltek Costpoint, Microsoft SharePoint, and Hyland OnBase IA and REQ ConnectStay connected: Join ourTalent Community!FOLLOW US!FacebookTwitterLinkedIn

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of a Technical Business Analyst in Madison, WI. Overview: The Technical Analyst will be a self-starter that works with minimal supervision who supports business strategy and utilize strong facilitation skills to elicit requirements and business needs from cross-functional teams across all levels of the organization, including vendors. The Technical Analyst will help define solution, scope and objectives and/or process improvements to meet business needs. They will optimize business functions, business and system process, understand impact of systems on business capability. They will also be responsible for ensuring the quality of IT solutions through testing activities (reusability, performance, automation, etc.) and understand defect tracking and remediation. They will also serve as a liaison between IT and business units to resolve technology issues, they will understand and support complex and cross-functional assignments using various methodologies. The Technical Analyst will also gain confidence of stakeholders at all levels of the organization in the problem solving and decision-making analysis approach through effective leadership of these activities that result in appropriate solutions to underlying problems. This position could be training users and clearly communicated changes and impacts on processes and policies. They may be required to work outside of core hours for production support rotation and/or project implementations. They may be required to travel to sites where needed. Name: Business Reporting Analyst

Headquartered in Chicago, Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 147 territories, with over 33,000 professionals. The combined worldwide revenue of independent member firms is $3.4 billion. It’s an exciting time to join Baker Tilly! Responsible for development and maintenance of firm-wide reporting systems. Name: Sr. Business Analyst (2 positions)
Description: These positions have the primary responsibility of eliciting business needs from the various DHS program areas to develop solutions to business problems. This includes, but is not limited to, facilitating requirements sessions, documenting business needs and business processes, analyzing business processes, and applying and implementing both technology and non-technology focused solutions to business problems. The incumbent is expected to serve as the principal authority in business analysis methodology and will work with the Project Management Section (PMO) leadership to establish standards, procedures and best practices for business analysis at the Department. These positions are also responsible for providing direction and mentorship to other business analysts in the PMO in the use of tools, techniques, metrics, and standards.  The incumbent is expected to perform the most advanced level of work with little supervision, assist others in their area of expertise, and work with others to prepare accurate estimates of work. The incumbent is expected to provide expertise in multiple projects of moderate to difficult scope and complexity. Project lead activities may be required depending on project scope and individual assignment.  Special Notes: Due to the nature of the position, all applicants who may be appointed to this position will be required to allow the DHS to conduct a background check to determine whether the circumstances of any conviction may be related to the job being filled. Qualifications:Minimally qualified candidates will have:Experience working with customers to identify their functional needs and translating them into technical solutions.Experience designing business processes and preparing business rules to support needs.Strong communication and organizational skills.In addition, well-qualified candidates will have:Project management experience performing duties such as gathering business requirements, mapping data requirements, using process improvement techniques creating process flows, and/ or proposing alternative business processes, etc.Experience using case designs and documentation.Strong analysis and problem solving skills.SDL2017

Name: RPA Business Analyst
Description: The RPA Process Analyst Business Analyst is an integral part of the Robotics Process Automation (RPA) Enablement Team. This role will provide the expertise needed to drive continuous improvement within the organization. By working closely with subject matter experts in functional areas, this role will serve as change agents and internal consultants. The Process Analyst & Modeler works with business units to analyze the current way of doing business and determine what opportunities are available for process improvement and/or automation. The right person for this role should stimulate thinking by posing new ways of doing things, challenge conventional wisdom and demonstrate successful application of methodologies. This role will report to the Director of RPA. Position Responsibilities:Lead process assessment and conduct “deep dive” sessions with SMEs (Subject Matter Experts) to understand, analyse and document the processWork with Sr. Management, and Executive board to identify and understand the benefits of Robotic Process Automation.Create post-deep dive “Analysis Reports” to: Map the current-state process and collect functional requirements and business metrics from the process owner (cycle time, case volumes, SLA requirements, current work effort, etc.)Identify additional process improvement opportunities (both technical and non-technical) to drive efficiency and stabilization prior to and throughout RPACreate detailed documentation to support process automation from design through test phases and ensure accurate mapping of current-state and future-state processBuild robot automation (software training to be provided) as per best practices and coding standards to meet defined requirements as per the specification and documentation signed-off by the Process OwnerPerform functional and non-functional testing of the robots to ensure that the robot is working as per the specification and documentation signed-off by the Process OwnerFacilitate meetings with management to review and examine pipeline and projects progress.Provide project, methodology, and tool support to the organization.Serve as a change agent promoting process improvement.Develop strong working relationships with management at all levels.

Familiar with industry standards, current and emerging technologies, and business process mapping, and re-engineering.  Prepares solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc. Develops RFPs. Description: *Position Summary:** The primary purpose of this position is to serve as a supporting liaison between members of the technical team and the business user community to analyze business and user needs, elicit and document requirements, identify system enhancements, and determine impacts to current processes. and ?To-Be? states  + Ensures business requirements are met, optimal system design is achieved and differences between business requirements and systems capabilities are resolved  + Leverages business experience and analytical skills to define recommendations and process improvements through industry best practices and personal line of business knowledge.  + Identifies potential solutions and evaluates them for both technical and business suitability  + Serve as a liaison between business users and developers  + Contributes to the adoption services/efforts of an implementation project  + Develops training materials for end users *Basic Qualifications:** + Bachelor?s Degree in Systems Analysis, Information Technology, Business, or related field  + At least three (3) years? Employees are obligated to know and perform their duties in accordance with Sirius policies, standards, and procedures related to security and report security violations to the appropriate Sirius authority.  + Participate at hire and annually in the Information Security Awareness training as well as other required training identified by the Human Resources department. Other data privacy and data security related regulatory training may be required based on your role or assignment. *_Essential Functions:_** _This position exists to provide consulting solutions to customers a_ _nd as such requires the ability to travel to and from customer sites and interact with customers on an ongoing and regular basis._ The above primary duties, responsibilities, and position requirements are not all inclusive. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Leading Web Services and E-Commerce company seeking a full-time Business Analyst to complement our growing team in Madison, Wisconsin. Wisconsin Interactive Network, LLC, a Madison-based subsidiary of eGovernment firm NIC (NASDAQ: EGOV), helps Wisconsin government entities Web-enable their information services. Our electronic government solutions use technology to increase efficiency and reduce costs for governments and their constituents.  We are seeking an enthusiastic and motivated candidate who thrives in a fast-paced environment to join our team as a Senior Business Analyst. This position will oversee all aspects of discovery, requirements gathering and documentation of functional and technical software requirements. The selected candidate will have the opportunity to work with a team of highly versatile and talented project managers, developers and designers and at various levels of state government.  The best qualified candidates will have at least four years of real world experience as a business analyst. Familiarity with Web applications and Internet technology, strong communication and writing skills are a must. A strong work ethic, great attitude and dedication to success are expected. Our team members are self-motivated professionals who enjoy the challenge of implementing project management and business solutions in a high-pressure, client-services entrepreneurial environment.  Who we are: Our growing Madison team is dynamic, energetic and brings a wealth of experience from NIC partners in other states as well as other companies. Our mission is to knock the socks off our Wisconsin clients as well as the citizens they serve. To do this we need a rock star Business Analyst to keep the hundreds of moving parts going full steam ahead in perfect unison.  People often say that Government should serve its constituents more like businesses serve their customers. At NIC, we make that ideal a reality by removing technology as a barrier and helping government engage with citizens in a meaningful way online twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week.  We are a premier provider of Internet-based, electronic government services that help government entities use the Internet to reduce costs and provide a higher level of service to businesses and citizens. We contract with governments and design, build and operate websites, web, and mobile applications for government. We allow businesses and citizens to access information and complete transactions such as applying for permits or renewing licenses online. NIC's unique business model allows us to reduce our government clients' financial and technology risks and obtain revenue by sharing in the fees generated by electronic services.  Our government clients benefit from a centralized, manageable, customer-focused presence on the Internet. Businesses and citizens benefit from faster, more convenient and cost-effective interactions with government.  Job duties in a few tidy bullet points: Manage a small team of Business Analysts to include performance management, skill development, training and input into hiring decisions for your teamRefine and reinforce consistency in processes and artifacts for business analysis and requirements gathering, and collaborate with development staff to develop and improve organizational standardsLead customer interview sessions with state agencies to elicit and validate functional and technical requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirement workshops, surveys, site visits, business process description, use cases, scenarios, task and workflow analysisCritically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low level information to a general understanding and distinguish user requests from underlying needsIdentify workflow and process improvement opportunities, and perform analysis of new changed processes, and clearly document and communicate themCollaborate with state agencies, development staff and user interface designers to define requirements and acceptance criteria for implementation Create detailed and effective project specification documentation, including user scenarios, screen mock-ups, business rules, and acceptance criteriaCreate test plans and scripts for user testingPerform internal testing and other quality assurance activitiesResponsible for validation of requirements with key stakeholdersProvide hands-on participation throughout the development life cycleDevelop trusted relationships with state agency subject matter expertsYou will definitely need all this:Undergraduate degree in information systems, business, computer science or equivalent work experience in business analysis with a preference for Certification of Competency in Business Analysis or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)Minimum two years of job related experienceExperience with formal requirements syntaxMust display a positive attitude and patience in dealing with customers with varying technical experience or knowledgeSelf-motivated with the ability to multi-task, prioritize tasks and deliver results to meet customer expectations Desire and ability to work in a fast-paced, highly flexible and entrepreneurial environmentMust enjoy working both independently and within project teamsMust possess strong analytical and problem-solving abilities and pay obsessive attention to detail Why work for us? Your work product will be used by thousands if not millions of peopleWe offer the excitement of a start-up AND the benefits/support of a big companyBenefits:Competitive compensation programNo-cost group medical/dental insuranceVision insuranceStock purchase planMatching 401(k) contributions with 100% vestingDisability insuranceLife insuranceCompany wellness programCasual and fun office environmentPaid State holidays/vacationTuition reimbursementSDL2017

Name: Corporate Business Planning Analyst
Description: DescriptionRole Purpose:Under the direction of the Manager of Business Analysis, the Corporate Business/Planning Analyst performs a variety of project oriented tasks and has a proven commitment to exceptional customer service to support the strategic operational and financial needs of SSM Health Dean Medical Group (DMG). The position is responsible for the direction of small to medium sized projects, ensuring consistency with the corporate strategy, consistency of process across projects, and customer satisfaction with the processes and results. This position interprets all pertinent operational and financial data, summarizes issues and examines the market forces to present comprehensive analyses. Comprehensive analyses will include collation and evaluation of data from a variety of sources, drawing conclusions relative to available data, and identifying alternative options and recommendations, prepare financial impact analysis and prepare final report. The position will participate in presentations involving all levels of management. Responsibilities1. Analyze, synthesize and interpret business data and use a creative problem solving approach to solve business issues. Projects and assignments may include medium to large projects to assist Senior Management decision making:a. Operational and/or financial analysisb. Strategic assessment of current and future growth opportunities.c. Analysis and research in support of specific business strategies.d. Financial scenario modeling of potential initiatives and investments and comprehensive financial analysis.2. Create models to forecast business variables for specific projects that may include limited integration with other entities. Based on specific business requirements, develop ad hoc analysis for senior management to assess current/historical trends and the potential impact on future operations and profitability.3. Interact with Senior Management from DMG, SSM and DHP on matters involving strategic planning, operations and financial models often requiring coordination between the organizations. 4. Identify and provide guidance to Associate Analyst to identify appropriate analysis techniques and methods for presenting the data in a way that it meets the customers needs.5. Develop and maintain subject matter data expertise in one or more subject areas and provide guidance to other analysts in these areas.6. Utilize project management knowledge and skills for assigned projects. Develop and manage project plan from original concept through final implementation. Monitor and report to the project owners the project progress, timeframe, scope, quality, cost and risk. Facilitate identification of issues, assign responsibility and ensure proper resolution.7. Assist Senior Corporate Business Analysts in the development of project solutions by working closely with customers to obtain in-depth understanding of the business need in order to develop business requirements. 8. Proactively identify problems and facilitate process improvement opportunities to improve quality and efficiency.9. Performs other duties and special assignments as needed.QualificationsRequired1. Bachelors degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or related field with 3-5 years of business or finance experience.2. Healthcare experience to include ambulatory, inpatient, professional billing, regulatory, coding, insurance, operations, administration or other related area.3. Experience with spreadsheets, database applications and reporting tools to create, manipulate, interpret and repot from complex data sources.4. Proficient in using reporting tools (Crystal, Access, Comshare, SQL, Qlik View) used to fill data/information requests.5. Proven ability with data interpretation and identification of trends and anomalies.6. Solid knowledge and understanding of database structures, query languages and concepts.7. Strong analytical, critical thinking, financial analysis and problem solving skills to identify issues and trends, create innovative options and make recommendations for management to act on. 8. Excellent communication and organizational skills to work effectively with all levels of the organization.9. Strong time management skills for working on multiple projects at a given time and meeting assigned deadlines.10. Strong presentation skills and group facilitation skills with the ability to present oneself and ones ideas with clarity, confidence and poise.Preferred:1. Masters degree.2. Prior experience in an integrated healthcare delivery system.3. Project management experience.4. Subject matter expertise in one or more healthcare related subject areas: specific specialty/business line or business/administrative aspect.Essential Physical Functions:The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Ability to continuously see fine print and to use the computer for extended periods.3. Ability to hear and converse on the phone and in person.4. Name: Project Portfolio Analyst, Organization Engineering
Description: The Project Portfolio Analyst oversees the activities that support the company’s most complex strategic projects by ensuring reporting and governance alignment, providing portfolio performance measurements and recommendations, and trending analytics. This position is responsible for the Portfolio’s intake, supply and demand (resource management) methods, analytics and recommendations. Reporting responsibilities includes detailed analysis, dashboards and decision support updates (KPI’s) and recommendations on a regular cadence. The Portfolio Analyst will at times provide project support to Project and Change managers. This position reports to the Associate Director, Organization Engineering. Name: Business Analyst/Consultant
Description: Description:The Office of Health Informatics (OHI) in the Division of Public Health (DPH) seeks to add a Business Analyst/Consultant 3 contractor primarily assisting the Informatics Architecture team with process coordination and business requirement analysis for our Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health (HITECH) Act projects. These efforts include improving Meaningful Use (MU) registry reporting by developing a process to transmit all MU data to DPH in one feed, per provider.  This position will serve as liaison between the submitting provider, the Intermediary and the Division of Public Health, as well as, between the Office of Health Informatics and the programs receiving Meaningful Use data. They will compile the electronic submission requirements for all public health MU registries and provide guidance to the data routing development staff. This position will also assist with other Informatics Architecture Section HITECH projects as needed to meet DPH business needs, aligned with the appropriate funding.  Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Experienced with business process reengineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective. Familiar with industry standards, current and emerging technologies, and business process mapping, and reengineering.  Prepares solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc. Develops RFPs. Business Analyst/Consultant capabilities with 8 or more years of experience in the field or in a related area. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Independently, performs a variety of complicated tasks. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: DescriptionBusiness Analyst (IT): III (Senior)  12 Month Contract*candidates must complete a background check and drug screen upon offer*Description: We are seeking a highly motivated Senior Business Analyst, that will work to build the next generation of robust platforms that lay the foundation for our agent and broker product lines. As a member of the Brand Digital Marketing team the Business Analyst will be responsible for one or more business products and expected to collaborate with the other business analysts to coordinate across product. We are looking for an individual with a strong understanding of Business Analysis who has a demonstrated track record of defining and driving technology-based solutions to implement strategic solutions while bridging the divide between business and technical knowledge. This resource must be a clear articulate communicator, proficient in presenting to all levels.  The Business Analyst is responsible for developing solutions that support business ideas and product concepts through gathering and translating testable requirements into application software solutions. They must be a critical thinker capable of contributing independently and collaborating to drive sound solutions with a diverse team including product managers, software developers, testers, program managers, scrum masters and teams across the organization. They will serve as a liaison between the customer/business community and the software development team, working with them to obtain requirements through various avenues both Agile and Waterfall using interviews, document analysis, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, road maps, workflow analysis and use cases etc. They will need to leverage excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to mentor, coach, lead as well as direct the work of others. Responsibilities:Create and maintain standard processes, templates, workflows and proceduresConduct interviews, requirements workshops with a cross-discipline team to elicit understanding of business needsCollaborate with key stakeholders to help design and drive the functional definition of a solution that meets the program level objectives and visionWrite unambiguous, testable user stories with clear acceptance criteria; an integrated scrum team member to assure requirements are understood fully; & define non-functional requirementsWork with Product Management to write business cases and acceptance criteriaWork with Business Product Owners to facilitate creation and maintenance of product roadmaps and backlogs.Assist team to troubleshoot issues; evaluate existing application products which could address client requirements and develops recommendations where appropriatePartner with cross-functional teams to analyze, decompose and map current state processes and pain points, then determine improvement opportunities including creation of target operating modelsTake ownership to lead solutions from concept to implementation by partnering with Technology and Business to ensure requirements are satisfied and delivered on timeBuild and develop business relationships vital to the success of the projectDeliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholdersRequirements:Bachelor's degree; advanced degree, Computer Science, Information Technology, Science5+ years of experience in Business AnalysisHands-on experience in an Agile development environment, ideally Scrum.Proven experience in eliciting requirements, creating user stories, test cases, and wireframesExperience in facilitating the elicitation and evaluation of business requirements for delivering new or enhanced software systems, and measuring the success of the associated initiativesAbility to independently and quickly ramp up on new business and technical conceptsExperienced in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions using data visualization techniques and tools.Documenting systems design, creating specifications, flow charts, and other related diagrams based on user or system design specifications.Advanced knowledge in generating process documentationExcellent verbal, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; is a team player.Very strong written skills showing the ability to convey details accurately in a well-structured and precise manner that describe end user problems and solutions.Solid experience in and understanding of Scrum Agile development or Scaled Agile Framework, Waterfall, and SDLC processesExperience with Balsamiq or similar toolJIRA knowledgeProven problem-solving skills, is logical and analytical.Experience in working with distributed, offshore teams.Experience in managing and mentoring team.Preferred CBAP (Certified Business Analyst Professional) or PMI-PBA (PMI Professional in Business Analysis)Preferred previous experience in Content Management Systems (CMS) and specifically Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)Proficient in Visio, MS Excel, PowerPoint and other Office applications to build process flows and presentations #Low  #LI-RD1,#LI-KR1Horizontal Integration is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.
