Name: Senior Business Analyst- Finance
Description: Company Profiles  Weir has been in business since 1871 and our sustainability and success has been built on attracting, retaining, and developing exceptional people.  As a global company, employing around 15,000 people in over 70 countries, we reflect the diversity of our customers in the diversity of our people and ensure everyone is given the opportunity to flourish regardless of their gender, race, beliefs or background.  Weir is an inclusive and innovative organisation where you can be your authentic self. We continually develop our talent and diversity of thought to keep our business relevant, innovative and successful for the future.  Enabling our people to unleash their full potential is central to 'We are Weir', our vision, mission, and strategic priorities. We aim to be the most admired engineering business in our markets and we'll achieve that ambition by being the employer of choice in our markets.  We offer a wide range of career opportunities across a variety of technical and business roles in engineering, manufacturing and service locations worldwide.  Business Need / Purpose of Role  Under the direction of the Controller, the Senior Business Analyst is responsible for various accounting functions including, but not limited to, product line profitability analysis, account reconciliations, department expense reviews. The role will primarily be based in Madison, but may require occasional travel to other facilities within the Weir Minerals North America region.  Objectives & Measurement - Key Responsibilities Responsible for ongoing analysis of product lines to identify profitable and marginal or unprofitable offerings. Work with Supply Chain and Sales to increase margins where possible.Account for manufacturing variances, scrap and rework cost, and product returns. Produce internal information to facilitate control of these costs.Account reconciliations for % of completion account and obsolete/slow move inventory account (monthly) as well as preparation of related journal entries.Assist managers to prepare capex approval requests and prepare capex post implementation reviews in accordance with Divisional and Group timetables.Analyze and update multi-level product costs as changes occur.Assist with intercompany reviews/transactions, including preparing the monthly payment schedule and reviewing intercompany mark-up transactions mid-month and at month-end for accuracy, resolve any issues in a timely manner.Develop financial analyses as needed to support business needs.Assist with data gathering for internal and external audits.Complete special projects as assigned by the Controller.Comply with all Finance Department and Company policies, procedures, and programs.Ensure compliance with all safety and work rules and regulations. Ensure the maintenance of departmental housekeeping standards.Participate on cross-functional teams to ensure the continuous, ongoing improvement of processes, methods, productivity and quality, while reducing costs.Promote and maintain a flexible, cooperative, team oriented, and customer focused attitude within and between departments.Responsible for Environmental Health and Safety management and policy commitments as prescribed for this role in Weir's Duty of Care.Nothing in this position description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. Job Knowledge / Education and Qualifications  Job Knowledge / Education and Qualifications  The details described here are representative of those that are encountered by or must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Education and/or Experience: Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university in finance/accounting. Three to five years of financial accounting experience in a global manufacturing environment. Knowledge of IFRS, including key differences between IFRS and U.S. GAAP. Experience with consolidation/elimination process and foreign currency translation accounting, knowledge of financial budget and reporting impact of foreign currency fluctuations. Language Skills: Ability to read, analyze, and interpret financial reports. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community. Ability to effectively present financial information, including budgets, forecasts, monthly results and other financial analyses to management. Mathematical: Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations. Reasoning Ability: Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. Computer Skills: The Senior Financial Analyst job requires strong data mining skills. Proven experience developing Excel financial models is required, including development and/or use consolidation models for multiple locations or entities, profitability analysis by product line/category, departmental expense variance analysis, account reconciliation analysis and development of key performance indicator analyses and tracking. Advanced Excel user experience is required, including use of VLOOKUPs, Pivot Tables, IF and IFSUM formulas.  Requires the ability to operate a variety of standard business equipment and software. Strong ERP knowledge including experience with multiple systems in a mid-sized organization is required. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations: Requires a valid driver's license. Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Basic knowledge and skills within supervisory, coaching, mentoring and disciplinary areas. Strong analytical skills. Excellent computer skills with spreadsheets. Excellent organization, oral and written communication, motivation, human relations, records keeping, trouble shooting, problem-solving and follow-through skills. Effective presentation skills. Ability to promote and maintain positive relationships. Good work ethic - proactive. Confidence in own abilities and capable of acting decisively. Ability to project and maintain professionalism with a diversity of people inside and outside the Company. Willingness to accept responsibility and accountability. Willingness and ability to travel as necessary. Ability to work under pressure and in stressful situations and maintain attention to detail. Must have a passion for the business and the "will" to succeed. Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, use hands to finger, handle or feel, talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk and reach with hands and arms.  The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close, distance, color, and ability to adjust focus. Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  General office environment. Moderate noise..  Core Competencies  Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully; develops alternative solutions; works well in group problem solving situations; uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.  Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; responds promptly to customer needs; solicits customer feedback to improve service; responds to requests for service and assistance; meets commitments.  Organizational Support - Follows policies and procedures; completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; supports organization's goals and values; benefits organization through outside activities; supports affirmative action and respects diversity.  Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; looks for ways to improve and promote quality; applies feedback to improve performance; monitors own work to ensure quality.  Quantity - Meets productivity standards; completes work in timely manner; strives to increase productivity; works quickly.  Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; takes responsibility for own actions; keeps commitments; commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals; completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.SDL2017

Name: SAP Business Analyst SD Functional Consultant
Description: Role: SAP Business Analyst SD Functional Consultant  Location: Madison , Wisconsin  Duration: 7 months **************************************************************************Please send your resume to resumes@witssolutions.com************************************************************************** Day to Day job Duties: (what this person will do on a daily/weekly basis) Support SAP ECC and related software. Knowledge of Sales and Distribution techniques, methods, and tools. Subject matter best practices. Knowledge of SAP reporting capabilities. Develop IT and end-user documentation for processes and procedures. Participate in Service Desk function to resolve user related support calls. Prepare and execute test plans for new functionality. Publish communication related to the deployment of new functionality. Translate user requests into user requirements and program specifications. Work with Enterprise Shared Services and programmers to assure compliance to program specifications Develop training outlines for end-users and collaborate with documentation specialists Liaise with Divisional Management to understand direction within their functional area of responsibility Monitor compliance with Service Level Agreements for site. Support business initiatives utilizing Project Management expertise. Maintain security in compliance with client's Security directives. Ensure compliance to Client's IT Policies and Guidelines. Gather user requirements to develop solutions and alternatives. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. Translate high-level information into details as well as summarize detailed information. Communicate and collaborate with users to analyze information needs and functional requirements. Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs. Work with users to define concepts under direction of project leaders. Serve as the conduit between the user community and the software development team through which requirements flow. Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates. Liaise between the business, technology teams and support teams. Comply with companys Global IT Policies & Procedures. Other duties as assigned. Basic Qualifications: (what are the skills required to this job with minimum years of experience on each) SAP-SCM-Sales & Distribution: 5 years 3-7 years of business experience in functional area. 2-4 years of SAP experience. 4+ years of related technical work experience. Excellent knowledge of business processes and best practices. Knowledge of SAP in specified area. Strong interpersonal and excellent documentation skills are a must. Able to assume and complete assignments independently. Ability to explain and champion technical concepts to a broad audience. Excellent customer service skills required. Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. Strong project management skills and understanding of project management lifecycle. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Travel: Need local but Travel can range from 25%-50%. Degree: 4 year degree or 5-7 years experience in related area. Relevant technical certificates a plus. Nice to Have; (But not a must)

The individual will provide support services to include:  1) Identify and create processes to communicate and submit documents to the Internal Revenue Service using SDT-Technology  2) Track status of IRS-CAP updates and coordinate activities with multiple Agencies, and reporting of findings to the IRS as needed  3) Create efficient processes to identify the flow of Federal Tax Information (FTI) data in the KIDS Application and other applications used by the Bureau of Child Support  4) Assist in the update of Fact Sheets related to security or policy in the KIDS Application  5) Review audit logs and assist in the development of guidelines/processes for continued review  6) Identify liaisons supporting the Child Support Portal to determine changes impacting Agencies  7) Monitor security mailbox, process user access requests, respond to security related questions, KidPol mailbox, and questions for the department.  EEO Employer

Name: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: TDS Telecom has a fantastic opportunity for a Sr.Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Network Operations team in our Madison, WI office!  This position provides functional system support, creates operational tools, and develops reporting and analysis for all areas of the Network Operations organization (CLEC, ILEC, and Cable). This includes but is not limited to the following teams: Customer Repair, Field Services, Dispatch, Advanced Technical Services, Service Activation, Deployment, Provisioning and Assignment, Translations, and Circuit Design.  Provides day-to-day support of functional systems owned by Network Operations such as UTS, Metasolv, DSM, as well as home grown tools used by the Network Operations teams. This position is responsible to develop new tools to support operational initiatives. Works collaboratively with internal customers to gather requirements and build solutions to meet internal customer needs.  Develops reporting and analysis of data housed within systems to target opportunities for controlling costs, growing revenue, and driving operational efficiencies across all NO teams. Provides data and analysis to cross functional teams to support improvements of products and services and implementation of new products and services delivered to customers,  Takes a leadership role in cross functional teams including PAC/ORC projects to ensure back end systems are appropriately enhanced for business and process changes. Develops standards, processes and procedures, and training for system and tool enhancements. Leads projects to research and implement best practices and tools for data mining and analysis. Mentors team members and performs technical reviews of peer projects.  Support of systems and tools used functionally by the Network Operations Teams. System support includes issues related to automation, system functionality, improving efficiency related to the applicable system(s), or training end-users.Leadership role in projects including PAC/ORC projects related to systems/tools, upgrades, enhancements, releases.Creates design requirements, table updates, database administration, test plans, implementation and training plans, conversion review work, and report planning.In many cases system enhancements will be driven by the Network Operations team and this position may be called upon to be a project lead. In this capacity the employee may be called upon to review or research new systems/functionality Develop and enhance operational tools for customers within and outside the department. Communicates collaboratively with internal customers to understand requirements and business objectives. Asks probing questions to uncover underlying business need and builds effective tools to meet the business need.Maintains a deep functional knowledge of system data structure and procedures to ensure tools developed are as effective as possible.Develops and documents procedures and trains users where needed on tool enhancements or new tools that are developed. Develop/determine reporting needs related to the TDS network, resource efficiency, and/or other analysis. This may include report creation via Crystal Enterprise, Python, SQL, or other data analysis technologies depending on the needs.  Keeps current with changes in the telephone industry and ongoing initiatives in other TDS functional units. Required QualificationsAssociate Degree or higher OR 2+ years professional work experience.3+ years experience in the area of Relational Database Reporting Languages such as: SQL, OR experience programming with Python or any other programming languageOther QualificationsAdvanced Programming/SQL ExperienceDataBase Reporting ExperienceExceptional working knowledge of most NetOps Functional Systems and ToolsKnowledge of LinuxKnowledge of ApacheExperience using or creating web servicesA professional attitude and courteous manner toward clients, partners and staffExcellent & proven interpersonal communication skills (i.e., verbal, written, listening). Able to provide consulting to personnel and customersProven ability to make timely and effective decisionAble to make difficult decisions concerning complex issues often in areas where there is no precedentAbility to organize priorities to achieve maximum performance cost effectively  Excellent PC skills – including key software programsFlexible personality and ability to multi-task a variety of projects with diverse groupsWill be expected to travel as the job dictates the needBenefits: As a part of your total compensation, #TDS provides a comprehensive, competitive benefit package. The benefit plans address both the immediate and long term needs that you and your family may have. For an overview of what we have to offer for full-time employees including vacation, health benefits and retirement options please click here.

Name: Project Manager / Business Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client seeking a Project Manager/Business Analyst in Madison, Wisconsin (WI).  Summary:  The candidate needs strong analysis skills to be involved in helping break down larger initiatives/projects into smaller tasks/features with the business to prepare the work for the delivery teams. This person would be used as a utility player on the team to cover some of the smaller initiatives but also need to have a strong PM mindset to independently manage and drive work forward. This is a long-term contract position working with a great group of people.REQUIREMENTS: Master's or Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experience in similar position Any Project Management or Scrum Master related certifications would be preferred Experience with EPIC/Feature decomposition to prepare work for features which requires strong analysis skills Experience leading projects and working with business partners to help define requirements Experience with vendor coordination, planning/tracking of business activities, tracking of financials, etc. Experience in Healthcare is preferred, but not required PM tasks - Risk/Issue management, vendor/multi-team coordination, planning/tracking of business activities, tracking of financials Facilitation skills, soft skills, and building relationships Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: cybersecurity Risk Analyst
Description: This position provides risk analysis and compliance program support for the Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) domain of the UW-Madison Office of Cybersecurity. Responsibilities include evaluating security risks and compliance strategies; offering direction, guidance and consultation; and making recommendations for the improvement in information security of IT systems primarily for University of Wisconsin-Madison and for the University of Wisconsin System upon request. The incumbent coordinates implementing university-wide, proactive and distributed information security management programs to ensure the continuous availability, confidentiality, and integrity of information assets owned and used by the university community, consistent with university management's informed risk tolerance.  A successful individual will have exceptional information security expertise as well as project management, business analysis, solution implementation skills and the ability to work under broad policy guidance. This individual must exercise sound judgment in working collaboratively and communicate effectively within a challenging environment in a visible role.  This position reports to the Office of Cybersecurity and serves as the campus technical expert and authority on information security risk analysis and compliance matters. As a trusted advisor and partner with campus researchers, Primary Investigators, program managers and system owners, the incumbent works with the entire university community in a consultative manner. The incumbent should understand organizational missions, values and goals, analyze information risks which threaten those objectives, recommend and guide large cross-functional and campus-wide teams towards appropriate security control solutions, and assist in implementing and auditing those solutions to materially reduce operational and compliance based exposures. Additional Information:Additional Preferred Qualifications:Experience with typical application components such as web servers, application servers, database software (Oracle and SQL), middleware and underlying infrastructure devices (WAN and LAN devices, operating systems for server platforms, workstations, and a broad range of applications, host and network security devices.Solid understating of manual, automated application penetration skills, vulnerability scanning and analysis as well as skill in careful, limited live testing in live production environments. Please note that successful applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without need of employer sponsorship, on or before the effective date of appointment.SDL2017

Name: Business Analyst (Recent Grads Welcome)
Description: Come work for Net@Work ranked #29 among the world’s 501 most strategic and innovative managed service providers (MSPs) and the top Sage partner in North America!  About Net@Work Net@Work is a full-service technology and business consulting firm specializing in the consulting, selection, and implementation of business-first technology. We understand systems and software and see the big picture of how it all needs to work together, today and into the future. From ERP, CRM, Employer Solutions, eCommerce and related business management solutions, to Cloud and IT Managed services, our experts work together to provide a 360º degree view of our clients business needs today while providing an IT roadmap for their future.  Job summary  Work location is either Madison, WI or St. Louis, MO The entry-level Business Analyst’s role is to assist with the plan, design, develop, and launch efficient information systems and operations systems in support of core organizational functions. Using both business and technical skills, the Business Analyst works directly with customers to identify business requirements with sufficient detail and clarity to proposals for solutions. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate and resolve systems issues to maximize the benefit of IT systems investments. ResponsibilitiesStrategy & PlanningAssist in the planning, design and development of new applications and enhancements to existing applications.Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end-users to define business requirements and systems goals, and identify and resolve business systems issues.Ensure compatibility and interoperability of in-house computing systems.Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.Acquisition & DeploymentAssist in the deployment of new applications and enhancements to existing applications.Create system design proposals.Perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.Create systems models, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to system programmers.Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems.Provide orientation and training to end-users for all modified and new systems.Other duties as assigned.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related filed emphasis in MIS helpful, NOT required.0-2 years of related experience3.4 GPA requiredCompetencies:Communication Skills: Communicates well one-on-one, in small groups and public speaking. Keeps people informed. Writes clear, precise, well-organized documents using appropriate vocabulary, grammar and word usage.Analysis: Identifies significant problems and opportunities. Analyzes problems and people in depth. Determines root causes and offers appropriate solutions.Customer Focused: Monitors client satisfaction, establishes partner relationship with clients. Visible and accessible to clients.Pragmatism: Generates sensible, realistic and practical solutions to projects. This position can be based in our Madison, WI office or our St. Louis, MO office.  We are an AA/EOE employer.

Name: Associate Software Implementation Analyst
Description: There’s a reason Insperity ranks in the top 3% on WorkplaceDynamics’ National Top Workplaces list and named one of the top 100 companies to work for in the U.S.Want to work for us and find out why?  As a trusted advisor to America’s best businesses for more than 32 years, Insperity provides an array of human resource and business solutions designed to help improve business performance. In addition, we provide the client company and their worksite employees with a wide array of value-added benefits and services.  Insperity offers a competitive compensation package and one of the best benefits packages in the business, including 19 days paid time off, 8 paid holidays, medical, dental and vision benefits, 401k and tuition reimbursement. At Insperity, our work environment and our commitment to our employees’ personal and professional success are the reasons we’ve been regarded as one of the “Best Places to Work” for 16 years running. ASSOCIATE SOFTWARE IMPLEMENTATION ANALYSTSUMMARY This position is responsible for project activities ranging from client discussions to training as well as learning the technical skill-set to engage in enterprise project implementations in the future. It will include learning to configure systems via SQL scripting and software configuration. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSUnder general supervision and moderate decision-making: Hosts remote kick-off meetings with clients to determine client business objectives for project implementations.  Creates configuration notes documentation and reviews with more experienced Implementation personnel for any configuration abilities that do not exist in the product and accuracy prior to sending to client.  Completes setup of the client’s software, getting verification of questions answered by more experienced Implementation personnel.  Works with Analyst team to learn how to configure ongoing system requests as needed per project.  Configures interfaces to integrate with existing HR, payroll or accounting systems.  Tests interfaces to confirm integration is complete.  Works with Analyst team to tailor formal training to meet the customer’s specifications.  Provides new client training (administrator, operator, supervisor, and employee), as required, on applicable Insperity Business Performance Solution’s software. .  Documents and reviews open issues list from training with pertinent personnel and updates configuration as necessary. Updates configuration notes with any changes made.  Works with client on system optimization through project closing.  Works with appropriate team members and mentor to coordinate timing of project deadlines, etc.  Works to improve customer experience and satisfaction, increasing customer reference-ability. EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Management Information Systems or related field is required.  Experience in system integration, HR, Accounting or the computer industry is preferred. Technical support or training experience is preferred. KNOWLEDGE / SKILLS Solid interpersonal skills to interface with co-workers and customers.  Ability to manage multiple projects and tasks to completion with minimal supervision.  Excellent written & verbal presentation skills.  Experience in communicating technical and project information in a business context.  Demonstrated track record in delivering quality, on-time business solutions to a diverse customer base.  SQL or FoxPro database experience.  Strong customer relations, time management and organizational skills.  At Insperity, we believe diversity is the quality of leadership. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

attentive to detail and excellent follow throughSelf motivated and resourceful with strong interpersonal skills; able to work individually as well as with a teamAble to adapt to changing demands and manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environmentSome travel requiredKnowledge of software development andor implementation practices is preferredValid passport or ability to obtain passport that allows for travel outside of the US is requiredTo be considered apply online at wwwwtsparadigmcomcareers

Name: Business Analyst with Project Management skills
Description: Business Analyst / Junior Project Manager The Business Analyst / Junior Project Manager is an integral member of the project team responsible for delivering documentation while supporting the Lead BI Project Manager. The outcome of this from scratch application will be crucial to success of the Agriculture applications.  You will be able to work directly and learn from some of the best, including paid time for PMP, Security Certs, etc. Blueline is hiring for development projects of varying size and complexity for similar roles, with the major focus is for a large Business Intelligence initiative. The Junior Project Manager is responsible for directing, organizing and controlling project initiatives along side the Senior PM. You will come out of this with a PM title and skill-set to propel your career forward, possibly a more Senior Role within the organization. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITIES on a Day to Day basis: · Attend client meetings and assist with determination of project requirements regarding government regulations and security as a focus  · Assist the PM in the drafting and issuance of project proposals, RFPs, SOWs, budgets, cash flows and interviewing schedules  · Prepare project organization and communication charts around hiring processes for a large team · STRONG DOCUMENTATION around Security and State Regulations · Assist the Division Supervisor and PM's in the review of Contractor quotations to ensure that only fair and reasonable pricing is recommended for approval · Use project scheduling and control tools to monitor projects plans, work hours, budgets and expenditures Qualifications from Junior Project Manager: Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or experience working within SDLC  2+ years of Business Analysis with strong documentation experience  Experience Issuing Contracts, Letters of Intent, Purchase Orders for contract executions Structured Project Management training preferred, have worked side by side with strong PM preferred

Name: Investment Compliance and Reporting Analyst
Description: The Wisconsin Foundation and Alumni Association (WFAA), the private fundraising and alumni relations organization for UW-Madison, is recruiting for an Investment Compliance and Reporting Analyst to join our finance team. This is a new position designed to assist the Investment Compliance and Reporting Manager in fulfilling a variety of investment related compliance and performance reporting responsibilities. By design this position operates in close contact with, but autonomous from, the WFAA investment staff.Essential FunctionsMonitoring investment compliance controls, processes, and procedures Ensure compliance with investment policies and procedures adopted by WFAA.Monitor external investment consultants and analytic service providers to ensure adherence to contractual obligations and related compliance and control policies, practices and procedures.Assist in the review, maintenance and safeguarding of essential documents related to board actions and investment related contractual agreements. Maintain sufficient documentation necessary to support compliance with policies and procedures.Assist in the ongoing assessment and development of compliance and control safeguards; propose and suggest changes and improvements.Review and analyze investment process documentation pertaining to risks and controls.Understand and comply with all applicable records and information management policies and procedures. Assist in the validation of investment activity and valuations Review custodian records to determine transactional activity is accurately reported on a timely and complete basis; including but not limited to: Review custodian reports to ensure that transactional activity is timely, complete and appropriately in agreement with information directly provided by investment managers.Assist in the monitoring and validation of investment cash flows between investment managers and custodian, to ensure proper authorization and delivery.Assist in the review of investment valuation reconciliations across all asset types; ensuring values are complete and accurately stated. Investment analytics and performance reporting Assist the Investment Compliance and Reporting Manager to fulfill ongoing reporting requirements, including: Analyzing, validating and generating portfolio analytics.Analyze accuracy and integrity of required investment compliance reporting relating to portfolio liquidity, transactional activity, asset class and portfolio exposures.Demonstrating adherence to WFAA Investment Policy.Develop and maintain understanding of performance methodologies used by the Foundation, its custodian, and investment managers. Assist in the review and validation of performance analysis for accuracy and integrity Continue professional growth in the investment and finance industry Maintain expert level professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies.Develop and maintain intimate knowledge of valuation and reporting standards, practices and conventions for all asset classes utilized. Support a service-oriented atmosphere in accordance with WFAA mission, values and philosophy Strategic beliefs The UW-Madison has a transforming impact on students, alumni, and society;Authentic, lifelong relationships and engagement with alumni, donors and friends are fundamental to sustaining the reputation and continued success of the University;Philanthropy has an essential and growing importance on the future progress of UW-Madison;The highest level of stewardship and fiduciary responsibility in financial, investment, data and gift administration is vital to maintaining trust with our stakeholders;Diverse views, experiences and perspectives strengthen WFAA and the university community.Organizational values We are serious about delivering results;We work together and with our campus partners as a team;We are committed to alumni, donors, volunteers and others;We are open-minded;We create a positive work environment.Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting or related field (or equivalent work experience) required.A minimum of 2 years of operational experience in a Finance/Accounting with strong preference toward an Investment concentrated environment.Candidate must exhibit strong analytical skills and ability to interpret financial statements.Awareness of common investment asset types, formats, structures and arrangements necessary.Microsoft Office skills required with proficient Excel skills.Experience with FactSet, WorkBench, Bloomberg, IntraLinks, Sunguard and/or Red Alerts a plus.Ability to take initiative, work independently with minimal guidance, prioritize workload, multi-task and meet established deadlines.Eagerness to learn with strong attention to detail is essential. OtherThis job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  This is a full time, exempt position reporting to the Investment Compliance and Reporting Manager. Name: Business Analyst - Healthcare - Madison, WI
Description: Job Description:Works collaboratively with clients and stakeholders - both external and internal to the company - to research and elicit, analyze, validate and document business requirements, and to ensure that those requirements clearly reflect true business needs, correctly representing all stakeholders. Translates business needs into system/ application requirements and project components to help determine solutions to business problems. Assists team members in producing functional requirements for tool development. Proactively identifies and manages changes to requirements and identify risks for the company’s clients. Effectively manages client’s expectations. Applies industry and information technology expertise to support proposals, feasibility studies, implementations and new business development.Responsibilities: Participate in the elicitation, documentation, analysis and validation of business processes, systems, and solution requirements.Research components of solutions to problems.Produce visualization, user experience and configuration elements of solution design.Document requirements specifications using high-maturity methods, processes and tools.Support requirements management and change management processes.Support aspects of the business cycle, including proposals, feasibility studies, and implementations.Education and Experience Required: Typically a Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience and a minimum of 0-2 years of related experience.May include highly experienced individuals performing entry-level equivalent work who are non- degreed or degreed in an unrelated field.Knowledge and Skills: 0-2 years experience.Essential: requirements determination using structured techniques for documentation, analysis; decomposition of high-level information into details; abstracting low-level information; distinguishing requests vs. needs; classifyingprioritizing requirements; requirements change management and traceability; building relationships and working collaboratively; effective verbal/ written communication.

Name: Onbase Administrator Analyst
Description: Overview As a member of the OnBase application team, supports the OnBase application by working closely with customers to troubleshoot and resolve level 1 and 2 issues without assistance. Also assist in resolving level 3 issues and solution implementation with support from other team members. Helps to identify enterprise wide application requirements and communicating solutions to customers. Uses operational expertise to seek out, research and evaluate a variety of solutions to provide customers that will help to produce high quality, efficient products. Functions in an enterprise wide manner, and places success of whole above individual entities within that enterprise. Promotes enterprise wide standardization. Works in Project Team Environment to assist in providing standardized solutions for clients. Indirectly contributes to patient care by providing system access. Demonstrates and maintains a calming demeanor in the face of a busy and stressful workplace.  Responsibilities Operational OnBase Systems Support Works collaboratively with other IT group members to ensure optimal OnBase functionality. Applies systems analysis techniques and procedures, including consulting with users, to determine hardware, software or system functional specifications. Assists with documentation, analysis, creation, testing or modification of computer systems or programs, including prototypes, based on and related to user or system design specifications. Reviews module enhancement specifications incorporating standardization guidelines into tailoring specifications and performs unit and integration tests. Assists with unit and integration testing. Provides timely and accurate documentation including solution design documentation. Plans, conducts, and documents proceedings of meetings as needed. Provides night and weekend on-call coverage per team schedule or as otherwise directed. Assists with training and development of associate staff. Assists with compliance of federal, state and local laws or regulations. Effectively prepares and complies with voluntary accreditation as accepted by the healthcare organizations we serve. Maintains regular and consistent attendance at work. Performs other duties as requested by manager to facilitate the smooth and effective operations of the department Project Support Provides input into preparation of project plans and monitors own task schedule. Participates in and coordinates status meeting and conference calls as needed for assigned projects. Provides project status reports on a regular basis for assigned active projects. Qualifications Education:  High school graduate or GED equivalent. Bachelors degree in related field or direct and applicable work experience preferred. Experience:  Two years experience in system integration utilizing the Hyland OnBase application or equivalent experience Skills:  Writes, reads, comprehends and speaks fluent English. Basic computer knowledge using word processing, spreadsheet, email and web browser. Demonstrates detail knowledge base and skill level in computer application methodology as it is used to automate health care business practices. Demonstrates functional knowledge of one or more application areas. Understands computer system functionality, limitations, and architecture of supported applications. Basic understanding of core Onbase design and development principles as they relate to workflow, unity forms, integration scripts, database integration, HL7 implementation and Epic integration. Ability to work as a team member. Ability to understand and apply guidelines, policies and procedures.

Name: ECM Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client seeking an ECM Analyst in Madison, Wisconsin (WI).  Summary:  This position's primary area of responsibility is the design, administration, maintenance, reliability and technical support for the Enterprise Content Management (ECM) environment, currently OnBase. This individual must work independently and without close supervision while exercising discretion and independent judgment in daily varying duties.  Responsibilities:  Responsible for the design, administration, maintenance, reliability and technical support for the ECM environment Administer, support and control for the OnBase environment through highly technical and complex solutions that require knowledge of hardware/software interfaces and operations while adhering to security policies Assist and offer guidance to members of the OnBase development team Plan and implement for upgrades to OnBase and the various modules working closely with business units and application vendor Maintain a test environment for use in testing new versions and for disaster recovery testing Ensure that system health is monitored and ensure performance and reliability is satisfactory Address data retention needs and ensure the retention policy is being adhered to Administer security and ensure that security policies are followed to meet PCI requirements Keep disaster recover documentation up to date and accurate Provide technical support to resolve user-related issues Provide advanced support for the ECM environment, OnBase Configure new processes for additional COLD applications Responsible for the accountability on all projects, that proper communication is maintained with appropriate contacts and to continually increase knowledge of technology advancements Responsible for estimating and meeting project task completion deadlinesREQUIREMENTS: Working knowledge of PC and printer hardware, ethernet topology, IP standards, and Microsoft Server OS To be considered for this position, candidates must have experience in a similar role or they must possess significant knowledge, experience, and abilities to successfully perform the responsibilities listed Relevant education and/or training will be considered a plus Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Technical Business Associate
Description: The Technical Business Associate position is responsible for learning and developing the skills that will allow them to assist in identifying process improvement opportunities and executing tasks that impact corporate business strategies and performance. The Technical Business Associate may provide support to a variety of laboratory teams including the Billing Team, the Contact Center as well as well as the ordering team. They work collaboratively, negotiating requirements across multiple groups. Finally they must have an understanding of the overall IT architecture of the organization. Name: IT Business Analyst-Ord-Cash
Description: Job Summary This position will work with business users to collect and document requirements and use the requirements to design, configure and test projects related to ERP business applications to ensure an optimal solution. Throughout the process, the IT Business Analyst will troubleshoot issues, meet with business users regularly to verify solutions and train users on results. Job Duties * Perform business analyst work, document business requirements, and develop functional and technical specifications/designs.  * Write functional specifications for development.  * Perform unit and integration testing for configuration and end to end business processes.  * Work with business partners throughout the process to ensure solutions meet business requirements.  * Act as liaison between business and IT to support business needs via technical solutions.  * Troubleshoot and resolve issues in a timely manner.  * Analyze, track and remediate root causes of defects.  * Ongoing responsibility of production support in the ERP functional modules assigned.  * Perform design, configuration and testing of assigned core ERP modules  * Participate in the design of any integration related to assigned functional modules.  * Create and run reports using report writer and report painter Integrates quality at the source thinking and activities in daily, individual, team and project work. * Utilizes quality/process tools and methodology in daily individual work  * Utilizes quality/process tools and methodology on teams  * Defines and documents individual processes within sphere of control  * Ensures that others are trained as back-ups on (processes) within the area/department  * Improves processes within sphere of control  * Identifies waste and rework and enacts plan to improve/solve  * Checks satisfaction of internal customers through use of quality tools and Customer/Supplier metrics Education and Experience * Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or related business field required.  * Minimum 4 years of Business Analysis experience. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities * Strong Business Process experience required.  * Strong knowledge and experience with requirement specifications to define scope and system boundaries, recommend alternative methods to achieve complex system requirements and estimate resource implications of requirements at a high level  * Business knowledge and process design skills  * Ability to translate business requirements into process and technical specifications  * Ability to analyze problems and provide clear recommendations  * Strong organizational skills  * Excellent communication skills, written and verbal  * Solid interpersonal skills  * Must be able to work independently as well as a team player and can manage own workload  * Able to multi-task and work under tight deadlines  * Must be an effective problem solver  * Up to 5% travel may be required Quality * Uses project plan and project schedule methodology  * Clearly defines and utilizes processes in daily work  * Knows SFW team structure, roles and responsibilities  * Integrates process methodology into daily work; MPI, QAT, 5S, 6D, Q@S etc  * Looks for innovative ways to streamline work processes across the division and involves stakeholders  * Identifies gaps using tools such as Baldridge criteria, WI Forward Award criteria, GPTW, IDP etc  * Establishes forums to share best practices  * Uses dept and company scorecard and other metrics  * Measures own work to plan and reports out at a micro and macro level

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: This position is for a Financial Analyst with effective communication skills. This position is for someone who enjoys working as part of a team. Robert Half Finance is seeking skilled candidates for a Financial Analyst position with a thriving Utilities/Infrastructure company. If selected, you will implement financial modeling on various financial products as well as measure, analyze, and forecast performance in conjunction with operating plans. Must be able to effectively advise management on the allocation of resources to best accomplish objectives and prepare reports for management. This role via Robert Half Finance provides an exciting opportunity to perform in a business partner capacity in areas such as forecasting, performance reporting, and expense management with fellow colleagues. This Financial Analyst role, which is located in the Madison, Wisconsin, is a full-time employment opportunity.  How you will make an impact Lead monthly reporting to business partners on financial results and if any actions are requiredEnable effective Business Intelligence (BI) to provide forward-looking insight and decision supportSupport weekly, quarterly and annual Area/Segment level Bookings and P L forecastingComplete and direct forecasting reportsWork with senior executives on strategic deep dives by developing financial models and insights on topics such as: Retention forecasts, Campaign Planning Tracking, return on investment of strategic investments, event tracking and execution, strategic resource allocation, and prioritizationUnderstand and explain internal and external drivers impacting performance and trendingWork alongside cross-functional partners in Accounting and Operations to ensure plans are properly executedThe ideal candidate should be a highly flexible individual who is adept at managing expectations and comfortable with handling large amounts of informationKeep tabs on monthly and quarterly performance through the comparison of actuals versus expectations, ensuring that business partners handle their resourcesAnalyze performance to date and assess potential risks and opportunities

Name: Technology Analyst
Description: OUR AGENCYMake a DifferenceSWIB enables forward thinking professionals opportunities to grow, develop and build excellence with a global investor making a difference in the lives of Wisconsin public employees.With more than $117 billion in total assets, SWIB is one of the world's largest institutional investors. As an independent state agency, SWIB is responsible for managing assets of the Wisconsin Retirement System (WRS) in addition to six separately managed funds. SWIB generates returns for more than 622,000 participants. SWIB has long been considered an investment industry leader because of its ability to grow and protect the WRS assets that its constituents count on for a more secure financial future.Be a World Class LeaderThe WRS is nearly 100 percent funded, making it one of the countrys best funded public employee retirement systems. It is the 9th largest public pension fund in the U.S. and 25th largest public or pension fund in the world. SWIBs performance for the WRS beat the one -, five- and ten-year benchmarks as of Dec. 31, 2017. As an innovative organization SWIB is committed to professional development. Approximately 50 percent of SWIBs investment professionals are Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) charterholders.About the TeamThe Technology Team at SWIB is approximately 30 staff over four groups; Business Systems, Database & Development, Security and Infrastructure & Operations. These groups support, implement & development industry leading systems and platforms to support SWIBs diverse and complex set of investment portfolios and strategies. The Technology team at SWIB strives to be a trusted advisor and partner to the business that is valued as a critical contributor to SWIBs continued growth and success. We effectively leverage technology to derive the maximum value from it and achieve SWIBs business goals. We keep technology aligned with SWIBs future direction and operate SWIBs technology according to industry standards.The Technology Analyst is responsible for acting as the primary architect for systems to solve business problems using technology. The Technology Analyst is tasked with translating business requirements into technical specifications and designing technology solutions to meet those requirements and specifications. The Technology Analyst partners with the Business Analysts, other Technology Analysts, as well as the Application Developers and Systems Analysts as part of the System Development Lifecyle to design technology solutions. The Technology Analyst has deep knowledge of the systems that SWIB utilizes to meet its business needs and uses that knowledge to efficiently and effectively help put technology in place to meet business needs. The role proactively learns about new technology that may enable additional business capability or extend automation to an area that previously was not possible. Working with system vendors they understand where products SWIB utilizes are going and push vendors to continue to evolve products to meet SWIBs needs. Thinking out of the box and being able to consider alternatives will be critical to the success of the position. The role will also provide documentation for and technical guidance to Systems Analysts, Operations, and other staff after solutions are deployed into production.Essential activities:Act as the architect/designer for the systems SWIB utilizes including being an advisor to the business on technology related issues.Lead the effort to design solutions including building technical specifications and source-to-target mapping documents based on business requirements to be utilized by developers or systems analysts to build/configure systems.Help build, evolve, and refine the framework from which to standardize the technology analyst practice at SWIB.Partner with Operations to research and implement new solutions.Help build business case justifications to support the pursuit of systems designed to meet the needs of SWIB.Lead, facilitate, and coordinate solutions design meetings.Work with Technology, Business Owners, and Operations to identify the support needs of a system.Interface with Operations and Technology resources inside and outside of SWIB to ensure business needs are met.Partner with Business Analysts to perform functional testing of enhancements/changes to systems to validate technical functionality.Identify gaps in SWIBs systems architecture and design. Make recommendations to business and Technology management about the best way to address these gaps.Continue to mature and evolve knowledge of investment and asset management business practices, both from a textbook and a practical perspective.Understand general and investment industry specific technology trends and forecast future technology shifts.Research new technologies to help drive SWIBs business capabilities forward and maintain a high degree of awareness of common industry specific trends, products, vendors and services.Work with Technology, Operations, and other SWIB management to provide data on the value of technology to stakeholders and annual budgets and forecasts.Work with Technology management to help monitor the general health of the application and services portfolio.Take a lead role coordinating activities with systems analysts and developers as they build out the solutions. Provide assistance, facilitate discussions, work through issues, provide guidance, and ensure business needs are being met.The Ideal Candidate:Bachelors Degree in Information Systems or Finance.Minimum of 3+ years of experience, ideally within the investment management industry.Ability to document and communicate technical knowledge effectively.Ability to envision solutions, communicate those solutions and help form tangible outputs from those conceptual solutions.Ability to interface effectively with investment and administrative staff to observe, interpret and analyze user needs.Communicating complex technology subjects in laymans terms.Detailed familiarity with common investment practices and securities.Interface with SWIB management, the PMO and others to negotiate solutions to business problems.Ability to design technology solutions to solve business problems.Ability to translate business requirements into technology specifications and design systems to meet the needs of the business.An intellectual curiosity that drives the person to dig into complex challenges and find ways to solve them.SWIB Offers:Competitive McLagan-base salaryMeaningful performance-based incentive compensationA comprehensive benefit packageEducational and training opportunitiesTuition reimbursementChallenging work in a professional environmentThe position requires U.S. work authorization and residency in, or willingness to relocate to the Madison, Wisconsin area. SWIB is prepared to offer relocation assistance as needed.Join HIGHER PERFORMERSHome to Top TalentSWIBs professionals shape sophisticated investment management strategies, drive forward looking technologies and deliver strong internal asset management. SWIBs internal team invests approximately 62 percent of its assets under management. As a result, Institutional Investor recognizes SWIB as home to top talent in American public investing.The organization has earned a reputation for investment excellence in part by running much of its portfolio successfully in-house versus outsourcing to Wall Street Institutional Investor.

Name: Business Analyst (2 Openings)
Description: Sundial Software is currently recruiting TWO (2) Business Analysts for a 6 month contract with option to hire.Business Analyst Description (2 Openings) Position Purpose:  The purpose of this position is, but is not limited to, providing business designs, requirements, and use case scenarios in the environment of our clients' applications development to ensure quality business processes and a quality end-user experience. The Business Analyst develops and documents business cases and models that show process flows, discuss findings with the project team, and works with development and testing staff in designing and doing user acceptance testing, each fall into this position.  The Business Analyst reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. This position requires formulating systems to parallel overall business strategies. This person writes detailed descriptions of user needs, requirements, program functions, and steps required to develop modify or develop systems. The Business Analyst coordinates deadlines and responsibilities with project managers and monitors and summarizes requirements with Development and Quality Assurance. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is expected in this position.  The Business Analyst typically works on small to mid-sized projects, including new development and substantial functional and process improvements.  This is a full-time, exempt position working Monday through Friday with core hours from 8:00am to 5:00pm. The position will be located at our corporate offices in Madison, Wisconsin and will report to our Director of Business Administration.  Positional Responsibilities: Works with people to develop and implement project requirements, management and analysisElicit, analyze, represent, and validate information and dataParticipate in development and adherence to scope, budget, and timelinesUnderstand direction, structure, business models and requirementsMay provide training and development to staff Positional Competencies:Ability to gather project requirements, throughout business unitsStrong communication and relational skillsExperience with standard business analysis modeling techniques, including Relationship Maps, Process Maps, Context Diagrams and Use Case DiagramsProject Management Skills – prioritizes and plans work activities; uses time efficiently; plans for additional resources; sets goals and objectives; develops realistic budget plansKnowledge of our business process and the TPA industry Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience from an accredited college or university is requiredThree or more years of business analysis experience, preferably in an Agile environment is requiredKnowledge of industry standard business analysis principles, practices, techniques, and toolsAbility to analyze comprehensive business processes, performs in-depth work analysis, and develops reports and flow chartsHigh-level computer skills (Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint, spreadsheet preparation, Internet research and business analysis software)Experience within the financial services or TPA industry is preferred

Name: Product Analyst 3
Description: DescriptionRole Purpose: The Senior Product Analyst (Level III) is primarily responsible for supporting product development and management, acting as a Project Manager for small to large size product efforts, and provides support for business leaders and managers for information gathering, project planning, documentation, analysis, implementation follow through, and monitoring activities related to the product line. This role is also the Vendor Manager accountable for one or more vendor relationships, and manages issues and audits of the vendor or partner. This role is expected to be able to work assigned projects independently, and report back to the Product Manager and Director. This may include being the Project Owner for small, medium or large sized implementation of new products, new marketing strategies, new IT related functionality, new vendors or other as assigned. Works collaboratively with Product Managers, product implementation teams, and strategy teams on various efforts and develops the ability to think strategically on product efforts to produce results for the company. This individual also interfaces with Sales and Marketing, Actuarial, Customer Service, Provider Management and other areas to support product. This role acts independently as a SME and key resource on various efforts outside the product area. Role may interface with senior leadership of company to translate strategies into project objectives and provide updates. Also accountable for development of project plans, management of project efforts and maintenance of appropriate documentation needed for key decisions and implementation. Role may work cooperatively with IT Project Managers on various efforts, and serve as liaison to product team. Completes, and/or oversees research, business analysis, ad hoc reporting requests and has complete knowledge and ability to use data to support fact based product decision making. Essential Job Duties: 1. Supports Product Managers in day to day activities related to product development and implementation and monitoring across the organization.  2. Manages projects and may act as project owner for various product related efforts.  3. Drives change within the organization and identifies opportunities within the organization for improvements.  4. May act as Account Manager and Vendor relationship manager for one or more key relationships related to product activities when ownership of vendor relationship is determined to be Product department.  5. Conducts vendor audits and other inquiries on a timely basis as assigned.  6. Independently may develop and lead small to medium sized initiatives approved by PST.  7. Maintains project documentation for key product initiatives and follows policy and procedure for product activities.  8. Supports completion of charters, project plans, impact assessments and other product line documents as needed.  9. Works with Marketing Communications staff on product updates, agent communications, and new product launches, e.g. articles content, internal communications and external materials/training sessions.  10. Develops training materials and associated communication pieces, product reference materials and internal information resources such as intranet, product guidelines and other sales support materials or training.  11. Trains as needed areas such as Customer Service and other key areas on product and product related activities.  12. May sit on cross functional committees and reviews representing Product, such as the CARCS and RARCs group.  13. Develops analysis of product information using data extracts to monitor product performance, and reports out information and trends to Product department and other key areas.  14. Serves as a liaison to the market research area, communicates research needs, synthesizes market research to inform product managers.  15. Acts as Coordinator for activities with shared responsibilities- Example: Contract reviews.  16. Manages and coordinates events for Agent, customer, vendor, health system, or product.  17. Assists with testing of rates, product attributes, QHP, outsourced capabilities, internal systems, as assigned.  18. Submits inquires to Compliance for regulatory analysis and questions following processes and procedures as established, and communicates results effectively for implementation and product management.  19. Completes assigned work related to QHP, Product Development and implementation and acts as primary liaison to PL for key areas.  20. Manages customer experience projects and activities, and helps create awareness of issues and works with business areas and the organization as a whole to improve customer satisfaction.  21. Reviews regulations with appropriate Compliance staff and assists in development of recommendations and transforms into implementation plans when impacting product.  22. Assists with analysis and documentation of costs and work as needed to enter into new market opportunities. Gathers information from various sources in the organization and works with Product Manager and Director to present summary as needed.  23. Acts as a SME and representative for product with a variety of implementation teams on efforts related to product.  24. Accountable for QHP template management or other Product Template Management and non- Compliance Team filing efforts and ensures that necessary processes and procedures for updates are followed to maintain integrity of templates.  25. Reviews webinars to determine if Product impacts are likely and makes determinations about assigning to other areas of Product. Additional Job Duties: 1. Assists Product staff with special projects as needed.  2. Assist business development/strategic planning by feeding market data or compiling market intelligence as needed.QualificationsRequired: 1. Bachelors degree with a minimum of seven years previous work in insurance industry, finance, product management or health care related field with over one year specifically supporting health insurance/health care.  2. Deep knowledge of product domain in health insurance and government regulation impacting health insurance products with coursework in generally accepted health insurance training programs.  4. Prior experience with health care reform, Medicare regulations, or Medicaid regulations.  3. Knowledge of insurance products or prior work as product analyst or product implementation specialist.  4. Certification or Designation in Health Insurance from a recognized program.  5. Knowledgeable on health insurance related regulation and ability to translate into business impact analysis.  6. Background working with Sales, Marketing, Analytics, Sales reporting Dean Health Plan, Inc.- Established in 1983, Dean Health Plan is the insurance services subsidiary of Dean and SSM Health. It maintains a position of leadership in insurance services through a physician-led integrated health system that improves the health of its members and delivers a superior level of service and care. Name: Business Objects Developer
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of a Business Objects Developer in Madison, Wisconsin (WI).  Overview:  As an Advanced Business Objects Developer in IT, you are in a technical position with primary accountability for developing Business Intelligence solutions in SAP Business Objects and providing internal customers with technical assistance related to BI.  You shall be accountable for Business Intelligence development, administration, and analytical activities including, but not limited to: documentation of processes and procedures, design and development of Business Intelligence reporting solutions. You will leverage various Business Intelligence toolsets, with primary emphasis on SAP Business Objects. You will develop and test queries to perform analytical functions. You will coach and mentor analysts and other report developers. You will support and administer our SAP Business Objects environments.  Duties:  Accountability for designing and developing reporting solutions Accountability for all universe and Webi report development activities as part of project initiatives or to support business partners reporting requests; Support business partners and IT teams with expertise and guidance by identifying their reporting requirements and needs, deciphering those requirements and architecting reporting solutions Partner with other IT and Shared Services organizations and seek out collaboration opportunities; Work within the BI team in a Safe Agile software development methodologyREQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree in MIS, Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline with an Information Technology focus Minimum of 5+ years of experience developing SAP Business Objects universes and Webi or Crystal Report objects Minimum 5+ years of experience with report development, writing SQL queries, tool administration, and analytics with an emphasis on SAP BO Experience with other BI technologies like Tableau, Qlik, Microsoft PowerBI, SSRS Experience working with customers to develop solutions to complex business problems Ability to establish and maintain a high level of customer trust and confidence in the BI team Professional demeanor with the ability to model dedication and support for company goals Excellent interpersonal skills evidenced by the ability to work and communicate effectively with Business Intelligence Team, IT, Informatics Teams, other analysts, and business peers Ability to make decisions considering a wide variety of situations and conditions Preferred:  Health Care industry knowledge SAS experience a plus Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: SENIOR BI ANALYST
Description: CTG is immediately hiring a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst for a direct hire position with our client located in Madison, WI.  Compensation range - $60,000 - $75,000 Job Description:This position provides functional system support, creates operational tools, and develops reporting and analysis for all areas of the Network Operations organization (CLEC, ILEC, and Cable).This includes but is not limited to the following teams: Customer Repair, Field Services, Dispatch, Advanced Technical Services, Service Activation, Deployment, Provisioning and Assignment, Translations, and Circuit Design. Provides day-to-day support of functional systems owned by Network Operations such as UTS, Metasolv, DSM, as well as home grown tools used by the Network Operations teams.This position is responsible to develop new tools to support operational initiatives. Works collaboratively with internal customers to gather requirements and build solutions to meet internal customer needs.Develops reporting and analysis of data housed within systems to target opportunities for controlling costs, growing revenue, and driving operational efficiencies across all Network Operation teams.Provides data and analysis to cross functional teams to support improvements of products and services and implementation of new products and services delivered to customers.Takes a leadership role in cross functional teams including PAC/ORC projects to ensure back end systems are appropriately enhanced for business and process changes.Develops standards, processes and procedures, and training for system and tool enhancements.Leads projects to research and implement best practices and tools for data mining and analysis.Mentors team members and performs technical reviews of peer projects.Responsibilities:Support of systems and tools used functionally by the Network Operations Teams.System support includes issues related to automation, system functionality, improving efficiency related to the applicable system(s), or training end-users.Leadership role in projects including PAC/ORC projects related to systems/tools, upgrades, enhancements, releases.Creates design requirements, table updates, database administration, test plans, implementation and training plans, conversion review work, and report planning.In many cases system enhancements will be driven by the Network Operations team and this position may be called upon to be a project lead. programsFlexible personality and ability to multi-task a variety of projects with diverse groupsWill be expected to travel as the job dictates the need of functional systems owned by Network Operations such as UTS, Metasolv, DSM, as well as home grown tools used by the Network Operations teams.This position is responsible to develop new tools to support operational initiatives.Works
