CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.

Name: Strategy Analyst Intern
Description: Who We Are We are a leading not-for-profit health insurer in Wisconsin, and our services have grown to reach active-duty and retired military personnel, seniors, and families in Wisconsin, across the U.S., and around the world. Learn more!  WPS receives World's Most Ethical Company Award for 9th Year in a Row-2018 Most Ethical Companies AnnouncementAt Our Core WPS Health Solutions has earned a reputation as a leader in the insurance and benefits administration industry through our commitment to excellence and high-quality service. Our corporate values reflect the core of who we are and how we conduct business every day.Customer FocusedI recognize how my actions impact internal and external customers by being responsible for the customer experience. I look beyond the immediate issue to recognize and solve the problem. Individual ResponsibilityI own my actions. I am accountable and dedicated to achieving the best results for WPS Health Solutions and our customers. I embrace my role in helping the company achieve a high-performance workplace.Mutual RespectI lead by example and act ethically, honestly and am trustworthy. I show appreciation for others by giving and taking constructive feedback and encouragement. Driven and PassionateI approach my work with enthusiasm, and personal commitment to the success of our business. I keep the importance of the work we do for our customers alive in my attitude and interactions with others, and demonstrate pride in the worthiness of our purpose.Position Summary The Internship Program with WPS Health Solutions is comprised of four key components. WPS interns will primarily focus on the responsibilities within their functional areas, as it relates to their respective field of study. In a group setting, interns will collaborate on the“Pay-It-Forward Project”– the development of a resource to be utilized for future program participants. The third component relates to exposure to corporate culture and training to aid in future career successes. At the conclusion of the program, interns will participate in a final presentation for senior executives by showcasing their experience in the program and functional areas. In this role you will:Under direct supervision of professional staff, provides entry-level professional support services in a specialty field, as appropriate to the day-to-day operating objectives of the departmentAssists in the planning and implementation of assigned projectsParticipates in projects and programs designed to develop professional skills and expertise appropriate to the needs of the organizationUses acquired knowledge and skills to carry out and complete project activitiesAttend staff meetings and serve on project teams as requiredMaintain knowledge and ensure the protection of hardware/software system security policies, practices and requirementsMaintain knowledge and ensure compliance of company policies and proceduresUtilize software such as Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PPT), Tableau, SNL Financial reporting suitePrimary role is delivering value on team functions and projects through critical research, analytics and problem solving. As a core member of the strategy team, contributes to identifying business issues, draws preliminary implications, and produces high quality quantitative and qualitative outputsSupport WPS corporate and business unit strategic development processBuild quantitative models and interpret resultsResearch and analyze competitor performance and create dashboard summaries that will be viewed by executive managementManage project and product implementation to ensure execution is aligned with the strategic planUndertake industry or company-level financial analysisCompile strategic metrics and report back to divisional leadership teams to identify success or alert for early issues so that they can be resolvedCreate sufficient and logically-structured written reportsProvide ongoing assessment of market position and competitor trends across our businessesYou should have:Currently pursuing a degree in higher education or recent graduate of high educationExperience with Microsoft Office (i.e. Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Marketing, Mathematics, Engineering, Physical Sciences, or related field1 or more years experience work in general business or internship settingExperience in management consulting, private equity or venture capital, strategy, finance, or similarStay connected: Join ourTalent Community!FOLLOW US!FacebookTwitterLinkedIn

Name: MMIS/Medicaid Business Analyst - Madison, WI
Description: Job Description:Works collaboratively with clients and stakeholders - both external and internal to the company - to research and elicit, analyze, validate and document business requirements, and to ensure that those requirements clearly reflect true business needs, correctly representing all stakeholders. Translates business needs into system/ application requirements and project components to help determine solutions to business problems. Assists team members in producing functional requirements for tool development. Proactively identifies and manages changes to requirements and identify risks for the company’s clients. Effectively manages client’s expectations. Applies industry and information technology expertise to support proposals, feasibility studies, implementations and new business development. Responsibilities:Through self-directed activities act as a liaison between client and technical groups, using superior communication skills to elicit, document, analyze and validate requirements.Apply industry-specific expertise to recommend and coordinate the development, enhancement, and maintenance of a client's business systems, processes, and products using high-maturity methods, processes and tools.Combine industry expertise with a thorough understanding of information technology to develop innovative business solutions. Influence the strategic direction of clients.Lead analysis teams on large projects. Lead requirements management and change management processes.Direct development of visualization, and user experience elements of solution design.Develop and maintain internal and external relationships to manage scope, schedule, budgets and expectations.Lead business studies and present study results to the company and client senior management.Coordinate and participate in proposals, feasibility studies, and new business development activities.Leverage industry knowledge and client relationships to assess the business implications of the application of technology to the current and future business environment and to identify new business opportunities. Promote and direct process improvement activities and training of peers and clients.Education and Experience Required:Typically a Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience and a minimum of 8 years of related experience or a Master's degree and a minimum of 6 years of experience.Recommended: IIBA CBAP& #8482; (or equivalent) certification obtained.Ideally, recognized industry- certification.MMIS/MedicaidKnowledge and Skills:8 or more years experience.Essential: requirements elicitation via interviewing and workshop facilitation; requirements.Determination using structured techniques for documentation, analysis, evaluation/ validation.Decomposition of high-level information into details; abstracting low-level information; distinguishing requests vs needs; distinguishing requirements vs. solutions.Classifying prioritizing requirements; OO techniques using UML models; ambiguity analysis, ensuring consistent understanding across users, designers and testers; business process modeling of current state and desired future state processes; defining and managing scope and client expectations, requirements change management and traceability; identifying and mitigating risks; applying creativity/ innovation to solving complex problems; building relationships and working collaboratively; developing and communicating a vision for project/ system; providing thought leadership; mentoring; effective verbal/ written communication; preparing and delivering effective presentations; experience in one or more industry domains.Specialized: Function Point counting; survey design and execution; statistical analysis; developing structured user manuals and training; visualization modeling; business rules modeling; develop and executing acceptance test plans.

Name: SQL Developer Analyst
Description: OverviewTDS is looking to add a detail-oriented SQL Developer Analyst to work with our Contact Center Reporting team in Madison, WI!The SQL Developer Analyst supports the Contact Center by providing maintenance and development of the reporting processes and applications utilized by TDS Telecom's Customer Contact Operations (CCO). The SQL Developer Analyst works with management and end user community to develop a clear understanding of user information needs, prioritizes the user requests according to business impacts, and translates the user requirements into the appropriate report programs. TDS Telecommunications LLC (TDS Telecom/TDS®) is the seventh largest local exchange telephone company in the U.S. with 1.2 million connections to high-speed internet, phone, and TV entertainment services in nearly 900 rural, suburban, and metropolitan communities. TDS, a growing force in the cable industry, operates BendBroadband, which is part of TDS Broadband Service LLC. For residential customers, TDS deploys up to 1Gig internet access, IPTV service (TDS TV), cable TV options, and traditional wireline services. For businesses, TDS offers advanced communications solutions, including: VoIP (managedIP Hosted voice), high-speed internet, fiber optics, data networking, and hosted-managed services. Visit tdstelecom.com or tdsbusiness.com.TDS Telecom, headquartered in Madison, Wis., employs more than 2,800 people and is a wholly owned subsidiary of Telephone and Data Systems, Inc. [NYSE: TDS]. A Fortune 1000® company, Telephone and Data Systems, Inc. provides wireless; cable and wireline broadband, TV and voice; and hosted and managed services. TDS has approximately six million connections nationwide through its businesses U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions LLC, and TDS Broadband Service. In 2018, TDS was named to three Forbes lists: America’s Best Employers for Diversity, Best Large Employers, and Best Employers for Women. Founded in 1969 and headquartered in Chicago, TDS employs 9,600 people. Visit tdsinc.com. Benefits:As a part of your total compensation, #TDS provides a comprehensive, competitive benefit package. The benefit plans address both the immediate and long term needs that you and your family may have. For an overview of what we have to offer for full-time employees including vacation, health benefits and retirement options please click here. ResponsibilitiesMaintains and expands upon current contact center reporting systems/applications. Develops new reporting applications with focus on providing actionable data.Troubleshoots issues with existing contact center reporting systems/applications, provides root cause analysis, and recommends and implements enhancements to reduce frequency of ongoing errors.Ensures reporting accuracy through full scope QA testing.Communicates and follows up with customers to develop requirements and ensure information requests meet or exceed business needs. Works proactively to uncover and identify management reporting needs with each request.Effectively leads the translation of business requirements into specific management reporting and information deliverables to meet customer expectations.Maintains a basic level understanding of the internal TDS databases relationships.Demonstrates system knowledge appropriate for the business units QualificationsRequired Qualifications:Associate’s degree or higher OR 2+ years professional work experience.2+ year experience in the area of Relational Database Reporting Languages such as: SQL, PSQL, or TSQL OR experience programming with either Visual Basic for Applications (VBA), c#, asp.net or any object-oriented programming languages.

Name: Senior Financial and Business Development Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionP3 Recruiting is in search of a Senior Financial and Business Development Analyst that will be responsible for compiling, analyzing, and interpreting data and other information used in conjunction with decision making for strategy and business development. Detailed analysis and coordination with other business units and its broader entities is required to ensure efficient and thorough data compilation and effective analysis. Essential Job Duties:Financial Analysis Compile, analyze, summarize, and present (written and/or verbal) varied analyses pertaining to strategic planning and ongoing decision support. Develop complex and integrated financial models for forecasting and risk assessment of potential opportunities.Business Analysis Identify, research, develop, and analyze business opportunities.Executive Interaction Effectively coordinate and lead executive level discussions with internal and external customer facing business partners. Participate in the negotiation team for business development opportunities and potential new partners.Market Analysis - Define and analyze key markets for product development/network expansion, develop marketing plans and provide targeted market research results and customer needs analysis.Business Plan Development - Develop and implement project business plans, including creation and updating detailed project plans to identify critical dependencies, identify and help resolve issues and barriers.Intellectual Property Management - Ensure intellectual property is documented and protected, working with the legal affairs within organization.Contracting Work with executives/management, legal affairs, and other areas as needed to outline/draft various agreements related to outside vendor support on projects, agreements between client and its business partners, etc.Public Relations - manage customer and industry relationships and communications to support new market development.Actively oversee teams of internal staff and outside contractors, suppliers, consultants and vendors. Work closely with strategic development, business customers, internal operations (network management, finance, medical affairs, and technology) from a strategic perspective to ensure new business initiatives are successful. Provide coordination/ leadership of new business development/acquisition projects and the effective integration of those initiatives into the business operations.Required:Bachelor's degree in business or other related field plus applicable work experience5+ years of financial or business development analytical experienceExperience researching new markets and analyzing customer and market needs, excellent writing/presentation/communication skills, ability to work with C-suite executives internally and externally, ability to multi-task and prioritize while working with deadlinesAdvanced financial modeling skills, ability to synthesize complex information and loosely defined ideas into financial models for use and discussion by executives at client, its owners, and its potential business partners.Strong Microsoft Excel applications expertise and proficient use of Word and PowerPoint applicationsSkilled at building relationships and advising senior level management and key stakeholdersExperience in project management tools and deliverables, strategic planning, development of business and marketing plans and managing external consultants, agencies, contractors and vendorsPreferred:MBA or other business/analytical master's degreeProject Management Professional certificationAnalytical experience in a health insurance or health care organizationMinimum of 2 years of leadership experience in developing new business opportunities and leading new business acquisition projects and teams

Name: Workday Analyst
Description: New Resources Consulting is searching for a Workday Analyst. You will be handling functional responsibilities. Any technical experience is a plus. You will be handling analysis, testing, configurations, training users and documentation. Any experience with EIB’s and Workday Studio is a plus. This role is in Madison, WI and is a contract role. Contract to hire or permanent role. Desired Skills and Experience The ideal candidate will have knowledge/expertise in the following: Experience with Workday Understanding of the ins and outs of Workday Functional background Workday configuration Payroll and recruiting modules would be nice to have Workday Studio and EIB’s a plus Good communication skills What We Do: Named a Future 50 Award Winner, a Mid-Market Growth Award winner, and formally recognized as one of Milwaukee's greatest places to work, NRC helps clients leverage technology to better serve their business. What does that mean? If you join our team, you can use your skills and talents every day to apply the latest technology solutions, unravel complicated business issues, and help your client overcome obstacles and thrive. New Resources Consulting is a world-class management and technology consulting firm, headquartered in WI and serving clients nationwide. Organizations come to us for help in tackling some of their most demanding challenges, relying on our integrity and our ability. Our ability to demonstrate a trustworthy character, and our proven capability of doing the job – day in, and day out – is what defines us. We are governed by the fundamentals of good business practices and believe in loyalty and a strong work ethic. As a part of our team, you will be valued, challenged and rewarded. You’ll be given a forum to share your ideas both for our clients and the future of NRC. NRC is dedicated to those who bring their unique talents and deliver the results our clients expect. Consistently recognized as a “Top Workplace,” we strongly believe that the success of NRC comes as a direct result of the people who represent us. Because of this belief, we work as a team, we grow as a team, and we succeed as a team. - provided by DiceWorkday

HRIS Analyst) will ensure ongoing performance, integrity, and security of organization’s Human Resource Information System (HRIS)/Payroll technology, through use of both internal and external resources. Will design, develop, and deploy dashboard, standardized reports, and ad-hoc reports for use by organization. In this role you will: Reporting, Analytics& Data Strategy (30%) Setting reporting strategy for people data.Develop framework for reports to create a companywide standard for design and delivery of people data.Lead requirements gathering, design, development, and implementation of people analytics initiatives.Accountable for integrity of data provided as an outcome of people analytics and audit requests.Lead collaboration with other departments on initiatives to improve process efficiency, reporting capabilities, and data integrity.Analyze current state and propose future state for issues surfaced in audit findings; implement or direct analyst to implement successful resolutions.Audit data within HRIS to maintain data integrity to ensure system controls and processes meet all internal and external requirements. Systems Administration (40%) Establish and document current and future state functionality, practices, and procedures of Human Resources Information System (HRIS).Administer HR systems activities and projects to provide business leaders at all levels with quality, accessible, and compliant HR data/workflows that support business/strategic objectives.Lead HRIS system upgrades.Serve as primary liaison to represent HR business needs with current HRIS vendor, other HR vendors, and internal Information Systems (IS).Assess and manage system risks and facilitate resolution of escalated issues.Provide analysis and recommendations of new technologies that support HR strategy.Serve division as primary technical resource for HR system.Direct work of other technical resources to implement, customize, and maintain HR system. Leadership (30%) Provide technical leadership to lessor experienced analysts in evaluation, planning, analysis, implementation, and testing of HRIS software upgrades or patches and any impact to other software products being utilized.Provide leadership, expertise, and solutions on complex initiatives.Mentor others and represent management, as appropriate.Take a leadership role on highly complex projects and provide guidance to less experienced staff. * This job profile is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties or responsibilities associated with the job. Other job-related duties may be assigned. You should have:Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, or related field OR equivalent post high school education and/or work-related experienceFour (4) years of progressively responsible information technology experience which includes programming experience involving database managementIn addition, we prefer:Experience gathering and documenting technical requirements and translating into actionable project plansExperience translating technical information to a non-technical audienceExperience with IBM Cognos Business Intelligence, Cognos Connection, HRISUltimate Software (UltiPro)Stay connected: Join ourTalent Community!FOLLOW US!FacebookTwitterLinkedIn #CB

Name: Senior Technical Business Analyst CRM
Description: The Senior Technical Business Analyst - CRM provides strategic business analysis services to the business by acting as an intermediary between with IT project teams and business partners to collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual deign (using appropriate tools and models) from which applications and solutions are developed. The focus of this position is to work closely with the business units to gain in-depth understanding of business strategy, processes, services, roadmap and the context in which the business operates.  This role will support the sales and marketing organization through CRM system implementation and integration. Works to elicit high-level requirements and capture business needs through dialogue with business sponsors. Clearly articulates and documents business requirements.Translates business needs into requirements utilizing a structured process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing change) to assess and recommend solutions based on cost vs benefit analysis.Assesses the risks of various solutions and prioritizes competing business demands.Coordinates project delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions.Develops test plans and assists in testing of software solutions. Participate in user acceptance testing and user training.Manages ongoing relationship with business partner to drive satisfaction with IT.Proactively provides process improvement recommendations within a quickly evolving company.Proactively resolves customer satisfaction issues.Work with outside vendors to deliver solutions. Monitors and manages vendor relationship and performance.Provide leadership assistance to other analysts by modeling best-practices and approaches and serving as a coach to more junior colleagues.Minimum RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science/MIS, healthcare-related science or related degree.3+ years of experience as a business analyst.5+ years in a hands-on technical role implementing or supporting business applications specific to the business function this role supports through technical project management, sytems development, or quality assurance.Strong analytical skills, prioritization skills, business intuition, and organizational ability.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, ability to operate in a cross cultural and complex matrix environment, and ability to build consensus across functions.Adaptable, open to change and able to work in ambiguous situations and respond to new information or unexpected circumstances.Demonstrated capacity for decision making in complex scenarios and for holding one-self and others accountable to those decisions.Desired CharacteristicsPast experience with business analysis.Past experience working under SDLC or other software-specific project management process.Experience working as a team and/or project leader.Experience working in order cycle management or revenue cycle management.Fast and enthusiastic learner.Physical RequirementsAbility to work in an office setting, operate telephony devices, and a computer. #LI-KE1 Exact Sciences is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, disability, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other status protected by applicable local, state or federal law. Applicable portions of the Company’s affirmative action program is available to any applicant or employee for inspection upon request.

Name: SAP Business Analyst - SD
Description: Job DescriptionWhen you join us at Thermo Fisher Scientific, youll be part of a smart, driven team that shares your passion for exploration and discovery. With revenues of $20 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world. Knowledge of business processes and SAP within a specific area(s) of responsibility, defined by the position. Directly support users and corporate processes in the assigned area. Researches gaps in functionality, gathers requirements of users and presents recommendations to teams both technical and business.  Excellent grasp of industry and subject matter best practices, trends, and concepts. Ability to apply these concepts into the SAP environment and business process. Strong Leadership skills, especially in the handling of Organization Change Management are strongly desired. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Support SAP ECC and related software.Knowledge of Sales and Distribution techniques, methods, and tools. Subject matter best practices.Knowledge of SAP reporting capabilities.Develop IT and end-user documentation for processes and procedures.Participate in Service Desk function to resolve user related support calls.Prepare and execute test plans for new functionality.Publish communication related to the deployment of new functionality.Translate user requests into user requirements and program specifications.Work with Enterprise Shared Services and programmers to assure compliance to program specificationsDevelop training outlines for end-users and collaborate with documentation specialistsLiaise with Divisional Management to understand direction within their functional area of responsibilityMonitor compliance with Service Level Agreements for site.Support business initiatives utilizing Project Management expertise.Maintain security in compliance with ThermoFisher Security directives.Ensure compliance to Thermo Fisher IT Policies and Guidelines.Travel can range from 25%-50%.Gather user requirements to develop solutions and alternatives.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.Translate high-level information into details as well as summarize detailed information.Communicate and collaborate with users to analyze information needs and functional requirements.Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.Work with users to define concepts under direction of project leaders.Serve as the conduit between the user community and the software development team through which requirements flow.Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates.Liaise between the business, technology teams and support teams.Comply with companys Global IT Policies & Procedures.Other duties as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:Excellent knowledge of business processes and best practices.Knowledge of SAP in specified area.Knowledge of Thermo Fisher SAP Template a plus.3-7 years of business experience in functional area.2-4 years of SAP experience.4 year degree or 5-7 years experience in related area.Relevant technical certificates a plus.4+ years of related technical work experience.Strong interpersonal and excellent documentation skills are a must.Able to assume and complete assignments independently.Ability to explain and champion technical concepts to a broad audience.Excellent customer service skills required.Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.Strong project management skills and understanding of project management lifecycle.Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.FUNCTIONS WITHIN ISO:To understand the quality policy and objectives for quality.Perform duties and responsibilities according to the documented quality system.Recommend and implement improvements to activities and processes within the quality system.Have awareness of ITIL and other related quality/IT processes. At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 65,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular missionenabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.  Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Quartz is seeking an individual who is interested in growing a career as a Data Analyst. This role assists in the development, maintenance, and support of the Quartz enterprise data warehouse system and corresponding data marts. Key Responsibilities include: Gather requirements from end users or research production issues to identify root cause and developing remediation plans. Use standard data tools to gather required data to fully profile the data and analyze its ability to meet the requirements. Work with designers, as necessary, to design solution(s). Document processes for getting data to move accurately through the solution. Write and execute test plans and work with developer(s) to remediate any defects. Analyze the data to identify data inconsistencies, report them to senior employees and follow through to make sure they are adequately logged and addressed. Ensure vendor data feeds are meeting departmental and organizational standards, along with fulfilling business requirements. Understand the business processes and rules that create the data including claims, enrollment, billing, etc. and work with the subject matter experts in those areas to ensure they understand and can leverage their data as needed.Identify opportunities for improving effectiveness and/or efficiency of processes and controls that can be improved upon.The preferred candidate will possess the following skills/qualities: Associate’s Degree (or higher) is preferred, however relevant experience will be considered in lieu of education requirement.1-4 years of relevant experience analysing or querying data in a professional data warehouse setting.Health insurance experience is preferred – specifically in an analytical role related to fees, provider set up and benefit plansIntermediate knowledge of SQL, analytical software and personal computers Intermediate knowledge of data warehousing principles including provenance, lineage, modelling, etc. and applies best practices along with modern data architecture principles including the enforcement of data policies and access controlsExperience using query tools (BusinessObjects, Cognos, MS Query or SAS) is preferred. Ability to problem solve using analytical thinking skills. Works well independently – must be inquisitive and seek answers to complex questions without being prompted. Ability to develop rapport with end users, co-workers and third-party vendors. Strong organizational and time management skills. This role will work out of our office located in Madison, WI. Quartz offers an excellent benefit and compensation package, opportunity for professional growth and a professional culture built upon the foundations of Respect, Responsibility & Relationships.Quartz values and embraces diversity and is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Name: Product Analyst
Description: Requisition Number:1482Job Title: Product Analyst Job Description:POSITION SUMMARYThe Product Analyst works closely with the product management, sales, account management, business development, provider and healthcare informatics teams to analyze data to recommend solutions, analyze product design to ensure products meet the needs of different customer demographics, analyze utilization of products and their features to improve engagement and design, support the creation of business cases for product development and enhancements, and evaluate product performance relative to goals and competitors. The Product Analyst collaborates and aligns closely with product management, sales and account management colleagues to achieve product, sales and retention objectives including supporting peers with analyses, reporting, etc. The Product Analyst collaborates cross-organizationally to assess and recommend improvements to product operations, leverage customer intelligence to improve product performance, and create tools that allow various stakeholders to enhance their productivity.REQUIRED RESPONSIBILITIES Product Analytics and ReportingProvide complete, thoughtful and compelling evaluative information through peer collaboration and independent research and compilation and analysis of data. Evaluate product, account and prospect data to simplify, differentiate and improve the performance of solutions and customers.Assess product performance trends and recommend opportunities to simplify, differentiate and improve the performance of solutions.Analyze product features and customer utilization to identify opportunities for improved product design and customer engagement. Provide insights to inform product enhancement efforts and support customer engagement action planning with customers.Support product management and sales/account management teams with insights and reports to articulate product value for customers and the organization.Establish and maintain effective collaboration with Healthcare Informatics colleagues and other stakeholders, to evaluate product performance, product compliance and improvement opportunities.Drive customer intelligence through internal and external data sources to enhance understanding of products' market, competitors and customers and how they compare to offered and proposed products.Provide reports and recommendations to management and colleagues that drive improvement initiatives product performance, solutions that solve customer needs, solutions that create member engagement to improve health outcomes, solutions that decrease medical loss ratio and/or administrative expense and offerings that are differentiated from competitors.Support ad hoc analytics and reporting requests to support the achievement of division goals.Product Research and EvaluationCollaborate with colleagues to research, evaluate and build out new products, product changes, product enhancements, market opportunities, etc. including supporting the development of associated business cases.Support impact assessments to evaluate the impact of new products and enhancements including operational capabilities.Collaborate with colleagues to develop financial projections and key metrics to support product development and enhancement decisions.Assist with evaluation of product ideas at various stages of product development including high level and detailed assessments, as needed.Leverage a consistent product evaluation/development framework to ensure appropriate questions are answered at various stages of the product development process.Ensure new product solutions support strategic goals and customer needs.Required QualificationsBachelor's Degree in product management, business, marketing, computer science or related field or commensurate experience.Minimum of 2-3 years of product development and research experience, including creation of actionable product development business cases based on appropriate research techniques.Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data extraction from multiple data sources and reporting.Knowledge of principles of health insurance and/or health insurance products/plans including use of associated data and principles.Knowledge of program evaluation methods, both qualitative and quantitative and the ability to select the appropriate data analysis methods to produce meaningful findings for stakeholders.Working knowledge of analytical and research tools including spreadsheets, database applications (Excel, SQL Server Management Studio, Power BI preferred) and the internet for research.Knowledge of the intermediate features of calendaring and e-mail, word processing, presentation, (Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Internet Explorer preferred)Excellent performance in present and past positions. Required Skills Self-motivation and willingness to collaboratively and creatively problem solve in order to meet customer and organizational needs.Ability to balance multiple priorities with strong business acumen.Ability to be composed and adaptive in a dynamic, fast-paced, customer-focused work environment characterized by rapid change, minimal lead times, and multiple competing priorities.Ability to work collaboratively as an effective team member, colleague and influencer with staff at all levels.Excellent analytical skills, including the ability to identify problems, research and analyze issues from different perspectives, organize information, reach sound conclusions and work cooperatively with others to develop effective solutions.Ability to use reporting software and tools to produce accurate and meaningful reports, and perform business analysis or process improvement.Strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to negotiate and compose clear, concise correspondence, internal policies and procedures, proposals and recommendations and narrative reports and to develop and present presentations to audiences of various levels.Excellent attention to detail.Ability to work independently and to establish, monitor, and achieve goals with minimal supervision.Excellent organizational skills, including the ability to effectively and competently handle multiple priorities simultaneously and the flexibility and ability to quickly adapt to changes.Results driven.Accountable, open, candid and transparent.Commitment to excellence in customer service and the company's cultural and other values.Commitment to achieving the company's key results.Work RequirementsAbility to work in typical office conditions with frequent use of computer equipment.Flexibility to work the number and schedule of hours needed to accomplish regular and ad hoc job responsibilities.Preferred Qualifications and SkillsExpertise in the company's plans, policies, claims processing, customer service and grievance and dispute resolution procedures and the concepts and terminology associated with group insurance contracts, laws and regulations.Thorough understanding of the company's member demographics.General understanding of population health management programs, the cost and utilization drivers for unmanaged chronic disease and existing programs that are currently implemented by health insurers to address these issues.Continuous process improvement experience.

Name: Asset Analyst -
Description: Responsibilities Conduct pre and post-closing financial analysis on assigned NMTC projects. This will include working with borrowers to discuss ongoing reporting compliance, addressing borrower financial strength, understanding and documenting community impacts. Once project data is reviewed, assist with designating appropriate risk ratings and prepare periodic internal reports for management and clients. Work with disbursement agents and lending partners to monitor construction by reviewing and approving construction draws of real estate projects. Manage all aspects of compliance reporting for client portfolios by organizing, collecting, verifying, and ensuring accuracy of compliance data on an annual basis, and by analyzing additional annual community impact reporting and borrower certifications. Continually assess project and partnership risk factors as they pertain to compliance with Section 45 (NMTC) provisions, allocation agreement requirements, and operating agreement conditions. Monitor loan defaults and ensure there are no mechanic liens or other non-permitted encumbrances on the project. Establish strong, productive working relationships with investors, lenders, project developers, and other financial partners. Provide exemplary client service and cultivate relationships conducive to information sharing and problem solving. Assist with the preparation, modification, and distribution of annual community impact questionnaires. Maintain database information integrity as it relates to compliance data, financial reporting, construction updates, and project information. Qualifications Bachelors degree in real estate finance, economics, business, accounting or a related field, required. Two years of experience in asset/portfolio management or real estate finance, preferred. Strong aptitude with information technology with proficient skills in word-processing, spreadsheet and presentation software, and the ability to adapt to new technology is required. Strong financial analysis skills with the ability to recognize financial issues through review of borrower financial statements. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with supervisors, co-workers, and outside business professionals. Self-starter who exhibits the drive and resourcefulness to work independently and with team members toward common company goals. Ability to show confidence in functional skills and apply those skills in a multi-task cross-functional team setting. Ability to work in an evolving, team oriented environment, and accept new challenges as assigned. Demonstrated exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Ability to provide exceptional client service and demonstrate commitment to continuous learning. Eligibility to work in the U.S. without sponsorship. Connect With Us! Become a Talent Insider to learn about new opportunities as they become available including job alerts, future events and industry updates.  Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.

Name: Investment Analyst Intern, Private Markets
Description: OUR AGENCYMake a DifferenceSWIB enables forward thinking professionals the opportunity to grow, develop, and build excellence with a global investor that makes a difference in the lives of Wisconsin public employees.With more than $117 billion in total assets, SWIB is one of the world's largest institutional investors. As an independent state agency, SWIB is responsible for managing the assets of the Wisconsin Retirement System (WRS) in addition to six separately managed funds. SWIB generates returns for more than 622,000 participants. SWIB has long been considered an investment industry leader because of its ability to grow and protect the WRS assets that its constituents count on for a more secure financial future.Be a World Class LeaderThe WRS is nearly 100 percent funded, making it one of the countrys best funded public employee retirement systems. It is the 8th largest public pension fund in the U.S. and 25th largest public or pension fund in the world. SWIBs performance for the WRS beat the one -, five-, and ten-year benchmarks as of Dec. 31, 2017. As an innovative organization SWIB is committed to professional development. More than 50 percent of SWIBs investment professionals are Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) charterholders.About the TeamThe Funds Alpha division consists of five investment professionals that actively manage approximately $6 billion of hedge fund AUM and $15 billion of beta one equity and fixed income AUM. The Funds Alpha team is responsible for selecting external firms to partner with and complement internal capabilities. The hedge fund portfolio is managed under an absolute return mandate leading to a wide variety of underlying sub-strategies including fundamental equity market neutral, systematic equity and macro, volatility arbitrage, event driven, reinsurance, and discretionary macro. The beta one portfolios are managed relative to global equity and fixed income benchmarks. Active strategies in beta one include a combination of fundamental and systematic investment processes.Funds Alphas investment process includes significant qualitative and quantitative diligence focused on setting expectations for forward return level and source across beta, style, and alpha. Investment professionals meet with existing and prospective strategies in Madison and across the globe to evaluate quality of return and fit within the portfolio. Manager exposures, track record, and other transparency are thoroughly analyzed through multiple systems to provide evidence and support throughout the process.SWIB is seeking a student intern to join its Funds Alpha Team, who is responsible for the selection, allocation, and oversight of SWIBs active external public market managers. These include hedge fund strategies and long only strategies across equities and fixed income as well as multi-asset strategies. This opportunity lends the opportunity for the intern to gain exposure to a host of investment styles across all asset classes. The intern will be assigned to a lead analyst, but is expected to leverage the broader team. The intern will work up to 40 hours per week during the summer with the possibility for 10-15 hours per week during the school year, if the selected candidate is local.Essential activities:Assist analysts with analysis and research of traditional and hedge fund managers and investment strategies.Become well versed with Funds Alphas various investment systems to aid with the building of internal risk analysis reports and models.With oversight from team, assist with asset allocation and bench-marking studies.Review and report on portfolio and compliance issues for managers.Special projects, as assigned.The ideal candidate:Undergraduate student with Finance, Economics, Business or Statistics major: will also consider graduate level students with an interest in hedge funds and/or private market investments.Proficiency or familiarity with Factset, Pertrac, and/or R.Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Join HIGHER PERFORMERSHome to Top TalentSWIBs professionals shape sophisticated investment management strategies, drive forward looking technologies, and deliver strong internal asset management. SWIBs internal team invests approximately 60 percent of its assets under management. As a result, Institutional Investor recognizes SWIB as home to top talent in American public investing.The organization has earned a reputation for investment excellence in part by running much of its portfolio successfully in-house versus outsourcing to Wall Street Institutional Investor.

Name: Credit Analyst
Description: Join the winning team at First Business as a Commercial Credit Analyst!  At First Business, we've built a team whose expertise extends to specific types of businesses and the unique challenges they face. We take an individual approach to our client's banking needs and pride ourselves on responsiveness. First Business offers a full line of financial services including: commercial lending, treasury management, private wealth management, retirement plans, investment management services, trust services, specialty lending, and equipment finance and leasing. We serve businesses, their owners and executives, and high net worth individuals with a model that provides unexpected levels of customer service and expertise.  First Business Financial Services (NASDAQ: FBIZ) is a $1.8 billion Wisconsin-based bank holding company. We are a growing company with opportunities that are vital to the operations and success of the company. We see our growth strategy as an opportunity to not only increase our market presence, but also to add top talent to our team of professionals.  The Commercial Credit Analyst is responsible for analyzing financial data on new and existing clients, monitoring loan covenants and preparing loan committee presentations while striving to help maintain the overall soundness of the loan portfolio.  We will provide a solid foundation into Commercial Banking for you to grow your career towards a lending path.  Specifically, as a Commercial Credit Analyst you will: Be responsible for analyzing financial data on new and existing clients, while striving to help maintain the overall soundness of the loan portfolio.Analyze and review appraisals receivedSpread and analyze financial information to determine the credit worthiness of the bank's existing and prospective clients.Be responsible for monitoring loan covenants, which includes running scorecards and reviewing loan agreements.Prepare loan committee presentations to include: bank exposure, cash flow analysis, collateral analysis, background summary, and overall financial summary.Develop a working knowledge on all aspects of loan policy and the ability to communicate its interpretation and rationale to other bank personnel.Work closely with the commercial lending team, including our credit analysts, commercial lenders, chief credit officer and other members of senior management.The successful candidate should have:Completed Bachelor degree in Finance, Real Estate, Accounting, Economics, or other Business related fieldPrior experience in an analyst role and/or financial services preferredDesire to explore and pursue a career in commercial lending, preferredStrong knowledge of technology, business computer applications, and ability to pick up on new systems quicklyStrong personal drive and initiative, demonstrated work ethic, and ability to work as a teamAbility to work independently and use independent judgment with minimal supervisionAbility to handle pressure of meeting deadlinesSDL2017

Name: Actuarial Analyst
Description: DescriptionRole Purpose: The Actuarial Analyst analyzes health plan and industry data using spreadsheet and multiple analytic query tools to perform premium rate development and the implementation of the overall rating strategy. This position performs variance analysis on rating factors, including maintaining trend and other models. This position also performs reserving and other actuarial analysis on products and blocks of business, including preparing various schedules. Actively participates in process improvement and project teams supporting Actuarial Services functions. Essential Job Duties: 1. Query data from various sources to maintain variance analysis on age/gender, benefit and other rating factors.  2. Perform periodic and ad hoc analysis utilizing complex spreadsheets and systems by developing new and innovative approaches.  3. Maintain and manipulate various continuance and actuarial tables required to quantify alternative plan benefits and designs.  4. Maintain working knowledge of query and analytic tools for use throughout projects assigned.  5. Assist with maintaining rate engine formulas and data, to support underwriting process.  6. Actively participate in team activities to identify problems and improve work processes and systems.  7. Perform other special assignments as requested.QualificationsRequired: 1. Bachelors Degree in Actuarial Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or Finance.  2. Strong math and data modeling skills.  3. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  4. Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, to meet time sensitive deadlines, and to organize workload with general supervision.  5. Successful completion of at least one SOA sponsored actuarial exam.  6. Participate in Actuarial Study Program at least through attainment of Associateship in Society of Actuaries. Preferred: 1. Internship and/or related experience in an Actuarial function.  2. Working knowledge of MS-Excel, Business Objects and SAS.  3. High level attention to detail.  4. Demonstrated organization skills, managing multiple priorities in a dynamic environment. Essential Physical Functions: 1. Job tasks are primarily sedentary in nature.  2. Ability to perform fine motor skills while using the computer or writing. Computer use may occur for extended periods.  3. Ability to continuously perform fine motor tasks, such as computer, writing or phone tasks. Dean Health Plan, Inc.- Established in 1983, Dean Health Plan is the insurance services subsidiary of Dean and SSM Health. It maintains a position of leadership in insurance services through a physician-led integrated health system that improves the health of its members and delivers a superior level of service and care. We're looking for talented individuals committed to improving the health of community through innovation, partnership and integrity.

Name: Data Warehouse Analyst II
Description: Project Description (include Deliverables and Timelines for services to be provided):  This position will be working on the Unemployment Insurance (UI) business intelligence team to provide development and production support for UI data warehouses and other emerging business intelligence platforms. The current data warehouses support mission critical business activities and reporting needs for DWD and are loaded on a daily basis and require on-call support.  This position is needed for advanced business analysis, database design, ETL design, and data warehouse support for enabling UI reporting and data-driven decision making. Best-qualified candidates will have strong experience using Oracle, Erwin, Informatica and Business Objects in a data warehouse environment. Knowledge of Tableau, Python and other business intelligence tools is desirable.  This position will do the following: work with advanced-level accountants and other business customers to understand their data analysis and reporting requirements; design data warehouse table structure to satisfy business requirements, identify data source, develop strategies for data extraction from source systems, design transformation and loading into data warehouse target systems; develop, implement, and follow technical and process standards; develop strategies for system fault tolerance, data recovery and purge; work to improve the efficiency of data warehouse applications through the use of indexes, compression, and other techniques; work within both formal and “agile” application development project management methodologies; function as a database liaison on the business intelligence team.  Qualified candidates must have prior experience in data warehouse design and construction. Preference will be given to qualified candidates familiar with State of Wisconsin application systems, procedures and development standards. Preference will also be given to candidates with experience with insurance and accounting data and data warehouses Hardware/Software Environment: Oracle 11g or 12c  Business Objects XI (Designer, Deski, WebI)  Informatica PL/SQL ERWin  SQLNavigator  MS-Team Foundation Server  Distributed Control-M job scheduler  Visual Studio Additional Comments: Previous work experience in government, insurance, accounting, or case management systems a plus. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: As the number one manufacturer of indoor air quality products, we know that smart, accomplished people are the reason for our success. It is because of our team members that we’ve been delivering indoor air quality and comfort solutions since 1954. To create the best, we need to be the best and that’s why Aprilaire®, a Division of Research Products Corporation® has been designated by InBusiness magazine as one of Madison's Best Companies to Work For and why we are a Worksite Superstar Award Winner and a Bicycle Friendly Business.  At Aprilaire you'll play a key role in improving indoor air quality for millions of people. Align your future with a company that has a strong culture of innovation, great respect for its people, and a commitment to growth.  With five consecutive record setting years of financial growth, we are seeking a Financial Analyst to join Aprilaire. If you have a strong business acumen and like taking an active role in business planning using business analytics, then this job is for you!  Under the direction of the Controller, the Financial Analyst will assist with month-end close, support manufacturing operations, and develop and coordinate product pricing methods and models. The Financial Analyst will work across multiple business functions and will interact with various levels of management throughout the organization.  Additional responsibilities include: Responsible for developing, analyzing and reporting on all aspects of product gross margins.Develop and understand product costing trends and key drivers to those trends.Prepare and present to the executive team analysis and reports around gross margin and trends.Working with the operations leadership team, develop manufacturing plant, distribution center and transportation financial scorecards and metrics.Prepare, analyze and make recommendations for product pricing.Key member of business operations processes including forecasting, inventory management, product pricing, transportation and manufacturing operations.Develop budget data and assist with preparing Company operating budgets.Recommend, modify or develop more effective cost control methods and assume responsibility for special projects.Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance or Accounting Major preferred; special courses in cost accounting and technical subjects beneficial.Two to five years of general accounting experience in a manufacturing environment required to develop the necessary background in financial analysis, modeling and reporting necessary to manage the diverse scope of projects assigned.Knowledge and experience with general accounting and cost accounting concepts.Advanced knowledge and experience with Excel, ERP systems and SQL databases. Strong quantitative and analytical competency with process orientation.Good general business acumen.Ability to analyze data and make recommendations to management.Ability to communicate with other departments.Initiative to continuously recommend cost saving strategies and identify opportunities to reduce costs and improve processes. We offer:  A stable yet innovative growth culture, a collaborative team environment, an opportunity to make a difference in your job and your community, and the ability to do what you love for a company that cares about its employees.  Our competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package includes: 401(k) with company match and generous profit sharing (6% in 2017),a platinum-rated low deductible health insurance plan,dental and vision insurance,three types of life insurance coverage,vacation and holiday pay,company-sponsored short and long term disability plans,progressive wellness programming for you and your family (including a company nurse/wellness educator and fitness programs),a family-oriented corporate culture,strong values,opportunity for career growth,a work location on Madison’s vibrant near-East side with free parking,and much, much more. Aprilaire, a Division of Research Products Corporation  1015 E. Washington Avenue  Madison, WI 53703  www.aprilaire.com  Applicants have rights under federal and state employment laws:  Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) En Español  Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) En Español  Wisconsin Family and Medical Leave Act (WFMLA) En Español  Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA) En Español  Aprilaire is an E-Verify company.

Name: Digital Data Analyst
Description: The Digital Data Analyst is the point analyst for both descriptive and prescriptive analytics supporting digital marketing, website analytics (and other digital guest experiences), testing and optimization efforts, in addition to developing cutting edge visualizations.  You will team with both marketing and commercial operations across the business to analyze information and identify key insights that will drive growth. You will identify the data and infrastructure required to generate cohesive analysis to better understand our customers and product impact. You will provide actionable insights and recommendations on all analytic and financial activities for area of business including agile ad hoc analysis and long term Project-based production of business insights.  In addition to these core functions, your additional responsibilities will be to: Collaborate with both internal stakeholders and external vendors involved in project definition, design and planningDevelop hypotheses, gather data, brainstorm strategic options and create recommendations around strategic initiativesOwn and rationalize marketing, web data and information across the organizationOperate as a visualization lead and Subject Matter Expert across the organizationCollect, Analyze and Synthesize complete information from disparate sources into a clear and compelling story in visualizationsBuild key success metrics to evaluate the impact of various projects, improvements and services that we provideDevelop tactical analysis of our online business to strategically analyze current planning resources and develop actionable analysisRequired Qualifications: 2+ years of experience in operational analytics Experience with range of Advanced Analytics techniques; statistical analysis skills; SQL, Tableau, Alteryx and other ETL/ELT knowledge and experienceGoogle Analytics, A/B testing and multivariate testingStrong desire to tell analytical journeys and stories through the use of visualization toolsPreferred Qualifications:Ability to effectively build relationships across the business at all levelsCreative thinker who is intellectually curious with a demonstrated passionate about learningSelf-starter, entrepreneurial, high-energy who can take initiative in a fast-moving environmentProficient in various programming languages, including SQL, R, and Python (and others)Develop critical business analysis skills -- ability to hone in on real business impact and sorting through anecdotal reasoning, comfortable working with analysts and quantitative analysisProvide strong technical understanding of current and emerging internet technologies and the operations of a commercial WebsiteFunction as a highly effective leader in a matrix environment given the role of serving various business partners on the enterprise and business unit teamsIdentify and model data to support personalization across digital channels; collaborate with product management, development, digital marketing, and data science to implement and enhance personalization efforts.Use of Google Analytics and other analytic and statistical tools to provide in-depth statistical analyses to leverage data when making business decisionsCommunicate insights to key internal stakeholders and executive leadership teamEducation:Bachelor's Degree Required (Concentration in a quantitative field preferred including Business, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research)\Master's Degree Preferred Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Description: Responsibilities In this role, you will work closely with Partners and Managers servicing existing clients to deliver financial advisory services such as: Execute financial modeling for transactions Assist with preparation of write-ups and underwriting of transactions for board meetings Partner with potential borrowers to determine the structure of proposed transactions and negotiate a term sheet with borrowers and investors on behalf of the client Assist with application writing, data analysis, pipeline building, and obtaining capital commitments Help clients to locate and vet transactions as needed Support team with general consulting to assist clients in achieving objectives Educate potential lenders and community stakeholders to participate in transactions Qualifications Currently pursuing Bachelors Degree in Business Administration with an emphasis in Accounting or Finance 0-1 years of experience with financial modeling and/or underwriting bank debt Demonstrated analytical, organization, interpersonal, project management, communication skills, and highly developed Microsoft Suite skills (Word, Excel) Ability to provide exceptional client service, demonstrate commitment to continuous learning in order to stay current regarding applicable strategies, see the "big picture" as well as the details, display appropriate ethical knowledge and commitment, and exhibit a sense of urgency and commitment to quality and the timely completion of duties Connect With Us!
