Name: Process Analyst
Description: *Description:** Accountable to support the provision of standardized, documented processes and process solutions for the assigned Product Operations \(PO\) business unit that are cost\-effective and timely, and that comply with Bank policies and procedures \(PandPs\) and regulatory requirements\. Analyze processes, business issues, procedures, products and processes to create new and/or revise processes that adhere to financial and regulatory controls\. This role focuses on up to a six\-month time horizon *KEY AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITY** + Product and Process *ACCOUNTABILITIES***Product and Process** + Conduct analysis of processes and process design, establish required internal controls, PandPs, position processes for automation, and identify risk impacts for new processes and process workflows related to low to medium complexity initiatives\.  + Conduct analysis for change or business initiatives, using specialized process knowledge\.  + Document process requirements or provide input to conversion and implementation strategy plan from a process perspective, as assigned\. Identify opportunities for process improvement and initiate changes, as assigned\.  + Revise standardized processes, design work flow, obtain sign\-offs for assigned initiatives\. Identify business process gaps, efficiency and control issues in timely fashion\. *Qualifications:** We?re here to help  At BMO Harris Bank we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the center of everything we do ? helping people is in our DNA\. For 200 years we have thought about the future?the future of our customers, our communities and our people\. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day\. Together we?re changing the way people think about a bank\.  As a member of the BMO Harris Bank team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact\. We strive to help you make an impact from day one ? for yourself and our customers\. We?ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs\. From in\-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network\-building opportunities, we?ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset\.  To find out more visit us at https://bmoharriscareers\.com \.  BMO Harris Bank is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace\. By learning from each other?s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives\. BMO Harris Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer for all, inclusive of Minorities, Women, Veterans, and Persons with Disabilities\. *Job Field:** Operations *Job Schedule:** full\-time *Primary Location:** United States\-Wisconsin\-Madison

Name: Asset Analyst
Description: Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a nationally recognized, full-service accounting and advisory firm whose specialized professionals connect with clients and their businesses through refreshing candor and clear industry insight. With approximately 2,700 employees across the United States, Baker Tilly is ranked as one of the 15 largest accounting and advisory firms in the country. Headquartered in Chicago, Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 147 territories, with over 33,000 professionals. The combined worldwide revenue of independent member firms is $3.4 billion. It’s an exciting time to join Baker Tilly! We are looking for an Asset Analyst to join the Baker Tilly’s Transaction Advisory Services team in Madison, WI.  The Transaction Advisory Services team at Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP is comprised of dedicated, client-focused professionals. Whether it’s a sale, buyout, carve-out or refinancing, our highly specialized team supports every critical business decision before, during and after a transaction. Our employees thrive in a challenging, supportive environment, taking on a high level of responsibilities as a Valued Business Advisors to our clients. Performance is rewarded and there are many professional opportunities to grow within the team.  Baker Tilly Annual Report 2017 Conduct pre and post-closing financial analysis on assigned New Market Tax Credit investments (NMTC) projects. This will include working with borrowers to discuss ongoing reporting compliance, addressing borrower financial strength, understanding and documenting community impacts. Once project data is reviewed, assist with designating appropriate risk ratings and prepare periodic internal reports for management and clients.Work with disbursement agents and lending partners to monitor construction by reviewing and approving construction draws of real estate projects.Manage all aspects of compliance reporting for client portfolios by organizing, collecting, verifying, and ensuring accuracy of compliance data on an annual basis, and by analyzing additional annual community impact reporting and borrower certifications.Continually assess project and partnership risk factors as they pertain to compliance with Section 45 (NMTC) provisions, allocation agreement requirements, and operating agreement conditions. Monitor loan defaults and ensure there are no mechanic liens or other non-permitted encumbrances on the project.Establish strong, productive working relationships with investors, lenders, project developers, and other financial partners. Provide exemplary client service and cultivate relationships conducive to information sharing and problem solving.Assist with the preparation, modification, and distribution of annual community impact questionnaires. Maintain database information integrity as it relates to compliance data, financial reporting, construction updates, and project information.Bachelor’s degree in real estate finance, economics, business, accounting or a related field, required.Two years of experience in asset/portfolio management or real estate finance, preferred.Strong aptitude with information technology with proficient skills in word-processing, spreadsheet and presentation software, and the ability to adapt to new technology is required.Strong financial analysis skills with the ability to recognize financial issues through review of borrower financial statements.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with supervisors, co-workers, and outside business professionals.Self-starter who exhibits the drive and resourcefulness to work independently and with team members toward common company goals.Ability to show confidence in functional skills and apply those skills in a multi-task cross-functional team setting.Ability to work in an evolving, team oriented environment, and accept new challenges as assigned.Demonstrated exceptional verbal and written communication skills.Ability to provide exceptional client service and demonstrate commitment to continuous learning.Eligibility to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.

Name: Prospect Development Analyst
Description: The Wisconsin Foundation and Alumni Association (WFAA), the private fundraising and alumni relations organization for UW-Madison, is recruiting for a Prospect Development Analyst to join our Research and Prospect Management (RPM) Team. In collaboration with multiple WFAA development teams, the Prospect Development Analyst provides prospect information and consultation in support of effective fundraising programs and activities. This position provides portfolio management support to development officers, utilizing prospect management best practices and prospect data to optimize fundraising resources.Essential FunctionsProspect Development Consultative Services Consult with development clients in regular portfolio consultation meetings to advise on portfolio composition, discuss portfolio activity and understand prospect identification needs.Partner with new Development Directors and Prospect Identification Analyst team to assist in establishing portfolios.Collaborate with RPM Team members to identify, evaluate, and recommend assignment and qualification of the University’s top prospects.Coordinate with business intelligence and analytics teams to deploy systems to help enhance prospect management strategies and reporting for success in all stages of development. Prospect Management Duties Implement prospect management strategies, business processes and protocols, specifically those activities focused on informing and motivating prospect activity.Serve as subject matter expert on prospect management policies and system processes, providing training to development clients as needed.Develop, document and maintain a schedule of regular data audit tasks to ensure that prospect management data is optimized for portfolio management and organizational reporting. Prospect Qualification Duties Research new prospects using experience and judgement to qualify prospects for major gift development. The review process includes capacity verification, demographic updates, broad interest and philanthropic history and provides rationale for unit assignment. Participate as member of Research & Prospect Management Team Attend and participate in regular research meetings and offsites.Share best practices and provide training for research colleagues.Attend and participate in development group meetings on a regular basis.Lead or participate in strategic planning and priority team projects.Recommend research information sources and other tools for subscription renewal, new purchase, or as an addition to regularly used free web sources.Participate in organization-wide task forces or other appropriate groups. Professional Development Participate in at least one appropriate professional development conference, continuing education course, or workshop per year.Present information on prospect development function during staff training and orientation sessions.When applicable, share prospect development expertise with development officers and researchers at other organizations. Support a service-oriented atmosphere in accordance with WFAA mission, values and philosophyStrategic beliefs The University of Wisconsin-Madison has a transforming impact on students, alumni, and society;Authentic, lifelong relationships and engagement with alumni, donors and friends are fundamental to sustaining the reputation and continued success of the University;Philanthropy has an essential and growing importance on the future progress of UW-Madison;The highest level of stewardship and fiduciary responsibility in financial, investment, data and gift administration is vital to maintaining trust with our stakeholders;Diverse views, experiences and perspectives strengthen WFAA and the university community.Organizational values We are serious about delivering results;We work together and with our campus partners as a team;We are committed to alumni, donors, volunteers and others;We are open-minded;We create a positive work environment. OtherThis job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.Qualifications Minimum of a bachelor’s degree required. Advanced degree preferred.Minimum of one year’s experience in prospect research, prospect management, development, or information field.High analytical skills, language and reasoning ability.Familiarity with using a variety of online databases and internet search tools; experience with MS office products, particularly Word and Excel; and capacity to become fluent in SQL, Blackbaud CRM Query, Export and Batch update procedures is required.Experience with relational databases, preferably Blackbaud CRM or Raiser’s Edge.Understanding of information management in a database structure, particularly the ability to store, manipulate and retrieve data.Ability and expertise in discerning data quality discrepancies that require further investigation.Experience with SQL and/or relational databases to perform queries and create reports (working knowledge of Blackbaud CRM Query and/or Microsoft Access or similar) preferred.Ability to prioritize and work with a high degree of independence while exercising critical thinking skills to determine best use of time and resources.Ability to work well as part of a team; high degree of customer service skills.Excellent analytical and interpersonal skills, including ability to express all appropriate information clearly and concisely, whether written or verbal.Ability to manage several projects simultaneously, set priorities and meet deadlines.Understanding of basic financial principles and an unwavering attention and commitment to matters of discretion and confidentiality. This is a full time, exempt position, reporting to the Managing Director, Research and Prospect Management. We offer a competitive salary and excellent benefit program. To apply, please submit a cover letter and resume.  Apply Today  Please contact Human Resources if you have any questions at hr@supportuw.org. Review of applications will begin on December 3.

Name: Service Desk Analyst I
Description: Job DescriptionWe are currently searching for a qualified Service Desk Analyst for Core BTS, a successful business transformation company, providing organizations comprehensive IT solutions from network management to virtualization. This position will be located out of our Madison, WI office.  Successful candidates must be team-oriented with outstanding work ethic, excellent written abilities, and a solid communication foundation. The Service Desk Analyst will function as first level support for our client’s end users, networks, and server issues. The candidate will troubleshoot software, hardware, and operating system issues while creating detailed documentation of issues.  Some of the supported technologies and hardware are: CiscoCitrixWindowsMicrosoft OfficePrintersLaptopsiPhonesAndroidEtc. We are looking for candidates with the following skills/competencies: Two years related experience with Help Desk or network support preferredStrong customer service, telephone skills and analytical skillsExperience with Microsoft Office Suite, iPhone and Android devicesExpertise in operating systems and application softwareFamiliarity with Cisco network technologyWorking knowledge in major desktop operating systems and in major network operating systems.Experience with basic end user administration, including network and general account maintenanceStrong troubleshooting skillsExperience in communicating with users in problem situationsGood oral and written communication skills with the ability to articulate network issues Special Requirement: Net+ certification helpfulCCNA preferred Core BTS provides a compensation package consisting of a competitive base salary and bonus program. In addition, we are pleased to provide employees with a very comprehensive benefits program including: Health, Vision and Dental Insurance, Life Insurance, Health/Dependent Flexible Spending, 401(k) Plan, with a company match, Short Term and Long Term Disability Coverage, Paid Time Off (PTO), Company Paid Holidays, Business Casual Dress Policy, and Training and Development Opportunities.  Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action EmployerCompany DescriptionTransforming IT experiences – It is what we do.  Core has accepted the responsibility: to listen, learn, and communicate to create, provide, and support innovative technology solutions for its valued customers, employees, and investors. Since 1984, Core BTS, Inc., has provided business technology solutions to a wide variety of industries, helping companies achieve their goals, streamline operations, reduce costs, and enhance their bottom lines. Core’s story is one of convergence – bringing together the right people and organizations to build a leading provider of business technology solutions.  Core employs a team of IT consultants and engineers that work to Envision, Execute, and Empower our clients by offering design, implementation and on-going support services.

Name: Benefits Administration Analyst
Description: DescriptionRole Purpose:This position is responsible for the build and quality assurance of new and renewing benefit plans in Dean Health Plans core administrative systems. The position is responsible for the creation and posting of Dean Health Plan Member Certificate and Summary of Benefits and Coverage documents amongst other member facing documents. This position is responsible for processes that bring Dean Health Plan products to market.Essential Job Duties:1. Define, create, test and maintain detailed benefit plan designs. This includes the creation of templates utilizing keywords and coverages to assign financial liabilities to benefit plans within the claims administration system.2. Utilizing excel high level capabilities, create and maintain interactive job aides that support the build and quality assurance of benefit plan builds and benefit narratives. Participate in providing technical/research support and analysis for benefit design in support of company initiatives.3. Provide expert knowledge and recommendations related to detailed benefit plan builds. 4. Create and analyze reports to support and complete quality assurance activities against detailed plan designs to insure accuracy prior to promotion to production. Complete all benefit remediation as required by quality assurance activities, regulatory changes, and benefit configuration changes throughout the year.5. Create member facing documents including Summary of Benefits and Coverage, Certificate of Coverage, and Schedule of Benefits utilizing MS office applications - high level excel mappings and Word mail merging for the purpose of member distribution. 6. Create and maintain templates for the Certificate of Coverage and Summary of Benefits and Coverage in conformance to the Wisconsin Office of Commissioner of Insurance filings. 7. Publish member facing documents to the Member Document Center in Deancare.com for access to prospective and enrolled health plan members, agents, employers and health plan providers. 8. Define, configure, test and maintain benefit narratives for Electronic Data Interchange 270/271 transactions. 9. Assist with automated files and interfaces related to benefit narratives. 10. Provide production assistance with EX code processing related to benefit plans.11. Provide production support for questions related to member benefits and accumulators.12. Participate in cross-functional teams for routine and entry-level scope activities that support processes and programs.13. Review and provide input on policies/procedures in support of benefit configuration in all applications that require benefit data.14. Maintain and update technical and process documentation.15. Assist with system maintenance and ongoing support.16. Work directly with external parties and consultants to complete required duties.17. Communicate functional configuration needs to leader; assist in prioritization.18. Provide support for unit testing and MetaVance patch testing.19. Act as the super user of the Benefit Information Data System (BIDS):a. Troubleshoot potential data and system problems.b. Execute data edits based on issue log.c. Validate sold plan does not already exist in BIDS.d. Participate in outlining functional requirements and specifications for BIDS enhancements and projects.e. Participate in all application testing tied to enhancements and projects.20. Perform training as needed on processes related to functional areas assigned and serve as subject matter expert for training and operational departments. QualificationsRequired:1. High school diploma or equivalent.2. Metavance experience achieved through participation in detailed Metavance training or as a Metavance user.3. 2 or more years of experience within a health insurance, health plan administration, claims operations, benefit administration or benefit policy setting or technology setting.4. Claims operations knowledge.5. Demonstrated process development and improvement skills.6. Strong organizational and communication skills. 7. Highly proficient in MS Office applications, specifically Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word.8. Knowledge of medical terminology, medical coding and common claims adjudication practices.9. Ability to maintain semi-technical documentation.10. High degree of attention to detail and analytical work.Preferred:1. Bachelors Degree in business or a related field.2. Minimum of 1 year direct experience with the application of standard principles, theories, concepts and techniques related to benefit plan design and build. 3. Industry Standard coding knowledge. 4. Ability and initiative to work with minimal supervision.Dean Health Plan, Inc.-Established in 1983, Dean Health Plan is the insurance services subsidiary of Dean and SSM Health. It maintains a position of leadership in insurance services through a physician-led integrated health system that improves the health of its members and delivers a superior level of service and care. We're looking for talented individuals committed to improving the health of community through innovation, partnership and integrity.

Advanced degree strongly preferred.3+ years directly related analytical experienceStatistics / Mathematics / Quantitative Methods – Quantifying evidence, understanding variation, and separating signal from noiseAbility to write scripts that accomplish specific tasksAbility to use basic version control functionalityKnowledge of tools and procedures for basic inferential tasksAbility to interpret output, extract p-values, etc.Data Skills – Applying the right transformations to the right data in an acceptable amount of timeBasic SQL proficiencyAbility to interpret data models in conjunction with exploratory analysis of a database.Ability to get data into and out of toolsKnows multiple systems and their relevant differencesMachine LearningComfortable using predictive tools and understanding of common best practicesCommunicationAbility to explain difficult or sensitive information and build consensus and influenceWhat we offer:EXL Analytics offers an exciting, fast paced and innovative environment, which brings together a group of sharp and entrepreneurial professionals who are eager to influence business decisions. Name: Sr Internal Business Systems Analyst
Description: This Senior Internal Business Systems Analyst (Migration Lead) position is responsible for data migration of high profile modernization projects within the FSE section. The BRITS Phase II modernization is a multi-year project spanning multiple Agile Release cycles. The candidate will adhere to consistent data migration processes and must be experienced in versatile software data ETL approaches. This candidate will also assist with database documentation, management, SSIS and data flow diagrams.  The candidate will be joining a fast-paced Scrum team delivering data migration features and packages in Sprint-sized deliverables. Expert experience in working with a Scrum team, Agile principles and data migration tasks are required for this position. Project duties for data migration include Scrum-suitable data migration planning, migration requirement gathering, package development in Visual Studio, dry-runs, testing, quality reports, exception reports and production promotion processes.  This candidate is required to analyze the current production database (source database), the development database (destination database) and work with the business unit to create requirements for data migration. Expert communication skills are required for ensuring requirements are understood by business units and technical design team. Requirement reviews and approvals are required prior to implementation of the migration.  The candidate will have additional consideration if they also bring experience in creating Visual Studio programs to perform migration tasks, configuration management (Prod, Test, Training, Dev), Team Foundation Server (TFS) and SQL Server database optimization. Candidate must have experience and expertise in leading large and complex data migration projects.Candidate should demonstrate experience working in teams that follow Scrum ceremonies and Agile development processes.Web development experience is not required for this position; strong experience in SQL Server, T-SQL, Visual Studio and C# is required.The candidate should have strong communication skills and should be a team player.Other Notes: 1) An in person interview will be required before a final hire is made.  2) Please bring three (3) business references to an interview.  3) The selected candidate will be required to complete a criminal background check.  5) This position is budgeted for 1960 hours annually. Hours will be prorated the first year based on start date. QualificationsMethodologies - Understanding of project management methodologies and experience with 'agile'. Name: IT Quality/Business Analyst
Description: The IT Quality/Business Analyst is a member of the IT Quality Team. This role fulfills both the business analyst and quality analyst roles for applications and systems development. The Quality/Business Analyst contributes to shaping technology demands and driving quality among the Exact Sciences business community.  The quality/business analyst acts as an intermediary between IT project teams and business partners to define, analyze, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design (using appropriate tools and models) from which applications and solutions are developed. This role functions as the stakeholder and user advocates by understanding their requirements, by representing their interests when working with the implementation teams, and by executing the test strategy to provide objective evidence that system and application requirements are met. This role is hands-on and requires strategic thinking and planning to ensure all requirements are met for overall quality of the intended solutions both functionally and technically. Maintains on-going relationships with business partners to drive satisfaction with IT.Works to elicit high-level requirements and capture business needs through dialogue with business partners.Clearly articulates and documents business requirements.Translates business requirements into functional requirements utilizing a structured process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing change).Maintains project requirements according to requirements management plan.Supports applications and solutions delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate requirements and validate proposed solutions.Reviews product design documentation to ensure that requirements are correct, unambiguous, and verifiable.Assists in generating use cases/user stories to ensure that all functional requirements are captured.Assesses the risks of various solutions.Recommends solutions based on cost vs benefit analysis.Develops and executes test plans.Plans and supports user acceptance testing and user training.Creates documentation to describe program evaluation, testing, correction, and objective evidence of meeting requirements.Ensures all prerequisite tasks are complete and ready for deployment.Provides Level 3 systems and applications support.Participates in system and data triage as necessary.Monitors program performance after implementation to prevent reoccurrence of program operating problems and ensure efficiency of operation.Proactively provides process improvement recommendations within a quickly evolving company.Proactively resolves customer satisfaction issues.Works with outside vendors to deliver solutions.Conducts compatibility tests with vendor and non-vendor-provided programs.Minimum RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science/MIS, science, healthcare-related science, or other degree in combination with relevant work experience.One (1) or more years of experience in a hands-on technical role supporting laboratory order management systems through systems development, systems implementation, quality assurance, or similar experience.Two (2) or more years of professional work experience interfacing with customers directly and problem solvingStrong analytical skills, prioritization skills, business intuition, and organizational ability.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, ability to operate in a cross cultural and complex matrix environment, and ability to build consensus across functions.Adaptable, open to change and able to work in ambiguous situations and respond to new information or unexpected circumstances.Demonstrated capacity for decision making in complex scenarios and for holding one-self and others accountable to those decisions.Desired CharacteristicsExperience working as business analyst, quality analyst, or product owner on technology development projects.Experience working under SDLC or other software-specific project management process.Experience with User Centered Design.Experience working with laboratory order cycle management, revenue cycle management, or healthcare engagement and communication systems.Fast and enthusiastic learner.Physical RequirementsAbility to work in an office setting, operate telephony devices, and a computer. #LI-KE1 Exact Sciences is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, disability, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other status protected by applicable local, state or federal law. Applicable portions of the Company’s affirmative action program is available to any applicant or employee for inspection upon request.

Name: Research Analyst
Description: County(ies): Dane Classification Title: / JAC:Job Working Title:RESEARCH ANALYST 18-03411 Research Analyst Type of Employment: Full Time (40 hrs/week) Salary: Starting salary is between $17.60 and $29.03 per hour, plus benefits. This classification is in pay range/schedule 08-04. A 12-month probationary period will be required. Pay will be set in accordance with the compensation plan in effect at the time of appointment. Contact: Renata McMillen, HR Specialist - Senior, 608-266-6679, RenataM.McMillen@dwd.wisconsin.gov Bargaining Unit: Non-Represented Area of Competition: Open Deadline to Apply: 12/14/2018 Assessment Information:46401 -  018  RESEARCH ANALYST Preview Assessment Join the team that collects data from Wisconsin employers that the State and Federal government use to inform policy decisions and plan workforce development programs. Our Research Analysts become experts in specific industries so that they can explain what's happening in a specific business sector. The information we collect impacts a variety of State and Federal programs, including direct funding for worker training.  We're looking for a strong data analyst who would like to help us innovate new ways to compile and communicate information to all of our various stakeholders. We expect to train the right person on our data sets and reporting, and we hope you will bring skills and ideas we can learn from, also. If you love collecting and analyzing data and are looking for a job with opportunities for advancement, apply today!  This position is located in the heart of downtown Madison. A five-minute walk in any direction from the office will place you on the lawn of the State Capitol, at a Madison Metro bus stop, or even on the extensive biker/runner friendly Capital City bike path system. In addition, there are plenty of nearby restaurants as well as music and shopping venues.  Join the Department of Workforce Development (DWD) for the opportunity to help build the workforce to move Wisconsin forward! DWD offers an exciting place to work with an excellent benefits package, public service loan forgiveness, a casual work environment, flexibility, and many opportunities to develop and grow your skills. Find out why we love to Work Wisconsin!Position Summary: This position is responsible for inputting and analyzing statistical data to populate data bases and provide information and interpretations of quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW) data and processes to users, including QCEW, Labor Market Information (LMI) section, and bureau staff. The position generates analytical reports on the program's operations, develops analysis applications, and operates and manages corresponding software. This position also participates in the operation of, meeting deliverables for, and implementing program processes of the Bureau of Labor Statistics cooperative agreement. Duties include inputting, editing, and making corrections to employer-reported data, processing survey instruments, and updating address information necessary to the survey process.Special Notes: Due to the nature of this position, a criminal background check may be required prior to appointment. Applicants must be legally entitled to work in the United States (i.e. a US citizen or national or a lawfulpermanent resident) at the time of appointment. DWD does not sponsor visas and is not an eligible OPT employer for those with F1 visas. This is not a contract position. Any appointment made will be contingent on the applicant being able to prove valid status to work in the United States.Qualifications:Minimally qualified applicants will have the following:Experience working with Microsoft Excel, Access and/or Word, or other similar programs.Strong verbal and written communication skills, including experience communicating professionally and effectively with a variety of audiences (e.g., leadership, stakeholders, partners and/or customers) about complex and sometimes technical topics.Well-qualified applications will also have the following:Experience working with current employment or unemployment statistics, employer tax and accounting data, or related labor market information.Experience using mainframe and data entry software to input and analyze statistical data.Ability to work as part of a team as well as independently.Ability to prioritize work, meet established deadlines and make decisions independently.How To Apply: To apply for this position, click “Log In” to access your existing account or to create a new account if you do not already have an account in the system. After you have logged in, click “Apply Now.” You will be asked to provide your personal information and attach a resume that describe how your knowledge, skills and abilities relate to the above qualifications. It is highly recommended that you customize your materials before submitting them. NOTE: Any application materials that contain corrupt files or are in formats that are unable to be opened will not be reviewed. Please check your files and attachment formats prior to uploading into Wisc.Jobs. Application materials will not be accepted if received in an email, as a hard copy or a fax. If you have any questions regarding Wisc.Jobs or need assistance using the system, please contact the HR Specialist on this announcement. Failure to submit all required documents will result in an incomplete application and will not be considered. Information regarding the State's hiring process is provided via WiscJobs/FAQ. Your resume and letter of qualifications will be evaluated by one or more job experts. Your materials must provide sufficient detail to portray your qualifications. It is important that they clearly describe your background so the job expert(s) evaluating your application materials are able to make an accurate judgment regarding your qualifications. Use specific examples to clearly demonstrate your level of expertise. The most qualified candidates will be invited to participate in the next step of the selection process. If you have any questions regarding the application process, please contact the HR Specialist listed above.  All interested applicants, including current State of WI employees, should follow the application instructions provided above. DWD is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer seeking a diverse and talented workforce. Log In to Apply Email A Friend Printable Version

Name: Product Analyst
Description: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door. - Milton Berle Come build your door with us. It's what we do here. At WTS Paradigm, we make world-class software and deliver high-quality professional services for the building products industry. Our success is tied directly to our customers' success, so we do what it takes to make sure they're successful. And we know that we couldn't do it without our awesome employees. Our award-winning office space lets you work where you prefer – at your desk, in a collaborative space, in a private enclave. Whatever suits you and lets you get your work done. We've got a ton of options to unwind during the workday. Grab a game of pool, play some ping pong, sit back and relax on the deck, or even plop down in front of a gigantic projection TV. We're sure you'll enjoy all the standard perks, like delicious free coffee. We've got some extra-cool perks too, which you won't find anywhere else. An employee favorite is our annual company-wide scavenger hunt in downtown Madison. If you thrive in a dynamic, creative, professional, and fun environment, WTS Paradigm could be the breath of fresh air you've been looking for. Check us out! We'd love to hear from you. We are currently seeking a Product Analyst to join out Middleton, WI office. Position Summary: We are looking for a Product Analyst who will bring exceptional creative and analytical skills to drive forward a best in class product that provides real value to our customers and helps grow the business. You're a self-starter, solutions-oriented, and excited to dive into something new. Essential Functions of the Role: Uses data to understand current behavior and evaluate potential opportunities in order to optimize the product. Works with the product manager and the product team to set goals, measure right things, and analyze the impact of everything we do. Empowers the team with data: you will work with the product team to bring data to their fingertips Works with the technical team to extract and segment data, and develop autonomy over time to help define and create reports Works with the product, development and design to ensure analysis has a meaningful impact on product and strategy Provides objective evaluations post implementation Measures data so we can learn what kind of impact we had with each release -serving as a liaison between the internal and external customer community and the software development team to gather and communicate requirements which help define and verify product design Coordinates schedule and communicates customer enhancement-focused collaboration sessions Translates business and user requirements through conversations with customers into functional requirements, specified in an appropriate level of detail that can be utilized for UI/Ux and development. Generates feature and bug cases in Jira. Familiarity with agile development methodologies Conducts follow up conversations with customers, as needed. Serves as a resource for development and quality assurance; clarifies requirements throughout the software development life cycle. Maintains and updates requirements documentation as needed throughout the software development life cycle. Creates release notes. Participates in special interest group discussions to hear how users are utilizing the software and documenting possible conceptual requirements, enhancements, ad hoc cases and interface needs. Supports the broader team by communicating and training new functionality internally prior to releases. Position Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in related field or an equal amount of related professional experience 4+ years of experience in business systems and processes Critical thinking, requirement gathering skills, and proven problem-solving skills Proven teamwork and collaboration skills Strong written and verbal communication Strong organizational skills; attentive to detail and excellent follow-through Self-motivated and resourceful, with strong interpersonal skills; able to work individually as well as with a team Able to adapt to changing demands and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment Some travel required To be considered, apply online at www.wtsparadigm.com/careers. - provided by DiceAgile, Analysis, Analyst, Analytical Skills, Development, Manager, Quality Assurance, Release, UX

Name: Research Analyst, Energy Services
Description: OverviewThe Cadmus Group, Inc. is seeking an entry level Research Analyst to join the Energy Services Sector. The Energy Services team at Cadmus provides advanced analytic and strategic consulting services to energy companies, utilities, governments, and non-profit organizations  Our primary areas of focus are: Measuring and verifying energy efficiency and load control program energy impacts.Performing engineering, economic, statistical and econometric modeling and analysis in support of impact evaluations, market transformation analysis, and resource planning. Candidates should have interest and knowledge in the field of energy management or energy efficiency. They should have exceptional written and verbal communication skills, be highly self-motivated to perform and learn, be able to work collaboratively and independently, and manage assigned tasks and projects from start to finish with input from supervisors.  This position will be based in Madison, Wisconsin, and will work closely with our staff throughout the country.ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities for this position include both technical work and project support/management.  Technical Elements Assist with planning, designing and implementing research efforts to support program evaluations.Conduct primary and secondary data collection.Analyze and interpret data to reach meaningful conclusions and recommendations for inclusion in clearly written, concise reports. Project Management Assist with project management activities such as internal project coordination and budget tracking.Perform survey, scheduling and recruiting calls.Contribute to proposal efforts.Perform office management duties, including purchasing supplies, planning group events, and coordinating mail deliveries. QualificationsUndergraduate degree in engineering, economics, statistics, mathematics or related field.Proficient in MS Office applications, including Word and Excel.Familiarity with qualitative and quantitative data collection methods.Experience with analyzing data and interpreting data.Excellent writing, communication, and critical thinking skills.Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, including setting priorities and adapting to changes in a time-sensitive, deliverable driven workplace.Strong organizational, detail-oriented skills.Initiative and ability to self-direct on assignments.PreferredFamiliarity with energy sector or utility industryFamiliarity with Python/Jupyter, VBA, Matlab, R, SQL, Access, FileMaker, or similar tools a plusExperience in professional/consulting business environment.Applied experience with quantitative research activities in academic or professional setting.Familiarity with project management tactics and tools, including schedule software and budget tracking.Additional Information This position will be based in Madison, WI.  Cadmus is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer and considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran’s status or disability.  Learn more about Cadmus by visiting our website at: http://www.cadmusgroup.com

Name: Programmer Analyst
Description: The Company: Placon is a leading designer and manufacturer of plastic packaging, producing quality thermoformed and injection molded packaging in the food, retail and medical markets. Working side-by-side with our customers, our mission is to fuel the heart and mind of the engineer in each of us by delivering packaging breakthroughs that inspire better engagement between people and products.  Every day we solve problems, embrace challenges and celebrate successes. We work together to transform valuable natural resources back into new plastic packaging while continuing to push the boundaries of sustainability and environmentally-responsible packaging. The Position: Were looking for a Programmer Analyst to join our team. This position is the result of a new addition to our IT team. The Programmer Analyst is responsible for systems analysis and application development, specifically but not exclusively, planning, design, implementation and maintenance of Placons ERP solution, Oracle. In addition to the ERP responsibilities, the Programmer Analyst will also be highly involve in supporting all of the organizations software solutions.  The minimum qualifications for this position include a related Bachelors degree and at least 2 years of ERP analyst/support experience, preferably in a manufacturing environment. Name: Quality Assurance Analyst

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Overview  Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a nationally recognized, full-service accounting and advisory firm whose specialized professionals connect with clients and their businesses through refreshing candor and clear industry insight. With approximately 2,700 employees across the United States, Baker Tilly is ranked as one of the 15 largest accounting and advisory firms in the country. Headquartered in Chicago, Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 147 territories, with over 33,000 professionals. The combined worldwide revenue of independent member firms is $3.4 billion.  It's an exciting time to join Baker Tilly!  Baker Tilly is currently hiring a Financial Analyst to join the team in Madison, WI! This is a great opportunity for someone with financial modeling, accounting, and underwriting experience to work within our established New Markets Tax Credit practice to serve clients located throughout the U.S.  Baker Tilly Annual Report 2017 ResponsibilitiesIn this role, you will work closely with Partners and Managers servicing existing clients to deliver financial advisory services such as:Execute financial modeling for transactionsAssist with preparation of write-ups and underwriting of transactions for board meetingsPartner with potential borrowers to determine the structure of proposed transactions and negotiate a term sheet with borrowers and investors on behalf of the clientAssist with application writing, data analysis, pipeline building, and obtaining capital commitmentsHelp clients to locate and vet transactions as neededSupport team with general consulting to assist clients in achieving objectivesEducate potential lenders and community stakeholders to participate in transactionsQualificationsCurrently pursuing Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration with an emphasis in Accounting or Finance0-1 years of experience with financial modeling and/or underwriting bank debtDemonstrated analytical, organization, interpersonal, project management, communication skills, and highly developed Microsoft Suite skills (Word, Excel)Ability to provide exceptional client service, demonstrate commitment to continuous learning in order to stay current regarding applicable strategies, see the "big picture" as well as the details, display appropriate ethical knowledge and commitment, and exhibit a sense of urgency and commitment to quality and the timely completion of dutiesSDL2017

Description: Title: REMOTE EPIC CLIENT SUPPORT ANALYST  Location: United States  Job Number: 18212620  CTG is looking for a Clinical IT Associate Application Analyst (Tier 1) will support a large Health System client for CTG Health Solutions and is responsible for providing service desk functionality in support of health care delivery specifically in Epic Systems. Name: Programmer Analyst

Works with technical staff and business team to understand and analyze system changes. Reviews existing programs or formulates logic for new systems, devises logic procedures, prepares flow-charting, performs coding, and tests/debugs programs. Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science, MIS, or equivalent work experience.  Preferences: Familiarity with energy industry terms and business vernacular. Experience troubleshooting and debugging web applications on the Windows Operating System environment.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: TDS, a FORTUNE 1000® national communications company, has an excellent opportunity for an energetic and forward-thinking individual. This highly visible position directly interacts with our CEO, enterprise executives, and senior leadership and plays a crucial role in helping to establish the strategic direction for the TDS family of companies: U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecommunications Corporation, OneNeck IT Solutions, and Suttle Straus.  This position is in our Middleton, WI Corporate office with a start date in May or June, 2019. If you are a highly motivated, strategic thinker with outstanding interpersonal skills and are interested in a fast- paced, dynamic and ever-changing industry; then come join and add value to our team!  The Financial Analyst plays a key role supporting the financial analysis and strategic planning processes at TDS. The Financial Analyst prepares analyses and presentations for the strategic planning process, the annual budget, quarterly forecasts and quarterly board of directors meetings, and prepares financial statement projections for the annual rating agency review process. The Financial Analyst also reviews and analyzes business investment proposals and provides financial and strategic impact analyses of acquisitions, divestitures and other special projects. Required Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or related fieldRelevant internship experience -OR- 6+ months financial analysis or accounting experienceOther Qualifications:CPA, CFA, or other relevant professional certification is preferred (or willingness to actively work towards one)Strong knowledge and understanding of financial statements, accounting concepts, financial modeling, and application of analytical toolsAdvanced experience using Microsoft ExcelExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills; including the ability to successfully perform independent, in-depth analysis and generate concise conclusionsSuperior verbal and written communication skills; including the ability to communicate effectively with multiple levels within the enterprise, including executive managementAbility to collaborate and work in a team environment effectivelyExcellent organizational and interpersonal skills with a strong attention to detail and quality Employees at TDS, ranked as one of Madison Magazine’s Best Places to Work, enjoy a robust total rewards package, flexible work culture, wellness programs, community involvement, tuition reimbursement and professional development. We offer challenging work and outstanding growth potential! To learn more about this position or our company, please visit tds.jobs. EEO

Name: Real Estate Affordable Housing Financial Analyst
Description: The Transaction Advisory Services team at Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP is comprised of dedicated, client-focused professionals. Whether it’s a sale, buyout, carve-out or refinancing, our highly specialized team supports every critical business decision before, during and after a transaction. Our employees thrive in a challenging, supportive environment, taking on a high level of responsibilities as a Valued Business Advisor to our clients. Performance is rewarded and there are many professional opportunities to grow within the team.  Within this team, Baker Tilly’s Housing practice has a deep understanding of complex real estate transactions, a passion for supporting the mission of community stakeholders, and a commitment to the financial and operational health of our clients' organizations in an increasingly-regulated environment. We serve housing developers, property owners, property managers, state housing credit agencies, public housing authorities, syndicators and investors across the United States, and our clients trust our proactive and experienced advice to manage compliance, development, risk and other strategic and operational issues. In the past 24 months, Baker Tilly has closed affordable housing deals totaling $626 million of equity from LIHTC and $29 million of historic tax credits; we’ve been involved in the review or/or direct completion of more than 10 percent of Rental Assistance Demonstration (RAD) applications; and we’ve closed RAD transactions totaling 1,250 units and $149 million in development costs. It’s an exciting time to join Baker Tilly! Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a nationally recognized, full-service accounting and advisory firm whose specialized professionals connect with clients and their businesses through refreshing candor and clear industry insight. With approximately 2,700 employees across the United States, Baker Tilly is ranked as one of the 15 largest accounting and advisory firms in the country. Headquartered in Chicago, Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 147 territories, with over 33,000 professionals. The combined worldwide revenue of independent member firms is $3.4 billion.  Baker Tilly Annual Report 2017 Transaction structuring and financial modeling.Assist in securing financing and equity sources for transactions, and negotiation surrounding these sources.Assist with acquisition, preservation, disposition and recapitalization strategies for real estate portfolios.Assist with various aspects of transactions involving low-income and historic tax credits including preparing the relevant application materials and structuring the credits to ensure the value is maximized.Assist in writing, editing and organizing work product, including client reports and funding applications.Provide support in developing presentations, responding to requests for proposals, pitching books and creating proposals for the team.Research industry and technical issues, compile data, and present findings.General consulting to assist clients in achieving their objectives.Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration with emphasis in Accounting or Finance, required.One (1) to three years (3) of experience with financial modeling and/or underwriting bank debt highly desired, or relevant business experience, required.Qualified recent graduates with relevant work or internship experience may be considered.Experience with affordable housing funding sources, including low-income housing tax credits, HOME, FHLB, and HUD, preferred.Understanding of real estate financials and operating performance.Demonstrated analytical, organizational, interpersonal, project management, and communication skills.Highly developed Microsoft Suite skills (Word, Excel) required.Ability to provide exceptional client service and demonstrate commitment to continuous learning in order to stay current regarding applicable strategies.Eligibility to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.

Name: CYBERSECURITY RISK ANALYST
Description: Position Vacancy ID:96671-ASEmployment Class:Academic Staff-RenewableWorking Title:Cybersecurity Risk AnalystOfficial Title:IS SPECIALIST(S45DN)Hiring Department(s):A060370-INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY/SEC/CYBERSECURITYFTE:100%Anticipated Begin Date:JANUARY 02, 2019Term:This is a renewable appointment.Advertised Salary:Minimum $73,000 ANNUAL (12 months)  Depending on QualificationsDegree and area of specialization:Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology Security or related discipline and two years' experience; OR five or more years of applicable professional services and/or information security experience and expertise.Minimum number of years and type of relevant work experience:Required Qualifications: Minimum of three years' experience conducting risk assessments against recognized standards (NIST, COBIT or ISO).Must hold, or be able to obtain within six months, a management oriented security certification (e.g., CISSP, CISM or GSEC). Demonstrated knowledge or professional certification in Information Security or IT Audit is a strong addition.Detailed understanding of network design, security protocols and systems administration with excellent analytical and problem solving skills.Experience using standard industry applications to create or update current documents to meet compliance reporting requirements.Must display working knowledge of NIST, HIPAA, or PCI Data Security, standards along with virtual environment and cloud computing services.Experience executing project management skills including design review, threat modeling and risk profiling while working across a large, distributed organization that is representative of a diverse IT and business communities.Expertise using vulnerability management tools to analyze discovered vulnerabilities against current configurations to determine the organizational risk.Preferred Qualifications:Experience working independently to conduct technical investigations with diverse constituents, providing detailed written reports and presentations.Highly advanced skills in PC/Macintosh/Unix workstation, Internet software skills, groupware, office productivity software, project management software, and architecture tools (e.g. Visio, etc.).Experience conducting assessments in a healthcare or research organization.Experience in assessing vendors as part of procurement and implementation stages.Demonstrated experience applying standards and practices for risk management and compliance; and familiarity with and validation skills using Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) principles.License or Certificate:Position Summary:This position provides risk analysis and compliance program support for the Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) domain of the UW-Madison Office of Cybersecurity. Responsibilities include evaluating security risks and compliance strategies; offering direction, guidance and consultation; and making recommendations for the improvement in information security of IT systems primarily for University of Wisconsin-Madison and for the University of Wisconsin System upon request. The incumbent coordinates implementing university-wide, proactive and distributed information security management programs to ensure the continuous availability, confidentiality, and integrity of information assets owned and used by the university community, consistent with university management's informed risk tolerance.  A successful individual will have exceptional information security expertise as well as project management, business analysis, solution implementation skills and the ability to work under broad policy guidance. This individual must exercise sound judgment in working collaboratively and communicate effectively within a challenging environment in a visible role.  This position reports to the Office of Cybersecurity and serves as the campus technical expert and authority on information security risk analysis and compliance matters. As a trusted advisor and partner with campus researchers, Primary Investigators, program managers and system owners, the incumbent works with the entire university community in a consultative manner. The incumbent should understand organizational missions, values and goals, analyze information risks which threaten those objectives, recommend and guide large cross-functional and campus-wide teams towards appropriate security control solutions, and assist in implementing and auditing those solutions to materially reduce operational and compliance based exposures.Additional Information:Additional Preferred Qualifications: Experience with typical application components such as web servers, application servers, database software (Oracle and SQL), middleware and underlying infrastructure devices (WAN and LAN devices, operating systems for server platforms, workstations, and a broad range of applications, host and network security devices.Solid understating of manual, automated application penetration skills, vulnerability scanning and analysis as well as skill in careful, limited live testing in live production environments. Please note that successful applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without need of employer sponsorship, on or before the effective date of appointment.Contact:Bradley Molzahn  bradley.molzahn@wisc.edu 608-262-0596 Relay Access (WTRS): 7-1-1 (out-of-state: TTY: 800.947.3529, STS: 800.833.7637) and above Phone number (See RELAY_SERVICE for further information. )Instructions to Applicants:Please click on the "Apply Online" button to start the application process. To apply for this position you will need to upload a cover letter and resume. Your cover letter should specifically address the required qualifications listed above.Additional Link: Full Position Details NOTE: A Period of Evaluation will be Required The University of Wisconsin is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.  The Annual Security and Fire Safety Report contains current campus safety and disciplinary policies, crime statistics for the previous 3 calendar years, and on-campus student housing fire safety policies and fire statistics for the previous 3 calendar years. UW-Madison will provide a paper copy upon request; please contact the University of Wisconsin Police Department.

Name: Financial Analyst, Staff or Senior
Description: Overview  TDS, #521 on the FORTUNE 1000®, has an excellent opportunity for an energetic and forward-thinking individual. The Financial Analyst directly interacts with our CEO, enterprise executives, and senior leadership throughout the organization. This highly visible Financial Analyst position plays a crucial role in helping to establish the strategic direction for the TDS family of companies: U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecommunications Corporation, OneNeck IT Solutions, and Suttle Straus.  NOTE: We have one Financial Analyst opportunity available and the position can be filled at the Staff or Senior level based on applicable skills.  If you are a highly motivated, strategic thinker with outstanding interpersonal skills and are interested in a fast-paced, dynamic and ever-changing industry come join and add value to our team! Responsibilities The Financial Analyst plays a key role supporting the financial analysis and strategic planning processes at TDS. The Financial Analyst prepares analyses and presentations for the strategic planning process, the annual budget, quarterly forecasts and quarterly board of directors meetings, and prepares financial statement projections for the annual rating agency review process. The Financial Analyst also reviews and analyzes business investment proposals and provides financial and strategic impact analyses of acquisitions, divestitures and other special projects. QualificationsRequired Qualifications:STAFFBachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or related fieldRelevant internship experience -OR- 6+ months financial analysis or accounting experienceSENIORBachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or related field; Master's degree in Business Administration (MBA) preferred3+ years finance, accounting or strategy experienceOther Qualifications: STAFF and SENIOR CPA, CFA, or other relevant professional certification is preferred (or actively working towards one)Strong knowledge and understanding of financial statements, accounting concepts, financial modeling, and application of analytical toolsAdvanced experience using Microsoft ExcelExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills; including the ability to successfully perform independent, in-depth analysis and generate concise conclusionsSuperior verbal and written communication skills; including the ability to communicate effectively within multiple levels within the enterprise, including executive managementAbility to collaborate and work in a team environmentExcellent organizational and interpersonal skills with strong attention to detail and qualitySENIORStrong business acumen and strategic thinkerStrong presentation and facilitation skillsHigh level ability to oversee others effectivelyAbility to build relationships with others that are outside of the reporting lineAbility to meet deadlines and work under aggressive time constraints, prioritizing multiple projects Employees at TDS, ranked as one of Madison Magazine's Best Places to Work, enjoy a robust total rewards package, flexible work culture, wellness programs, community involvement, tuition reimbursement and professional development. We offer outstanding growth potential! To learn more about this position or our company, please visit tds.jobs.  EEOSDL2017

Name: Business Systems Analyst/Application Testing
Description: This position functions as the primary department contact for the consultant and project management systems for the Bureau of Project Development (BPD) and provides independent project leadership to the Bureau of Project Development in the installation, maintenance and problem resolution of computer platforms, software systems, and applications software as they relate to the external and internal users of the department's consultant and project management systems. Work is performed under general supervision and this position reports to the Consultant Services and Project Management Section. This position performs duties such as data and application analysis on existing business systems and analysis of new technology in the delivery of new or enhanced systems. In addition this position's duties include, information system administration, documentation of all application business processes, troubleshooting on existing business systems and, budgeting, purchasing and monitoring.  Assignments involve a large number of complex variables including multi-platform requirements and the performance of advanced specialist functions for major systems such as the Contract Administration and Reporting System (CARS) and Masterworks products licensed by the department, and other complex systems developed for the Bureau of Project Development. These assignments have a significant departmental impact related to the delivery of consultant contracts, and contract payments to prime consultants. The assignments can cross organizational and/or agency lines, including all levels of government, and can involve the private sector. This position is responsible for the continued operation of and installation of yearly upgrades to the aforementioned business systems.  This position will provide ongoing advanced system/network troubleshooting expertise. This position independently uses a number of troubleshooting mechanisms to diagnose and correct business system problems or user errors. This position is responsible for presenting IT recommendations to management concerning future trends in the data processing marketplace and information technology related to information systems that support the Bureau of Project Development. This position facilitates the development of business requirements with the Bureau of Information Technology Services (BITS) as well as initiating problem resolution with appropriate individuals in BITS.  The work is multi-tasking, self-initiated and conducted independently. This position is under general supervision and work is reviewed only from a standpoint of feasibility, comparability with other work and effectiveness in meeting objectives. The person in this position must exhibit significant discretion and judgment in the performance of their assigned duties and responsibilities. This position requires statewide travel to transportation regions and the Madison Truax Materials Laboratory QualificationsExcel (MS). Required - 3 yearsMS Office products. Required - 3 yearsOutlook (MS). Required - 1 yearVisio. Required - 2 yearsWindows (MS). Required - 2 yearsExperience troubleshooting technology support issues. Required - 2 yearsAbility to perform testing of applications, facilitate testing by others, document results. Required - 2 yearsExperience using SQL, SPUFI, Platinum, Fileaid, QMF Tools or Equivalent. Required - 2 yearsExcellent verbal/written communication skills and strong time management and analytical/problem solving. Required - 2 yearsCreate and maintain database links, database gateway software. Desired - 2 yearsDatabase Tuning and Maintenance to assure highest level of system availability and performance.
