Name: Investment Banking, Mergers and Acquisitions Analyst
Description: Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a nationally recognized, full-service accounting and advisory firm whose specialized professionals connect with clients and their businesses through refreshing candor and clear industry insight. With approximately 2,700 employees across the United States, Baker Tilly is ranked as one of the 15 largest accounting and advisory firms in the country. Headquartered in Chicago, Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 147 territories, with over 33,000 professionals. The combined worldwide revenue of independent member firms is $3.4 billion. It’s an exciting time to join Baker Tilly! Due to the continued growth we are seeking a Mergers & Acquisitions Financial Analyst to join our team in Madison, Milwaukee or Chicago. Our Financial Analysts are highly qualified individuals committed to pursuing a long-term career focused on providing financial advice to our clients. You will play an integral role on our Investment Banking team, providing quantitative and analytical support for buy- and sell-side transactions and other financial advisory services. Baker Tilly Capital Financial Analysts work closely with senior bankers during all stages of the transaction so they develop both the execution and client skills required to be an effective senior banker.  Under the direction of a Managing Director, Vice President, or a Senior Associate, an Investment Banking Financial Analyst is expected to perform many of the elements of an engagement.  Baker Tilly Annual Report 2017 Support deal teams in the execution of merger and acquisition transactions and corporate finance advisory assignments from start to finish, working closely with Partners, Managing Directors, Vice Presidents, Senior Associates and outside advisors.Assist in the preparation of financial models, business valuations and other materials to be used in presentations and as support for deal processes.Assist in the preparation of confidential information memoranda to be utilized in transactions.Conduct industry and company-specific due diligence and research in support of transaction activities and new business generation.Interact directly with Partners and Managing Directors on matters related to client and engagement management by working on proposals and participating in sales meetings.Undergraduate or graduate degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics.Minimum one (1) year of experience in professional corporate finance advisory functions, investment banking, and/or public accounting due diligence preferredStrong financial modeling, financial analysis, and business valuation experience.Demonstrated analytical, organizational, interpersonal, project management, and communication skills, and highly developed Microsoft Suite skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).A strong work ethic, detail orientation and a passion for excellenceAbility to provide exceptional client service, demonstrate commitment to continuous learning in order to stay current regarding applicable strategies, see the "big picture" as well as the details, display appropriate ethical knowledge and commitment, and exhibit a sense of urgency and commitment to quality and the timely completion of duties.Organized and able to simultaneously manage multiple projects/priorities in a time critical, fast paced environment.Ability to maintain a flexible work schedule as projects dictate.FINRA Series 79 and 63 Investment Banking securities licenses, or ability to obtain required licenses within 90 days of hire.

Name: Budget and Policy Analyst - Division of Medicaid Services
Description: The position is primarily responsible for the fiscal implementation and maintenance of the Childrens Long Term Support Waiver (CLTS) Program rate schedule, which is a new program initiative in 2019. This includes developing a deep understanding of the rate schedule and methodologies, a working knowledge of waiver language and supporting documentation related to the in scope CLTS services, and understanding of the Medicaid card fee-for-service (FFS) rate methods for related services. In addition, the position conducts complex claims data analyses to understand service and rate utilization under the new schedule. The position must also develop an understanding of programs that serve similar populations, including but not limited to: foster care, Comprehensive Community Services (CCS), Birth to 3, and Childrens Community Options Program (CCOP)) and recommend rate schedule adjustments or considerations to promote cross-program alignment.  In addition to these duties, this position is also responsible for assisting the Budget and Operations Section team with duties related to the fiscal administration of CLTS, CCOP and Birth to 3. This includes providing fiscal technical assistance to counties administering the programs, developing and executing county program allocations and adjustments, performing annual program fiscal reconciliation activities, monitoring and forecasting program budgets, performing ad hoc data analyses, and researching and developing fiscal policies that support program goals and adhere to federal and state regulations.  Special Notes: Due to the nature of these positions, all applicants will be required to allow DHS to conduct a background check to determine whether the circumstances of any convictions may be related to the job being filled. Qualifications:Minimally qualified applicants will have: Experience developing, analyzing, projecting and/or monitoring government, business, or health care budgets.  Experience performing data analysis and interpreting analysis results.  Experience using Microsoft Excel to perform data analysis.  Strong written and oral communication skills.  Strong skills in time management and prioritization. Well-qualified applicants will also have: Experience developing and/or evaluating service rate or pricing methodologies for government, business, or health care programs.  Experience working with federal Medicaid funding.  Experience in accounting or policy analysis related to health care.SDL2017

Name: Supply Chain Systems Analyst
Description: Madison Gas and Electric Company (MGE) is looking for an experienced, self-motivated individual to join our Supply Chain team. This key role will provide data and business analysis in addition to software development and support for our Oracle Cloud ERP and Oracle Work and Asset Management systems along with legacy Oracle PeopleSoft Purchasing and Inventory systems and various systems, databases, and spreadsheets.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Participates actively in safety through continuous improvement teams. Configures supply chain software systems to meet user requirements. Analyzes the business to identify and implement process improvement opportunities. Creates procedures and training materials, trains users, and provides ongoing support. Designs, develops, and maintains reports, databases, and spreadsheets. Maintains and distributes supply chain department metrics. Analyzes data to identify cost reduction opportunities and provides data to aid negotiations with suppliers and discussions with other departments. Manages and coordinates medium and large projects. Develops processes and procedures to best use the supply chain applications. Prepares training materials and provides appropriate user training for upgrades for both large and small implementations. Performs regression testing for enhancements and upgrades. Acts as a liaison between developers and functional areas. QUALIFICATIONS Education and Experience Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business, a related field, or equivalent. Minimum of five years of experience in systems analysis and computer programming work, at least two of which involved financial management systems applications. Knowledge and Skills Adept at building trust and relationships quickly. Creative, motivated, and growth-oriented team player. Able to self-teach and independently learn new knowledge and skills. Advanced conceptual and applied knowledge of computer systems analysis, design, development, and testing across various computer system platforms. Advanced skills in project management, verbal/written communication, and documentation. Advanced skills in developing and maintaining supply chain software systems. Advanced knowledge of standard supply chain and IT industry software. Advanced SQL coding skills and use of Microsoft SQL Server tools. Excellent Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Microsoft Project skills. Able to manage many ongoing projects while supplying support for existing systems.

Name: Financial Analyst II
Description: Finance is all about the numbersunless you work at Amazon; its knowing the numbers and so much more. Enthusiasm and energy help us deliver new ideas, and solutions. Do you view problems as treasures, and are you willing to dive deep to develop those solutions and deliver results? Will you seek to challenge the status quo, and accept that your ideas and mechanisms may be tested daily? At Amazon, we move with purpose and speed, and this requires we work with a dynamic network of Operations, HR, Tech and Retail partners. We help others understand finance and are *the* trusted business advisors by employing every facet of data and communication to ensure our partners and our leaders have the most up to date and reliable information to help them make the best possible decision. Come teach us a few things, and well teach you a few things as we navigate the most customer-centric company on Earth.  This is a perfect position for someone who knows how to lead others, work fast, and smart. Your experience has taught you how to avoid sticky predicaments, and you are good about avoiding the mess, sooner rather than later. You know which details make all the difference, and which ones dont add value. You know the difference between spending time wisely and wasting time. Job Responsibilities include: · Ability to manage or lead others and further develop exceptional talent  · Expertise collecting, analyzing and managing quantitative data and creating meaningful reports to lead business improvement and cost reductions  · Root cause analysis and uncovering core issues using data, then assisting the FC improve and create new measures for site productivity  · Recommend, develop, and implement policies and programs that guide the organization in maintaining and improving its competitive position and profitability  · Manage the development of all weekly and monthly financial close, all planning, forecasting, and reporting models and their continuous innovation and communicating to your Operations partners  · Work with data source providers and technology teams to ensure that key decision data is accurate, automated and timely  · Proven ability to manage a team with competing priorities & providing level-headed guidance during unexpected events

Name: Actuarial Analyst
Description: Quartz is seeking an individual interested in growing their career as an Actuarial Analyst on our Underwriting Team. This role will work closely with our Underwriting, Sales and other actuarial team members to provide accurate pricing, prepare financial reports and support underwriting business decisions. This can include, but not limited to development of financial models, reporting, and comparing actual to budget costs. Key Responsibilities: Produce quotes, create financially viable underwritten proposals and work closely with sales to meet clients’ needs by making underwriting decisions, enforcing rules and standards and investigating to resolve issues or concerns.Gather data to prepare and interpret regular and ad hoc reports to aid management in their understanding of the business. Prior experience and professional application of actuarial and/or underwriting principles. Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and analytical software. • Experience developing analytical tools, models and financial presentation formats. Excellent oral and written communication skills when working with internal and external parties.Ability to manage multiple tasks to ensure timely and accurate delivery of financially impactful work and other required analyses.Ability to resolve complex problems in a professional manner, exercising strong judgment and reason.This position will work from our office in Madison, WI. Quartz values and embraces diversity and is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Name: Production Control Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of a Production Control Analyst in Madison, Wisconsin (WI).  Overview:  The Production Control Analyst performs daily analysis and reporting of production status to ensure optimal performance of production enterprise systems and availability of these systems during core business hours based on Service Level Agreements (SLA). They provide core and after hours support for the production environment as well as lower environment to support all batch jobs processed through the Enterprise Batch Schedule (EBS). This person is accountable for all development of the EBS, including but not limited to: scheduling design and analysis, performance analytics, production and pre-production monitoring and reporting.  Essential Functions:  Works with cross-functional teams to drive resolution and determine root cause Evaluates job performance and recommend improvements Ensure that all financially critical jobs are completed within the defined SLAs and troubleshoot issues to assist in root cause analysis and remediation when failures occur Meet established service level objectives through management and execution of production control daily operations (50%) Strong problem solving and quick thinking to restore services and address concerns (20%) Translate assignments received into the form of objectives to specific tasks, features, stories, ceremonies and overall work needed (10%) Work with vendors as needed to address issues or implement changes (10%) Knowledge of core system and processes across multiple business and system areas (5%) Evaluate and present recommendations for process improvements (5%) Ensure broad team knowledge by providing schedule training to other team members Attend Change Advisory Board meetings and review all changes for potential impacts to productionREQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree with 1 - 3 years of relevant experience; or Associate degree or 2 years of continuing education or training with 4 - 6 years of relevant experience; or a High School diploma or equivalent with 5 - 7 years of relevant experience Solid communication, organization and interpersonal skills Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills and appropriate escalation skills Willingness to be collaborative to achieve business objectives Demonstration of strong team work skills Self-Starter- quickly learn systems/processes and assigned work Flexible with change, pivot and redirect as needed to meet objectives Business Process Knowledge/system knowledge Experience triaging issues in Enterprise Batch System Strong knowledge of batch processing and scheduling methodologies Ability to work across teams to identify emergent issues and their root cause(s) Solid understanding of managed care processing fundamentals Ability to multitask and manage competing priorities in a cross-functional and high-pressure setting Desire to identify long-term solutions to proactively address issues and potential issues Fluent in batch scheduling paradigms Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: IS Relationship Analyst
Description: IS Relationship AnalystIf you are the IS Relationship Management Analyst our client is looking for, you will…  Act as a liaison between Information Systems (IS) and the business bridging the technical gap that may exist. You will have a broad technical background along with strong customer service skills and be able to effectively elicit business requirements from the customer. The role will develop and maintain strong working relationships with IS teams and internal customers and respond to customer inquiries. You may act as a technical liaison on large projects and coordinate the escalation of issues with the IS Problem and Incident team. Responsibilities Understand the business and can effectively disseminate IS concepts from both a technical and customer point of view.  Articulate technical concepts using easily understandable business language.  Provide coordination to ensure completion of requests for technical assistance and support for incoming queries and issues related to assigned business units.  Demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to interact in a team environment, with all levels of management and technical and non-technical staff.  Collaborate with IS and business customers to document problems and develop solutions.  Assist with documenting process workflows and create end-user documentation.  Consistently apply knowledge of the organization’s mission, values and strategic goals.  Act as primary contributor to the development of strategic initiatives and aid in prompt, efficient and quality execution through management of project staff.  Provide support for IS Service Level Agreements (SLAs).  Act as point of contact for system rollouts, upgrades, troubleshooting, triage, and issue resolution. Coordinate issue escalations with the IS Problem and Incident team.  Provide support for incident management/communications in conjunction with the IS Problem and Incident team.  Adhere to company policies and processes, including IS change control policies/procedures.  Provide one-on-one and small group training as needed.  Provide technical assistance to clients in a professional and accommodating manner.  Take a leadership role on moderately complex projects independently or as part of a larger project team.  Handle multiple competing initiatives and escalate issues effectively.  Consistently utilize data, statistics, and technology to solve problems.  Develop and review metrics and KPI's to identify areas to mature the relationship management process. You should have: Bachelor’s Degree in Data Processing, Computer Science, Information Systems or related field; OR equivalent post high school education and/or work-related experience  2 or more years of Information Systems experience in a developer or system administrator role and includes 1 or more years in customer focused role OR a combination of relevant experience and demonstrated ability to meet the Information Systems Career Ladder Competencies which include Focus, Leadership, Design/Analysis, Support/Implementation, Strategy, Budget and Analytic Ability.  If this position sounds like you, please send your resume for immediate consideration.

Work independently with staff to assist, guide, and mentor them to identify solutions. Participate as a team member to achieve successful business process reengineering. Communicate status to management and teams. Desired Behaviors Proactive - operates with and communicates to all stakeholders and co-workers Meets commitments and is upfront and proactive in communicating when goals are in jeopardy Analyze issues, proposes solutions, and then takes ownership of the execution of solutions Work effectively with a variety of personalities and work styles Ability to prioritize issues and resolve them Act with integrity at all times Work to understands college governance model and operate effectively within it Qualifications An educational background with a Bachelor's degree or higher Must have solid competency in configuration and implementation of the PeopleSoft Academic Advising and 3 C's Module 5+ years in PeopleSoft Academic Advising Implementation or Process Re-engineering Consultant role 6+ years of experience working with an academic institution Strong data, application and integration skills. Strong process definition skills. Experience creating workflow diagrams, relationship maps, use cases, and test plans. Outstanding verbal and written communication skills are essential. Well-developed skills with Visio and Word. Experienced working in a deadline-driven environment, handling and prioritizing multiple tasks. Demonstrated record of accomplishment of successful project delivery. Excellent conceptual, problem solving, and analytical skills. Ability to work independently or as a member of a team on complex tasks. Demonstrated competency in documenting solutions for both technical and functional audiences. Experience with testing, including end-to-end system testing and user acceptance testing. Name: Data Warehouse Analyst
Description: Description:This position is for a dedicated IT Business Analyst; please do not submit ETL developers for this role. DCF is looking for a strong practitioner with 5 or more years of business requirements elicitation, documentation, stakeholder communication, requirements verification and testing as a primary job responsibilities. Preference will be given for candidates will experience in gathering requirements for data warehouse/business intelligence projects.  THIS IS FOR A ONE YEAR CONTRACT  • Responsible for leading and facilitating the communication with IT staff, business customers and other stakeholders, implementation services, and support services to assist in the development, implementation and support of business intelligence.  • Understands business objectives and problems, identifies alternative solutions, performs feasibility studies and cost/benefit analysis of alternatives in support of enterprise wide business intelligence. Manages the balance between business requirements and user expectations.  • Uses extensive experience as a liaison between users and technologists to drive requirements into design.  • Analyzes user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate processing or to improve existing processes: Confers with personnel of organization unites involved to analyze current business procedures, identify issues, and learn specific business requirements, such as how data is to be summarized, and formats for reports.  • Works with the team lead and manager to determine a detailed and prioritized list of objectives and activities for current and future projects. Experience with Human Services business intelligence is desirable.  • Responsibilities with include project work enhancing existing/new processes through data sharing, configuration, report writing and metrics.  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues efficiently. Identify potential technology improvements to be leveraged in support of the business. Assist in the creation and maintenance of test plans. Participate in special projects as required.  • Business Analyst with 5 or more years of experience, relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals, independently performs a variety of complicated tasks.  Other Notes to Vendors:  1) An in person interview will be required before a final hire is made.  2) Please bring three (3) business references to an interview.  3) Selected candidate required to sign Exhibit B.  4) DCF does not sponsor work visas, either at the time of hire or at any later date.

Name: IT Business Analyst - Human Services Industry
Description: *IT Business Analyst - Human Services Industry***Share this** Find similar career opportunities *IT Business Analyst - Human Services Industry***Category:** Business Analysis (functional and technical)*City:** Madison, Wisconsin, United States*Position ID:** J1018-1498*Employment Type:** Full Time*Meet our professionals***CGI: A place to build an IT career***Position Description:** CGI has a need for an experienced Business Analyst to join our team in Madison, WI. This is an exciting full-time opportunity to work in a fast-paced team environment on technology for human services. We take an innovative approach to supporting our clients working side-by-side in collaborative environment modernizing existing technology.  This is the chance to further advance your career. Why? Full-time opportunity to become a member of an organization w/$10 billion+ in annual revenues70,000 employees in 40 countries We're offering a complete benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, paid vacation, etc. *Your future duties and responsibilities:** The Business Analyst will need to be able to design, test, and support system users in the human services industry. Ultimately, the business analyst will collaborate with the business on all technology and business process related efforts that include gathering functional business requirements, designing new system functionality, testing software code, and supporting end users. Additional duties are as follows:  ? Facilitate team and client meetings effectively to gather and document requirements, design system enhancements, drive user feedback and QA testing to completion of project  ? Write system documentation including developer guides/design specs and topic papers  ? Create test scripts based on business requirements  ? Perform system testing using test scripts to ensure requirements are met  ? Execute regression testing scripts  ? Support application help desk responding to end-user calls  ? Very strong oral and written communication skills  ? Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills  ? Self-motivator with great attention to detail and follow through *Required qualifications to be successful in this role:** Key Items we will be looking for are:  ? A business analyst with at least 2 years of SACWIS or other large Child Welfare IT systems experience  ? Demonstrated performance with a track record of success in human services industry  ? Experience in all facets of project lifecycle  ? Experience in system analysis, design and testing  ? Experience supporting an application help desk  ? Ability to prioritize effectively, multitask, and manage time appropriately  ? Strong interpersonal skills and clear communication skills  ? Ability to respond quickly and efficiently while understanding and interpreting automated child welfare application user needs  ? High level technical aptitude and analytical skills as they relate to child welfare functionality and workflow  ? High level interpersonal skills and customer service oriented experience and proficiency \#L1-AC2*Skills:** + Business Analysis *What you can expect from us:***Build your career with us.** It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change?supporting our clients? digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com .  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.  CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com . You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. **Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned** .  We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here at https://cgi-veterans.jobs/ to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.  All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held.  CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI?s legal duty to furnish information.

Name: Senior Finance Planning Analyst
Description: Company ProfilesWeir has been in business since 1871 and our sustainability and success has been built on attracting, retaining, and developing exceptional people.  As a global company, employing around 15,000 people in over 70 countries, we reflect the diversity of our customers in the diversity of our people and ensure everyone is given the opportunity to flourish regardless of their gender, race, beliefs or background.  Weir is an inclusive and innovative organisation where you can be your authentic self. We continually develop our talent and diversity of thought to keep our business relevant, innovative and successful for the future.  Enabling our people to unleash their full potential is central to ‘We are Weir’, our vision, mission, and strategic priorities. We aim to be the most admired engineering business in our markets and we'll achieve that ambition by being the employer of choice in our markets.  We offer a wide range of career opportunities across a variety of technical and business roles in engineering, manufacturing and service locations worldwide.Business Need / Purpose of RoleUnder the direction of the Finance Controller, the Senior Finance Planning Analyst is responsible for the preparation of key financial reports, analysis of key financial data, and developing/implementing corrective actions to improve efficiency and profitability within the company.Objectives & Measurement - Key ResponsibilitiesLead the preparation and evaluation of the annual budgets; quarterly forecast reports, monthly and mid-monthly reports in accordance with reporting timetables. This includes appropriate delegation of tasks to Finance team to gather budget and forecasting information from departments.Perform in depth analysis of variances between actual and budget / current forecast comparisons, including regular engagement with key business partners to determine root causes.Lead the three-month-rolling-forecast (3mRF) monthly input and output meetings, developing a strong knowledge of the US Minerals product lineProduce the daily input/ output/ backlog report, making improvements where necessary, including potential transition to Power BISummarize monthly results, through presentation to senior management, with support from finance team to investigate variances from forecast/ budget.Direct the IT Department to create system reports (Cognos and Mapics) needed to achieve desired analyses.Work with Cost Accounting team in the analysis of manufacturing variances and with the relevant business areas to address recurring issues.Monitor and forecast of working capital. Close liaison with key business partners (including operations, procurement, accounts receivable and accounts payable) to develop actions to manage working capital effectively and meet targets. Monitor the implementation of actions and recommend corrective actions where necessary.Support key business partners in financial analysis / modeling of the potential impact of changes e.g. product price changes, changes in commodity prices etc.Complete general accounting responsibilities as assigned, such as balance sheet reconciliations.Preparation of responses to ad hoc financial analysis requests on a timely basis.Complete special projects as assigned.Follow and comply with all safety and work rules and regulations. Maintain departmental housekeeping standards.Responsible for Environmental Health and Safety management and policy commitments as prescribed for this role in Weir's Duty of CareNothing in this position description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. Job Knowledge / Education and QualificationsJob Knowledge / Education and Qualifications The details described here are representative of those that are encountered by or must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCEBachelor’s degree from four-year college or university in finance/accounting. Seven plus years of progressive financial accounting experience in a public company, preferably in a manufacturing environment.LANGUAGE SKILLSAbility to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community. Ability to write speeches and articles for publication that conform to prescribed style and format. Ability to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors. MATHEMATICAL SKILLS Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations. REASONING ABILITY Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS CPA or CMA preferred. Requires a valid driver’s license  Strong analytical skills. Excellent computer skills with ERP business systems and Excel spreadsheets. Excellent organization, oral and written communication, motivation, human relations, records keeping, trouble shooting, problem-solving and follow-through skills. Effective presentation skills. Ability to promote and maintain positive relationships. Good work ethic - proactive. Confidence in own abilities and capable of acting decisively. Ability to project and maintain professionalism with a diversity of people inside and outside the Company. Willingness to accept responsibility and accountability. Willingness and ability to travel as necessary. Ability to work under pressure and in stressful situations and maintain attention to detail. Must have a passion for the business and the “will” to succeed. MACHINES, TOOLS, EQUIPMENT, AND WORK AIDS Requires the ability to operate a variety of standard business machines, such as computer and job related software (Microsoft Office & Lotus Notes), calculator, telephone, fax photocopier, etc. Mid-range ERP system knowledge (MAPICS on IBM AS/400) preferred.PHYSICAL DEMANDSWhile performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, use hands to finger, handle or feel, talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close, distance, color, and ability to adjust focus.WORK ENVIRONMENTThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. General office environment. Moderate noise.Core CompetenciesAnalytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; collects and researches data; uses intuition and experience to complement data; designs work flows and procedures.  Interpersonal Skills - Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; maintains confidentiality; listens to others without interrupting; keeps emotions under control; remains open to others' ideas and tries new things. Delegation - Delegates work assignments; matches the responsibility to the person; gives authority to work independently; sets expectations and monitors delegated activities; provides recognition for results. Business Acumen - Understands business implications of decisions; displays orientation to profitability; demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; aligns work with strategic goals; knows the competition; is aware of how strategies and tactics work in the marketplace. Strategic Thinking - Develops strategies to achieve organizational goals; understands organization's strengths & weaknesses; analyzes market and competition; identifies external threats and opportunities; adapts strategy to changing conditions. Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively; edits work for spelling and grammar; varies writing style to meet needs; presents numerical data effectively; able to read and interpret written information. Motivation - Sets and achieves challenging goals; demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles; measures self against standard of excellence; takes calculated risks to accomplish goals. Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities; uses time efficiently; plans for additional resources; sets goals and objectives; organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; develops realistic action plans. Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; looks for ways to improve and promote quality; applies feedback to improve performance; monitors own work to ensure quality. Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; reacts well under pressure; treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; accepts responsibility for own actions; follows through on commitments.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: TDS, a FORTUNE 1000® national communications company, has an excellent opportunity for an energetic and forward-thinking individual. This highly visible position directly interacts with our CEO, enterprise executives, and senior leadership and plays a crucial role in helping to establish the strategic direction for the TDS family of companies: U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecommunications Corporation, OneNeck IT Solutions, and Suttle Straus.  This position is in our Middleton, WI Corporate office with a start date in May or June, 2019. If you are a highly motivated, strategic thinker with outstanding interpersonal skills and are interested in a fast- paced, dynamic and ever-changing industry; then come join and add value to our team!  The Financial Analyst plays a key role supporting the financial analysis and strategic planning processes at TDS. The Financial Analyst prepares analyses and presentations for the strategic planning process, the annual budget, quarterly forecasts and quarterly board of directors meetings, and prepares financial statement projections for the annual rating agency review process. The Financial Analyst also reviews and analyzes business investment proposals and provides financial and strategic impact analyses of acquisitions, divestitures and other special projects. Required Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or related fieldRelevant internship experience -OR- 6+ months financial analysis or accounting experienceOther Qualifications:CPA, CFA, or other relevant professional certification is preferred (or willingness to actively work towards one)Strong knowledge and understanding of financial statements, accounting concepts, financial modeling, and application of analytical toolsAdvanced experience using Microsoft ExcelExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills; including the ability to successfully perform independent, in-depth analysis and generate concise conclusionsSuperior verbal and written communication skills; including the ability to communicate effectively with multiple levels within the enterprise, including executive managementAbility to collaborate and work in a team environment effectivelyExcellent organizational and interpersonal skills with a strong attention to detail and quality Employees at TDS, ranked as one of Madison Magazine’s Best Places to Work, enjoy a robust total rewards package, flexible work culture, wellness programs, community involvement, tuition reimbursement and professional development. We offer challenging work and outstanding growth potential! To learn more about this position or our company, please visit tds.jobs. EEO

Name: Programmer Analyst . NET
Description: Job Summary: The Programmer Analyst ensures efforts are in alignment with the Information Technology department to support customer-focused objectives and the IT Vision, a collaborative partner delivering innovative ideas, solutions and services to simplify people's lives. The Programmer Analyst's role is to define, develop, test, analyze, and maintain existing applications in support of the achievement of business requirements. This includes writing, coding, testing, and analyzing software programs and applications. The Programmer Analyst will also research, design, document, and modify software specifications throughout the production life cycle. Job Responsibilities:Ensure efforts delight the customer.Provide superior customer service utilizing a high-touch, customer centric approach focused on collaboration and communication.Contribute to a positive team atmosphere.Innovate and create value for the customer.Collaborate with analysts, developers, programmers, and designers in conceptualizing and development of software programs and applications.Analyze and assess existing business systems and procedures.Assist in the definition, development, and documentation of software's business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal users and departments.Assist in defining software development project plans, including scoping, scheduling, and implementation.Research, identify, analyze, and fulfill requirements of all internal and external program users.Conduct research on emerging application development software products, languages, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts.Recommend, schedule, and perform software improvements and upgrades.Liaise with network administrators, systems analysts, and software engineers to assist in resolving problems with software products or company software systems.Consistently write, translate, and code software programs and applications according to specifications.Modify and write programming scripts to enhance functionality and/or performance of company applications as necessary.Design, run and monitor software performance tests on new and existing programs for the purposes of correcting errors, isolating areas for improvement, and general debugging.Administer critical analysis of test results and deliver solutions to problem areas.Generate statistics and write reports for management and/or team members on the status of the programming process.Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines.Train end users to operate new or modified programs.Install software products for end users as required.Responsibilities (including one or more of the following):Visual StudioVB.NETC#WPFOracleMS SQLInformaticaJavaScriptJQueryCSSHTMLAJAXWCF Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/DisabledEducation: College degree (2 or 4 year program) typically in the field of computer science, information systems, or software engineering. Professional programming work experience strongly preferred. Experience:Working knowledge of source control tools such as TFS and GitHub.Prior experience interviewing end-users for insight on functionality, interface, problems, and/or usability issues.Hands-on experience developing test cases and test plans.Healthcare industry practices and HIPAA knowledge would be a plus.Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.Key Skills/Competencies:Able to communicate effectively with non-technical staff and with members of interdisciplinary teams.Flexible and adaptable in regards to learning and understanding new technologies.Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.Ability to conduct research into software-related issues and products.Highly self-motivated and directed.Keen attention to detail.Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.On-call availability.Some travel may be required. #LI-POSTAssociated topics: architect, back end, c#, develop, matlab, php, programming, senior, senior software developer, senior software engineer

Name: Agile Business Analyst/Consultant - 3
Description: The candidate will work on a multi-year, multi-phase modernization project of a legacy collection system.  This business analyst (BA) will work closely with the project manager and is responsible for facilitating communication with the project manager, product owner, stakeholders, change agents, and the development team. The candidate will gather business requirements from multiple stakeholders. The candidate is responsible for transitioning the BRITS project from application development into a production implementation. Experience working on 'agile' projects is required.  The BA will understand business objectives and problems, and identify alternative solutions. The candidate will manage the balance between business requirements and user expectations, while being a liaison between users and technologists to drive requirements to design. The BA will schedule and present at user group and other meetings.  Responsibilities include project work, building strong trusting relationships, identifying conflicting stakeholder requirements and constraints, and identifying areas for improvement, testing and special projects as required. Essential Job Duties: § Experience working on an Agile development team  § Strong facilitation skills of small to large groups including knowing when and how to regain group focus and use of the 'parking lot'  § Ability to adjust presentation and facilitation approach suitable for executives and workers alike  § Ability to "tell the story" using verbal and visual approaches  § Holistic knowledge of the overall requirements process, business and technical  § Prior use of requirements tools and experience/demonstrated knowledge of how they may interact with applications used for management of bugs, issues, testing (manual and automated), design and development  § Ability to quickly understand business drivers, model existing processes and facilitate and guide business constituents to developing future state requirements, rather than solutions  § Adaptability and flexibility when working with multiple clients with varying degrees of knowledge and ability/availability to participate. In other words, ability to be creative in helping clients provide the requirements and detail needed  § Experience with transitioning from legacy to modernized systems  § Experience with change management in a large scale, multiple constituent organization to understand and anticipate change management, training, support, and overall operational handoffs needed Other Notes to Vendors: 1) Resumes must be 3 pages or less.  2) An in person interview will be required before a final hire is made.  3) Please bring three (3) business references to an interview.  4) A background check is required before final hire. QualificationsChange management. Required - 3 yearsMethodologies - Understanding of project management methodologies and experience with 'agile'. Required - 3 yearsParticipation in project management methodologies including experience with 'agile' methods. Required - 3 yearsMeeting management. Name: Real Estate Affordable Housing Financial Analyst
Description: The Transaction Advisory Services team at Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP is comprised of dedicated, client-focused professionals. Whether it’s a sale, buyout, carve-out or refinancing, our highly specialized team supports every critical business decision before, during and after a transaction. Our employees thrive in a challenging, supportive environment, taking on a high level of responsibilities as a Valued Business Advisor to our clients. Performance is rewarded and there are many professional opportunities to grow within the team.  Within this team, Baker Tilly’s Housing practice has a deep understanding of complex real estate transactions, a passion for supporting the mission of community stakeholders, and a commitment to the financial and operational health of our clients' organizations in an increasingly-regulated environment. We serve housing developers, property owners, property managers, state housing credit agencies, public housing authorities, syndicators and investors across the United States, and our clients trust our proactive and experienced advice to manage compliance, development, risk and other strategic and operational issues. In the past 24 months, Baker Tilly has closed affordable housing deals totaling $626 million of equity from LIHTC and $29 million of historic tax credits; we’ve been involved in the review or/or direct completion of more than 10 percent of Rental Assistance Demonstration (RAD) applications; and we’ve closed RAD transactions totaling 1,250 units and $149 million in development costs. It’s an exciting time to join Baker Tilly! Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a nationally recognized, full-service accounting and advisory firm whose specialized professionals connect with clients and their businesses through refreshing candor and clear industry insight. With approximately 2,700 employees across the United States, Baker Tilly is ranked as one of the 15 largest accounting and advisory firms in the country. Headquartered in Chicago, Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 147 territories, with over 33,000 professionals. The combined worldwide revenue of independent member firms is $3.4 billion.  Baker Tilly Annual Report 2017 Transaction structuring and financial modeling.Assist in securing financing and equity sources for transactions, and negotiation surrounding these sources.Assist with acquisition, preservation, disposition and recapitalization strategies for real estate portfolios.Assist with various aspects of transactions involving low-income and historic tax credits including preparing the relevant application materials and structuring the credits to ensure the value is maximized.Assist in writing, editing and organizing work product, including client reports and funding applications.Provide support in developing presentations, responding to requests for proposals, pitching books and creating proposals for the team.Research industry and technical issues, compile data, and present findings.General consulting to assist clients in achieving their objectives.Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration with emphasis in Accounting or Finance, required.One (1) to three years (3) of experience with financial modeling and/or underwriting bank debt highly desired, or relevant business experience, required.Qualified recent graduates with relevant work or internship experience may be considered.Experience with affordable housing funding sources, including low-income housing tax credits, HOME, FHLB, and HUD, preferred.Understanding of real estate financials and operating performance.Demonstrated analytical, organizational, interpersonal, project management, and communication skills.Highly developed Microsoft Suite skills (Word, Excel) required.Ability to provide exceptional client service and demonstrate commitment to continuous learning in order to stay current regarding applicable strategies.Eligibility to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.

Name: IT STE Innovation Analyst
Description: CLA is seeking to hire a IT STE Innovation Analyst that will focus on business transformation and the client experience. This position will work closely with business and other IT teams to qualify innovation opportunities/issues, solution design and validation scenarios through activities such as process analysis, preliminary solution design, prototype development and software/application “proof of technology” exercises.This role can be based in any of the following locations: Minneapolis, MN, Phoenix, AZ and Madison, WI. This position may require occasional non-local or overnight travel for office visits, training, meetings and/or other business-related purposes. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:•Work with IT and business stakeholders to identify issues or opportunities with internal and external process or services.•Recommend and drive innovation opportunities.•Lead and/or participate along with other IT teams, proof of “concept” efforts, as prioritized by IT leadership and project portfolio processes.•For these purposes, “proof of concept” includes final platform design and analysis, conceptual migration to production strategies, integration design and execution and the development of support models.•Conduct software application, service and work process assessments to identify innovation opportunities for improvements to the “experience” for CLA clients and staff.•Monitor the use of key client-facing technologies and services. Take proactive steps and notify management when opportunities or issues exist.TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES:• The ability to gather and document project requirements (business, technical and functional).•Office productivity application power user.•Software, interface and/or report programming capabilities.•Ability to demonstrate innovation and creativity for problems and effective solutions.•Sound working knowledge of application/solution development methodologies.• Ability to manage competing demands on time remaining focused on key objectives/goals, results oriented.•Recognized for using interpersonal skills/style to gain acceptance of ideas and plans, particularly as it relates to the implementation of company-wide processes and guidelines supporting efficiency-focused objectives.REQUIRED EDUCATION EXPERIENCE:•5-8 years of relevant experience in business application administration, software/report or data programming or development.•3-5 years’ experience with software, interface or report programming languages•Bachelor’s degree required•Certification/ Licenses: None requiredEqual Opportunity Employer/AA Employer/Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities#LI-KR1

Name: Senior Revenue Cycle Analyst; 1.0FTE
Description: Senior Revenue Cycle Analyst; 1.0FTE  23-Oct-2018 Department Name HSP Patient Business Svcs. Location Meriter Business Center Job Description Under the direction of the Revenue Cycle Director, the Senior Revenue Cycle Analyst provides revenue cycle consulting assistance to administrative and managerial staff of the hospital and affiliated departments. This position plays a key role in ensuring that Meriter’s business processes align to UnityPoint Health standards while identifying opportunities to enhance or improve revenue cycle performance throughout the organization.  This position is expected to stay attuned to requirements and changes within the regulatory and payor environments as well as to be able to provide revenue cycle analysis and process improvement support for management. The Senior Revenue Cycle Analyst may be assigned areas of responsibility and will be required to collaborate with different teams within the revenue cycle that may include: Patient Access (Scheduling and Registration), Financial Clearance, Patient Financial Coordination, Accounts Receivable, Denials Management, Charge Description Master (CDM) Maintenance, Charge Capture, Revenue Integrity, Payor Audits or other duties as assigned. This position will have a greater focus on Charge Description Master (CDM) Maintenance, Charge Capture, Revenue Integrity, and Payor Audits. Name: Product Analyst Internship - Summer
Description: OVERVIEWAt Sentry, we realize that getting valuable, hands-on experience is important for you and your career. We don’t offer just an internship; we offer a whole experience built to give talented students like you a head start for your career. From rewarding work in your business area to professional development trainings all the way to paid volunteer time and diverse social events, we make sure our internship program fits all of your needs.WHAT YOU'LL DOProduct Analyst Interns work closely with their mentor to create and implement strategic market plans, evaluate business results to drive profitable growth, and participate in other key initiative teams with the focus on making us the best provider of automobile and motorcycle insurance. In addition, you will assist in market and competitive analysis, balancing competitive pricing with profitability and recommending courses of action to take advantage of market opportunities. This internship opportunity is available in our Madison, WI office.WHAT IT TAKESIn order to be eligible for this elite opportunity you must meet the following criteria: Pursuing an undergraduate degree in Business, Mathematics, Risk Management or a related fieldObtain a minimum in-major GPA of 3.00Graduating in Fall of 2019 or Spring of 2020Ability to work in a team atmosphereSentry does not offer employment in this position to holders of F-1, J-1, and H-1 Visas for the purpose of obtaining practical experienceWHAT YOU'LL RECEIVE• Opportunity to unleash your talents and add value to the organizationExposure to company executivesProfessional development trainingsNetworking opportunitiesCompetitive compensationHOW YOULL APPLYSentry Insurance has an online employment application. In order to complete it, you need to apply for a specific position. We ask that you apply for one position at a time with us; so if you are interested in several positions, please determine the position in which you are most interested and apply for that position first. If you are not selected for your first choice, we invite you to apply for the next job in which you are interested.  If this is the first time you have applied for a position at Sentry, you will be asked to register. Returning applicants will only need to provide their email address and password.WHO YOULL WANT TO CONTACTHannah Krueger at 715/346-6281 HANNAH.KRUEGER@SENTRY.COMABOUT SENTRYSentry Insurance is one of the largest and strongest mutual insurance companies in the United States, holding an A+ (superior) rating from A.M. Best. The company and its subsidiaries sell property and casualty insurance, life insurance, annuities and retirement programs for business and individuals throughout the country. Headquartered in Stevens Point, Wisconsin, Sentry employs more than 4,000 associates in 41 states. A complete list of underwriting companies can be found at www.sentry.com.EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITYIt is our policy that there be no discrimination in employment based on race, color, national origin, religion, sex, disability, age, marital status, or sexual orientation.

Name: Summer 2019 Commercial Credit Analyst Intern
Description: Description Position at First BusinessJoin the winning team at First Business as aSUMMER Commercial Credit Analyst Intern!First Business is a locally managed successful, entrepreneurial, and growth-oriented financial services company that specializes in focused financial solutions for businesses, key executives, and high net worth individuals through its operating companies. Our companies specialize in commercial banking, asset-based lending, equipment financing, retirement plans, investment management, and trustee services. We provide specifically tailored solutions to meet our clients’ financial goals.First Business Financial Services (NASDAQ: FBIZ) is a $1.9 billion Wisconsin-based bank holding company. We are a growing company with opportunities that are vital to the operations and success of the company. We see our growth strategy as an opportunity to not only increase our market presence, but also to add top talent to our team of professionals. As an intern with First Business you will gain valuable work experience in a professional environment, leveraging your prior experience, education, and involvement. Our interns play an essential role in the departments they are part of, working on important responsibilities, special projects, and networking with our teams. Internship Purpose: This position will provide an opportunity to work closely with the commercial lending team of a Madison based publicly traded commercial bank, including working with a team of credit analysts, commercial lenders and business development officers, and senior credit managers. Specifically as a Commercial Credit Analyst Intern you will:Input financial statement data into company software and analyze to determine the credit worthiness of existing and prospective commercial clients.Prepare Cash Flow worksheets to demonstrate borrower’s ability to repay loans.Gain exposure to the commercial loan approval process by completing credit presentations and memos (which are used to approve new loans, renew existing loans, or report losses and/or covenant violations) for Loan Approval Committee.Develop a working knowledge of loan policy and gain the ability to communicate its interpretation and rationale to other bank employees.Input data, build tables and build borrower relationships into credit presentations.Work on other projects with department manager.Requirements:Be pursuing a degree in Finance or AccountingStrong technology proficiency (strong skills in Excel a plus)Above average communication skills, both verbal and writtenStrong attention to detail, problem solving skills, and ability to prioritize work to meet numerous levels of deadlinesDemonstrated drive, initiative, and work ethic Important Information – Internship Length, Hours, & Schedule: This internship will run through at least the end of summer 2020 with full time summer hours available, with the potential to be extended if the candidate is still a student. The position will start May 2019. The position works out of our Madison headquarters, so ability to travel to/from during the semester is necessary. We are looking for an individual to 15-20 hours per week during the school year after working full time during the summer. Flexibility of working hours during the semester will be available. Please include a list of all applicable coursework on your resume. First Business Financial Services, Inc. is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all applicants and employees regardless of their race, creed, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, military service, protected veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. We are strongly committed to this policy and believe in the concept and spirit of the law.

Name: Financial Analyst, Staff or Senior
Description: OverviewTDS, #521 on the FORTUNE 1000®, has an excellent opportunity for an energetic and forward-thinking individual. The Financial Analystdirectly interacts with our CEO, enterprise executives, and senior leadership throughout the organization. This highly visible Financial Analyst position plays a crucial role in helping to establish the strategic direction for the TDS family of companies: U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecommunications Corporation, OneNeck IT Solutions, and Suttle Straus. NOTE: We have one Financial Analyst opportunity available and the position can be filled at the Staff or Senior level based on applicable skills.If you are a highly motivated, strategic thinker with outstanding interpersonal skills and are interested in a fast-paced, dynamic and ever-changing industry – come join and add value to our team!  ResponsibilitiesThe Financial Analyst plays a key role supporting the financial analysis and strategic planning processes at TDS. The Financial Analyst prepares analyses and presentations for the strategic planning process, the annual budget, quarterly forecasts and quarterly board of directors meetings, and prepares financial statement projections for the annual rating agency review process. The Financial Analyst also reviews and analyzes business investment proposals and provides financial and strategic impact analyses of acquisitions, divestitures and other special projects.  QualificationsRequired Qualifications:STAFFBachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or related fieldRelevant internship experience -OR- 6+ months financial analysis or accounting experienceSENIORBachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or related field; Master’s degree in Business Administration (MBA) preferred3+ years finance, accounting or strategy experienceOther Qualifications:STAFF and SENIORCPA, CFA, or other relevant professional certification is preferred (or actively working towards one)Strong knowledge and understanding of financial statements, accounting concepts, financial modeling, and application of analytical toolsAdvanced experience using Microsoft ExcelExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills; including the ability to successfully perform independent, in-depth analysis and generate concise conclusionsSuperior verbal and written communication skills; including the ability to communicate effectively within multiple levels within the enterprise, including executive managementAbility to collaborate and work in a team environmentExcellent organizational and interpersonal skills with strong attention to detail and qualitySENIORStrong business acumen and strategic thinkerStrong presentation and facilitation skillsHigh level ability to oversee others effectivelyAbility to build relationships with others that are outside of the reporting lineAbility to meet deadlines and work under aggressive time constraints, prioritizing multiple projectsEmployees at TDS, ranked as one of Madison Magazine’s Best Places to Work, enjoy a robust total rewards package, flexible work culture, wellness programs, community involvement, tuition reimbursement and professional development. We offer outstanding growth potential! To learn more about this position or our company, please visit tds.jobs.EEOUS-WI-Madison

Name: Compliance Solutions Analyst
Description: DescriptionRole Purpose: The Compliance Solutions Analyst is responsible for working with Compliance Department Management to ensure Dean Health Plan's (DHP) compliance with state and federal regulatory requirements (e.g. Wisconsin insurance law, federal health care reform, federal ERISA, HIPAA privacy and security, Medicaid, and Medicare managed care). Duties may include, subject to the direction and concurrence of Compliance Management: communicating to the business compliance requirements, assessing likely risks and recommending compliant solutions that support business goals, and actively working with all areas of the business to implement those solutions; and facilitating resolution of compliance issues identified though all channels (e.g. direct reports, external and discretionary audits, government programs oversight, etc.). Essential Job Duties: 1. Represent the Compliance Department and actively participate on business implementation teams by effectively communicating and ensuring adherence to compliance requirements and recommending compliant solutions that support business goals.  2. Communicate compliance issues to the impacted business areas and assist in the development of value-added services through process improvements and best practice policies, at the direction of Compliance Management, to make recommendations for process improvements to ensure compliance and facilitates working to solutions that support business goals.  3. Document compliance issue resolution through the established program or process.  4. Prepare formal updates on compliance issues for reporting to the DHI/DHP Compliance Committee.  5. Partner with other areas of DHP as appropriate to establish and maintain a high level of compliance.  6. Raise internal awareness of legal/regulatory changes impacting DHPs products.  7. Coordinate defined external audits. This includes: researching audit materials, communicating with external regulators for information requests, preparing audit materials for regulators, communicating with business partners, collaborating with the Compliance Specialist (or designee), to verify documentation, and completing necessary audit papers and providing formal reporting to Compliance Management.  8. Assist in workforce education activities; support compliance education initiatives within the business areas.  9. Support vendor oversight activities within the business areas.  10. Assist the HIPAA Privacy Officer in the execution of duties performed in that capacity, including fostering awareness of the importance of safeguarding Protected Health Information (PHI).  11. Assist the Corporate Compliance Officer in the execution of duties performed in that capacity, including supporting the DHP/DHI Corporate Compliance Committee and all sub-committees.QualificationsRequired: 1. A bachelor's degree in business or related field and 3-5 years relevant work experience.  2. Familiarity with Wisconsins managed care environment, DHPs products, the Affordable Care Act and/or the HIPAA Privacy Rule.  3. Strong analytical and problem solving skills.  4. Able to independently research, understand and apply regulatory requirements in a corporate setting.  5. Able to draft insurance policy/benefit language, corporate policies and procedures and proposed legislation.  6. Detail-oriented, organized, and able to manage multiple priorities to effectively meet production and regulatory deadlines in a fast-paced work environment.  7. Works well both independently and in a high-producing team environment.  8. Works with other departments to foster collaborative relationships with peers that promotes corporate compliance.  9. Able to write clearly for the general workforce, corporate decision makers and regulators.  10. Strong verbal communication skills.  11. Strong PC skills in Windows environment (including Word and Excel).  12. Valid drivers license and personal, reliable vehicle is required for work related travel in order to fulfill position responsibilities. Preferred: 1. Experience working with state and/or federal regulators.  2. At least two years of direct experience working on cross-functional teams in a health insurance setting.  3. At least two years of experience with the legislative or administrative process in the State of Wisconsin. Essential Physical Functions: 1. Job tasks are primarily sedentary in nature.  2. Ability to perform fine motor skills while using the computer or writing. Computer use may occur for extended periods.  3. Ability to hear and converse on the phone and in person.  4. Ability to continuously perform fine motor tasks, such as computer, writing or phone tasks.  5. Ability to perform occasional tasks that involve crouching, twisting, overhead or climbing stairs. Dean Health Plan, Inc.- Established in 1983, Dean Health Plan is the insurance services subsidiary of Dean and SSM Health. It maintains a position of leadership in insurance services through a physician-led integrated health system that improves the health of its members and delivers a superior level of service and care. We're looking for talented individuals committed to improving the health of community through innovation, partnership and integrity.

Name: EDI Analyst
Description: Who We AreWe are a leading not-for-profit health insurer in Wisconsin, and our services have grown to reach active-duty and retired military personnel, seniors, and families in Wisconsin, across the U.S., and around the world. Learn more!WPS receives World's Most Ethical Company Award for 9th Year in a Row- 2018 Most Ethical Companies AnnouncementAt Our CoreWPS Health Solutions has earned a reputation as a leader in the insurance and benefits administration industry through our commitment to excellence and high-quality service. Our corporate values reflect the core of who we are and how we conduct business every day.Customer FocusedI recognize how my actions impact internal and external customers by being responsible for the customer experience. I look beyond the immediate issue to recognize and solve the problem.Individual ResponsibilityI own my actions. I am accountable and dedicated to achieving the best results for WPS Health Solutions and our customers. I embrace my role in helping the company achieve a high-performance workplace.Mutual RespectI lead by example and act ethically, honestly and am trustworthy. I show appreciation for others by giving and taking constructive feedback and encouragement. Driven and PassionateI approach my work with enthusiasm, and personal commitment to the success of our business. I keep the importance of the work we do for our customers alive in my attitude and interactions with others, and demonstrate pride in the worthiness of our purpose.Position SummaryAnalyst EDI will coordinate development and testing of new or existing Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) software and acceptable data formats across lines of business as required by defined business needs. Will coordinate support activities for current EDI trading partners and testers. Will identify and resolve EDI processing discrepancies or problems.In this role you will:Assist with daily maintenance of EDI front-end gateways, Secure EDI applications, as well as EDI front-end processes.Ensure quality monitoring of incoming and outgoing data formats.Create EDI transaction testing scenarios, perform tests, report issues, and approve releases into production environments.Coordinate assistance to submitters in Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) problem areas and resolution. Serve as resource for EDI Help Deskstaff as related to EDI data requirements and formats for all applicable lines of WPS business. Communicate directly with providers and submitters as needed.Oversee use/upgrades of acceptable EDI data formats with EDI operations staff, claims divisions, Information Systems staff, and EDI front-end vendor.Support development/upgrade of EDI software by serving as liaison between claims areas, Information Systems divisions, and EDI front-end vendor.Ensure effective use and upgrades of ANSI X12 transaction files through the EDI front-end software. Coordinate revisions/corrections as needed while serving as primary client contact for ANSI X12 data file questions/problems.Assist with installations/upgrades of all EDI front-end software.Develop and maintain high-level understanding of UNIX environment as it relates to EDI front-end hardware/software.Support setup/installation, training, and administration of EDI software packages, both off-site and at WPS, by serving as resource expert.Serve as primary contact for Multi Carrier System (MCS), Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), and TRICARE DHA concerning system problems/changes as related to accurate functionality for EDI as applicable.Serve as resource expert for administration and support of Secure-EDI file transfers and messages.Assemble teams with various departments to support current EDI transactions and implement new transactions to utilize electronic capabilities within WPS lines of business.Coordinate monthly invoices from trading partners, including billing services and Medicare’s Coordination of Benefits Contractor (COBC).Serve as resource expert for development and execution of system reports for applicable WPS lines of business.Maintain updates to corporate code sets.* This job profile is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties or responsibilities associated with the job. Other job-related duties may be assigned.You should have:U.S. citizenship is required for this position due to U.S. Department of Defense restrictions Associate’s degree in Business, Computer Science, or related field OR equivalent post high school education and/or work-related experienceTwo (2) years working with claims adjudication system and/or EDI business flows, includingTwo (2) years progressive responsibility in health insurance claims, administration, or customer service where employee provided service to provider or billing vendor on complex issuesIn addition, we prefer:Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, or related fieldAdvanced knowledge of computer concepts, experience with EDI, including procedures, goals, objectives, administrative practices and systems, EDI products, and business flowsStay connected: Join ourTalent Community! FOLLOW US!FacebookTwitterLinkedIn
