Name: Senior HRIS Analyst - Workday
Description: The HR Business Application Analyst will support our HR Systems primarily including, but not limited to, Workday (Human Capital Management). A key responsibility of this role is to develop and continuously improve HR system processes to increase user adoption, ensure compliance with policy and regulations, and improve business performance.  This role will work closely with the Human Resources and Payroll teams to continually enhance and support HCM systems and processes. General working knowledge of all HR disciplines (Benefits, Recruiting, Compensation, Learning, Talent, and HR Self-Service) is critical to success in this role.  As part of the HR team, this role will collaborate regularly with team colleagues, HR stakeholders, and other business partners to ensure that business processes are optimized to align with the technology and provide an excellent user experience with the systems supported. Assist with the day-to-day operation of the HR systems (primarily Workday). This includes, but is not limited to business process configuration/improvement, data entry, report creation & reporting, data analysis, user help and communications.Work with key stakeholders (employees, managers, HR business partners, payroll, benefits resources, etc.) to identify and refine business requirements for the HR systems supported (primarily Workday).Assist with implementation and upgrades for Workday including the change management process, training and communication plans.Actively participate in the design and implementation of new Workday functionality as business needs justify the enhancements.Assist with the process to design, deliver and support Workday integrations (with support from IT (internal or external) resources as necessary).Create test scripts, document test scenarios and perform testing activities of HR systems upon upgrade or launch of new features.Execute data conversion and data validation activities, resolve issues and defects reported and monitor health, usage and overall compliance of HR systems.Create reports that support metrics needed for the business and provide analysis as necessary.Work with internal resources to develop user procedures, guidelines, and documentation. Description: *IT Business Analyst - Human Services Industry***Share this** Find similar career opportunities *IT Business Analyst - Human Services Industry***Category:** Business Analysis (functional and technical)*City:** Madison, Wisconsin, United States*Position ID:** J1018-1498*Employment Type:** Full Time*Meet our professionals***CGI: A place to build an IT career***Position Description:** CGI has a need for an experienced Business Analyst to join our team in Madison, WI. Perform system testing using test scripts to ensure requirements are met  ? Execute regression testing scripts  ? Support application help desk responding to end-user calls  ? A business analyst with at least 2 years of SACWIS or other large Child Welfare IT systems experience  ? Demonstrated performance with a track record of success in human services industry  ? Experience in all facets of project lifecycle  ? Experience in system analysis, design and testing  ? Experience supporting an application help desk  ? Ability to prioritize effectively, multitask, and manage time appropriately  ? Strong interpersonal skills and clear communication skills  ? Ability to respond quickly and efficiently while understanding and interpreting automated child welfare application user needs  ? High level technical aptitude and analytical skills as they relate to child welfare functionality and workflow  ? High level interpersonal skills and customer service oriented experience and proficiency \#L1-AC2*Skills:** + Business Analysis *What you can expect from us:***Build your career with us.** It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change?supporting our clients? digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com .  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer. Name: Senior Financial and Business Development Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionP3 Recruiting is in search of a Senior Financial and Business Development Analyst that will be responsible for compiling, analyzing, and interpreting data and other information used in conjunction with decision making for strategy and business development. Essential Job Duties:Financial Analysis Compile, analyze, summarize, and present (written and/or verbal) varied analyses pertaining to strategic planning and ongoing decision support. Develop complex and integrated financial models for forecasting and risk assessment of potential opportunities.Business Analysis Identify, research, develop, and analyze business opportunities.Executive Interaction Effectively coordinate and lead executive level discussions with internal and external customer facing business partners. Participate in the negotiation team for business development opportunities and potential new partners.Market Analysis - Define and analyze key markets for product development/network expansion, develop marketing plans and provide targeted market research results and customer needs analysis.Business Plan Development - Develop and implement project business plans, including creation and updating detailed project plans to identify critical dependencies, identify and help resolve issues and barriers.Intellectual Property Management - Ensure intellectual property is documented and protected, working with the legal affairs within organization.Contracting Work with executives/management, legal affairs, and other areas as needed to outline/draft various agreements related to outside vendor support on projects, agreements between client and its business partners, etc.Public Relations - manage customer and industry relationships and communications to support new market development.Actively oversee teams of internal staff and outside contractors, suppliers, consultants and vendors. Work closely with strategic development, business customers, internal operations (network management, finance, medical affairs, and technology) from a strategic perspective to ensure new business initiatives are successful. Provide coordination/ leadership of new business development/acquisition projects and the effective integration of those initiatives into the business operations.Required:Bachelor's degree in business or other related field plus applicable work experience5+ years of financial or business development analytical experienceExperience researching new markets and analyzing customer and market needs, excellent writing/presentation/communication skills, ability to work with C-suite executives internally and externally, ability to multi-task and prioritize while working with deadlinesAdvanced financial modeling skills, ability to synthesize complex information and loosely defined ideas into financial models for use and discussion by executives at client, its owners, and its potential business partners.Strong Microsoft Excel applications expertise and proficient use of Word and PowerPoint applicationsSkilled at building relationships and advising senior level management and key stakeholdersExperience in project management tools and deliverables, strategic planning, development of business and marketing plans and managing external consultants, agencies, contractors and vendorsPreferred:MBA or other business/analytical master's degreeProject Management Professional certificationAnalytical experience in a health insurance or health care organizationMinimum of 2 years of leadership experience in developing new business opportunities and leading new business acquisition projects and teams

Name: Senior Finance Planning Analyst
Description: Company ProfilesWeir has been in business since 1871 and our sustainability and success has been built on attracting, retaining, and developing exceptional people.  As a global company, employing around 15,000 people in over 70 countries, we reflect the diversity of our customers in the diversity of our people and ensure everyone is given the opportunity to flourish regardless of their gender, race, beliefs or background.  Weir is an inclusive and innovative organisation where you can be your authentic self. We continually develop our talent and diversity of thought to keep our business relevant, innovative and successful for the future.  Enabling our people to unleash their full potential is central to ‘We are Weir’, our vision, mission, and strategic priorities. We aim to be the most admired engineering business in our markets and we'll achieve that ambition by being the employer of choice in our markets.  We offer a wide range of career opportunities across a variety of technical and business roles in engineering, manufacturing and service locations worldwide.Business Need / Purpose of RoleUnder the direction of the Finance Controller, the Senior Finance Planning Analyst is responsible for the preparation of key financial reports, analysis of key financial data, and developing/implementing corrective actions to improve efficiency and profitability within the company.Objectives & Measurement - Key ResponsibilitiesLead the preparation and evaluation of the annual budgets; quarterly forecast reports, monthly and mid-monthly reports in accordance with reporting timetables. This includes appropriate delegation of tasks to Finance team to gather budget and forecasting information from departments.Perform in depth analysis of variances between actual and budget / current forecast comparisons, including regular engagement with key business partners to determine root causes.Lead the three-month-rolling-forecast (3mRF) monthly input and output meetings, developing a strong knowledge of the US Minerals product lineProduce the daily input/ output/ backlog report, making improvements where necessary, including potential transition to Power BISummarize monthly results, through presentation to senior management, with support from finance team to investigate variances from forecast/ budget.Direct the IT Department to create system reports (Cognos and Mapics) needed to achieve desired analyses.Work with Cost Accounting team in the analysis of manufacturing variances and with the relevant business areas to address recurring issues.Monitor and forecast of working capital. Close liaison with key business partners (including operations, procurement, accounts receivable and accounts payable) to develop actions to manage working capital effectively and meet targets. Monitor the implementation of actions and recommend corrective actions where necessary.Support key business partners in financial analysis / modeling of the potential impact of changes e.g. product price changes, changes in commodity prices etc.Complete general accounting responsibilities as assigned, such as balance sheet reconciliations.Preparation of responses to ad hoc financial analysis requests on a timely basis.Complete special projects as assigned.Follow and comply with all safety and work rules and regulations. Maintain departmental housekeeping standards.Responsible for Environmental Health and Safety management and policy commitments as prescribed for this role in Weir's Duty of CareNothing in this position description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. Job Knowledge / Education and QualificationsJob Knowledge / Education and Qualifications The details described here are representative of those that are encountered by or must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCEBachelor’s degree from four-year college or university in finance/accounting. Seven plus years of progressive financial accounting experience in a public company, preferably in a manufacturing environment.LANGUAGE SKILLSAbility to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community. Ability to write speeches and articles for publication that conform to prescribed style and format. Ability to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors. MATHEMATICAL SKILLS Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations. REASONING ABILITY Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS CPA or CMA preferred. Requires a valid driver’s license  Strong analytical skills. Excellent computer skills with ERP business systems and Excel spreadsheets. Excellent organization, oral and written communication, motivation, human relations, records keeping, trouble shooting, problem-solving and follow-through skills. Effective presentation skills. Ability to promote and maintain positive relationships. Good work ethic - proactive. Confidence in own abilities and capable of acting decisively. Ability to project and maintain professionalism with a diversity of people inside and outside the Company. Willingness to accept responsibility and accountability. Willingness and ability to travel as necessary. Ability to work under pressure and in stressful situations and maintain attention to detail. Must have a passion for the business and the “will” to succeed. MACHINES, TOOLS, EQUIPMENT, AND WORK AIDS Requires the ability to operate a variety of standard business machines, such as computer and job related software (Microsoft Office & Lotus Notes), calculator, telephone, fax photocopier, etc. Mid-range ERP system knowledge (MAPICS on IBM AS/400) preferred.PHYSICAL DEMANDSWhile performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, use hands to finger, handle or feel, talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close, distance, color, and ability to adjust focus.WORK ENVIRONMENTThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. General office environment. Moderate noise.Core CompetenciesAnalytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; collects and researches data; uses intuition and experience to complement data; designs work flows and procedures.  Interpersonal Skills - Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; maintains confidentiality; listens to others without interrupting; keeps emotions under control; remains open to others' ideas and tries new things. Delegation - Delegates work assignments; matches the responsibility to the person; gives authority to work independently; sets expectations and monitors delegated activities; provides recognition for results. Business Acumen - Understands business implications of decisions; displays orientation to profitability; demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; aligns work with strategic goals; knows the competition; is aware of how strategies and tactics work in the marketplace. Strategic Thinking - Develops strategies to achieve organizational goals; understands organization's strengths & weaknesses; analyzes market and competition; identifies external threats and opportunities; adapts strategy to changing conditions. Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively; edits work for spelling and grammar; varies writing style to meet needs; presents numerical data effectively; able to read and interpret written information. Motivation - Sets and achieves challenging goals; demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles; measures self against standard of excellence; takes calculated risks to accomplish goals. Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities; uses time efficiently; plans for additional resources; sets goals and objectives; organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; develops realistic action plans. Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; looks for ways to improve and promote quality; applies feedback to improve performance; monitors own work to ensure quality. Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; reacts well under pressure; treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; accepts responsibility for own actions; follows through on commitments.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: TDS, a FORTUNE 1000® national communications company, has an excellent opportunity for an energetic and forward-thinking individual. This highly visible position directly interacts with our CEO, enterprise executives, and senior leadership and plays a crucial role in helping to establish the strategic direction for the TDS family of companies: U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecommunications Corporation, OneNeck IT Solutions, and Suttle Straus.  This position is in our Middleton, WI Corporate office with a start date in May or June, 2019. If you are a highly motivated, strategic thinker with outstanding interpersonal skills and are interested in a fast- paced, dynamic and ever-changing industry; then come join and add value to our team!  The Financial Analyst plays a key role supporting the financial analysis and strategic planning processes at TDS. The Financial Analyst prepares analyses and presentations for the strategic planning process, the annual budget, quarterly forecasts and quarterly board of directors meetings, and prepares financial statement projections for the annual rating agency review process. The Financial Analyst also reviews and analyzes business investment proposals and provides financial and strategic impact analyses of acquisitions, divestitures and other special projects. Required Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or related fieldRelevant internship experience -OR- 6+ months financial analysis or accounting experienceOther Qualifications:CPA, CFA, or other relevant professional certification is preferred (or willingness to actively work towards one)Strong knowledge and understanding of financial statements, accounting concepts, financial modeling, and application of analytical toolsAdvanced experience using Microsoft ExcelExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills; including the ability to successfully perform independent, in-depth analysis and generate concise conclusionsSuperior verbal and written communication skills; including the ability to communicate effectively with multiple levels within the enterprise, including executive managementAbility to collaborate and work in a team environment effectivelyExcellent organizational and interpersonal skills with a strong attention to detail and quality Employees at TDS, ranked as one of Madison Magazine’s Best Places to Work, enjoy a robust total rewards package, flexible work culture, wellness programs, community involvement, tuition reimbursement and professional development. We offer challenging work and outstanding growth potential! To learn more about this position or our company, please visit tds.jobs. EEO

Name: Intacct Implementation Consultant
Description: Overview  Technology has changed the way businesses function -- both internally across the enterprise and externally with vendors and customers. The ability to adopt new technologies is vital to an organization's growth and ability to compete. Baker Tilly's Technology Solutions team helps clients utilize Intacct, the only cloud accounting software company to be appointed a preferred provider by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA), to improve business efficiency and drive business forward.  We are currently seeking an Intacct Implementation Consultant to join our Baker Tilly Technology Solutions team in Austin, Chicago, DC, or Madison! In this fast-paced and challenging role, you will utilize your well-polished interpersonal skills and technical abilities as you work alongside clients to plan and execute Intacct implementations.  It's an exciting time to join Baker Tilly!  Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a nationally recognized, full-service accounting and advisory firm whose specialized professionals connect with clients and their businesses through refreshing candor and clear industry insight. With approximately 2,700 employees across the United States, Baker Tilly is ranked as one of the 15 largest accounting and advisory firms in the country. Headquartered in Chicago, Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 147 territories, with over 33,000 professionals. The combined worldwide revenue of independent member firms is $3.4 billion. Name: Data Warehouse Analyst II
Description: Description:This recruitment is for a Business Objects Report Writer Advanced position in the Department of Children and Families (DCF), Division of Safety and Permanence (DSP), Child Welfare Data and Analytics Section. This contract position will provide advanced Business Objects report development expertise with the primary customer being DSP program, policy, and research staff.  An advanced skill set in Business Objects report development is required. This individual will follow standards to implement reports and documentation. The selected contractor is required to show proof of experience in working independently to gather requirements, design, build and test effective Business Objects reports. Preference will be given to qualified candidates with Tableau, Xcelsius and/or SAP Dashboards 4.x experience.  Strong communication skills are required. The individual in this position will:Be responsible for development and support of Child Welfare reporting using Business Objects.Work with DSP program, policy and research staff to understand reporting and data analysis needs. Work closely with customers in the gathering of requirements for reports and dashboards. Have extensive experience working with WebI Business Objects tool.Have expert level knowledge of Business Objects report, folder and security configurations.Work interactively with both technical and non-technical staff to build Business Objects reports that adhere to underlying data model and effectively deliver data to end users.Have extensive experience working within a Business Intelligence environment and knowledge of data warehouse terms and constructs (e.g. facts, dimensions, SCD types, star schema, etc.).Stay abreast of releases / patches for Business Objects. Act as Business Objects subject matter expert for fellow technologists as well as end users. Mentor others in the section on the use of Business Objects.Typically have 5+ years of experience with enterprise level database management systems, business intelligence tools and systems.Other Notes to Vendors: 1) An in person interview will be required before a final hire is made.  2) Please bring three (3) business references to an interview.  3) Selected candidate required to sign Exhibit B.  4) A background check is required before final hire.  5) Disclose subcontractor employer if applicable.

Name: Senior Business Analyst, Decision Analytics Services (Insurance Analytics)
Description: Senior Business Analyst, Decision Analytics ServicesEXL (NASDAQ:EXLS) is a leading operations management and analytics company that helps businesses enhance growth and profitability in the face of relentless competition and continuous disruption. Using our proprietary, award-winning Business EXLerator Framework™, which integrates analytics, automation, benchmarking, BPO, consulting, industry best practices and technology platforms, we look deeper to help companies improve global operations, enhance data-driven insights, increase customer satisfaction, and manage risk and compliance. EXL serves the insurance, healthcare, banking and financial services, utilities, travel, transportation and logistics industries. Headquartered in New York, New York, EXL has more than 24,000 professionals in locations throughout the United States, Europe, Asia (primarily India and Philippines), Latin America, Australia and South Africa.EXL Analytics provides data-driven, action-oriented solutions to business problems through statistical data mining, cutting edge analytics techniques and a consultative approach. Leveraging proprietary methodology and best-of-breed technology, EXL Analytics takes an industry-specific approach to transform our clients’ decision making and embed analytics more deeply into their business processes. Our global footprint of nearly 2,000 data scientists and analysts assist client organizations with complex risk minimization methods, advanced marketing, pricing and CRM strategies, internal cost analysis, and cost and resource optimization within the organization. EXL Analytics serves the insurance, healthcare, banking, capital markets, utilities, retail and e-commerce, travel, transportation and logistics industries.Please visit www.exlservice.com for more information about EXL Analytics.Role Overview: Requires theoretical knowledge as well as real-world experienceMay lead small projects with manageable risks and resource requirementsSolves problems; takes a new perspective using existing solutions and approaches changes with flexibilityWorks independently in well-defined situationsActs as a resource for colleagues with less experience Responsibilities Statistics / Mathematics / Computer Science – Quantify evidence, understand variation, and building computational toolsSolve complex problems that may require obtaining additional knowledgeWrite scripts that accomplish defined well-defined tasksUse basic version control functionalityUtilize tools and procedures for basic inferential tasksInterpret output from statistical tools (e.g., extract p-values, etc.Data Analysis – Apply the right transformations to the right data in an acceptable amount of timePerform exploratory analysis within a database environmentBuild datasets using basic SQLMachine LearningUtilize predictive tools to accomplish work objectivesCommunicationTake a new perspective on existing solutions; seek out and use ideas, opinions and insights from various sources and individualsInteract across teams and disciplines/departments to achieve project and discipline/department goalsWork to build consensus and influence across teamsThe above list of duties is not intended to be all inclusive and other duties will be assigned from time to time. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Math, Statistics, Economics or related field. Advanced degree strongly preferred.3+ years directly related analytical experienceStatistics / Mathematics / Quantitative Methods – Quantifying evidence, understanding variation, and separating signal from noiseAbility to write scripts that accomplish specific tasksAbility to use basic version control functionalityKnowledge of tools and procedures for basic inferential tasksAbility to interpret output, extract p-values, etc.Data Skills – Applying the right transformations to the right data in an acceptable amount of timeBasic SQL proficiencyAbility to interpret data models in conjunction with exploratory analysis of a database.Ability to get data into and out of toolsKnows multiple systems and their relevant differencesMachine LearningComfortable using predictive tools and understanding of common best practicesCommunicationAbility to explain difficult or sensitive information and build consensus and influenceWhat we offer:EXL Analytics offers an exciting, fast paced and innovative environment, which brings together a group of sharp and entrepreneurial professionals who are eager to influence business decisions. From your very first day, you get an opportunity to work closely with highly experienced, world class analytics consultantsYou can expect to learn many aspects of businesses that our clients engage in. You will also learn effective teamwork and time-management skills - key aspects for personal and professional growth Analytics requires different skill sets at different levels within the organization. At EXL Analytics, we invest heavily in training you in all aspects of analytics as well as in leading analytical tools and techniques.We provide guidance/ coaching to every employee through our mentoring program wherein every junior level employee is assigned a senior level professional as advisors.Sky is the limit for our team members. Name: Agile Business Analyst/Consultant - 3
Description: The candidate will work on a multi-year, multi-phase modernization project of a legacy collection system.  This business analyst (BA) will work closely with the project manager and is responsible for facilitating communication with the project manager, product owner, stakeholders, change agents, and the development team. The candidate will gather business requirements from multiple stakeholders. The candidate is responsible for transitioning the BRITS project from application development into a production implementation. Experience working on 'agile' projects is required.  The BA will understand business objectives and problems, and identify alternative solutions. The candidate will manage the balance between business requirements and user expectations, while being a liaison between users and technologists to drive requirements to design. The BA will schedule and present at user group and other meetings.  Responsibilities include project work, building strong trusting relationships, identifying conflicting stakeholder requirements and constraints, and identifying areas for improvement, testing and special projects as required. Essential Job Duties: § Experience working on an Agile development team  § Strong facilitation skills of small to large groups including knowing when and how to regain group focus and use of the 'parking lot'  § Ability to adjust presentation and facilitation approach suitable for executives and workers alike  § Ability to "tell the story" using verbal and visual approaches  § Holistic knowledge of the overall requirements process, business and technical  § Prior use of requirements tools and experience/demonstrated knowledge of how they may interact with applications used for management of bugs, issues, testing (manual and automated), design and development  § Ability to quickly understand business drivers, model existing processes and facilitate and guide business constituents to developing future state requirements, rather than solutions  § Adaptability and flexibility when working with multiple clients with varying degrees of knowledge and ability/availability to participate. In other words, ability to be creative in helping clients provide the requirements and detail needed  § Experience with transitioning from legacy to modernized systems  § Experience with change management in a large scale, multiple constituent organization to understand and anticipate change management, training, support, and overall operational handoffs needed Other Notes to Vendors: 1) Resumes must be 3 pages or less.  2) An in person interview will be required before a final hire is made.  3) Please bring three (3) business references to an interview.  4) A background check is required before final hire. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: About the Company Cardiac Science is located in Deerfield, WI and designs, manufactures, and markets Powerheart® automated external defibrillators (AEDs) and related services that facilitate successful deployments. Our guiding principle is to develop automated external defibrillators that are at the heart of saving lives™ – a commitment we take very seriously. Are you ready for the opportunity to say that you save lives every day? Job Role Essential Responsibilities:  Prepares and files financial statements to regulators and financial executives. Performs financial analyses and generates reports and recommendations for management review. Creates reports for Senior Management and other stakeholders  Advises senior management on changes to financial reporting requirements  Studies trends and reports on depreciation, working capital, investments, rates of return, and financial and expense comparisons based on profit and loss statements and income statements  Assists senior level staff with various financial functions such as budgeting, auditing, forecasting and analysis  Perform ongoing analysis of budget variances and expense trends and Ensure management understanding of rate and budget issues  Reviews, classifies, examines and analyzes data and records of financial transactions  Collects and reviews financial data from various sources  Maintains and updates financial databases and spreadsheets, and generates financial reports as required  Creates financial databases and spreadsheets, and generates various financial reports as required  Maintains appropriate records and documentation  Provides assistance to management and customers, interpreting financial reports and identifying and resolving problem areas  Ensures compliance with internal policies and procedures, as well as, government regulations  May interface with auditors and provide audit support to ensure understanding of financial data, methodology and applicability under appropriate regulations  Assists in performing internal audits  May participate in team efforts to improve functioning of the department  Comply with company policies and procedures regarding employee health, safety, and conduct Qualifications Required Qualifications:  3+ years of Financial Analysis experience  Bachelors Degree in Finance (or equivalent combination of education/training and experience)  Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze and solve problems and clearly link financial results to operational performance drivers, generate alternatives and drive positive change  Solid verbal and written communication skills  Excellent attention to detail  Experience with Microsoft Office, especially Excel Benefits/Culture We recognize the importance of taking care of the people who are dedicated to saving lives each and every day they come into work. Our philosophy is based on the belief that every employee is valuable and the development of our people is a key component to the success of Cardiac Science. We work to cultivate leadership, recognize achievement, and provide a rewarding work environment for all of our employees. We are a progressive and evolving organization that is focused on attracting and retaining best-in-class talent. Some of the benefits we offer in our total rewards program are: Medical, Rx, Vision, and Dental InsuranceHealth Saving Accounts with Company paired money up to $1250 on annualized basis.Life and Disability Insurance12 Paid National HolidaysAdditional PTO for vacation timeCompany sponsored events such as a holiday party and summer picnicEqual Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.

Name: Senior Consultant
Description: DescriptionThe CAST (Consulting and Accounting Solutions Team) at CLA (CliftonLarsonAllen) is continuing to grow and looking to add to our current consultant team. CLA is not your typical professional services firm- we have dynamic career opportunities in out audit, tax and wealth advisory practices but we also offer customized accounting support for our clients on an interim and project basis. Our CAST team is made up of highly skilled accounting and finance professionals. If you are seeking flexibility, variety, have an entrepreneur spirit and want to continue to add value with your skills and knowledge, we would love to talk to you.Our CAST consultants are provided a lot of flexibility in their schedules while maintaining a high level of service and ability to the project. Our clients, both public and private businesses, say they appreciate how we roll up our sleeves and work alongside them, using our years of experience for their benefit. Common roles we fill are Controller, Accounting Manager, Internal Auditor, or Financial Reporting Manager to name a few.We offer opportunities for traditionally qualified accounting professionals to utilize their talents in non-traditional ways in a role we call our Senior Consultant… Our Senior Consultants typically have a minimum of 7 years of accounting, audit, technology or financial leadership experience and really enjoy servicing clients’ needs with a hands on approach. With the freedom to pick and choose your engagements, you allow yourself the ability to enjoy your career AND your life.At CLA CAST, you can build the career YOU want.We are looking for Consultants to work for $40-45/hr.JOB REQUIREMENTSMINIMUM REQUIREMENTS FOR A SENIOR CONSULTANT:• Experience: Minimum of 7 years of work experience, including Big 4 or other similar public accounting experience. Industry experience as accounting manager, financial analyst, internal auditor, etc. Governmental accounting experience is a plus in our Madison Market!• Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or related field• Certifications/Licenses: CPA preferred​AN IDEAL SENIOR CONSULTANT ALSO POSSESSES:• Experience fixing things! Designing/improving accounting processes such as: monthly close, management and financial reporting, budgeting, forecasting, consolidations, shared services or application outsourcing and system implementations• Exceptional interpersonal skills. We want someone with the capability to gain the confidence and respect of senior executives and team members without needing to be hand-held or requiring supervision.• A strong client services orientation including the ability to take an active and hands on approach in executing engagements to exceed client expectations… Our Consultants hit the ground running, provide value, and take pride in their work!• Ability to travel is a big plus – The more open you are to travel, the more opportunities we can present to you!

Name: CYBERSECURITY RISK ANALYST
Description: Position Vacancy ID:96671-ASEmployment Class:Academic Staff-RenewableWorking Title:Cybersecurity Risk AnalystOfficial Title:IS SPECIALIST(S45DN)Hiring Department(s):A060370-INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY/SEC/CYBERSECURITYFTE:100%Anticipated Begin Date:JANUARY 02, 2019Term:This is a renewable appointment.Advertised Salary:Minimum $73,000 ANNUAL (12 months)  Depending on QualificationsDegree and area of specialization:Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology Security or related discipline and two years' experience; OR five or more years of applicable professional services and/or information security experience and expertise.Minimum number of years and type of relevant work experience:Required Qualifications: Minimum of three years' experience conducting risk assessments against recognized standards (NIST, COBIT or ISO).Must hold, or be able to obtain within six months, a management oriented security certification (e.g., CISSP, CISM or GSEC). Demonstrated knowledge or professional certification in Information Security or IT Audit is a strong addition.Detailed understanding of network design, security protocols and systems administration with excellent analytical and problem solving skills.Experience using standard industry applications to create or update current documents to meet compliance reporting requirements.Must display working knowledge of NIST, HIPAA, or PCI Data Security, standards along with virtual environment and cloud computing services.Experience executing project management skills including design review, threat modeling and risk profiling while working across a large, distributed organization that is representative of a diverse IT and business communities.Expertise using vulnerability management tools to analyze discovered vulnerabilities against current configurations to determine the organizational risk.Preferred Qualifications:Experience working independently to conduct technical investigations with diverse constituents, providing detailed written reports and presentations.Highly advanced skills in PC/Macintosh/Unix workstation, Internet software skills, groupware, office productivity software, project management software, and architecture tools (e.g. Visio, etc.).Experience conducting assessments in a healthcare or research organization.Experience in assessing vendors as part of procurement and implementation stages.Demonstrated experience applying standards and practices for risk management and compliance; and familiarity with and validation skills using Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) principles.License or Certificate:Position Summary:This position provides risk analysis and compliance program support for the Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) domain of the UW-Madison Office of Cybersecurity. Responsibilities include evaluating security risks and compliance strategies; offering direction, guidance and consultation; and making recommendations for the improvement in information security of IT systems primarily for University of Wisconsin-Madison and for the University of Wisconsin System upon request. The incumbent coordinates implementing university-wide, proactive and distributed information security management programs to ensure the continuous availability, confidentiality, and integrity of information assets owned and used by the university community, consistent with university management's informed risk tolerance.  A successful individual will have exceptional information security expertise as well as project management, business analysis, solution implementation skills and the ability to work under broad policy guidance. This individual must exercise sound judgment in working collaboratively and communicate effectively within a challenging environment in a visible role.  This position reports to the Office of Cybersecurity and serves as the campus technical expert and authority on information security risk analysis and compliance matters. As a trusted advisor and partner with campus researchers, Primary Investigators, program managers and system owners, the incumbent works with the entire university community in a consultative manner. The incumbent should understand organizational missions, values and goals, analyze information risks which threaten those objectives, recommend and guide large cross-functional and campus-wide teams towards appropriate security control solutions, and assist in implementing and auditing those solutions to materially reduce operational and compliance based exposures.Additional Information:Additional Preferred Qualifications: Experience with typical application components such as web servers, application servers, database software (Oracle and SQL), middleware and underlying infrastructure devices (WAN and LAN devices, operating systems for server platforms, workstations, and a broad range of applications, host and network security devices.Solid understating of manual, automated application penetration skills, vulnerability scanning and analysis as well as skill in careful, limited live testing in live production environments. Please note that successful applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without need of employer sponsorship, on or before the effective date of appointment.Contact:Bradley Molzahn  bradley.molzahn@wisc.edu 608-262-0596 Relay Access (WTRS): 7-1-1 (out-of-state: TTY: 800.947.3529, STS: 800.833.7637) and above Phone number (See RELAY_SERVICE for further information. )Instructions to Applicants:Please click on the "Apply Online" button to start the application process. To apply for this position you will need to upload a cover letter and resume. Your cover letter should specifically address the required qualifications listed above.Additional Link: Full Position Details NOTE: A Period of Evaluation will be Required The University of Wisconsin is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.  The Annual Security and Fire Safety Report contains current campus safety and disciplinary policies, crime statistics for the previous 3 calendar years, and on-campus student housing fire safety policies and fire statistics for the previous 3 calendar years. UW-Madison will provide a paper copy upon request; please contact the University of Wisconsin Police Department.

Name: SQL Developer Analyst
Description: TDS is looking to add a detail-oriented SQL Developer Analyst to work with our Contact Center Reporting team in Madison, WI!  The SQL Developer Analyst supports the Contact Center by providing maintenance and development of the reporting processes and applications utilized by TDS Telecom's Customer Contact Operations (CCO). The SQL Developer Analyst works with management and end user community to develop a clear understanding of user information needs, prioritizes the user requests according to business impacts, and translates the user requirements into the appropriate report programs.  TDS Telecommunications LLC (TDS Telecom/TDS®) delivers high-speed internet, TV entertainment, and phone services to nearly 900 rural, suburban, and metropolitan communities across the U.S. With more than 1.2 million connections, TDS is one of the fastest growing technology companies in the United States. Powered by fiber-optics and new industry-leading technologies, TDS delivers up to 1 Gigabit internet speeds and offers internet-protocol based TV entertainment solutions along with traditional phone services. TDS also offers businesses VoIP advanced communications solutions, dedicated internet service, data networking, and hosted-managed services. Visit tdstelecom.com.  TDS Telecom, headquartered in Madison, Wis., employs nearly 2,700 people and is a subsidiary of Telephone and Data Systems, Inc. [NYSE: TDS], a Fortune 1000® company. Founded in 1969, TDS Inc. employs 9,600 people and has approximately six million connections nationwide through its businesses U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions LLC, and TDS Broadband Service. In 2018, TDS Inc. was named to several Forbes lists, including America's Best Employers for Diversity, Best Large Employers, and Best Employers for Women. Visit tdsinc.com. Benefits: As a part of your total compensation, #TDS provides a comprehensive, competitive benefit package. The benefit plans address both the immediate and long term needs that you and your family may have. For an overview of what we have to offer for full-time employees including vacation, health benefits and retirement options please click here. Maintains and expands upon current contact center reporting systems/applications. Develops new reporting applications with focus on providing actionable data.Troubleshoots issues with existing contact center reporting systems/applications, provides root cause analysis, and recommends and implements enhancements to reduce frequency of ongoing errors.Ensures reporting accuracy through full scope QA testing.  Communicates and follows up with customers to develop requirements and ensure information requests meet or exceed business needs. Works proactively to uncover and identify management reporting needs with each request.Effectively leads the translation of business requirements into specific management reporting and information deliverables to meet customer expectations.Maintains a basic level understanding of the internal TDS databases relationships.Demonstrates system knowledge appropriate for the business unitsRequired Qualifications:Associate’s degree or higher OR 2+ years professional work experience.2+ year experience in the area of Relational Database Reporting Languages such as: SQL, PSQL, or TSQL OR experience programming with either Visual Basic for Applications (VBA), c#, asp.net or any object-oriented programming languages.

Name: Asset Analyst
Description: Overview  Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a nationally recognized, full-service accounting and advisory firm whose specialized professionals connect with clients and their businesses through refreshing candor and clear industry insight. With approximately 2,700 employees across the United States, Baker Tilly is ranked as one of the 15 largest accounting and advisory firms in the country. Headquartered in Chicago, Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 147 territories, with over 33,000 professionals. The combined worldwide revenue of independent member firms is $3.4 billion.  It's an exciting time to join Baker Tilly! We are looking for an Asset Analyst to join the Baker Tilly's Transaction Advisory Services team in Madison, WI.  The Transaction Advisory Services team at Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP is comprised of dedicated, client-focused professionals. Whether it's a sale, buyout, carve-out or refinancing, our highly specialized team supports every critical business decision before, during and after a transaction. Our employees thrive in a challenging, supportive environment, taking on a high level of responsibilities as a Valued Business Advisors to our clients. Performance is rewarded and there are many professional opportunities to grow within the team.  Baker Tilly Annual Report 2017 ResponsibilitiesConduct pre and post-closing financial analysis on assigned New Market Tax Credit investments (NMTC) projects. This will include working with borrowers to discuss ongoing reporting compliance, addressing borrower financial strength, understanding and documenting community impacts. Once project data is reviewed, assist with designating appropriate risk ratings and prepare periodic internal reports for management and clients.Work with disbursement agents and lending partners to monitor construction by reviewing and approving construction draws of real estate projects.Manage all aspects of compliance reporting for client portfolios by organizing, collecting, verifying, and ensuring accuracy of compliance data on an annual basis, and by analyzing additional annual community impact reporting and borrower certifications.Continually assess project and partnership risk factors as they pertain to compliance with Section 45 (NMTC) provisions, allocation agreement requirements, and operating agreement conditions. Monitor loan defaults and ensure there are no mechanic liens or other non-permitted encumbrances on the project.Establish strong, productive working relationships with investors, lenders, project developers, and other financial partners. Provide exemplary client service and cultivate relationships conducive to information sharing and problem solving.Assist with the preparation, modification, and distribution of annual community impact questionnaires. Maintain database information integrity as it relates to compliance data, financial reporting, construction updates, and project information.QualificationsBachelor's degree in real estate finance, economics, business, accounting or a related field, required.Two years of experience in asset/portfolio management or real estate finance, preferred.Strong aptitude with information technology with proficient skills in word-processing, spreadsheet and presentation software, and the ability to adapt to new technology is required.Strong financial analysis skills with the ability to recognize financial issues through review of borrower financial statements.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with supervisors, co-workers, and outside business professionals.Self-starter who exhibits the drive and resourcefulness to work independently and with team members toward common company goals.Ability to show confidence in functional skills and apply those skills in a multi-task cross-functional team setting.Ability to work in an evolving, team oriented environment, and accept new challenges as assigned.Demonstrated exceptional verbal and written communication skills.Ability to provide exceptional client service and demonstrate commitment to continuous learning.Eligibility to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.SDL2017

Name: Process Analyst - Madison, WI.
Description: Accountable to support the provision of standardized, documented processes and process solutions for the assigned Product Operations (PO) business unit that are cost-effective and timely, and that comply with Bank policies and procedures (PandPs) and regulatory requirements. Analyze processes, business issues, procedures, products and processes to create new and/or revise processes that adhere to financial and regulatory controls. This role focuses on up to a six-month time horizon KEY AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITYProduct and ProcessACCOUNTABILITIESProduct and ProcessConduct analysis of processes and process design, establish required internal controls, PandPs, position processes for automation, and identify risk impacts for new processes and process workflows related to low to medium complexity initiatives.Conduct analysis for change or business initiatives, using specialized process knowledge.Document process requirements or provide input to conversion and implementation strategy plan from a process perspective, as assigned. Identify opportunities for process improvement and initiate changes, as assigned.Revise standardized processes, design work flow, obtain sign-offs for assigned initiatives. Identify business process gaps, efficiency and control issues in timely fashion. We’re here to help  At BMO Harris Bank we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the center of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.  As a member of the BMO Harris Bank team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.  To find out more visit us at https://bmoharriscareers.com.  BMO Harris Bank is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. BMO Harris Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer for all, inclusive of Minorities, Women, Veterans, and Persons with Disabilities.

Name: Supply Chain Analyst
Description: F o u n d e d in 1978, RenewAire is a privately held, green company that has experienced double digit growth over the past ten years. Recognized as a leader in Quick Response Manufacturing, we design and manufacture configurable Energy Recovery Ventilators for residential and commercial applications. Our products improve indoor air quality by supplying fresh air, while at the same time conserving energy. Operating out of our headquarters in Waunakee, WI, just a hop and a skip from Madison, our unique company culture encourages employee innovation and continuous improvement, and positions us as a fast-paced, forward thinking organization.  The Supply Chain Analyst powers a broad array of critical supply chain and related activity. As Supply Chain Analyst, you will lead and work closely with other team members to ensure accurate, coordinated, and efficient materials and information flow, including inbound, storage, production, outbound, and related systems and processes. You will simultaneously own many day-to-day duties and champion overall process improvements strategies by utilizing Quick Response Manufacturing and Continuous Improvement methodologies. Ideal candidate enjoys converting complexity into straightforward and sustainable process, turning ambiguity into action, appreciates a challenge and delights in the details. Essential Duties & Responsibilities:Inventory/Materials management and AnalyticsAnalyze and lead resolution of material variances by processing part problem forms, consulting and coordinating with involved parties and providing root cause corrective action to materials systems and processesAssist with the planning and control of materials related to Engineering Change projects and New Product Introduction projects including BOM error resolution and follow upAssess, develop, and participate in inventory management areas including physical inventories, inventory audits, cycle count programs, ensuring inventory level standards are met, and assessing improvement opportunities to increase inventory accuracyComplete ERP maintenance including item master accuracy (group codes, product codes, locations, descriptions, etc.) and analyze the practical application of supply chain technology and interfacesProcess job closing activitiesAct as backup to purchasing and schedulingContinuous ImprovementProvide continuous improvement strategies to ensure positive progress in all aspects of material flow and inventory control throughout Operations.Determine process gaps in change/project management. Actively engage supply chain and connected departments to effectively develop solutions and influence others through both oral presentations and written documentation.Complete computer-related analytical tasks and projects to determine root cause and problem-solving improvement strategies for material flow issues and processes.Participate in maintaining and proactively improving space utilization and manufacturing flow in all locations for all department uses (residential, commercial, shipping/receiving, and miscellaneous).Build strong and positive working relationships across the organization. Serve as a team leader, team member and/or sponsor for cross-functional teams, as needed.Suggest, assess, and participate in RenewAire Quick Fix project improvement activities.Other duties as assignedEducation/Experience:3+ years related work experienceBS Degree in Supply Chain, Purchasing, Business, Material/Operations/Inventory Management, Logistics, or related field required. Masters preferred.Experience with data analysis tools and enablers such as SQL, MS Access, MS Excel, etc. Must be able to learn various software solutions to obtain data, support analysis, and implement improvementsExtensive knowledge of ERP systems and experience in computerized scheduling, production, inventory control, & purchasing activities.Prefer QRM, Lean, Six Sigma and project management skillsCompetenciesAnalytical skills with ability to capture and review data to determine and resolve inventory discrepanciesSelf-directed, yet a strong team player. Interpersonal skills necessary to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, and interdepartmental employeesHighly organized and detail-oriented with a strong sense of urgency, and the ability to organize and prioritizeExcellent written and verbal communication skillsPhysical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of the job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee frequently is required to stoop, kneel; and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms.  The employee must frequently lift and or move up to 30 lbs. and up to 50 lbs. occasionally. Specific vision required by this job includes close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  The employee is occasionally exposed to risk of electrical shock, fumes, or airborne particles.  The above statements reflect the general details necessary to describe the principle functions of the occupation described and shall not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be inherent in the occupation.  In addition to our competitive, accelerated wage progression schedule, we offer a generous and employee friendly benefits package including Unity Medical, RenewAire funded HRA, Delta Dental and Vision, Mutual of Omaha STD/LTD/Life, paid holidays and vacation, 401(k) plans with up to 6% Company match and immediate vesting, and flexible spending accounts. We also offer a cutting edge and ecologically friendly environment.  RenewAire is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Data Warehouse Analyst II
Description: Description:This recruitment is for a Business Objects Report Writer Advanced position in the Department of Children and Families (DCF), Division of Safety and Permanence (DSP), Child Welfare Data and Analytics Section. This contract position will provide advanced Business Objects report development expertise with the primary customer being DSP program, policy, and research staff.  An advanced skill set in Business Objects report development is required. This individual will follow standards to implement reports and documentation. The selected contractor is required to show proof of experience in working independently to gather requirements, design, build and test effective Business Objects reports. Preference will be given to qualified candidates with Tableau, Xcelsius and/or SAP Dashboards 4.x experience.  Strong communication skills are required. The individual in this position will:Be responsible for development and support of Child Welfare reporting using Business Objects.Work with DSP program, policy and research staff to understand reporting and data analysis needs. Work closely with customers in the gathering of requirements for reports and dashboards. Have extensive experience working with WebI Business Objects tool.Have expert level knowledge of Business Objects report, folder and security configurations.Work interactively with both technical and non-technical staff to build Business Objects reports that adhere to underlying data model and effectively deliver data to end users.Have extensive experience working within a Business Intelligence environment and knowledge of data warehouse terms and constructs (e.g. facts, dimensions, SCD types, star schema, etc.).Stay abreast of releases / patches for Business Objects. Act as Business Objects subject matter expert for fellow technologists as well as end users. Mentor others in the section on the use of Business Objects.Typically have 5+ years of experience with enterprise level database management systems, business intelligence tools and systems.Other Notes to Vendors: 1) An in person interview will be required before a final hire is made.  2) Please bring three (3) business references to an interview.  3) Selected candidate required to sign Exhibit B.  4) A background check is required before final hire.  5) Disclose subcontractor employer if applicable.

Name: Commercial Credit Analyst/Underwriter
Description: Heartland Financial USA, Inc. is a growing dynamic organization with many locations offering uniquely different banking and financial solutions for businesses and personal clients. As a performance driven company, we strive to create a culture of excellence with high standards, and high values while providing outstanding growth and involvement opportunities for employees. Join a team that makes "Great Things Happen!"  The Commercial Credit Analyst/Underwriter is responsible for underwriting Commercial and Ag credit exposures, consisting of gathering, analyzing and interpreting credit and financial information for existing and prospective customers to assess credit quality and minimize risk and potential loss. In addition, the Commercial Credit Analyst/Underwriter assists the Commercial Banker in managing their client relationships. PRIMARY & ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:Works with limited oversight, to appropriately and timely underwrite credit and develop the appropriate credit structure in relationship to the credit risk. a. Analyzes historical and projected financial statements for business, personal borrowers and guarantors. Identifies and analyzes risks and repayment ability.  b. Evaluates the adequacy of loan structures and collateral positions.  c. Identifies risks related to borrower operations, considering the history of business, ownership, type of business entity, and industry/sector of the borrower.  d. Summarizes findings in a credit presentation (write-up) which will be utilized by the respective authorities as a basis for their approval decisions. Write-ups will summarize credit risks in a "Credit Comment"; identify loan policy exceptions; propose improvements to loan structure; assess the loan rating, and determine the probability and impact of default.  e. Reviews commercial loan file documentation for accuracy and compliance with approval requirements.  f. Completes required participation allocations based upon an understanding of requirements of combining loans for legal lending limit considerations and assesses appropriate level of approval required for each request.  g. Leads underwriting discussions with Credit Officers and Commercial Bankers.  h. May assist the Credit Officer in providing underwriting, completed applications and servicing requests for Government Guaranteed programs.  i. Keeps the Commercial Banker informed of the status of the credit and obtains concurrence from the Commercial Banker on significant changes to proposed terms and conditions of the credit.  j. Holds weekly meeting with required individuals to ensure the renewal is properly underwritten, and that the loan is renewed on or before the maturity date. Assists the Commercial Banker in the monitoring of the portfolio, specifically: a. Obtains and reviews financial statements on a timely basis.  b. Understands, detects, and reports the early warning signs of problem credits. Minimizes the risk of credit loss to maintain appropriate risk ratings on all loans.  c. Obtains and reviews Compliance Certificates, Borrowing Base Certificates, and associated receivable, payable, and inventory reports on a timely basis.  d. Monitors all covenants and follow ups immediately on any covenants out of compliance. Assists the Commercial Banker in preparing for client and prospect meetings. a. Obtains updated information on existing relationship by obtaining industry or call information from sites such as First Research and mentor.  b. Participates, with the Commercial Banker, in meetings with the client or prospect at the customer's place of business, the bank offices, or by phone. Serves as the expert on PROFITMAX. Prepares business case memos and participates in business case discussions, subsequent meetings with bank management, industry specialists, and other interested parties. Exchanges information, ideas, and seeks to understand the opinions of others.Assists the Commercial Banker in ensuring that all client documentation and customer agreements, credit and non-credit alike, are accurate, properly executed, and funds are withheld until all documents are properly executed.Assists the Commercial Banker by being identified as the in-bank relationship manager, taking care of requests from the customer that cannot be handled by the Loan Assistant.May assist the Commercial Banker by conducting loan closings.Assists the Commercial Banker by scheduling, attending, and participating in the Lender Annual Review.Prepares real estate property evaluations consistent with bank policy and regulations.Conducts business in compliance with bank policies, procedures, federal and state laws and regulations.When applicable, actively participates in community activities that promote the bank and/or assist in business development.May participate in the on-site conversion of acquired banks, including assisting in the conversion of portfolio data, initiating renewal requests, and training bank staff.Continuously seeks additional knowledge and training to enhance sales, credit, and people skills.REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, including specific courses in Accounting, Finance and Economics3 -5 years of related experience as a Credit Analyst, Portfolio Manager or Commercial Loan OfficerStrong analytical skills and an understanding of general economic theory as it relates to the lending and business environmentUnderstanding of credit analysis, risk analysis, and accounting and finance principlesKnowledge of commercial and agricultural lending, credit and appropriate banking laws and regulationsStrong credit underwriting skills. Experience in credit structuring and prudently accommodating customer credit needs.Track record of demonstrating accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality. Applies feedback to improve performance and monitors own work to ensure quality.Ability to maintain confidentiality of customer and credit informationDemonstrated proficiency in organizing and prioritizing work to meet deadlines, with the ability to adapt within a changing environmentProficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.Experience with PROFITMAX, InfoAccess, CME, AS400/Fiserv or other relevant computer programs, preferredUnderstanding of bank policies and procedures, preferredScheduled Weekly Hours:40Time Type: Full timeSDL2017

Name: Broker Analyst
Description: Broker Analyst  Job Title  Broker Analyst  Job #  US09697 Requisition Type  Regular  Function  General & Administrative  State/Province  Wisconsin  City  Middleton  Region  US Posting Start Date  Oct-30-2018  Division InformationSpectrum Brands utilizes a Shared Services model that enables resources to be leveraged across the organization. The Shared Services team is made up of information technology, human resources, indirect sourcing, finance & accounting professionals that support all business units. Shared services teams are headquartered in Middleton, Wisconsin but have members across the country.Job SummaryProvide oversight of the Sales performance for broker accounts, while monitoring actual sales and creating reconciliations to ensure broker accrual funds are accurate. Support (45%) In partnership with Customer Service, Sales and Finance maintain the broker customer hierarchy.Ensure any broker, and customer changes are made accurately and by the required deadlines.Communicate with brokers regarding timing of commission payments as well as tracking report of monthly sales.Liaison between the broker, legal, sales and sales finance regarding broker contracts, amendments and terminations.Maintain centralized electronic files of broker commission rate and all broker contracts, ensuring accuracy and timeliness of any necessary changes or revisions initiated by the Sales team. Other/General (5%) Ensure all SOX compliance requirements are followed regarding broker change reports and securing required approvals for changes to contracts, etc.Other duties as assigned. Education and Experience Profile Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Accounting or Finance. Relevant experience will be considered in lieu of degree requirement.Minimum of 2 years related finance experience.Sales compensation experience preferred, but not required.Required SkillsPrevious SAP or related ERP experience desired, but not required.Microsoft Office experience; Specifically, intermediate Excel Skill level.Ability to learn new tasks quickly while working in a fast-paced, confidential environment.Ability to work independently, organize and prioritize work.Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.Effective organization, decision making and interpersonal skills.Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate well with all levels of the organization and across multiple departments.Demonstrated analytical, problem-solving and system knowledge. Work EnvironmentWorking conditions are normal for an office environment. Name: Organizational and Data Analyst
Description: DEGREE AND AREA OF SPECIALIZATION:  Bachelors degree required.  MINIMUM NUMBER OF YEARS AND TYPE OF RELEVANT WORK EXPERIENCE:  Five or more years of professional experience in research or general administration within a higher education environment.  The candidate should exhibit the following qualities and competencies:  *Strong analytical, organizational and management skills  *Strong problem-solving skills  *Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  *Evidence of ability to exercise good judgment and discretion  *Must be detail-oriented  *A transparent and collaborative work style  *Relevant work experience in data management and budgeting  *The analyst will draw on the Universitys enterprise systems and will need the ability to write queries to extract data from large data sets.  *Ability to obtain and analyze data with automated tools (Excel,OBIEE, PeopleSoft Query)  *Knowledge of financial budgeting principles, forecasting and modeling tools, ability to perform complex analyses of financial data and to present information effectively in written and graphic reports  *General understanding of university research administration and facilities management  Title and pay will be determined at the time of hire based on candidate qualifications and experience.  POSITION SUMMARY:  The Office of the Vice Chancellor for Research (OVCRGE) provides oversight for the institutions broad research enterprise including a university-wide array of faculty and staff research programs with total annual expenditures of more than $1 billion, and promotes graduate education and research by enhancing funding support from internal and external agencies including the Wisconsin Alumni Research Foundation (WARF). The OVCRGE is responsible for an array of multidisciplinary research centers and institutes, as well as sponsored program administration and research policy and compliance.  This position is a part of the OVCRGE administrative team, reporting directly to the Associate Vice Chancellor for Administration. The Analyst has a broad set of responsibilities, overlapping and coordinating with all areas of OVCRGE administration in support of data analysis, administrative planning, and oversight of centers/institutes.
