Description: State of Wisconsin Government Jobs - Job Announcement  The Official Employment Site of Wisconsin State Government  Home/Job Search  Application Information  Veterans  Benefits of State Employment  Current/Former State Employee  Diversity Zone  Labor and Service Positions  Short Term Employment Opportunities  Other Government Jobs  Contact Us  What's New  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer seeking a diverse and talented workforce.  Log In to  Email A FriendPrintable Version  Health Services, Department ofSystems Analyst - Division of Medicaid Services  Job Announcement Code(s): 18-03234 County(ies): Dane Classification Title: / JAC:Job Working Title:IS BUSINESS AUTOMATION SENIOR 18-03234 Systems Analyst IS BUSINESS AUTOMATION SPECIALIST 18-03234 Systems Analyst Type of Employment: Full Time (40 hrs/week) Salary: The starting salary for the Senior level is between $56,160 and $70,720 and is in pay schedule and range 07/34. The starting salary for the Specialist level is between $68,640 and $83,200 per year and is in pay schedule and range 07/33. A 12 month probationary period is required. Contact: Shannon Kavorik, Human Resources Specialist, ************, ********************************* Bargaining Unit: Non-Represented Area of Competition: Open Deadline to :11/21/2018Assessment Information:13663 - 224 IS BUSINESS AUTOMATION SPECIALIST Preview Assessment  The Wisconsin Department of Health Services (DHS), Division of Medicaid Services (DMS); Bureau of Adult Program and Policy (BAPP) is recruiting to fill two IS Business Analyst positions in Madison, Wisconsin.  DHS is located at 1 W. Wilson Street in the heart of downtown Madison; near the State Capitol and the Monona Terrace, the Wednesday Farmers' Market, the Madison Metro route and the Capital City bike path.  State of Wisconsin benefits include nearly 4 weeks of vacation, 9 paid holidays, ample sick time, a top rated health plan, multiple insurance options, and an exceptional retirement plan. In addition, DHS also offers free on-site yoga classes, indoor walking area and a supportive and collaborative work environment. Work hours are Monday through Friday. We offer a team-oriented atmosphere and a focus on work-life balance. Click here to see what working for the State of Wisconsin is all about!  Position Summary: Both positions are located within the IRIS Management Section (IMS). IRIS is the States program to provide health and long-term care to persons with disabilities and the elderly in a self-directed, consumer-focused setting. IRIS supports program participants achieving their long-term care outcomes in a cost effective manner based on self-determination principles. IRIS goal is to benefit Wisconsin citizens enrolled in the programs while achieving important cost savings for taxpayers. Wisconsins Self-Directed Information Technology System (WISITS) is a centralized case management system that supports the DHS IRIS Program. The system is supported by a web-based software application and utilized by DHS staff and DHS contractors.  Senior Level: Responsible for assisting in development and enhancement of WISITS system functionality and reporting and extract requirements. Responsibilities include: user account and security role definition and maintenance, identification and definition of business rules and workflows, form development and maintenance, data extract development maintenance and analysis and formal reporting standards and requirements. Another primary function of the systems analyst will be to conduct user acceptance testing of new or modified functionality. IMS is heavily reliant upon external providers conducting testing of new or modified functionality. This position is responsible for the functioning of the new features and end-to-end testing and assisting in the extraction of routine and ad-hoc data reports. These reports are critical to the health and safety of the participants served as well as to the required federal compliance of the 1915 (c) waiver authority governing the IRIS program. The data reporting and extracts include level of care eligibility reports, enrollment, service utilization, authorizations, outcome based service relationships, critical incidents, deaths, disenrollment, appeals, grievances, and qualified provider credentialing.  Specialist Level: Responsible for continued development and enhancement of system functionality and reporting and extract requirements. This position translates manual processes or those processes conducted outside of the WISITS system into business rules and work flows in order to be incorporated into the system. This system includes: critical incident reporting, budget amendment and one-time expense requests, notice of action, disenrollment, fraud monitoring and detection, provider accreditation, appeals and grievances, record review collection, cost share ledger, and other reporting. The Specialist works with external contract providers to identify barriers to provide efficient delivery of IRIS services. This position provides support to IRIS consultant staff and develops recommendations regarding program and policy enhancements that directly correlate to case management system changes and enhancements. This position also works with contracted Fiscal Employer Agents. This work includes supporting the processing of participant hired worker timesheets and provider claims to make processing of this information more accurate and decrease opportunities for fraud, abuse, and/or human error in claim processing. Overall, this position is responsible for the development of recommendations related to the WISITS case management system regarding changes to policy, business rules and work flows to increase efficiency in program administration, intuitiveness and cost effectiveness of system development and maintenance.  Special Notes: Due to the nature of the position, all applicants who may be appointed will be required to allow DHS to conduct a background check to determine whether the circumstances of any conviction may be related to the job being filled. Qualifications: Minimum requirements for the IS Business Automation Senior and Specialist level are: Experience analyzing and facilitating business automation needs for a business or program performing tasks such as defining business requirements, conducting User Acceptance Testing, evaluating business process solutions, etc.Experience providing technical assistance or training to end-users related to IT systems or software.Experience communicating with IT developers in regard to system issues.Excellent written and oral communication skills. Additional minimum qualifications for the IS Business Automation Specialist level are: Experience researching and recommending system changes or enhancements OR experience in data analytics. Well qualified candidates will also have experience with WISITS and experience with community based long-term care support programs. How To : Click on the Preview Assessment link near the top of this announcement to view the qualifications that will be evaluated in the initial part of the selection process.  To be considered for this position applicants must complete the online process by uploading a resume and letter of qualifications in a Word or PDF compatible format.. Failure to submit all required materials will result in an incomplete application and ineligibility for this position. Application materials will not be accepted if received in an email, as a hard copy or a fax.  Your resume and letter of qualifications are very important parts of your application at DHS and is used during our evaluation process to determine your qualifications as they relate to this job. For suggestions on what to include when developing your resume and letter, please click here. Applicants deemed eligible will be invited to participate in the next step of the selection process.  Permanent classified state employees who are eligible for consideration (transfer, voluntary demotion, or former employees as a reinstatement) must complete the online application process to apply. Name: Validation Analyst
Description: Validation Analyst - 149744  Description  Expect more from your career. Expect PPD.  The Validation Analyst ( level based on experience) provides business/system support of software systems and will primarily be focused on laboratory instrumentation qualification / validation.  As a Validation Analyst with PPD's Information Technology (IT) team, you will work with staff of various departments and the client to initiate and complete Performance Qualification (PQ) validation activities. Facilitates the validation process as well as implementation of system upgrades, including duties of guiding, testing, supporting the introduction, and ongoing support of software systems. Participates as a member of the Project teams where needed and helps provide direction on future enhancements to the system. Assists management with maintaining project schedules and providing estimated levels of effort for validation tasks. Essential Job Functions/Responsibilities: Serve as Validation Support for new releases and modifications to applications throughout the Software Development Life Cycle. Prepares Validation Plans, Test Cases and Validation Summary Reports and executes Test Cases. Reviews and approves all change controls associated with the validated systems per SOP. Reviews PQ and change control documentation with the IT Project Manager per SOP. Meets with project teams on a regular basis to ensure effective communication and accuracy in testing. Ensures test scripts challenge the functional requirements and adequately demonstrate that the application meets the expectations of the business customer. Updates test scripts where required based on requirement changes or upgrades in application functionality. Executes test scripts accurately to produce evidence that the computer system consistently performs its intended functions accurately and reliably proving the software functions correctly. Creates, updates, and manages data within the testing environment sufficient to accurately test software functionality. Works with IT Project Manager to address any PQ related issues arising from client or internal audits.  Supervises the daily activities of other validation analysts or associate validation analysts performing the same or similar tasks. Assigns, monitors and reviews progress and accuracy of work. Directs efforts and provides technical guidance on more complex issues. May be required to complete tasks of subordinates when the need arises. May initiate and communicate a variety of personnel actions (e.g. performance and salary reviews, time off requests, timesheet and expense report approvals).  Manages assignments to meet deadlines and produce high quality deliverables. Remains familiar with relevant contractual obligations, sponsor expectations, applicable regulations, and SOPs/WPDs. Monitors own assignments; evaluates and shifts priorities and assignments to meet deadlines and deliver high quality work. Communicates pro- actively with all Project team members and provides regular feedback to management concerning timeline/budget or resource constraints.  Participates in departmental and corporate process initiatives. Cross trains and mentors validation analysts on systems of expertise. Trains personnel resourced to validate software releases, including internal testers, contractors, and temporary employees.  Prepares for and represents department within relevant system related client / audit forums. Represents IT Validation in sponsor audits. Participates in or conducts vendor audits as appropriate for tools or systems in use. key words: "computer validation", "app administration", "system validation", "instrument validation", "instrument qualification", HPLC, computer, validation, "validation lead".  IndeedPPDUS1 #LI-MM1QualificationsMinimum Required Education and Experience: Requires 4-yr degree in computer, biological or life sciences or related area, or equivalent combination of education, training and professional experience that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities  Fundamental training, knowledge and experience with systems and software validation processes  0-4 years experience with systems or programming tools in use at PPD or within the CRO/Pharmaceutical industry  Analytical laboratory instrument qualification and validation experience strongly preferred.  Experience in clinical research, or alternatively in another highly regulated technical environment preferred. Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Client focused approach with strong interpersonal skills  Strong oral and written communication skills and ability to teach others  Strong attention to detail and problem solving skills  Competent with MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Project  Demonstrates positive attitude, enthusiasm toward work and the ability to work well with others  Good organization skills and time management skills with the ability to adapt and adjust to changing priorities and to manage multiple assignments with challenging/conflicting deadlines  Good understanding of clinical trials operational processes and terminology  Good understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC)  Proven ability to learn new computer software with minimum of instruction  Strong troubleshooting skills needed to analyze software defects and the ability to explain how errors are produced  Ability to attain, maintain and apply a working knowledge of GCPs, applicable SOPs/WPDs, and Process Maps  Ability to review and critique SDLC documentation including Requirements, Functional Design, System Design, and Test Plans  Ability to assess the cause of test failures  Demonstrated ability to coordinate project activities and work and communicate effectively on a multi-disciplinary team  Ability to realize validation process needs and provide solutions  Demonstrated experience in identification and resolution of technical problems in a professional environment  Ability to develop and maintain Project Schedules within MSProject  Must be able to set and meet timelines and be able to negotiate schedule changes in response to project demands  PPD Benefits Overview  PPD offers comprehensive a benefits offering including medical, dental, vision, pharmacy, employee assistance program, wellness program options and more. Other benefits include: 401k with matching contributions, life insurance, long term and short term disability insurance, flexible medical and dependent care spending accounts.  Work life balance programs including paid time off for vacation/sick time, paid holidays, floating holiday and vacation sell back program.  Wellness benefits including health and wellness programs, fitness facility access or discounts, health coaching and more.  Education reimbursement and tuition assistance programs, professional development training, skills training, education loan repayment plan, dependent scholarship program and more.  Employee appreciation events, service recognition awards, annual reviews, merit plans and bonus plans  Community connections and activities including philanthropic engagement, volunteer service projects and more  Other great options including pet insurance, legal and financial services plan, auto and home insurance discounts.  Working Conditions  Work is performed in an office and/or laboratory with exposure to electrical office equipment.  Physical Demands  Frequently stationary and/or moving for 6-8 hours per day.  Repetitive hand movement of both hands with the ability to make fast, simple, repeated movements of the fingers, hands, and wrists.  Frequent mobility required.  Occasional crouching, stooping, bending and twisting of upper body and neck.  Light to moderate lifting and carrying (or otherwise moves) objects including luggage and laptop computer with a maximum lift of 15-20 lbs.  Ability to access and use a variety of computer software developed both in-house and off-the-shelf. Name: REMOTE CERNER CLAIRVIA SUPPORT ANALYST
Description: Title: REMOTE CERNER CLAIRVIA SUPPORT ANALYST  Location: United States  Other Locations: US-IL-Chicago  Job Number: 18212361  CTG is seeking a resource to support the ClairVia workforce application utilized for clinical staff scheduling and determining patient acuity. There are three programs in the ClairVia software suite: CVM Client, CVM Web and CVM Administrator. This resource should be familiar with NPAS Assessments imported from Cerner to measure patient acuity.  Responsibilities include all support such as incidents, service/change request, routine maintenance. This position is remote. Must be on site for knowledge transfer (3-6 weeks) at the start of project. Will be part of on call rotation.  Census Mismatch  Due to workflow issues between Cerner and ClairVia, there will be instances where the census (i.e. patient list) in ClairVia will not be the same as the census in Cerner Millennium (i.e. PowerChart). This will present itself to users as ClairVia either having extra patients or missing patients. Resolution involves finding out the erroneous patient?s FIN (AKA encounter number) and checking Cerner records to manually transfer or discharge the patient accordingly.  Interface issues  There are interfaces between ClairVia and Clockwork, Banner / HR Front End, and the production ADT interface. The Clockwork and Banner interfaces deal with new users / employees being imported to ClairVia. The HR import file needs to be checked to ensure the new employees have their correct cost center coming across.  System Down  Multiple users cannot access ClairVia. Confirm if it is one or all ClairVia applications that cannot be accessed (Web or Client ). Ping the relevant servers and gather relevant information to engage the vendor and the sever team.  Patient Acuity? Manage patient acuity based on NPAS assessments? NPAS (Nurse Patient Assessment System) powerform data imported real-time from Cerner? Custom tool developed by UIMC in 2005? Not used by all units, some use Clairvia acuity (such as 8E Psych) while others use different acuity systems (such as Surgical Services and the Emergency Department) while others don?t use an acuity system? Acuity used for patient assignment of RNs and NTs  Common Requests  Access Request of various levels of access and New builds for nursing units/clinics based on user specifications Other applications supported include:Healthstream Morrisey MSOWAllscripts SCMSunquest LISGE MUSE/PowerScribe 360/Provation MDMcKesson EnterpriseRxCerner Millennium/TransChart/Teletracking XTMidas Plus/VizientOptum Computer Assisted CodingQualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran. Name: Analyst - Sirius Academy Program
Description: A position within the Sirius Academy program is a sought-after role from which to launch a career in IT services. It provides career growth and robust professional development, including: recognized industry certifications; dedicated classroom and e-learning training; on-the-job immersion and real client project experience. *_Highlights:_** ? This exciting opportunity offers proven success with graduates working in multiple areas of IT, including security, networking, virtualization, data center solutions, project management, and managed services.  ? Experience our state-of-the art data center facility with more than 40 different vendors and 150+ types of technology.  ? Attain valuable certifications in the latest technologies, giving you a competitive career advantage.  ? Gain meaningful insight into different areas of the business through rotational training.  ? Sharpen your professional presence with clients through online and classroom learning.  ? As an Analyst in the Academy, you will split your time between our office in Skokie, IL and the Sirius Data Center in Elk Grove Village, IL.  After completion of a 6 month training program in the Chicago area starting in January 2019, you will relocate within the continental US to assume a Services Delivery role in one of Sirius? practices. Possible relocation areas include, but are not limited to: Dallas, San Antonio, Houston, Austin, Kansas City, Omaha, Seattle, Portland, Los Angeles, Phoenix, Denver, Milwaukee, Minneapolis, Charlotte, Raleigh, Tampa, the New York City metro area, or Washington, D.C. Relocation assistance is available. Once with a Services Delivery team, up to 60% overnight travel is expected. *Position Summary:** The primary purpose of this position is to participate in the Sirius Academy program, which prepares employees to begin careers in IT Consulting with Sirius. Employees will receive exposure to various business units and work on several teams, experience online and classroom learning, and develop soft skills to make them more impactful in front of clients. Additionally, employees will participate in shadowing and mentoring opportunities and hands-on technology training, all designed to help develop the necessary skills for an ultimate role as a member of our services organization. *Primary Duties & Responsibilities** ? Participates in a several month training curriculum at the Sirius offices in the Chicago area:  o Completing assigned rotations through various business units  o Self-development and certification courses  o Hands-on experience in the Sirius Data Center  o Practical exposure through on-the-job training which includes mentoring by a team of dedicated engineers and introduction to designing technology solutions for a client environment  ? Learns and develops in all phases as an Information Technology engineer, to include:  o Systems design  o Implementation & installation  o Integration  o Systems assurance  o Project management  ? Obtains satisfactory evaluations through progress reviews in order to advance in training program  ? Develops a base level of technical and consulting enabling performance of quality service for clients *Basic Qualifications:** ? Bachelor?s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Information Technology, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field  ? Experience with MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Powerpoint) *Other Position Requirements:** ? Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize workload under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment  ? Demonstrated organizational, time-management, problem solving and follow-up skills  ? Demonstrated presentation and communication skills  ? Demonstrated ability to work as a team member *Preferred Qualifications:** ? Linux experience  ? Programming experience  ? Exposure to an Agile environment  ? Prior experience with VMWare (automation, orchestration, cloud)  ? Prior experience with Cisco route/switch Networking solutions, and/or Network Security solutions (Palo Alto, Cisco ISE)  ? Prior experience with Aruba Wireless (HP) solutions Data Privacy and Security: ? All Sirius employees are responsible to safeguard the information and information systems that they use or handle in the execution of their duties. Employees are obligated to know and perform their duties in accordance with Sirius policies, standards, and procedures related to security and report security violations to the appropriate Sirius authority.  ? Participate at hire and annually in the Information Security Awareness training as well as other required training identified by the Human Resources department. Other data privacy and data security related regulatory training may be required based on your role or assignment. Essential Functions: This position exists to provide technical consulting solutions to customers and as such requires the ability to travel to and from customer sites and interact with customers on an ongoing and regular basis.  The above primary duties, responsibilities, and position requirements are not all inclusive.  Sirius is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. As a government contractor, Sirius takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans; maintains a drug-free workplace; and participates in E-Verify.  Individuals who receive job offers will be required to complete pre-employment screening that includes a background check verifying name, residences, education, work experience, and criminal convictions consistent with the Fair Credit Reporting Act; and a drug test for controlled substances consistent with the Drug-Free Workplace Act and the Americans with Disabilities Act.  Sirius will not sponsor work eligibility for this position.

Name: Research Analyst
Description: County(ies): Dane Classification Title: / JAC:Job Working Title:RESEARCH ANALYST 18-03411 Research Analyst Type of Employment: Full Time (40 hrs/week) Salary: Starting salary is between $17.60 and $29.03 per hour, plus benefits. This classification is in pay range/schedule 08-04. A 12-month probationary period will be required. Pay will be set in accordance with the compensation plan in effect at the time of appointment. Contact: Renata McMillen, HR Specialist - Senior, 608-266-6679, RenataM.McMillen@dwd.wisconsin.gov Bargaining Unit: Non-Represented Area of Competition: Open Deadline to Apply: 12/14/2018 Assessment Information:46401 -  018  RESEARCH ANALYST Preview Assessment Join the team that collects data from Wisconsin employers that the State and Federal government use to inform policy decisions and plan workforce development programs. Our Research Analysts become experts in specific industries so that they can explain what's happening in a specific business sector. The information we collect impacts a variety of State and Federal programs, including direct funding for worker training.  We're looking for a strong data analyst who would like to help us innovate new ways to compile and communicate information to all of our various stakeholders. We expect to train the right person on our data sets and reporting, and we hope you will bring skills and ideas we can learn from, also. If you love collecting and analyzing data and are looking for a job with opportunities for advancement, apply today!  This position is located in the heart of downtown Madison. A five-minute walk in any direction from the office will place you on the lawn of the State Capitol, at a Madison Metro bus stop, or even on the extensive biker/runner friendly Capital City bike path system. In addition, there are plenty of nearby restaurants as well as music and shopping venues.  Join the Department of Workforce Development (DWD) for the opportunity to help build the workforce to move Wisconsin forward! DWD offers an exciting place to work with an excellent benefits package, public service loan forgiveness, a casual work environment, flexibility, and many opportunities to develop and grow your skills. Find out why we love to Work Wisconsin!Position Summary: This position is responsible for inputting and analyzing statistical data to populate data bases and provide information and interpretations of quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW) data and processes to users, including QCEW, Labor Market Information (LMI) section, and bureau staff. The position generates analytical reports on the program's operations, develops analysis applications, and operates and manages corresponding software. This position also participates in the operation of, meeting deliverables for, and implementing program processes of the Bureau of Labor Statistics cooperative agreement. Duties include inputting, editing, and making corrections to employer-reported data, processing survey instruments, and updating address information necessary to the survey process.Special Notes: Due to the nature of this position, a criminal background check may be required prior to appointment. Applicants must be legally entitled to work in the United States (i.e. a US citizen or national or a lawfulpermanent resident) at the time of appointment. DWD does not sponsor visas and is not an eligible OPT employer for those with F1 visas. This is not a contract position. Any appointment made will be contingent on the applicant being able to prove valid status to work in the United States.Qualifications:Minimally qualified applicants will have the following:Experience working with Microsoft Excel, Access and/or Word, or other similar programs.Strong verbal and written communication skills, including experience communicating professionally and effectively with a variety of audiences (e.g., leadership, stakeholders, partners and/or customers) about complex and sometimes technical topics.Well-qualified applications will also have the following:Experience working with current employment or unemployment statistics, employer tax and accounting data, or related labor market information.Experience using mainframe and data entry software to input and analyze statistical data.Ability to work as part of a team as well as independently.Ability to prioritize work, meet established deadlines and make decisions independently.How To Apply: To apply for this position, click “Log In” to access your existing account or to create a new account if you do not already have an account in the system. After you have logged in, click “Apply Now.” You will be asked to provide your personal information and attach a resume that describe how your knowledge, skills and abilities relate to the above qualifications. It is highly recommended that you customize your materials before submitting them. NOTE: Any application materials that contain corrupt files or are in formats that are unable to be opened will not be reviewed. Please check your files and attachment formats prior to uploading into Wisc.Jobs. Application materials will not be accepted if received in an email, as a hard copy or a fax. If you have any questions regarding Wisc.Jobs or need assistance using the system, please contact the HR Specialist on this announcement. Failure to submit all required documents will result in an incomplete application and will not be considered. Information regarding the State's hiring process is provided via WiscJobs/FAQ. Your resume and letter of qualifications will be evaluated by one or more job experts. Your materials must provide sufficient detail to portray your qualifications. It is important that they clearly describe your background so the job expert(s) evaluating your application materials are able to make an accurate judgment regarding your qualifications. Use specific examples to clearly demonstrate your level of expertise. The most qualified candidates will be invited to participate in the next step of the selection process. If you have any questions regarding the application process, please contact the HR Specialist listed above.  All interested applicants, including current State of WI employees, should follow the application instructions provided above. DWD is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer seeking a diverse and talented workforce. Log In to Apply Email A Friend Printable Version

Name: Internal Controls & Revenue Assurance Senior Analyst
Description: OverviewWe are looking for a dynamic Sr. Analyst – Internal Controls & Revenue Assurance! This position is responsible for leading or supporting complex consultative activities of the Revenue Assurance & Internal Controls team associated with identifying, designing, documenting, and measuring the effectiveness of internal controls related to a diverse set of process owners throughout TDS Telecom, and across all business segments. This position supports risk assessment and mitigation activities performed by the Revenue Assurance & Internal Controls team. The position is directly responsible for providing status updates on the Telecom internal control deficiencies and outstanding TDS Internal Controls & Audit Service (ICAS) action plans to the Controller as well as administering Telecom annual user access reviews for key financially relevant applications. The position also plays a key role in facilitating the execution of revenue assurance projects designed to minimize costs, improve processes, and contribute to overall margin enhancement, as well as oversees timely execution of the recurring revenue assurance and internal control projects.TDS Telecommunications LLC (TDS Telecom/TDS®) delivers high-speed internet, TV entertainment, and phone services to nearly 900 rural, suburban, and metropolitan communities across the U.S. With more than 1.2 million connections, TDS is one of the fastest growing technology companies in the United States. Powered by fiber-optics and new industry-leading technologies, TDS delivers up to 1 Gigabit internet speeds and offers internet-protocol based TV entertainment solutions along with traditional phone services. TDS also offers businesses VoIP advanced communications solutions, dedicated internet service, data networking, and hosted-managed services. Visit tdstelecom.com.TDS Telecom, headquartered in Madison, Wis., employs nearly 2,700 people and is a subsidiary of Telephone and Data Systems, Inc. [NYSE: TDS], a Fortune 1000® company. Founded in 1969, TDS Inc. employs 9,600 people and has approximately six million connections nationwide through its businesses U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions LLC, and TDS Broadband Service. In 2018, TDS Inc. was named to several Forbes lists, including America's Best Employers for Diversity, Best Large Employers, and Best Employers for Women. Visit tdsinc.com. Responsibilities SOX Compliance:Work with TDS ICAS and Telecom stakeholders to ensure timely completion of Telecom internal control deficiencies and open action plans. Provide regular status updates on progress to Controller.Administer annual user access reviews by management for key billing datasets/systems. Perform evaluation and manage annual certification by various managers throughout Telecom.Evaluate and approve user access requests that come into the System Access Review Committee (SARC) mailbox. Evaluate appropriateness to ensure no segregation of duty issues for system access requested by user. Collaborate with SARC committee members to approve/deny unusual or risky access.Perform review of SSAE 16 reports on third party service providers. Validate end user control considerations. Design and implement any new end user control considerations.Provide support to Associate Manager –Revenue Assurance & Internal Controls or lead basic control consultations on control design to ensure compliance with SOX 404 requirements.Internal Control and Risk Management:Lead or support consultations with control and process owners to help them identify, design, document, and measure the effectiveness of internal controls. Name: Product Analyst
Description: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door. - Milton Berle Come build your door with us. It's what we do here. At WTS Paradigm, we make world-class software and deliver high-quality professional services for the building products industry. Our success is tied directly to our customers' success, so we do what it takes to make sure they're successful. And we know that we couldn't do it without our awesome employees. Our award-winning office space lets you work where you prefer – at your desk, in a collaborative space, in a private enclave. Whatever suits you and lets you get your work done. We've got a ton of options to unwind during the workday. Grab a game of pool, play some ping pong, sit back and relax on the deck, or even plop down in front of a gigantic projection TV. We're sure you'll enjoy all the standard perks, like delicious free coffee. We've got some extra-cool perks too, which you won't find anywhere else. An employee favorite is our annual company-wide scavenger hunt in downtown Madison. If you thrive in a dynamic, creative, professional, and fun environment, WTS Paradigm could be the breath of fresh air you've been looking for. Check us out! We'd love to hear from you. We are currently seeking a Product Analyst to join out Middleton, WI office. Position Summary: We are looking for a Product Analyst who will bring exceptional creative and analytical skills to drive forward a best in class product that provides real value to our customers and helps grow the business. You're a self-starter, solutions-oriented, and excited to dive into something new. Essential Functions of the Role: Uses data to understand current behavior and evaluate potential opportunities in order to optimize the product. Works with the product manager and the product team to set goals, measure right things, and analyze the impact of everything we do. Empowers the team with data: you will work with the product team to bring data to their fingertips Works with the technical team to extract and segment data, and develop autonomy over time to help define and create reports Works with the product, development and design to ensure analysis has a meaningful impact on product and strategy Provides objective evaluations post implementation Measures data so we can learn what kind of impact we had with each release -serving as a liaison between the internal and external customer community and the software development team to gather and communicate requirements which help define and verify product design Coordinates schedule and communicates customer enhancement-focused collaboration sessions Translates business and user requirements through conversations with customers into functional requirements, specified in an appropriate level of detail that can be utilized for UI/Ux and development. Generates feature and bug cases in Jira. Familiarity with agile development methodologies Conducts follow up conversations with customers, as needed. Serves as a resource for development and quality assurance; clarifies requirements throughout the software development life cycle. Maintains and updates requirements documentation as needed throughout the software development life cycle. Creates release notes. Participates in special interest group discussions to hear how users are utilizing the software and documenting possible conceptual requirements, enhancements, ad hoc cases and interface needs. Supports the broader team by communicating and training new functionality internally prior to releases. Position Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in related field or an equal amount of related professional experience 4+ years of experience in business systems and processes Critical thinking, requirement gathering skills, and proven problem-solving skills Proven teamwork and collaboration skills Strong written and verbal communication Strong organizational skills; attentive to detail and excellent follow-through Self-motivated and resourceful, with strong interpersonal skills; able to work individually as well as with a team Able to adapt to changing demands and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment Some travel required To be considered, apply online at www.wtsparadigm.com/careers. - provided by DiceAgile, Analysis, Analyst, Analytical Skills, Development, Manager, Quality Assurance, Release, UX

Name: Bilingual Customer Support Analyst
Description: RockAuto Bilingual Customer Support Analysts do not work from scripts or process workflows; they determine the needs of customers and use technology to accurately respond to a high volume of customer concerns. You will use your Spanish, German and/or French skills to respond to customer inquiries, create and implement solutions to customer concerns and help translate, maintain and improve our user-friendly website (available in Spanish, French and German versions). Why RockAuto?Strategic and tactical impact. Our reputation with our customers and our ultimate profitability as a business depend on what you do. Strong growth, unique business model. RockAuto has posted 15+ years of double-digit sales growth. We present products and information in ways that are relevant and compelling for online consumers and we deliver on what our catalog promises -- with quality and efficiency competitors struggle to match. You will play a key role in extending that leadership. Career building. People who tend to do well at RockAuto are those who enjoy tackling challenges with detail-oriented enthusiasm and taking on a variety of responsibilities. Working here truly is a "job of many hats". Our "promote from within" philosophy and encouragement of implementable ideas - proposed by any employee - make working at RockAuto professionally and personally fulfilling. Open, friendly environment. Everyone sits in an open space, encouraging collaboration and teamwork. Our flat structure creates transparency and enables near-constant implementation of employees' creative ideas and solutions. Office outings, like the annual winter holiday party, are a great way to connect with fellow employees. Excellent compensation. RockAuto offers competitive wages, overtime pay for all positions, a generous allowance of paid holidays and personal time off, affordable health insurance, a Simplified Employee Pension for employees with qualifying tenure and a tradition of rewarding individual results and sharing the fruits of company success. Madison, WI is a great place to live. Madison is uniquely centered on an isthmus between two beautiful lakes. It is consistently ranked one of the best places to live in the US. Both a capital city and hip college town, Madison provides affordable housing, excellent schools and a wide range of entertainment options and recreational activities. How to Apply Please email a cover letter and resume in PDF format to HR@RockAuto.com. In your cover letter please explain why you would be a good fit as a RockAuto Bilingual Customer Support Specialist and include your GPA (if not listed on your resume). Applications that exclude a cover letter will NOT be considered. Requirements Bachelor’s degree or currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program Fluency in Spanish, French and/or German (as well as English) Excellent customer service skills: ability to read closely, think quickly and problem-solve effectively Familiarity with car model names, part descriptions and other automotive terms Advanced computer skills – you will be using our automated translation tools and order-processing software, and contributing design ideas for our e-commerce website Eagerness to have an immediate impact on business Must be able to work from our Madison, WI office and have the ability to work for any US employer without visa sponsorship.  We are open seven days a week. Part Time Bilingual Customer Support Specialists must work a minimum of 16 hours per week up to 40 hours per week (early afternoon to late evening availability). Some weekend availability is required. Full Time Bilingual Customer Support Specialists must work 40 hours per week (early morning to early evening availability).

Name: Demand Analyst
Description: The Demand Analyst is responsible for all forecasting activities associated with assigned customers and products. The Demand Analyst is the integration point between sales and supply teams. This position creates and maintains forecast models for their customers, incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gathered from sales, marketing, finance, retailer replenishment analysts, and other sources. These forecasts prompt inventory purchasing decisions with the objective of maximizing customer satisfaction and minimizing excess inventory. This position is also responsible for incoming order management for their accounts to ensure orders can travel through the Fiskars systems as efficiently as possible. This position leads the dialogue each month for their respective customers and products with key counterparts in Sales and Operations Planning (S&OP) process. Primary responsibilities:Collaboratively develop and propose forecasts through use of historical sales data as well as market intelligence information such as market trends, POS data and other sources for accurate product forecasts used by planners & sourcing to identify risks and opportunities. Forecast should support company inventory objectives while meeting customer service expectations. Prepare, analyze, and present demand forecasts which support the business plans while clearly identifying and explaining variances to historical performance and prior forecast.Actively evaluate and analyze data required to support event forecasting process (i.e. promotions and plan-o-grams) to ensure forecast system item information is up-to-date and accurate.Lead communications through proactively sharing information with Sales, Channel and Supply to ensure internal and external targets, expectations and initiatives are met.Perform all Order Maintenance, System Maintenance and provide Customer Service for assigned accounts as required (i.e. resolve issues, track purchase orders, product information and pricing).Report and analyze KPI's to on a daily, weekly and monthly basis. Communicate progress on delivering results to management and key stakeholders. Understand financial impact of daily activities and propose actions ensure company plans and expectations.Report and manage customer satisfaction and high service levels as required by the customer while maintaining Fiskars company goals and objectives.Execute system data maintenance as required to ensure accurate system parameters which drive the forecast process.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Operations Management or related field, or equivalent experience.3 years' experience in key aspects of forecasting, demand planning, inventory control, and/or statistical analysis.Excellent communication skills, strong analytical skills and problem-solving skills.Strong analytical skills that enable one to clearly understand forecasting patterns or changes and then provide recommendations for future forecasts.Strong trouble-shooting and problem-solving skills with an orientation towards service and sincere willingness to assist others.Proficient knowledge and use of PC and related business applications (ERP systems, MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint) forecasting systems and other related business equipment. Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with DisabilitiesSDL2017

Name: Paid Media Analyst - Digital Marketing
Description: Job DescriptionWhen youre part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, youll do important work that enables our customers to do things like develop new treatments for rare diseases, protect the environment and ensure our food and water is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and youll have the opportunity to learn and achieve your career goals in the process.  We are looking for a savvy digital advertiser interested in helping to build a best-in-class paid search and display program. Thermo Fisher has an eye on becoming the leader in the digital marketing space. Our customers expect more from their online experience than ever before, and its our mission to exceed their expectations. As our Digital Marketing Paid Media Specialist, youll be responsible for managing a variety of campaigns across numerous teams with the goal of delighting our customers while getting results.  Are you passionate about online advertising and its ability to influence buying behavior? Do you look at ads and think critically about what could have been improved to make more of an impact? Are you unafraid to suggest a new approach, then test it and learn from the results? If so, wed love to hear from you. Responsibilities: Coordinate, implement and optimize on-going demand generation campaigns across channels (SEM, display, social advertising)Manage a large number of campaigns and budgets at the same timeAssist in the development of paid media strategies and campaigns by leveraging past performance insights and best practicesProvide regular and ad hoc reports to key campaign stakeholdersAssist in the development of online marketing forecasts and business cases to influence advertising decisionsIdentify causes and solutions to issues or unexpected resultsPartner with other members of the Digital Marketing team and business partners to guarantee consistency and accuracy across various channelsMonitor program budgets and competitive landscapeStay up to date on new developments, trends and technologies in the display advertising spaceMinimum Qualifications: Bachelors degree3+ years minimum hands-on experience with the following criteria: Experience executing paid advertising marketing tacticsAbility to manage and prioritize a variety of projectsStrong analytical skills to make data-driven decisionsStrong Excel skills, such as VLOOKUP, pivot tables and the ability to quickly isolate dataExcellent writing & communication skillsPreferred Qualifications: Familiarity with DSP, web analytics and bid management technologyWork or educational experience related to the science industryAccount management or project management experience If you are an individual with a disability who requires reasonable accommodation to complete any part of our application process, click here for further assistance.Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Name: Research Analyst, Energy Services
Description: OverviewThe Cadmus Group, Inc. is seeking an entry level Research Analyst to join the Energy Services Sector. The Energy Services team at Cadmus provides advanced analytic and strategic consulting services to energy companies, utilities, governments, and non-profit organizations  Our primary areas of focus are: Measuring and verifying energy efficiency and load control program energy impacts.Performing engineering, economic, statistical and econometric modeling and analysis in support of impact evaluations, market transformation analysis, and resource planning. Candidates should have interest and knowledge in the field of energy management or energy efficiency. They should have exceptional written and verbal communication skills, be highly self-motivated to perform and learn, be able to work collaboratively and independently, and manage assigned tasks and projects from start to finish with input from supervisors.  This position will be based in Madison, Wisconsin, and will work closely with our staff throughout the country.ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities for this position include both technical work and project support/management.  Technical Elements Assist with planning, designing and implementing research efforts to support program evaluations.Conduct primary and secondary data collection.Analyze and interpret data to reach meaningful conclusions and recommendations for inclusion in clearly written, concise reports. Project Management Assist with project management activities such as internal project coordination and budget tracking.Perform survey, scheduling and recruiting calls.Contribute to proposal efforts.Perform office management duties, including purchasing supplies, planning group events, and coordinating mail deliveries. QualificationsUndergraduate degree in engineering, economics, statistics, mathematics or related field.Proficient in MS Office applications, including Word and Excel.Familiarity with qualitative and quantitative data collection methods.Experience with analyzing data and interpreting data.Excellent writing, communication, and critical thinking skills.Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, including setting priorities and adapting to changes in a time-sensitive, deliverable driven workplace.Strong organizational, detail-oriented skills.Initiative and ability to self-direct on assignments.PreferredFamiliarity with energy sector or utility industryFamiliarity with Python/Jupyter, VBA, Matlab, R, SQL, Access, FileMaker, or similar tools a plusExperience in professional/consulting business environment.Applied experience with quantitative research activities in academic or professional setting.Familiarity with project management tactics and tools, including schedule software and budget tracking.Additional Information This position will be based in Madison, WI.  Cadmus is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer and considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran’s status or disability.  Learn more about Cadmus by visiting our website at: http://www.cadmusgroup.com

Name: Benefit Configuration Analyst I
Description: Requisition Number:1024Location: Phoenix Campus: Phoenix, Arizona Other Locations: Requirements:Education: Associates degree and/or a minimum of four years of work experience is required. Experience:Two years of pharmacy technician experience is preferredKnowledge of NCPDP or Medispan is a plus Job Description:Job Summary: The Benefit Configuration Analyst I position is responsible for analysis, interpretation, integration and business decisions with regards to hierarchy, pharmacy network rates and Navitus' formulary configuration designs. This position requires knowledge of both the technical and operational sides of the business utilizing Navitus' adjudication system (NaviClaimRx) and/or other applications which includes software updates and enhancements. The Benefit Configuration Analysts I will work closely with Provider Relations, Formulary Services and Client Services to understand the interdependence of each team pertaining to claims adjudication and client reporting needs. This position will ensure Navitus is able to provide a versatile adjudication system that allows for various benefit designs and accurate claim adjudication to adapt to the continuous changes in the pharmacy benefit industry. Job Responsibilities:Analyze and implement requests including adjudication hierarchy, pharmacy network rates and formulary management configuration with a high degree of accuracyImport and validate Member Prior Authorization loads for new client implementations along with formulary updates for existing clientsPerform quality assurance peer reviews on adjudication hierarchy, pharmacy network and formulary management configuration changes with a high degree of accuracy consistent with department work standardsServes as first line of support to troubleshoot adjudication inquiries to internal and external customersAccountable for pharmacy network rate build resolution and impact assessmentIs responsible for complying with departmental standards along with established turnaround timesUpdate and maintain existing departmental policies and proceduresComply with standards set forth regarding benefit design and configuration including HIPAA, NCPDP and Navitus internal business standardsUtilize departmental work flow management, issue resolution and reporting toolsContribute towards departmental performance and service level guarantees and achieve individual performance goals around accuracy and timelinessActively participate in and contributes to daily communications, team meetings and project/issue resolutionAssist in the development of process improvements that focus on efficiency and accuracyOther related duties as assigned/required.

Name: Premium Billing Analyst
Description: Premium Billing AnalystQuartz is seeking an innovative problem solver who is familiar with medical or health insurance billing for a Premium Billing Analyst opportunity. Premium Billing Analysts are responsible for completing departmental duties related to collecting and reconciling outstanding balances for multiple lines of business. Key Responsibilities: Draft and distribute group late payment notices and ad-hoc group invoicesComplete daily balancing of US Bank deposits, upload payment batches and log daily payment transactions Post journal entries for cash receipts into the general ledgerPerform collections activity for outstanding balances across multiple lines of business Run monthly metrics report for payment transactionsAssist with uploading and distributing payment batches to the billing staff for posting, as well as billing cycle computation and validationQualified candidates will possess the following skills/qualifications: Associate’s Degree in Finance, Accounting or related business field preferred. 1-2 years of accounting analysis, billing or A/R experience. Demonstrated knowledge and skill in Microsoft Excel (v-lookups, pivot tables, complex formulas) and automated general ledger systems. Excellent written and oral communication skills, including ability to interact with people at all levels within and outside of the organization. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and complete in a timely manner.These positions will work from our Madison, WI office. Quartz offers an excellent benefit and compensation package, opportunity for professional growth and a professional culture built upon the foundations of Respect, Responsibility & Relationships.Quartz values and embraces diversity and is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Name: Programmer-Analyst
Description: Job Description: We are looking for a developer to join a development team that is modernizing the existing Work Programs mainframe application. This is an multi-year project and follows an Agile based methodology and will leverage .NET and related state of the art technologies.  The programmer analyst 1 (PA) will closely work with the Architect and lead analyst to design, code, test, and implement the new application. Programming will include working on a backend API and the front end application. The development stack includes Core ASP.NET, C#, and the user interface Angular code written in TypeScript. Practical knowledge of change management and process improvement is required. This PA will support of the application using Cherwell and JIRA for ticket tracking.  Systems administration experience is a plus. Preference will be given to qualified candidates with business knowledge in DCF W- 2 business area, prior experience with the CARES system, and/or familiarity with Client application systems, procedures, and development standards. Other Notes to Vendors: 1) An in person interview will be required before a final hire is made.  2) Resumes should be no longer than 3 pages.  3) Please bring three (3) business references to an interview.  4) The selected candidate will be required to sign exhibit B (attached) as part of the onboarding process.  5) The selected candidate will be required to complete a criminal background check.  6) This position is budgeted for 1960 hours annually. Hours will be prorated the first year based on start date.  7) DCF does not sponsor work visas, either at the time of hire or at any later date

Name: Staffing & Scheduling Analyst; 1.0FTE; Day/PM Shifts
Description: Job Description The Staffing and Scheduling Analyst supports the scheduling and staffing process of the more than 1,000 patient care employees in the nursing division. This position reviews and maintains an in-depth knowledge of assigned system applications, related departmental policies, procedures and business operations, staffing and scheduling principles, bargaining agreements. The Staffing and Scheduling Analyst collaborates with and advises department staff, directors, and management in ongoing analysis and design of scheduling practices resulting in optimized use, training and support processes within the clinical units.  This position reports to the, Resource Support Unit Manager, and works closely with the Nursing Finance Manager, NACs, Human Resources, Nursing Directors, and Nurse Managers. The majority of this work is performed within the API Healthcare software with the Time & Attendance and Staffing & Scheduling modules. QualificationsBachelors degree in related field or direct and applicable work experienceValid driver's license when driving any vehicle for work-related reasons.Microsoft Office knowledgeRelationship management experienceExperience managing priorities and deadlinesStrong communication (written & verbal) Preferred API Staffing and Scheduling system experienceExperience managing projects in a hospital settingTechnical aptitude - ability to learn new systems quicklyFamiliar with healthcare industry and system dynamicsScheduling experience EEO/M/F/D/VSDL2017

Name: REMOTE EPIC CLIENT SUPPORT ANALYST
Description: Title: REMOTE EPIC CLIENT SUPPORT ANALYST  Location: United States  Job Number: 18212620  CTG is looking for a Clinical IT Associate Application Analyst (Tier 1) will support a large Health System client for CTG Health Solutions and is responsible for providing service desk functionality in support of health care delivery specifically in Epic Systems.  The focus of this position is to provide high First Call Resolution support by responding to inquiries from the user community for requests and incident resolution for Epic application modules.  The person will also assist Management in monitoring the quality and timeliness of response to customer issues and requests, meeting service delivery goals and customer satisfaction levels Qualifications: ? Must have previous experience supporting Ambulatory or Inpatient systems ? either as an analyst or Help Desk resources with Application Specific first call resolution.  ? Prefers prior experience with EpicCare EMR in some capacity ? Trainer, Go Live Command Center, Help Desk Technician, Application Analyst non certified.  ? Must have experience troubleshooting and problem solving end user issues in a healthcare environment.  ? Experience working with customer support/call center ticketing systems.  ? Ability to handle oneself in a professional manner working in a highly stressful environment, at times with impatient customers. Must possess excellent communication and problem-solving skills.  ? Requires the ability to read, write and speak effectively in English. Review and understand customer requirements and specifications.  ? Provide prompt escalation of application/system problems including assisting in determining root cause of problems through to appropriate solutions.  ? Must have a broad understanding of information technology and the ability to adapt to new technologies is essential. Able to deal with ambiguity and change and handle multiple projects and tasks.  ? Must possess ability to function independently and collaborate effectively on a team.  ? Must be self-directed and able to work remotely  ? Overtime and/or weekend work may/will be required depending on the shift schedule. Able to be flexible when necessary to support varied shifts. Qualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.  Job: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations

Name: Jr. Cost Analyst
Description: Position: Jr. Acquisition Specialist Location: Madison, WI Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (“JPS”) is currently seeking qualified and motivated candidate. Job Description:Must be able to collect amd analyze data and organize it in a standard work breakdown structure. Must be knowledge of cost methodologies and cost modeling applications, including Microsoft Excel. Must also be knowledgeable of time value of money, net present value, real US nominal dollars and other common cost estimating practices.Acquisition planning assistance, including market research and recommending procurement strategy.Acquisition document development, including cost/price estimates, quality assurance surveillance plans, statements of objectives, synopsis, solicitations, price memoranda, source selection plans, etc.Expect assistance in supporting quote and quote evaluations, including price/cost analysis or technical quote or quote analysis.Contract administration support services, including assistance with reviewing contractor performance, developing contract modifications, and investigating reports of contract discrepancies.Contract/task order closeout assistanceDrafting policy or procedure documents for government review.B.A or B.S Degree (in a business related field) with a combination of education and five (5) years of procurement/ acquisition experience and at least 3 of those years shall have been at a junior level.Extensive working knowledge of Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) will be required.U.S. Citizenship: Must be able to successfully pass a background check. JPS Corporate Overview: Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (“JPS”) a CVE Certified Service-Disabled Veteran Owned small business, is a customer driven firm with an extensive record of providing superior professional support services to our clients, supporting single and multiple nationally and internationally requirements. Name: Security Analyst 2
Description: Sundial Software is currently recruiting for a Security Analyst for a one year minimum contract with annual renewal.Security Analyst 2 (14240) Description The DHS Security Analyst 2 is a member of the Access and Identity Management team within BITS and specializes in information and network security. The role is responsible for analyzing security risks, planning controls, developing policies and procedures to implement security practices. In addition: Coordinates implementation of security controls, designs and implements controls, monitors compliance with security policies and procedures. The Security Analyst should have capabilities with 4-7 years of experience and be familiar with standard security concepts, practices, and procedures. The Analyst relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required.  Success in this role will require experience with the following technologies at minimum: Microsoft Active DirectoryMainframe security (RACF) and mainframe application security on the IBM Z\OS platform and Host on Demand (HOD)Additionally, experience with Business Objects security, the State of Wisconsin WAMS (Web Access Management System) tool, PowerShell, or workflow automation would be beneficial. This position will work independently and as a member of a team processing access and revocation requests for state applications following defined procedures. This role provides support via a helpdesk model and the candidate will be expected to provide support, as well as develop and maintain professional relationships to support agencies and partners, which range from counties and tribes to third party contracting firms working on behalf of the state of Wisconsin. Staff are required to maintain confidentiality while enforcing the laws, rules, policies and data sharing agreements which apply to this function.  On call responsibilities may be required.  Local candidates only.

Name: Help Desk Analyst I
Description: To be considered for a job at a rapidly expanding company, apply for Robert Half Technology's Help Desk Analyst role, which will be responsible for supporting local and field users. As a Help Desk Analyst, you will be a creative problem solver who enjoys working in a dynamic and rapidly-changing work environment. Due to this Help Desk Analyst role being the main front line support for internal end users helping them with mainly deskside support but will have to provide support for some external users.. This Help Desk Analyst role is located in the Madison, Wisconsin area and is a long term temporary-to-fulltime opportunity. Please apply at www.rht.com and send your resume to Jerry Fink at Jerry.Fink@rht.com and give him a call at 608-827-8882 to walk through your experiences. Your responsibilities in this role - Provide IT assistance for operating systems, productivity software, and a variety of other software applications used internally - Identify recurring technical issues and propose solutions to address the root of the problems - Independently investigate and implement solutions to technical issues - Respond and follow up on technical help tickets submitted via phone, email, and walk-ups *Technology doesn't change the world. People do.** As a technology staffing firm, we can't think of a more fitting mantra. We're extreme believers in technology and the incredible things it can do. But we know that behind every smart piece of software, every powerful processor, and every brilliant line of code is an even more brilliant person. *Leader among IT staffing agencies** The intersection of technology and people ? it's where we live. Backed by more than 65 years of experience, Robert Half Technology is a leader among IT staffing agencies. Whether you're looking to hire experienced technology talent or find the best technology jobs, we are your IT expert to call.  We understand not only the art of matching people, but also the science of technology. We use a proprietary matching tool that helps our staffing professionals connect just the right person to just the right job. And our network of industry connections and strategic partners remains unmatched.  Apply for this job now or contact our branch office at 888.674.2094 to learn more about this position.  All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.  ? 2018 Robert Half Technology. An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veterans.  By clicking 'Apply Now' you are agreeing to Robert Half Terms of Use. Req ID:* 04620-0010732187Functional Role:* Help Desk/Tech Support ICountry:* USAState:* WICity:* MADISONPostal Code:* 53719Compensation:* $15.04 to $17.41 per hourRequirements:* - IT support ticketing system experience desired - MS Windows 10 experience required - PC desktop/workstations experience - Deep understanding of MS Windows 7 in an Active Directory environment - Foundational knowledge in Active Directory - Eager problem-solver who listens for customer cues and actively resolves problems with grace and integrity - Basic networking concepts - Experience installing and configuring operating systems, networked and local printers, and business applications

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst (Administrative Manager I)
Description: About the Job Nexant is seeking a Senior Financial Analyst to provide  business unit and project financial management, financial planning and  analysis. Primary responsibilities include  business unit forecasting and budget management (reporting, analysis and  planning); project budget analysis and revenue/cost forecasting, and reporting  on business unit invoicing, utilization, subcontractor costs and payments,  accruals, and AR collections. This person will coordinate closely with the  finance and accounting, project management, and business development teams to  coordinate the annual financial plan; provide timely, accurate financial data;  and diagnose and troubleshoot reporting issues or inaccuracies. Duties and ResponsibilitiesFinancial  Planning and Tracking: Coordinate  input and updates for the Business Unit annual financial plan. Develop and administer reports or other  business intelligence tools to monitor key business unit financial metrics on  weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual timelinesBudgeting  and Forecasting: Administer monthly  revenue / cost forecasting and analysis.  Monitor and track key Business Unit KPIs relative to target: Subcontractor costs/accruals/payments,  accounts receivable, operating expenses, labor productivity, contract backlog,  sales pipeline and others as necessary.  Prior experience includes project financial budgeting and forecasting, as  well as pricing for new workFinancial  Reporting: Review project/budget reporting, highlight issues that need  attention, and provide recommendations for solutions to project managers and  senior business unit managers. Review  internal financial reporting for the operations, sales, and delivery groups to  ensure budgets are on track. Develop and  utilize business intelligence tools and reports in Oracle FusionContinual  Improvement: Work closely with  business unit leaders and finance and accounting teams to identify and support  implementation of processes and systems that speed reporting and dissemination  of financial information, improve productivity and reduce effort for business  unit staffOther  duties as assigned.QualificationsRequired Education /  Experience: ·  Bachelors and Masters degree with equivalent  work-related finance, project management, administrative or contract management  experience. ·  5-7 years of experience in project-based  accounting environments, specifically engineering, architecture, consulting or  general contractor/construction. Required  Skills/Qualifications:Knowledge/understanding of business unit and  project financial processes, specifically project-based accounting (e.g.,  contract administration, invoicing, accruals, revenue, margins)Excellent analytical, time management, and  interpersonal skills, as well as a demonstrated ability to maintain  confidentialitySuperior organizational and prioritization  skills with the ability to work well in a fast-paced, deadline-driven  environmentHighly developed oral and written communication  skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of internal  staff in written, visual, and verbal formsFrequent communication with business unit leaders, project managers, and  internal finance and accounting personnel requiredDemonstrated advanced proficiency with Microsoft  Office programs, particularly Microsoft ExcelDocumented experience with project-oriented  accounting software (e.g. Costpoint, Oracle Financials, Oracle Fusion,  NetSuite, Sage) and financial planning/reporting or dashboard software toolsOther software experience desired for software  tools in use at Nexant (e.g. Cognos, Oracle Fusion, Salesforce, Google GSuite,)Salary  and Benefits (U.S.) Nexant  offers competitive salaries based on candidate's qualifications. Nexant also  offers three weeks paid vacation per year, eleven paid holidays per year, a  401(k) plan with employee matching funds and an overall comprehensive benefits  package. About Nexant Nexant  is a globally recognized software, consulting and services leader that provides  innovative solutions to utilities, energy enterprises, chemical companies and  government entities worldwide. Founded in 2000 and headquartered in San  Francisco, Nexant and its 500+ employees work from 32 global offices providing  deep technical expertise and regional knowledge to improve customer engagement,  boost operational efficiency, reduce costs and achieve superior business  results.  Nexant supports clients through four distinct business units: Nexant Energy  Softwarehas developed and commercialized a  number of industry-leading software platforms and applications, including  Nexant iEnergy®, Nexant Grid360, and Nexant iHedge®Nexant Utility  Servicesworks with clients to drive customer  energy savings, ensure cost-effective program design, implementation and  management, and promote customer engagementNexant Energy &  Chemicals Advisoryprovides strategic  planning, project development, competitor analysis, market and price  forecasting, and NexantSubscriptions, a subscription program and online  product portal.Nexant  Government Services assists developing countries  with energy sector policies, infrastructure, financing, and access to  affordable electricity.Every  day, Nexant employees partner with customers to reimagine the world we live in  and create a more sustainable energy tomorrow. Nexant,  Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive  consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex,  national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other  characteristic protected by law.

Name: Sr. Test Analyst
