Name: Programmer Analyst
Description: Description: Develops, codes, tests and debugs new software or enhancements to existing software within the Company's suite of Internet applications. Works with technical staff and business team to understand and analyze system changes. Reviews existing programs or formulates logic for new systems, devises logic procedures, prepares flow-charting, performs coding, and tests/debugs programs.  Qualifications: Strong experience developing web applications and a working knowledge of Object Oriented Programming (OOP) techniques and design. Strong experience developing web applications using the following technologies/tools: Visual Studio .NET, ASP.NET, VB.NET, and the .NET Framework. Experience in creating SOAP and REST based web services. Strong SQL and analytical skills. Strong markup language skills (HTML, XML, CSS). Strong client-side JavaScript skills. Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science, MIS, or equivalent work experience.  Preferences: Familiarity with energy industry terms and business vernacular. Experience troubleshooting and debugging web applications on the Windows Operating System environment.

Name: Programmer Analyst, C++ Adjudication
Description: Requisition Number:947Location:Phoenix Campus: Phoenix, ArizonaOther Locations:Appleton Campus: Appleton, WisconsinRequirements:Education:College degree (2 or 4 year program) typically in the field of computer science, information systems, or software engineering. Professional programming work experience strongly preferred.Experience: Working knowledge of source control tools such as TFS and GitHub. Prior experience interviewing end-users for insight on functionality, interface, problems, and/or usability issues. Hands-on experience developing test cases and test plans. Healthcare industry practices and HIPAA knowledge would be a plus. Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.Key Skills/Competencies:Able to communicate effectively with non-technical staff and with members of interdisciplinary teams. Flexible and adaptable in regards to learning and understanding new technologies. Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to conduct research into software-related issues and products. Highly self-motivated and directed. Keen attention to detail. Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. On-call availability. Some travel may be required.Job Description:Job Summary:The Programmer Analyst ensures efforts are in alignment with the Information Technology department to support customer-focused objectives and the IT Vision, a collaborative partner delivering innovative ideas, solutions and services to simplify people's lives. The Programmer Analyst's role is to define, develop, test, analyze, and maintain existing applications in support of the achievement of business requirements. This includes writing, coding, testing, and analyzing software programs and applications. The Programmer Analyst will also research, design, document, and modify software specifications throughout the production life cycle.Job Responsibilities:Ensure efforts delight the customer. Provide superior customer service utilizing a high-touch, customer centric approach focused on collaboration and communication. Contribute to a positive team atmosphere. Innovate and create value for the customer. Collaborate with analysts, developers, programmers, and designers in conceptualizing and development of software programs and applications. Analyze and assess existing business systems and procedures. Assist in the definition, development, and documentation of software's business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal users and departments. Assist in defining software development project plans, including scoping, scheduling, and implementation. Research, identify, analyze, and fulfill requirements of all internal and external program users. Conduct research on emerging application development software products, languages, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts. Recommend, schedule, and perform software improvements and upgrades. Liaise with network administrators, systems analysts, and software engineers to assist in resolving problems with software products or company software systems. Consistently write, translate, and code software programs and applications according to specifications. Modify and write programming scripts to enhance functionality and/or performance of company applications as necessary. Design, run and monitor software performance tests on new and existing programs for the purposes of correcting errors, isolating areas for improvement, and general debugging. Administer critical analysis of test results and deliver solutions to problem areas. Generate statistics and write reports for management and/or team members on the status of the programming process. Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines. Train end users to operate new or modified programs. Install software products for end users as required.Responsibilities (including one or more of the following):C++ Unix/Linux Shell Scripting Informatica Oracle MS SQL

Name: CYBERSECURITY RISK ANALYST
Description: Position Vacancy ID:96671-ASEmployment Class:Academic Staff-RenewableWorking Title:Cybersecurity Risk AnalystOfficial Title:IS SPECIALIST(S45DN)Hiring Department(s):A060370-INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY/SEC/CYBERSECURITYFTE:100%Anticipated Begin Date:JANUARY 02, 2019Term:This is a renewable appointment.Advertised Salary:Minimum $73,000 ANNUAL (12 months)  Depending on QualificationsDegree and area of specialization:Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology Security or related discipline and two years' experience; OR five or more years of applicable professional services and/or information security experience and expertise.Minimum number of years and type of relevant work experience:Required Qualifications: Minimum of three years' experience conducting risk assessments against recognized standards (NIST, COBIT or ISO).Must hold, or be able to obtain within six months, a management oriented security certification (e.g., CISSP, CISM or GSEC). Demonstrated knowledge or professional certification in Information Security or IT Audit is a strong addition.Detailed understanding of network design, security protocols and systems administration with excellent analytical and problem solving skills.Experience using standard industry applications to create or update current documents to meet compliance reporting requirements.Must display working knowledge of NIST, HIPAA, or PCI Data Security, standards along with virtual environment and cloud computing services.Experience executing project management skills including design review, threat modeling and risk profiling while working across a large, distributed organization that is representative of a diverse IT and business communities.Expertise using vulnerability management tools to analyze discovered vulnerabilities against current configurations to determine the organizational risk.Preferred Qualifications:Experience working independently to conduct technical investigations with diverse constituents, providing detailed written reports and presentations.Highly advanced skills in PC/Macintosh/Unix workstation, Internet software skills, groupware, office productivity software, project management software, and architecture tools (e.g. Visio, etc.).Experience conducting assessments in a healthcare or research organization.Experience in assessing vendors as part of procurement and implementation stages.Demonstrated experience applying standards and practices for risk management and compliance; and familiarity with and validation skills using Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) principles.License or Certificate:Position Summary:This position provides risk analysis and compliance program support for the Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) domain of the UW-Madison Office of Cybersecurity. Responsibilities include evaluating security risks and compliance strategies; offering direction, guidance and consultation; and making recommendations for the improvement in information security of IT systems primarily for University of Wisconsin-Madison and for the University of Wisconsin System upon request. The incumbent coordinates implementing university-wide, proactive and distributed information security management programs to ensure the continuous availability, confidentiality, and integrity of information assets owned and used by the university community, consistent with university management's informed risk tolerance.  A successful individual will have exceptional information security expertise as well as project management, business analysis, solution implementation skills and the ability to work under broad policy guidance. This individual must exercise sound judgment in working collaboratively and communicate effectively within a challenging environment in a visible role.  This position reports to the Office of Cybersecurity and serves as the campus technical expert and authority on information security risk analysis and compliance matters. As a trusted advisor and partner with campus researchers, Primary Investigators, program managers and system owners, the incumbent works with the entire university community in a consultative manner. The incumbent should understand organizational missions, values and goals, analyze information risks which threaten those objectives, recommend and guide large cross-functional and campus-wide teams towards appropriate security control solutions, and assist in implementing and auditing those solutions to materially reduce operational and compliance based exposures.Additional Information:Additional Preferred Qualifications: Experience with typical application components such as web servers, application servers, database software (Oracle and SQL), middleware and underlying infrastructure devices (WAN and LAN devices, operating systems for server platforms, workstations, and a broad range of applications, host and network security devices.Solid understating of manual, automated application penetration skills, vulnerability scanning and analysis as well as skill in careful, limited live testing in live production environments. Please note that successful applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without need of employer sponsorship, on or before the effective date of appointment.Contact:Bradley Molzahn  bradley.molzahn@wisc.edu 608-262-0596 Relay Access (WTRS): 7-1-1 (out-of-state: TTY: 800.947.3529, STS: 800.833.7637) and above Phone number (See RELAY_SERVICE for further information. )Instructions to Applicants:Please click on the "Apply Online" button to start the application process. To apply for this position you will need to upload a cover letter and resume. Your cover letter should specifically address the required qualifications listed above.Additional Link: Full Position Details NOTE: A Period of Evaluation will be Required The University of Wisconsin is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.  The Annual Security and Fire Safety Report contains current campus safety and disciplinary policies, crime statistics for the previous 3 calendar years, and on-campus student housing fire safety policies and fire statistics for the previous 3 calendar years. UW-Madison will provide a paper copy upon request; please contact the University of Wisconsin Police Department.

Name: Global Partnership Analyst
Description: Wolters Kluwer is a global leader in professional information services. Professionals in the areas of legal, business, tax, accounting, finance, audit, risk, compliance and healthcare rely on Wolters Kluwer's market leading information-enabled tools and software solutions to manage their business efficiently, deliver results to their clients, and succeed in an ever more dynamic world. Every day, our customers make critical decisions to help save lives, improve the way we do business, build better judicial and regulatory systems. We help them get it right.  Within Wolters Kluwer, CT Corporation contains our expert information services businesses that serve large corporations, small businesses and law firms specializing in incorporation and legal business compliance solutions and clearance and protection solutions for trademark and brand professionals. coordinating new partner on-boarding efforts between CT team and strategic partner; coordinating training and development; and representing Wolters Kluwer within the industryQualifications:A minimum of five years of sales/service, operations, vendor/partnership management and/or data analysis experienceBachelor's degree from an accredited college/university or equivalent work experience; Project Management Professional (PMP), and/or Six Sigma Green or Black Belt preferredExperience gathering and analyzing information, integrating information from multiple sources quickly and accurately, as well as utilizing the results from analysis to inform and influence business decisionsDemonstrated ability to prioritize and manage multiple concurrent projects, along with driving and managing projects to successful completionProficient with Microsoft Office Suite applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and OutlookExperience using Sales tools such as Salesforce.com; and ancillary software to support the CRM databaseStrong working knowledge of E1, Salesforce.com, Tableau, and/or Arrow preferredAbility to travel up to 40% Wolters Kluwer N.V. (AEX: WKL) is a global leader in information services and solutions for professionals in the health, tax and accounting, risk and compliance, finance and legal sectors. We help our customers make critical decisions every day by providing expert solutions that combine deep domain knowledge with specialized technology and services.  Wolters Kluwer reported 2017 annual revenues of ?4.4billion. The company, headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands, serves customers in over 180 countries, maintains operations in over 40 countries and employs 19,000 people worldwide. Wolters Kluwer shares are listed on Euronext Amsterdam (WKL) and are included in the AEX and Euronext 100 indices.  For more information about our solutions and organization, visit www.wolterskluwer.com, follow us on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY Wolters Kluwer U. S. Corporation and all of its subsidiaries, divisions and customer/business units is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Name: Senior Network Analyst
Description: CLA is seeking to hire a Sr. Network Analyst for our Minneapolis, MN office. We have a fast paced and collaborative work environment. CLA believes in openness to ideas and a culture where employees are defined by their capabilities and contributions rather than title or tenure. CLA offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package to all employees, flexibility with the opportunity to work remote and quick advancement. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:•Lead project planning and implementation process requirements and technical solutions•Interacts with vendors for support, pricing and technical advisement•Mentors junior team members and additionally identify and lead R&D effort•Identifies operational inefficiencies and provide resolution to issues•Lead development and review of all operational documentation•Create and execute changes per change control •Complete PO/ HW/SW per project/business requirements•Responsible for leading production readiness process per specific project•Leads business continuity tests and document development•Leads operational assessments, development and creation of operating initiatives •Responsible for communicating operational status/updates•Assist in providing operational reporting and execute and evaluate general and advanced requests. Working knowledge of routing protocols, switching and wireless technologies.•Lead level 3 problem resolution process and manage outstanding issues•Proven self-starting troubleshooting skills•Maintain Network standards and operation through monitoring and analysis tools like Solarwinds•Ability to work with IOS firmware and security issues•Contribute to office moves, adds and changes•Develop and execute KTLO documentation/procedures•Participate in an On-Call rotation•Ability to provide technical expertise in the evaluation, planning, analysis, development and implementation of network infrastructure including providing roadmaps, processes and procedures for both project work and general organizational growthREQUIRED EDUCATION EXPERIENCE:•Bachelor's Degree and 3+ years of experience •Knowledge of Operational systems highly preferred; Cisco Systems: Windows, UNIX, Linux, and Microsoft •Ability to provide technical expertise in the analysis and resolution of issues to maximize system availability, and meet both internal and contractual Service Levels.•Ability to maintain knowledge of technologies, including new technology developments.•Experience with Networking: Switches, Routers, Hubs, Servers, Cables, Racks, Firewalls, LAN, WAN, TCP/IP, SNMP, OSPF, DMVPN, and DNS.Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Employer/Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

Name: Sr. Cost Analyst
Description: Position: Sr. Cost Analyst Location: Madison, WI Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (“JPS”) is currently seeking qualified and motivated candidate. Shall be knowledgeable of common investment analysis practices including Life Cycle Cost Estimating, Cost Benefit Analysis, Cost Effectiveness Analysis and Business Case Analysis.Acquisition planning assistance, including market research and recommending procurement strategy.Acquisition document development, including cost/price estimates, quality assurance surveillance plans, statements of objectives, synopsis, solicitations, price memoranda, source selection plans, etc.Expect assistance in supporting quote and quote evaluations, including price/cost analysis or technical quote or quote analysis.Contract administration support services, including assistance with reviewing contractor performance, developing contract modifications, and investigating reports of contract discrepancies.Contract/task order closeout assistanceDrafting policy or procedure documents for government review.B.A or B.S Degree (in a business related field) with a combination of education and ten (10) years of procurement/ acquisition experience and at least 3 of those years shall have been at a senior level.Extensive working knowledge of Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) will be required.U.S. Citizenship: Must be able to successfully pass a background check. Name: Financial Analyst, Staff or Senior
Description: Overview  TDS, #521 on the FORTUNE 1000®, has an excellent opportunity for an energetic and forward-thinking individual. The Financial Analyst directly interacts with our CEO, enterprise executives, and senior leadership throughout the organization. This highly visible Financial Analyst position plays a crucial role in helping to establish the strategic direction for the TDS family of companies: U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecommunications Corporation, OneNeck IT Solutions, and Suttle Straus.  NOTE: We have one Financial Analyst opportunity available and the position can be filled at the Staff or Senior level based on applicable skills.  If you are a highly motivated, strategic thinker with outstanding interpersonal skills and are interested in a fast-paced, dynamic and ever-changing industry come join and add value to our team! Responsibilities The Financial Analyst plays a key role supporting the financial analysis and strategic planning processes at TDS. The Financial Analyst prepares analyses and presentations for the strategic planning process, the annual budget, quarterly forecasts and quarterly board of directors meetings, and prepares financial statement projections for the annual rating agency review process. The Financial Analyst also reviews and analyzes business investment proposals and provides financial and strategic impact analyses of acquisitions, divestitures and other special projects. QualificationsRequired Qualifications:STAFFBachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or related fieldRelevant internship experience -OR- 6+ months financial analysis or accounting experienceSENIORBachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or related field; Master's degree in Business Administration (MBA) preferred3+ years finance, accounting or strategy experienceOther Qualifications: STAFF and SENIOR CPA, CFA, or other relevant professional certification is preferred (or actively working towards one)Strong knowledge and understanding of financial statements, accounting concepts, financial modeling, and application of analytical toolsAdvanced experience using Microsoft ExcelExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills; including the ability to successfully perform independent, in-depth analysis and generate concise conclusionsSuperior verbal and written communication skills; including the ability to communicate effectively within multiple levels within the enterprise, including executive managementAbility to collaborate and work in a team environmentExcellent organizational and interpersonal skills with strong attention to detail and qualitySENIORStrong business acumen and strategic thinkerStrong presentation and facilitation skillsHigh level ability to oversee others effectivelyAbility to build relationships with others that are outside of the reporting lineAbility to meet deadlines and work under aggressive time constraints, prioritizing multiple projects Employees at TDS, ranked as one of Madison Magazine's Best Places to Work, enjoy a robust total rewards package, flexible work culture, wellness programs, community involvement, tuition reimbursement and professional development. We offer outstanding growth potential! To learn more about this position or our company, please visit tds.jobs.  EEOSDL2017

Name: Business Systems Analyst/Application Testing
Description: This position functions as the primary department contact for the consultant and project management systems for the Bureau of Project Development (BPD) and provides independent project leadership to the Bureau of Project Development in the installation, maintenance and problem resolution of computer platforms, software systems, and applications software as they relate to the external and internal users of the department's consultant and project management systems. Work is performed under general supervision and this position reports to the Consultant Services and Project Management Section. This position performs duties such as data and application analysis on existing business systems and analysis of new technology in the delivery of new or enhanced systems. In addition this position's duties include, information system administration, documentation of all application business processes, troubleshooting on existing business systems and, budgeting, purchasing and monitoring.  Assignments involve a large number of complex variables including multi-platform requirements and the performance of advanced specialist functions for major systems such as the Contract Administration and Reporting System (CARS) and Masterworks products licensed by the department, and other complex systems developed for the Bureau of Project Development. These assignments have a significant departmental impact related to the delivery of consultant contracts, and contract payments to prime consultants. The assignments can cross organizational and/or agency lines, including all levels of government, and can involve the private sector. This position is responsible for the continued operation of and installation of yearly upgrades to the aforementioned business systems.  This position will provide ongoing advanced system/network troubleshooting expertise. This position independently uses a number of troubleshooting mechanisms to diagnose and correct business system problems or user errors. This position is responsible for presenting IT recommendations to management concerning future trends in the data processing marketplace and information technology related to information systems that support the Bureau of Project Development. This position facilitates the development of business requirements with the Bureau of Information Technology Services (BITS) as well as initiating problem resolution with appropriate individuals in BITS.  The work is multi-tasking, self-initiated and conducted independently. This position is under general supervision and work is reviewed only from a standpoint of feasibility, comparability with other work and effectiveness in meeting objectives. The person in this position must exhibit significant discretion and judgment in the performance of their assigned duties and responsibilities. This position requires statewide travel to transportation regions and the Madison Truax Materials Laboratory QualificationsExcel (MS). Required - 3 yearsMS Office products. Required - 3 yearsOutlook (MS). Required - 1 yearVisio. Required - 2 yearsWindows (MS). Required - 2 yearsExperience troubleshooting technology support issues. Required - 2 yearsAbility to perform testing of applications, facilitate testing by others, document results. Required - 2 yearsExperience using SQL, SPUFI, Platinum, Fileaid, QMF Tools or Equivalent. Required - 2 yearsExcellent verbal/written communication skills and strong time management and analytical/problem solving. Required - 2 yearsCreate and maintain database links, database gateway software. Desired - 2 yearsDatabase Tuning and Maintenance to assure highest level of system availability and performance. Desired - 1 yearDevelop plans for acceptance testing. Desired - 2 yearsDemonstrated expertise in implementation of Content Mamanagemt System (CMS) sites using SharePoint. Desired - 2 yearsDocumentation Skills. Desired - 2 yearsSDL2017

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Job Title: Senior Financial Operations Analyst Reports To: VP Finance Essential Job Functions:The Senior Financial Operations Analyst will provide proactive business partner support to the the Modular Division of Cupertino Electric. This position will partner directly with the Modular Division senior management to support the achievement of the Division’s performance objectives.Assist Modular Division senior management with the development of budgets, both at the division level and at the individual project level, monthly forecasting of project performance, forecasting and monitoring of capital spend requirements, cost performance analytics and helping to drive initiatives towards cost reductions.Working closely with senior management, provide in-depth analysis of Division and individual project performance.Review of Division monthly financial statements and ensuring consistency in the application of accounting policies and practices as set by senior Finance and Accounting Management.Assist in developing and tracking key metrics and trends in support of business decisions.Assist in driving continuous improvement in processes, systems, business intelligence and budgeting tools to meet the Company’s financial reporting and analysis requirements.Prepare ad-hoc analyses as requested by Senior Management.Minimum Job Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, business administration, or other business related field.Minimum 5 years financial analyst experience required. (CEI), founded in 1954, is one of the largest, well-established electrical contractors in the nation. Other job-related duties may be assigned. Name: Service Desk Analyst I - 3rd shift
Description: Job DescriptionWe are currently searching for a qualified Service Desk Analyst for Core BTS, a successful business transformation company, providing organizations comprehensive IT solutions from network management to virtualization. This position will be located out of our Madison, WI office.  Successful candidates must be team-oriented with outstanding work ethic, excellent written abilities, and a solid communication foundation. The Service Desk Analyst will function as first level support for our client’s end users, networks, and server issues. The candidate will troubleshoot software, hardware, and operating system issues while creating detailed documentation of issues. This position will work 3rd shift (roughly 11:30pm - 8am)  Some of the supported technologies and hardware are: CiscoCitrixWindowsMicrosoft OfficePrintersLaptopsiPhonesAndroidEtc. We are looking for candidates with the following skills/competencies: Two years related experience with Help Desk or network support preferredStrong customer service, telephone skills and analytical skillsExperience with Microsoft Office Suite, iPhone and Android devicesExpertise in operating systems and application softwareFamiliarity with Cisco network technologyWorking knowledge in major desktop operating systems and in major network operating systems.Experience with basic end user administration, including network and general account maintenanceStrong troubleshooting skillsExperience in communicating with users in problem situationsGood oral and written communication skills with the ability to articulate network issues Special Requirement: Net+ certification helpfulCCNA preferred Core BTS provides a compensation package consisting of a competitive base salary and bonus program. In addition, we are pleased to provide employees with a very comprehensive benefits program including: Health, Vision and Dental Insurance, Life Insurance, Health/Dependent Flexible Spending, 401(k) Plan, with a company match, Short Term and Long Term Disability Coverage, Paid Time Off (PTO), Company Paid Holidays, Business Casual Dress Policy, and Training and Development Opportunities.  Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action EmployerCompany DescriptionTransforming IT experiences – It is what we do.  Core has accepted the responsibility: to listen, learn, and communicate to create, provide, and support innovative technology solutions for its valued customers, employees, and investors. Since 1984, Core BTS, Inc., has provided business technology solutions to a wide variety of industries, helping companies achieve their goals, streamline operations, reduce costs, and enhance their bottom lines. Core’s story is one of convergence – bringing together the right people and organizations to build a leading provider of business technology solutions.  Core employs a team of IT consultants and engineers that work to Envision, Execute, and Empower our clients by offering design, implementation and on-going support services.

Name: Senior Finance Analyst
Description: Senior Finance Analyst  Job Title  Senior Finance Analyst  Job #  US09878 Requisition Type  Regular  Function  General & Administrative  State/Province  Wisconsin  City  Middleton  Region  US Posting Start Date  Nov-29-2018  Division InformationThe Spectrum Brands Global Batteries & Lights (GBL) division provides premium products at a value price. Our well-known Rayovac® brand offers a wide variety of products including: virtually-indestructible lights, the world’s longest lasting hearing aid batteries, innovative portable power solutions, and much more. We distinguish our product offerings from the competition by employing forward thinking, innovative technologies matched with a strong understanding of consumer needs to bring to market high quality, superior products that delight the end user.Job SummaryWe have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Financial Analyst (FP&A) to join our Finance team in Madison, WI. In this newly created role, the Senior Financial Analyst (FP&A) will provide financial support to senior management. The Analyst serves as the primary finance touchpoint for financial advice, analysis and support for budgets, forecasts, and results. This role will support the broader finance function as the process owners for planning, reporting, forecasting, financial analysis and data governance. This position supports process improvements, financial systems initiatives and innovations in analysis and forecasting.Primary Duties & Responsibilities Support budgeting activities for business partners including target-setting, budgeting, preparation of systems templates, ensure business partners adherence to deadlines, and perform checks on loaded budgets to confirm compliance to communicated targets.Prepare month-end reports and communicate results to business unit leaders.Analyze financial results to identify key drivers of variances. Utilize various analysis techniques to identify insights and communicate to business unit leaders.Develop monthly forecasts for business units reflecting drivers of significant variances and achieve consensus with business unit leaders.Operate as business partner and advisor to cross-functional departments and convey understanding of financial impact for operational decisions.Assist in process improvements in planning, reporting, forecasting, and analysis to drive efficiencies, improve data integrity and derive insights to support business leadership decision-making.Support special projects as requested by leadership to support the global finance strategy initiatives.Other duties as assigned. Education and Experience ProfileAn equivalent combination of: Ideal candidates will have a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or similar field.5+ years’ experience (progressive professional experience within a large corporation or equivalent related experience.Experience working within a manufacturing or CPG company is a plus. SAP experience is a plus.)Required SkillsStrong communication skills both written and verbal. Demonstrated ability to synthesize and effectively convey findings to management and functional areas.High level of detail orientation and organization, as well as ability to multi-task and handle multiple concurrent projects.Proven ability to self-motivate in a fast-paced environment, ability to deal with ambiguity, change and a dynamic business environment.Proven ability to develop strong relationships and partnerships with internal customers, peers and effectively manage those relationships.Experience effectively working across multiple departments to complete a project or resolve an organizational challenge.Advanced computer literacy skills with an emphasis on Microsoft Office, specifically Excel, Word, and Power Point. Experience with Microsoft Access or SQL a plus.Experience with SAP preferred, but not required.Able to exercise judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action.Good business acumen and be able to appropriately handle confidential information.Detail-orientated with strong organizational skills. Work EnvironmentWorking conditions are normal for an office environment.  The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job/classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  Spectrum Brands is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.  #LI-AR  #SPB

Name: Sr. Price Analyst, Management/Technical Analyst I
Description: Position: Sr. Price Analyst, Management/Technical Analyst I Location: Madison, WI Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (“JPS”) is currently seeking qualified and motivated candidate. Job Description:Provides support on projects by developing and applying analytic methodologies including but not limited to cost estimating and earned value management. Support project objectives through activities such as conducting interviews, gathering data, analyzing data, and developing recommendations in support of project objectives.Acquisition planning assistance, including market research and recommending procurement strategy.Acquisition document development, including cost/price estimates, quality assurance surveillance plans, statements of objectives, synopsis, solicitations, price memoranda, source selection plans, etc.Expect assistance in supporting quote and quote evaluations, including price/cost analysis or technical quote or quote analysis.Contract administration support services, including assistance with reviewing contractor performance, developing contract modifications, and investigating reports of contract discrepancies.Contract/task order closeout assistanceDrafting policy or procedure documents for government review.B.A or B.S Degree (in a business related field) with a combination of education and ten (10) years of procurement/ acquisition experience and at least 3 of those years shall have been at a senior level.Extensive working knowledge of Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) will be required.U.S. Citizenship: Must be able to successfully pass a background check. JPS Corporate Overview: Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (“JPS”) a CVE Certified Service-Disabled Veteran Owned small business, is a customer driven firm with an extensive record of providing superior professional support services to our clients, supporting single and multiple nationally and internationally requirements. JPS consistently and successfully delivers qualified employees to numerous Federal agencies as well as other public and private sectors across a broad field of occupations and disciplines.  JPS offers a wide range of employment opportunities in the commercial and government arenas. We seek employees who share our values of service excellence, integrity and professionalism.  JPS affords equal employment opportunity to all individuals, regardless of race, creed, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity, or sexual orientation. Our employees, as well as applicants and others with whom we do business, will not be subjected to sexual, racial, religious, ethnic, or any other form of unlawful harassment and/or discrimination. In addition, JPS adheres to the equal employment opportunity requirements of all states and localities in which it does business.  JPS’s commitment to equal opportunity is applied through every aspect of the employment relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, selection, placement, training, compensation, promotion, transfer, termination, and all other matters of employment.  Applicants may be required to successfully complete an online test to determine qualification for positions requiring specific skills. Please DO NOT contact with JPS regarding this opportunity. All applications must be submitted through our applications system at: http://careers.jps-online.net/x/openings

Name: Cerner PharmNet Support Analyst
Description: Title: Cerner PharmNet Support Analyst  Location: United States  Job Number: 18212770  CTG is seeking a Cerner Millennium Clinical support analyst with expertise in PharmNet Orders build. This resource will support Cerner Inpatient and PharmNet. Responsibilities include all support activities such as incidents, service/change request, routine maintenance.  This is a remote position but must be on site for knowledge transfer (3-6 weeks) at the start of project. Support includes being be part of the 24/7 on call rotation.  Preferred candidates will have 5 years of Cerner experience, particularly around Cerner Core functionality ? including CareSet, Order Sentence Discern rules build and maintenance, positions, privileges, and user preferences.  Candidates should be prepared to be part of a multifunctional team and provide support where needed. **Please note that all positions are W2 salary! Hourly, 1099, and corp-to corp will not be considered.Requirements: Experience with the detailed design, configuration, build, testing, and troubleshooting experience in one or more of the following Cerner solutions: PowerChart Inpatient or Ambulatory CPOE (including, PowerPlans, PowerOrders, Order Sentences, Dynamic Documentation, PowerForms, MPages, Workflow, Task Completion, etc.)Cerner Practice ManagementScheduling ManagementCare ManagementCore Measures/QualityCareAware, CCL/Clinical RulesRegistrationPathNet and the Reference Lab NetworkPharmNetRadNetSurgiNetFirstNetSecurity Location: Remote after 3-6 weeks of knowledge transfer in Chicago, IL  Duration: 2 years Qualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011). Name: Senior Consultant - Energy - Scheduling Analyst - Remote
Description: Navigant Consulting, Inc. (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant?s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant?s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com.  With over 600 consultants, Navigant?s global Energy practice is the largest energy management consulting team in the industry. We collaborate with utilities, government and NGOs, industries and large corporations, product manufacturers, and investors to help them thrive in a rapidly changing energy environment. Our clients include the world?s 50 largest electric, water, and gas utilities; the 20 largest independent power generators; and the 20 largest gas distribution and pipeline companies. Navigant?s seasoned professionals and highly skilled specialists form exceptional teams to help clients transform their businesses, manage complexity and accelerate operational performance, meet compliance requirements, and transform systems and governance to address upcoming changes as the energy transformation takes hold.  Navigant was awarded the contract by the Government of Puerto Rico through the Central Office of Recovery, Reconstruction, and Resilience (COR3). Bringing reliable and affordable power to Puerto Rico is critical to the island?s economy and the well-being of its residents. With Navigant?s expertise across power systems generation, T&D, distributed energy resources, and grid modernization, Navigant is uniquely positioned to deliver on key objectives for a more resilient, customer-centric, and sustainable energy system for the people of Puerto Rico.  The Scheduling Analyst will assist the Master Scheduler in the development and implementation of schedules to support client projects. Perform Program Planning and Scheduling tasks for the organization. The Scheduling Analyst will support a diverse group of Program Managers, Project Managers, and Technical Leads in the development of program plans and schedules. Responsibilities: + Facilitate project planning: prioritize tasks, set deadlines and manage deliverables  + Analyze schedule information with the project teams and stakeholders on a weekly basis  + Generate program plans & schedules from the earliest stages of program development through program execution  + Develop solutions to complex problems and support the development and deployment of new techniques and tools  + Prepare and coordinate plans and schedules for new and/or existing projects.  + Analyze effects of projects on engineering, facilities, and construction and determine efficient methods to solve conflicts.  + Minimum 2 years related experience in MS Project or Primavera  + Good organizational skills and ability to effectively coordinate multiple activities.  + Solid knowledge of MS Project; scheduling theory, techniques and methodologies; project management principles.  + Working knowledge of critical path and other schedule risk/opportunity analysis techniques.  + Good presentation, communication, and analytical skills  + BS in Engineering or Construction Management, with a solid academic performance.  + PMP Certification preferred  + 2 plus years? experience in scheduling, with emphasis in project controls.  + Highly motivated, driven, and dynamic attitude towards work and career.  + Creative problem-solving ability and a collaborative, consultancy mindset.  + Strong oral and written communication skills in English and Spanish is a plus.  + Ability to multi-task and effectively prioritize tasks.  + Must demonstrate a working knowledge of Word, Excel and PowerPoint.  + Experience with Primavera scheduling tools. MS Project and Critical Path Method (CPM) scheduling techniques.  + Solid skills in analysis and reasoning, good interpersonal, communication and time management skills.  + Travel is required  + Frequently communicates with clients and coworkers and must be able to share information effectively  + Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills  + Work as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independently  + Flexibility and responsiveness in managing multiple projects in sometimes high-pressure situations simultaneously  + Travel Required  + Usually remains stationary for the majority of the day  + Regularly uses close visual acuity and operates computer equipment to prepare and analyze and transmit data  The company offers competitive compensation packages including an incentive compensation plan, comprehensive medical/dental/life insurance, 401(k) and employee stock purchase plans. *_Navigant does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Navigant and Navigant will not be obligated to pay a placement fee._***Navigant** is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation. Navigant will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law or ordinance including the Fair Chance Ordinance of Los Angeles and San Francisco.

Name: Financial Analyst, Staff or Senior
Description: Overview  TDS, #521 on the FORTUNE 1000®, has an excellent opportunity for an energetic and forward-thinking individual. The Financial Analyst directly interacts with our CEO, enterprise executives, and senior leadership throughout the organization. This highly visible Financial Analyst position plays a crucial role in helping to establish the strategic direction for the TDS family of companies: U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecommunications Corporation, OneNeck IT Solutions, and Suttle Straus.  NOTE: We have one Financial Analyst opportunity available and the position can be filled at the Staff or Senior level based on applicable skills.  If you are a highly motivated, strategic thinker with outstanding interpersonal skills and are interested in a fast-paced, dynamic and ever-changing industry come join and add value to our team! Responsibilities The Financial Analyst plays a key role supporting the financial analysis and strategic planning processes at TDS. The Financial Analyst prepares analyses and presentations for the strategic planning process, the annual budget, quarterly forecasts and quarterly board of directors meetings, and prepares financial statement projections for the annual rating agency review process. The Financial Analyst also reviews and analyzes business investment proposals and provides financial and strategic impact analyses of acquisitions, divestitures and other special projects. QualificationsRequired Qualifications:STAFFBachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or related fieldRelevant internship experience -OR- 6+ months financial analysis or accounting experienceSENIORBachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or related field; Master's degree in Business Administration (MBA) preferred3+ years finance, accounting or strategy experienceOther Qualifications: STAFF and SENIOR CPA, CFA, or other relevant professional certification is preferred (or actively working towards one)Strong knowledge and understanding of financial statements, accounting concepts, financial modeling, and application of analytical toolsAdvanced experience using Microsoft ExcelExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills; including the ability to successfully perform independent, in-depth analysis and generate concise conclusionsSuperior verbal and written communication skills; including the ability to communicate effectively within multiple levels within the enterprise, including executive managementAbility to collaborate and work in a team environmentExcellent organizational and interpersonal skills with strong attention to detail and qualitySENIORStrong business acumen and strategic thinkerStrong presentation and facilitation skillsHigh level ability to oversee others effectivelyAbility to build relationships with others that are outside of the reporting lineAbility to meet deadlines and work under aggressive time constraints, prioritizing multiple projects Employees at TDS, ranked as one of Madison Magazine's Best Places to Work, enjoy a robust total rewards package, flexible work culture, wellness programs, community involvement, tuition reimbursement and professional development. We offer outstanding growth potential! To learn more about this position or our company, please visit tds.jobs.  EEOSDL2017

Name: Technology Consultant MMIS - Madison, WI
Description: Job Description:Provide technology consulting to external customers and internal project teams. Responsible for providing technical support and/or leadership in the creation and delivery of technology solutions designed to meet customers’ business needs and, consequently, for understanding customers’ businesses. As trusted advisor create and maintain effective customer relationships so as to insure customer satisfaction. Maintain knowledge of leading edge technologies and industry/market domain knowledge. Actively contribute to the company’s solutions portfolio by providing information ranging from technical knowledge to methodologies based on experience gained from customer projects. Shape technical direction and technical strategies within the organization and for external customers. Accountable for consistent and significant chargeability levels (or expense relief for internal project teams) and for assisting in meeting or exceeding revenue and customer satisfaction goals. Contribute to organization’s profitability by generating and cultivating new business opportunities and by providing technical support for deal proposal development. Responsibilities:Responsible for implementing part or all of the technical solution to the client, in accordance with an agreed technical design.Occasionally responsible for providing a detailed technical design for enterprise solutions.Understands a broad spectrum of company technology in order to provide part or all of a detailed technical design which meets customer requirements.Often leads small to medium technical projects.Works with and under the direction of the Project/Technical Manager and with customer nominated representatives.Liaises with Solutions Architect as appropriate.Provides technical support and input on the application of technology to a defined business segment.Provides advice on solution and integration opportunities to defined segments.Provides technical leadership on specific integration activities that are part of an engagement.Provides planning and design support for the development of solution architectures that will be implemented in a multiple system environment.Communicates across client community, and is viewed as adding value.Demonstrates execution of the company strategy.Contributes to knowledge tools and communities, and ensures project learnings are documented and shared.Role models Knowledge sharing and re-use within practice or profession.Proactively encourages membership and contributions of others to professional community. Uses professions to meet the relevant certification and professional standards.Produces internally published material such as knowledge briefs, service delivery kit components or modules, etc.Participates in the selling process in C&I and works with sales/principals on pre- sales activities.Education and Experience Required:5+ years of professional experience and a Bachelor of Arts/Science or equivalent degree in computer science or related area of study; without a degree, three additional years of relevant professional experience (8+ years in total).Knowledge and Skills:Has sufficient depth and breadth of technical knowledge to be individually responsible for the design and scope of deliverables within a field of expertise.Has led small team in delivery of a specific deliverable.Has mastered at least one technical discipline with strong knowledge in at least three major technology areas.Possesses advanced level of business, technical, or functional knowledge.Has ability to perform/drive resolution of problems on combinations and interactions of products.Ability to apply technology and consulting to solve a client business problem.Able to communicate and present complex issues with assurance and confidence.Demonstrates the use of consulting skills including: questioning, listening, ideas development, permission and rapport, and influencing.Ability to conduct/lead oral status/technical interchange meetings with clients on small to medium sized engagements.Owns and produces customer documentation. Ability to translate technical details into concise and easy to understand written form. Ability to write relevant components of a proposal document (e.g. answer specific RFP questions). Ability to translate verbal requirements from face to face client meetings into requirements documents, statements of work, and proposals.Able to discuss (within own area of expertise) requirements with a customer, and to challenge and clarify when appropriate. From the requirements, able to develop a high level design or plan, and then estimate the amount of effort required to deliver. Able to advise the engagement owner about the risks associated with this work package.Ability to work with a team to provide written responses to technical proposals and /or reports/documentation for delivery.

Name: Business Intelligence Development Manager
Description: Trek Bicycle Corporation in Waterloo, WI is seeking to hire a Business Intelligence Development Manager. Here at Trek you will have the opportunity to work alongside the best in the business, build real-world solutions, and be part of a fun energetic team.  The BI Development Manager is responsible for managing the team of BI Developers and Database Administrators responsible for delivering BI solutions to the business. In this role, in addition to managing the team, you will be expected to contribute at a highly technical level to help deliver solutions. We are looking for a strong candidate that is capable of working independently. As a developer manager, you will be directly responsible for your team, technical direction as well as setting the technical standard for BI. Having the ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical resources will be key in this role.  The Business Intelligence team at Trek utilizes leading-edge BI tools available on the market. From Azure SQL DW, Azure Data Lake Store, SQL 2019, Power BI and the rest of the Azure stack, our team provides a critical business need that drives business decisions across the organization. The BI team is fast paced and fun team. Manager Responsibilities:Leading by Owning: Take responsibility for your own results, BI team results, company results, and values. Promote and teach team norms that include product ownership, a positive attitude, and accountability.Leading by Vision: From analyzing the situation inside and outside the company and seeing opportunities and communicating this vision of the company including new ideas for sustainable business strategies and ways of working.Connect people: Stimulate collaboration and growth in teams across functions, operations and different cultures. Share experience and knowledge that leads to an always learning organization, creating sustainable expertise which drives the development of people and innovative products.Leading by Delivery: Anticipate situations and take initiative to overcome them. The result is a swift and on time delivery of qualitative and quantitative results. Core Responsibilities Ensures data and analytical solutions are well engineered, operable, maintainable, and delivered on schedule. Responsible for the development, documentation, and compliance using best practices including but not limited to the following coding standards, platform, and framework specific design concerns.Ensures programs are architected, developed, and implemented across the enterprise to meet Trek's business needs. Interfaces with the other IT teams and functional areas to ensure that the most efficient solution is designed to meet business needsEnsure data accuracy and data integrity by proactively identifying problems/issues.Implement advanced and leading-edge solutions in collaboration with developers and analysts.implement routine program modifications, performance tuning, problem solving, debugging, and testing.Adhere to good systems development methodology.Provided technical and procedural support for less experienced team members; teaching improved processes; mentoring team members.Lead the technical architecture and the data warehouse technology stackEnsure performance by providing ongoing maintenance support through SQL query tuning and optimizationProvide ongoing support for all current BI projects.Participate in agile development teams, including interacting with both business analysts and end users to come up with well performing and scalable solutionsQUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTSBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline4 + years' hands-on experience developing business intelligence solutions.A minimum of two years' directly managing a BI/related team.Expert understanding of relational database theory, principles and best practicesExperience in big data or data LakesProduction experience with Azure Data services preferredExperience transforming legacy DW to big data is a plusExperience with data warehouse design and dimensional modelingAdvanced experience with writing SQL and stored proceduresExperience building ETL processes using SQL Server SSISExperience building OLAP cubes with SSAS and MDXExperience with Visual Studio Data projects and deploymentsExperience managing remote employeesMust have good knowledge of Data Warehouse managementMust have good knowledge of software engineering and architecture principlesExcellent written/verbal communication skillsExcellent interpersonal and organizational skills, ability to handle multiple projects and rapidly changing prioritiesMust be a self-starter who requires minimal supervision, with excellent problem-solving skills.Net Development experience in C# a plusExperience with agile development methodologies (Scrum) a plusSDL2017

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst
Description: DescriptionCompany Summary:Trek Bicycle is a global leader in the design and manufacture of bicycles and related products. Trek believes the bicycle can be a simple solution to many of the world's most complex problems, and is committed to breaking down the barriers that prevent people from using bicycles more often for transportation, recreation, and inspiration. Our mission is to create products we love and take care of our customers. We value our team, making sure the best is on the field. We value new ideas from anywhere, inspiring others with our positive energy, dealing with reality to make the tough calls, and getting things done fast- turning ideas into reality.Position Summary:Trek is looking to hire a strong analytical, experienced and driven person to drive working capital accountability through great analytics and reporting as a Sr. Financial Analyst in Supply Chain Finance. The role is a high profile position responsible for global working capital reporting and helping Trek maximize working capital. The ability to work with and influence business partners to drive good decision making around inventory will be critical to success in this role. Duties & Responsibilities:Responsible for global reporting and analytics around working capitalOwn & develop monthly working capital review meetingManage the annual budget and monthly forecast for global working capitalResponsible for the monthly close process around inventoryDevelop & drive inventory best practices and procedures globallyDevelop & drive best practices globally around accounting for inventory (cycle counting, physical inventory, etc.)Develop and track list of initiatives to improve working capital & provide modeling and analysis for these initiativesProactively identify and take a leadership role in driving working capital improvementProcess Improvement - Able to develop and document work processes. Name: Systems Analyst - Division of Medicaid Services
Description: State of Wisconsin Government Jobs - Job Announcement  The Official Employment Site of Wisconsin State Government  Home/Job Search  Application Information  Veterans  Benefits of State Employment  Current/Former State Employee  Diversity Zone  Labor and Service Positions  Short Term Employment Opportunities  Other Government Jobs  Contact Us  What's New  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer seeking a diverse and talented workforce.  Log In to  Email A FriendPrintable Version  Health Services, Department ofSystems Analyst - Division of Medicaid Services  Job Announcement Code(s): 18-03234 County(ies): Dane Classification Title: / JAC:Job Working Title:IS BUSINESS AUTOMATION SENIOR 18-03234 Systems Analyst IS BUSINESS AUTOMATION SPECIALIST 18-03234 Systems Analyst Type of Employment: Full Time (40 hrs/week) Salary: The starting salary for the Senior level is between $56,160 and $70,720 and is in pay schedule and range 07/34. The starting salary for the Specialist level is between $68,640 and $83,200 per year and is in pay schedule and range 07/33. A 12 month probationary period is required. Contact: Shannon Kavorik, Human Resources Specialist, ************, ********************************* Bargaining Unit: Non-Represented Area of Competition: Open Deadline to :11/21/2018Assessment Information:13663 - 224 IS BUSINESS AUTOMATION SPECIALIST Preview Assessment  The Wisconsin Department of Health Services (DHS), Division of Medicaid Services (DMS); Bureau of Adult Program and Policy (BAPP) is recruiting to fill two IS Business Analyst positions in Madison, Wisconsin.  DHS is located at 1 W. Wilson Street in the heart of downtown Madison; near the State Capitol and the Monona Terrace, the Wednesday Farmers' Market, the Madison Metro route and the Capital City bike path.  State of Wisconsin benefits include nearly 4 weeks of vacation, 9 paid holidays, ample sick time, a top rated health plan, multiple insurance options, and an exceptional retirement plan. In addition, DHS also offers free on-site yoga classes, indoor walking area and a supportive and collaborative work environment. Work hours are Monday through Friday. We offer a team-oriented atmosphere and a focus on work-life balance. Click here to see what working for the State of Wisconsin is all about!  Position Summary: Both positions are located within the IRIS Management Section (IMS). IRIS is the States program to provide health and long-term care to persons with disabilities and the elderly in a self-directed, consumer-focused setting. IRIS supports program participants achieving their long-term care outcomes in a cost effective manner based on self-determination principles. IRIS goal is to benefit Wisconsin citizens enrolled in the programs while achieving important cost savings for taxpayers. Wisconsins Self-Directed Information Technology System (WISITS) is a centralized case management system that supports the DHS IRIS Program. The system is supported by a web-based software application and utilized by DHS staff and DHS contractors.  Senior Level: Responsible for assisting in development and enhancement of WISITS system functionality and reporting and extract requirements. Responsibilities include: user account and security role definition and maintenance, identification and definition of business rules and workflows, form development and maintenance, data extract development maintenance and analysis and formal reporting standards and requirements. Another primary function of the systems analyst will be to conduct user acceptance testing of new or modified functionality. IMS is heavily reliant upon external providers conducting testing of new or modified functionality. This position is responsible for the functioning of the new features and end-to-end testing and assisting in the extraction of routine and ad-hoc data reports. These reports are critical to the health and safety of the participants served as well as to the required federal compliance of the 1915 (c) waiver authority governing the IRIS program. The data reporting and extracts include level of care eligibility reports, enrollment, service utilization, authorizations, outcome based service relationships, critical incidents, deaths, disenrollment, appeals, grievances, and qualified provider credentialing.  Specialist Level: Responsible for continued development and enhancement of system functionality and reporting and extract requirements. This position translates manual processes or those processes conducted outside of the WISITS system into business rules and work flows in order to be incorporated into the system. This system includes: critical incident reporting, budget amendment and one-time expense requests, notice of action, disenrollment, fraud monitoring and detection, provider accreditation, appeals and grievances, record review collection, cost share ledger, and other reporting. The Specialist works with external contract providers to identify barriers to provide efficient delivery of IRIS services. This position provides support to IRIS consultant staff and develops recommendations regarding program and policy enhancements that directly correlate to case management system changes and enhancements. This position also works with contracted Fiscal Employer Agents. This work includes supporting the processing of participant hired worker timesheets and provider claims to make processing of this information more accurate and decrease opportunities for fraud, abuse, and/or human error in claim processing. Overall, this position is responsible for the development of recommendations related to the WISITS case management system regarding changes to policy, business rules and work flows to increase efficiency in program administration, intuitiveness and cost effectiveness of system development and maintenance.  Special Notes: Due to the nature of the position, all applicants who may be appointed will be required to allow DHS to conduct a background check to determine whether the circumstances of any conviction may be related to the job being filled. Qualifications: Minimum requirements for the IS Business Automation Senior and Specialist level are: Experience analyzing and facilitating business automation needs for a business or program performing tasks such as defining business requirements, conducting User Acceptance Testing, evaluating business process solutions, etc.Experience providing technical assistance or training to end-users related to IT systems or software.Experience communicating with IT developers in regard to system issues.Excellent written and oral communication skills. Additional minimum qualifications for the IS Business Automation Specialist level are: Experience researching and recommending system changes or enhancements OR experience in data analytics. Well qualified candidates will also have experience with WISITS and experience with community based long-term care support programs. How To : Click on the Preview Assessment link near the top of this announcement to view the qualifications that will be evaluated in the initial part of the selection process.  To be considered for this position applicants must complete the online process by uploading a resume and letter of qualifications in a Word or PDF compatible format.. Failure to submit all required materials will result in an incomplete application and ineligibility for this position. Application materials will not be accepted if received in an email, as a hard copy or a fax.  Your resume and letter of qualifications are very important parts of your application at DHS and is used during our evaluation process to determine your qualifications as they relate to this job. For suggestions on what to include when developing your resume and letter, please click here. Applicants deemed eligible will be invited to participate in the next step of the selection process.  Permanent classified state employees who are eligible for consideration (transfer, voluntary demotion, or former employees as a reinstatement) must complete the online application process to apply. Name: Senior Consultant - Energy - Organizational Transformation - Remote
Description: Navigant Consulting, Inc. (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant?s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant?s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com.  With over 600 consultants, Navigant?s global Energy practice is the largest energy management consulting team in the industry. We collaborate with utilities, government and NGOs, industries and large corporations, product manufacturers, and investors to help them thrive in a rapidly changing energy environment. Our clients include the world?s 50 largest electric, water, and gas utilities; the 20 largest independent power generators; and the 20 largest gas distribution and pipeline companies. Navigant?s seasoned professionals and highly skilled specialists form exceptional teams to help clients transform their businesses, manage complexity and accelerate operational performance, meet compliance requirements, and transform systems and governance to address upcoming changes as the energy transformation takes hold.  Navigant was awarded the contract by the Government of Puerto Rico through the Central Office of Recovery, Reconstruction, and Resilience (COR3). Bringing reliable and affordable power to Puerto Rico is critical to the island?s economy and the well-being of its residents. With Navigant?s expertise across power systems generation, T&D, distributed energy resources, and grid modernization, Navigant is uniquely positioned to deliver on key objectives for a more resilient, customer-centric, and sustainable energy system for the people of Puerto Rico.  The Organizational Transformation Analyst is responsible for working with Navigant PMO, technical advisors and external stakeholders including clients to implement change management methodologies, build organizational capability and lead cultural adoption. The OT Analyst will support creation and implementation of change management plans (including the integration of communications and training) for raising awareness about energy system transformation, coaching sponsors and leaders, involving employees in the design of the change, getting employees ready for the change, accelerating the transition from current to future states and achieving the benefits of the change Responsibilities: + Manages the change management process and applies change management tools in support of a project or initiative  + Builds change management skills and supports other change management practitioners  + Assists with implementing provision change management tools  + Supports design, development, delivery, and management of communications  + Conducts impact analysis, assesses change readiness, and identifies key stakeholders  + Provides input, supports document requirements, and designs and delivers training programs  + Consults and coaches project teams on change management  + Creates change management strategies  + Work within a team environment to build internal capacity and efficiencies, as well as promote a culture of continuous improvement.  + 2 -4 years of experience in the electric utility or consulting industry  + Change management, process improvement experience preferred  + Excellent written & verbal communication skills  + Strong Presentation, PowerPoint & Excel skills (Advanced)  + Demonstrated organization skills with the ability to multi task effectively in a high-volume environment while maintaining adherence to deadlines and priorities  + Strong knowledge and experience working with large data sets, determining the key data points and being able to concisely summarize it for senior management.  + BS required/MS preferred  + MBA or Masters preferred  + PMP preferred  + Travel required  + Frequently communicates with clients and coworkers and must be able to share information effectively  + Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills  + Work as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independently  + Flexibility and responsiveness in managing multiple projects in sometimes high-pressure situations simultaneously  + Able to travel via airplane with minimal assistance to client sites across the US and potentially internationally  + Usually remains stationary for the majority of the day  + Regularly uses close visual acuity and operates computer equipment to prepare and analyze and transmit data  The company offers competitive compensation packages including an incentive compensation plan, comprehensive medical/dental/life insurance, 401(k) and employee stock purchase plans. *_Navigant does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Navigant and Navigant will not be obligated to pay a placement fee._***Navigant** is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation. Navigant will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law or ordinance including the Fair Chance Ordinance of Los Angeles and San Francisco.
