Name: Intacct Implementation Consultant
Description: Overview  Technology has changed the way businesses function -- both internally across the enterprise and externally with vendors and customers. The ability to adopt new technologies is vital to an organization's growth and ability to compete. Baker Tilly's Technology Solutions team helps clients utilize Intacct, the only cloud accounting software company to be appointed a preferred provider by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA), to improve business efficiency and drive business forward.  We are currently seeking an Intacct Implementation Consultant to join our Baker Tilly Technology Solutions team in Austin, Chicago, DC, or Madison! In this fast-paced and challenging role, you will utilize your well-polished interpersonal skills and technical abilities as you work alongside clients to plan and execute Intacct implementations.  It's an exciting time to join Baker Tilly!  Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a nationally recognized, full-service accounting and advisory firm whose specialized professionals connect with clients and their businesses through refreshing candor and clear industry insight. With approximately 2,700 employees across the United States, Baker Tilly is ranked as one of the 15 largest accounting and advisory firms in the country. Headquartered in Chicago, Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 147 territories, with over 33,000 professionals. The combined worldwide revenue of independent member firms is $3.4 billion.  Baker Tilly Annual Report 2017 ResponsibilitiesPrepare documentation of client needs and business processesSetup and configure Intacct software to meet customer requirementsDevelop test scripts for customers' testing phaseAssist customers in extracting data from legacy systemsConvert extracted data into IntacctDevelop reports and dashboards utilizing the Intacct toolsSetup and configure integrated 3rd party solutionsProvide end-user training on Intacct and related integrated productsProvide ongoing product technical support to internal and external customersQualificationsBachelor's degree in accounting, information systems, or related field. Some experience working in an accounting environment is preferred.1-2 years of previous software implementation/training experience is requiredExperience using or implementing Intacct software is strongly preferredStrong Microsoft Suite skills (Word, Excel)Exhibit a sense of urgency and commitment to quality and the timely completion of dutiesExcellent verbal and written communication, presentation and people skillsOccasional overnight travel may be requiredSDL2017

Name: Systems Analyst - Division of Medicaid Services
Description: State of Wisconsin Government Jobs - Job Announcement  The Official Employment Site of Wisconsin State Government  Home/Job Search  Application Information  Veterans  Benefits of State Employment  Current/Former State Employee  Diversity Zone  Labor and Service Positions  Short Term Employment Opportunities  Other Government Jobs  Contact Us  What's New  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer seeking a diverse and talented workforce.  Log In to  Email A FriendPrintable Version  Health Services, Department ofSystems Analyst - Division of Medicaid Services  Job Announcement Code(s): 18-03234 County(ies): Dane Classification Title: / JAC:Job Working Title:IS BUSINESS AUTOMATION SENIOR 18-03234 Systems Analyst IS BUSINESS AUTOMATION SPECIALIST 18-03234 Systems Analyst Type of Employment: Full Time (40 hrs/week) Salary: The starting salary for the Senior level is between $56,160 and $70,720 and is in pay schedule and range 07/34. The starting salary for the Specialist level is between $68,640 and $83,200 per year and is in pay schedule and range 07/33. A 12 month probationary period is required. Contact: Shannon Kavorik, Human Resources Specialist, ************, ********************************* Bargaining Unit: Non-Represented Area of Competition: Open Deadline to :11/21/2018Assessment Information:13663 - 224 IS BUSINESS AUTOMATION SPECIALIST Preview Assessment  The Wisconsin Department of Health Services (DHS), Division of Medicaid Services (DMS); Bureau of Adult Program and Policy (BAPP) is recruiting to fill two IS Business Analyst positions in Madison, Wisconsin.  DHS is located at 1 W. Wilson Street in the heart of downtown Madison; near the State Capitol and the Monona Terrace, the Wednesday Farmers' Market, the Madison Metro route and the Capital City bike path.  State of Wisconsin benefits include nearly 4 weeks of vacation, 9 paid holidays, ample sick time, a top rated health plan, multiple insurance options, and an exceptional retirement plan. In addition, DHS also offers free on-site yoga classes, indoor walking area and a supportive and collaborative work environment. Work hours are Monday through Friday. We offer a team-oriented atmosphere and a focus on work-life balance. Click here to see what working for the State of Wisconsin is all about!  Position Summary: Both positions are located within the IRIS Management Section (IMS). IRIS is the States program to provide health and long-term care to persons with disabilities and the elderly in a self-directed, consumer-focused setting. IRIS supports program participants achieving their long-term care outcomes in a cost effective manner based on self-determination principles. IRIS goal is to benefit Wisconsin citizens enrolled in the programs while achieving important cost savings for taxpayers. Wisconsins Self-Directed Information Technology System (WISITS) is a centralized case management system that supports the DHS IRIS Program. The system is supported by a web-based software application and utilized by DHS staff and DHS contractors.  Senior Level: Responsible for assisting in development and enhancement of WISITS system functionality and reporting and extract requirements. Responsibilities include: user account and security role definition and maintenance, identification and definition of business rules and workflows, form development and maintenance, data extract development maintenance and analysis and formal reporting standards and requirements. Another primary function of the systems analyst will be to conduct user acceptance testing of new or modified functionality. IMS is heavily reliant upon external providers conducting testing of new or modified functionality. This position is responsible for the functioning of the new features and end-to-end testing and assisting in the extraction of routine and ad-hoc data reports. These reports are critical to the health and safety of the participants served as well as to the required federal compliance of the 1915 (c) waiver authority governing the IRIS program. The data reporting and extracts include level of care eligibility reports, enrollment, service utilization, authorizations, outcome based service relationships, critical incidents, deaths, disenrollment, appeals, grievances, and qualified provider credentialing.  Specialist Level: Responsible for continued development and enhancement of system functionality and reporting and extract requirements. This position translates manual processes or those processes conducted outside of the WISITS system into business rules and work flows in order to be incorporated into the system. This system includes: critical incident reporting, budget amendment and one-time expense requests, notice of action, disenrollment, fraud monitoring and detection, provider accreditation, appeals and grievances, record review collection, cost share ledger, and other reporting. The Specialist works with external contract providers to identify barriers to provide efficient delivery of IRIS services. This position provides support to IRIS consultant staff and develops recommendations regarding program and policy enhancements that directly correlate to case management system changes and enhancements. This position also works with contracted Fiscal Employer Agents. This work includes supporting the processing of participant hired worker timesheets and provider claims to make processing of this information more accurate and decrease opportunities for fraud, abuse, and/or human error in claim processing. Overall, this position is responsible for the development of recommendations related to the WISITS case management system regarding changes to policy, business rules and work flows to increase efficiency in program administration, intuitiveness and cost effectiveness of system development and maintenance.  Special Notes: Due to the nature of the position, all applicants who may be appointed will be required to allow DHS to conduct a background check to determine whether the circumstances of any conviction may be related to the job being filled. Qualifications: Minimum requirements for the IS Business Automation Senior and Specialist level are: Experience analyzing and facilitating business automation needs for a business or program performing tasks such as defining business requirements, conducting User Acceptance Testing, evaluating business process solutions, etc.Experience providing technical assistance or training to end-users related to IT systems or software.Experience communicating with IT developers in regard to system issues.Excellent written and oral communication skills. Additional minimum qualifications for the IS Business Automation Specialist level are: Experience researching and recommending system changes or enhancements OR experience in data analytics. Well qualified candidates will also have experience with WISITS and experience with community based long-term care support programs. How To : Click on the Preview Assessment link near the top of this announcement to view the qualifications that will be evaluated in the initial part of the selection process.  To be considered for this position applicants must complete the online process by uploading a resume and letter of qualifications in a Word or PDF compatible format.. Failure to submit all required materials will result in an incomplete application and ineligibility for this position. Application materials will not be accepted if received in an email, as a hard copy or a fax.  Your resume and letter of qualifications are very important parts of your application at DHS and is used during our evaluation process to determine your qualifications as they relate to this job. For suggestions on what to include when developing your resume and letter, please click here. Applicants deemed eligible will be invited to participate in the next step of the selection process.  Permanent classified state employees who are eligible for consideration (transfer, voluntary demotion, or former employees as a reinstatement) must complete the online application process to apply. Name: Senior Consultant - Energy - Organizational Transformation - Remote
Description: Navigant Consulting, Inc. (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant?s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant?s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com.  With over 600 consultants, Navigant?s global Energy practice is the largest energy management consulting team in the industry. We collaborate with utilities, government and NGOs, industries and large corporations, product manufacturers, and investors to help them thrive in a rapidly changing energy environment. Our clients include the world?s 50 largest electric, water, and gas utilities; the 20 largest independent power generators; and the 20 largest gas distribution and pipeline companies. Navigant?s seasoned professionals and highly skilled specialists form exceptional teams to help clients transform their businesses, manage complexity and accelerate operational performance, meet compliance requirements, and transform systems and governance to address upcoming changes as the energy transformation takes hold.  Navigant was awarded the contract by the Government of Puerto Rico through the Central Office of Recovery, Reconstruction, and Resilience (COR3). Bringing reliable and affordable power to Puerto Rico is critical to the island?s economy and the well-being of its residents. With Navigant?s expertise across power systems generation, T&D, distributed energy resources, and grid modernization, Navigant is uniquely positioned to deliver on key objectives for a more resilient, customer-centric, and sustainable energy system for the people of Puerto Rico.  The Organizational Transformation Analyst is responsible for working with Navigant PMO, technical advisors and external stakeholders including clients to implement change management methodologies, build organizational capability and lead cultural adoption. The OT Analyst will support creation and implementation of change management plans (including the integration of communications and training) for raising awareness about energy system transformation, coaching sponsors and leaders, involving employees in the design of the change, getting employees ready for the change, accelerating the transition from current to future states and achieving the benefits of the change Responsibilities: + Manages the change management process and applies change management tools in support of a project or initiative  + Builds change management skills and supports other change management practitioners  + Assists with implementing provision change management tools  + Supports design, development, delivery, and management of communications  + Conducts impact analysis, assesses change readiness, and identifies key stakeholders  + Provides input, supports document requirements, and designs and delivers training programs  + Consults and coaches project teams on change management  + Creates change management strategies  + Work within a team environment to build internal capacity and efficiencies, as well as promote a culture of continuous improvement.  + 2 -4 years of experience in the electric utility or consulting industry  + Change management, process improvement experience preferred  + Excellent written & verbal communication skills  + Strong Presentation, PowerPoint & Excel skills (Advanced)  + Demonstrated organization skills with the ability to multi task effectively in a high-volume environment while maintaining adherence to deadlines and priorities  + Strong knowledge and experience working with large data sets, determining the key data points and being able to concisely summarize it for senior management.  + BS required/MS preferred  + MBA or Masters preferred  + PMP preferred  + Travel required  + Frequently communicates with clients and coworkers and must be able to share information effectively  + Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills  + Work as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independently  + Flexibility and responsiveness in managing multiple projects in sometimes high-pressure situations simultaneously  + Able to travel via airplane with minimal assistance to client sites across the US and potentially internationally  + Usually remains stationary for the majority of the day  + Regularly uses close visual acuity and operates computer equipment to prepare and analyze and transmit data  The company offers competitive compensation packages including an incentive compensation plan, comprehensive medical/dental/life insurance, 401(k) and employee stock purchase plans. *_Navigant does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Navigant and Navigant will not be obligated to pay a placement fee._***Navigant** is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation. Navigant will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law or ordinance including the Fair Chance Ordinance of Los Angeles and San Francisco.

Name: PeopleSoft Analyst II - 9.2 Financials/nVision
Description: CCI's candidate must be an expert in understanding the functional and technical capabilities of the PeopleSoft nVision, PeopleSoft Query and PeopleSoft reporting in general. The primary responsibility for this engagement is upgrading nVision reporting for our 9.2 implementation of PeopleSoft Financials. Additional responsibilities include development of training documentation for nVision reporting and using the Reporting Console. Our institution currently uses many of the PeopleSoft Financials modules including Grants, AP/PO, Expenses, Asset Management, Cash Management and General Ledger modules, therefore this engagement will require knowledge of the interfaces between these modules to support the production activities relating to PeopleSoft Financials and Supply Chain V9.1. Project Scope: PeopleSoft Financials (SFS) is the University of Wisconsin System's Financial system using Oracle's PeopleSoft Financials and Supply Chain Management software 9.1 using PeopleTools 8.55 on Oracle 11.2. The goal is to provide knowledge and expertise on nVision and PeopleSoft Reporting for all of the client's Institutions.  This position is for a PeopleSoft Analyst to get expertise on PeopleSoft Query and nVision using the client's policies and procedures around functional testing and development.  Requirement: Must be able to travel to the University of Wisconsin-Madison. QualificationsExcellent oral and written communication skills. Name: Managing Consultant - Senior Research Analyst - Remote
Description: Navigant Consulting, Inc. (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant?s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant?s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com.  We work with energy leaders to aggressively strengthen their enterprises and help them make choices that ensure energy reliability, efficiency, and serviceability, as well as improve business performance. We focus on issues across the entire electric and natural gas energy value chain including fuels, generation (renewable, fossil, hydro, nuclear), transmission, energy markets, energy delivery, and consumption (including energy efficiency and demand response).  Navigant Research, a part of Navigant?s global Energy Practice, is a market research and consulting team that provides in-depth analysis of the global clean, distributed, intelligent, and mobile energy ecosystem. The team's research methodology combines supply-side industry analysis, end-user primary research and demand assessment, and deep examination of emerging technology trends to provide a comprehensive view of these industry sectors.  Navigant Research is seeking a senior research analyst to cover commercial electrification manufacturing and drivetrains.  Responsibilities include authoring research reports and briefs, creating quantitative models and forecasts, interacting with clients and the press, authoring articles for industry publications, delivering presentations, and contributing to consulting engagements. This position requires the ability to effectively communicate thought-provoking and original analytical findings to a client base that includes utilities, technology companies, service providers, the investor community, industry organizations, and government agencies.  Candidates should have a relationship with OEMs as well as strong knowledge and proven expertise in commercial transportation electrification and alternative fuels. Understanding of business aspects related to emerging demand-side transportation technologies and impact on power and utility markets is preferred, including:  + Commercial transportation electrification  + Electric vehicles  + Vehicle-to-grid  + Vehicle efficiency  + ?Alternative fuels  + A minimum of Bachelor?s Degree in journalism, business, economics, engineering or related higher education qualifications; graduate degree preferred.  + Minimum of 5 years? experience direct industry experience.  + Exceptional writing skills  + Solid quantitative analysis, ability to create forecasts in Excel using assumptions gleaned from primary research and existing infrastructure databases  + Strong secondary research / information discovery and aggregation skills  + Good interviewing skills  + Excellent presentation skills and executive presence  + Experience dealing with clients and delivering high-quality and responsive client service / international client experience preferred  + Technology market research / industry analysis experience is strongly preferred  + Frequently communicates with clients and coworkers and must be able to share information effectively  + Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills  + Work as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independently  + Flexibility and responsiveness in managing multiple projects in sometimes high-pressure situations simultaneously  + Able to travel via airplane with minimal assistance to client sites across the US and potentially internationally  + Usually remains stationary for the majority of the day  + Regularly uses close visual acuity and operates computer equipment to prepare and analyze and transmit data  The company offers competitive compensation packages including an incentive compensation plan, comprehensive medical/dental/life insurance, 401(k) and employee stock purchase plans. *_Navigant does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. Name: Sr. Financial Analyst
Description: DescriptionCompany Summary:Trek Bicycle is a global leader in the design and manufacture of bicycles and related products. Trek believes the bicycle can be a simple solution to many of the world's most complex problems, and is committed to breaking down the barriers that prevent people from using bicycles more often for transportation, recreation, and inspiration. Our mission is to create products we love and take care of our customers. We value our team, making sure the best is on the field. We value new ideas from anywhere, inspiring others with our positive energy, dealing with reality to make the tough calls, and getting things done fast- turning ideas into reality.Position Summary:Trek is looking to hire a strong analytical, experienced and driven person to drive working capital accountability through great analytics and reporting as a Sr. Financial Analyst in Supply Chain Finance. The role is a high profile position responsible for global working capital reporting and helping Trek maximize working capital. The ability to work with and influence business partners to drive good decision making around inventory will be critical to success in this role. Duties & Responsibilities:Responsible for global reporting and analytics around working capitalOwn & develop monthly working capital review meetingManage the annual budget and monthly forecast for global working capitalResponsible for the monthly close process around inventoryDevelop & drive inventory best practices and procedures globallyDevelop & drive best practices globally around accounting for inventory (cycle counting, physical inventory, etc.)Develop and track list of initiatives to improve working capital & provide modeling and analysis for these initiativesProactively identify and take a leadership role in driving working capital improvementProcess Improvement - Able to develop and document work processes. Able to drive harmonization of processes and pursue continuous improvement.Special projects as assignedSkills & Experience:Minimum of a bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or related field5-10 years finance/accounting experience, with at least 3-5 years in an analytical roleExperience in inventory and working capital strongly desiredAdvanced level of technical experience with systems and excel reporting capabilitiesDemonstrated success in roles requiring strong analytical and systems skillsStrong analytical and problem solving skillsExperience with analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutionsHighly organized & ability to build strong processesAbility to build strong relationships with business partners and senior leaders to drive changeAbility to manage the details as well as communicate with and influence senior leadersWe are an E-Verify employer.For more information, please click on the following links: E-Verify Participation Poster: English / Spanish  E-Verify Right to Work Poster: English | Spanish

Name: International CS Analyst
Description: SUMMARY The International Customer Service Analyst is primarily responsible for processing international customer orders, coordinating international order preparation with all departments, arranging export shipments, export compliance, export documentation, answering customer inquiries, handling complaints and driving continuous improvement. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Receive and respond to customer communications consisting of inquiries, quotes, orders, complaints and returns while ensuring high customer satisfaction with proper paperwork.  Process and insure accuracy of orders and coordinate export order preparation with the shipping department including obtaining quotes and coordinating logistics with freight forwarders.  Prepare export documents in compliance with Export Administration Regulations  Collaborate with Accounting/Credit Department to maintain current customer balances.  Maintain customer master file data and complete customer inquiry and complaint forms, as needed  Ability to obtain HAZMAT certification for IMO, IATA and DOT regulated shipments and prepare documents accordingly.  Prepare and analyze monthly duty drawback reports for US imports and exports.  Resolves order issues with the customer regarding pricing, availability, terms and delivery  Edit and clarify order details upon receipt and initiates the order processing cycle  Manage shipping consolidations schedule to conform to customer requirements as the regional fulfilment strategy matures.  Manage, track, and maintain outgoing shipments for International via backlog and shipping reports.  Other duties as assigned by International Operations Manager  Understand and comply with the Mueller Quality System and current regulatory requirements. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS The physical requirements for this position are typical of a normal office environment.  Sitting, standing and walking, up to 9 hours a day.  Talking and hearing on the phone and in person.  Occasional lifting up to 20 pounds. WORK ENVIRONMENT The employee will work in an office environment. QUALIFICATIONS Bachelors degree in Supply Chain, Business or equivalent  Strong communication and organizational skills with the ability to multi-task.  Prior experience with ERP systems, SAP experience would be beneficial.  Able to make decisions and work independently  Ability to effectively in a team environment, with demonstrated problem-solving skills  Ability to develop relationships, both inside and outside the company.  Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Bilingual English/Spanish at a Proficient Level  Previous international customer service experience  Prior experience working with freight forwarders  Knowledge of banking (Drafts and Letters of Credits)  Experience with the international order and export documentation processes  HazMat/Dangerous Goods Certification  Job Type: Full-time  Education: Bachelor's (Preferred)

Name: PeopleSoft Academic Advising Implementation Consultant
Description: Company DescriptionComputerConsultantsInternational, Inc. (CCI) is an IT Consulting Firm with more than 18 years experience providing effective, expert-level services in industries such as Construction, Technology, Finance, Healthcare, and Government. CCI focuses on building long-term relationships while completing projects from design to delivery. People are CCI's key component for success. Recruiting utmost-quality individuals for our clients, CCI fields a workforce of individuals who are selected not only because of their technical qualifications but also for their achievements as substantial, contributing human beings. In government work and in the commercial market, high standards of ethics and accountability are critical. Therefore our people are chosen for their integrity and ability to maintain relationships, as well as expertise in their field. To learn more about CCI, visit us online at www.cci-worldwide.com.Job DescriptionSeeking one (1) highly motivated and capable person to help configure Campus  Solution Academic Advising processes to better meet business needs. This work includes helping reengineer AA functionality to reduce customizations, decrease processing time and improve day to day service transactions as well as documentation of student/staff  interactions. This role requires someone with strong experience in AA day-to-day activities using the PeopleSoft Campus Solutions system and first-hand knowledge of the regulations and procedures for advising for professional and faculty advising.  This is a strategic position that impacts core student application and data environment; hence the position has an enterprise focus. The position has cross-organization scope within the College and Technology Services. This position will work with the department of Student Development and Retention to assess and document current functionality of processes, provide recommendations and justification for improvements, and create, write, and implement new processes and procedures designed to improve students experience in working through all aspects of the advising process. This position works with teams of professionals to design, develop, and support the colleges advisors and provide guidance to promote and enhance consistency of services to all students.  This position will coordinate with CARES Title III Project (CT3 Project) to help implement new advising processes into the myRoadmap solution being developed by the CT3 team to provide transparency to the processes of advising. The goal of the CT3 Project is to move towards a collaborative enterprise model creating a 360-degree view for our students through improved collection of data, better analysis, automated presentation of data to our students, faculty, and staff, and creating valuable performance measures.  This position will report directly to the CIO in Technology Services. Desired Behaviors • Proactive operates with and communicates to all stakeholders and co-workers  • Meets commitments and is upfront and proactive in communicating when goals are in jeopardy  • Analyze issues, proposes solutions, and then takes ownership of the execution of solutions  • Work effectively with a variety of personalities and work styles  • Ability to prioritize issues and resolve them  • Act with integrity at all times  • Work to understands college governance model and operate effectively within it Period of Performance: Up to 9 months with possible extensionQualifications Review, analyzes and evaluates academic advising business systems and user needs/requirementsAssess needs for the application and any required integrationsWork independently with staff to assist, guide and mentor them to identify solutionsParticipate as a team member to achieve successful business process reengineeringCommunicate status to management and teamsAn educational background with a Bachelors degree or higherMust have solid competency in configuration and implementation of the PeopleSoft AcademicAdvising and 3 Cs Module5+ years in PeopleSoft Academic AdvisingImplementation or Process Re-engineeringConsultant role6+ years of experience working with an academic institutionStrong data, application and integration skills.Strong process definition skillsExperience creating workflow diagrams,relationship maps, use cases, and test plans.Outstanding verbal and written communication skills are essential.Well-developed skills with Visio and WordExperienced working in a deadline-drivenenvironment, handling and prioritizing multiple tasks.Demonstrated record of accomplishment ofsuccessful project delivery.Excellent conceptual, problem solving, andanalytical skills.Ability to work independently or as a member of a team on complex tasks.Demonstrated competency in documentingsolutions for both technical and functional audiences.Experience with testing, including end-to-endsystem testing and user acceptance testing. Additional InformationFor immediate consideration, please send your resume to career(at)cci-worldwide.com with " PeopleSoft Academic Advising Implementation Consultant (JobID 505ENT-M12-SERVICESIT-01) - WI

Name: Implementation Consultant, Installed Accounts
Description: Tyler Technologies is experiencing significant growth and we are hiring Implementation Consultants to provide training and implementation assistance for new and existing Tyler clients.. Join our growing team of Implementation Consultants who work with our clients all over the country. While being fully supported, you will train clients online and onsite in the proper techniques for installing Tyler's products in addition to providing training in the use of related Tyler software. At Tyler Technologies, we devote all of our time, energy and resources to help local governments and school districts become more efficient, accessible and responsive to the needs of their constituents. With more than 4,600 employees (and growing), Tyler has a proven track record of supporting its employee's careers and lives.  Location  Madison, Wisconsin  Travel 90%ResponsibilitiesWork with colleagues and managers to implement and proactively manage a superior technology solution for our clients.Understand clients' business processes and configure applications based on business needs and accepted best practices.Provide implementation support to new clients by leading customers through the implementation process, communicating with those involved to ensure that implementation is completed and any issues are resolved so client can be successfully utilizing the product. Train users in system set up, administration and maintenanceAssure client satisfaction and successful implementation.Identify and report software gaps (work closely with our development team and impact future features and functionality of our products)Proof and analyze data conversionsContinuously evaluate implementation and training procedures and make improvements to facilitate the best possible customer experience. After implementation is complete, provide future training to clients on an as needed basis via telephone and GoToMeeting.Create user documentationConduct 12-15 days of billable training per month and maintain an organized training schedule.Complete training summaries specific to the client following the training to assist other Tyler staff in providing quality customer care.QualificationsAn Associate's degree OR 2+ years comparable experience in technical training and/or technical support OR a Bachelor's degree in business administration or related field, or comparable work experienceThe ability to solve technical problems, dive in to softwareThe ability to travel extensively (90%) overnight to client sites throughout the U.S.A Valid driver's license and acceptable driving recordExcellent interpersonal and customer services skillsStrong problem-solving skillsExceptional presentation and training skillsExperience with technical training and/or technical customer service experienceFamiliarity and ease with computer systems and common software productsKnowledge of tablet and other mobile technologiesExperience with school district organizations, municipal offices and their technological needsSDL2017

Name: Senior Consultant - Energy, CEP, Process - Campus
Description: *NAVIGANT** (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant?s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant?s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com. Navigant has been recognized as one of the Top Healthcare, Energy and Economic Consulting Firms by Vault.com and as a 2018 Best Mid-Size Employer by Forbes. Visit www.navigant.com/careers. for more information.*Navigant?s Clean Energy Programs** team advances the full lifecycle of distributed energy resource (DER) programs through research, analytics, evaluation and market strategies that foster our clients? success in a clean energy future. We understand how customers use energy and interact with their energy provider, the value they draw from energy programs and services, and how these initiatives ultimately benefit society. We are industry-leading experts in: + Strategic planning  + Market assessments  + Forecasting and potential studies  + Engineering and data analytics  + Program design and implementation assistance  + Evaluation, measurement and verification (EM&V) services.  The energy sector is undergoing transformational change. Emerging technologies and societal demand promise to reshape not only the energy we use, but also how we use it. Navigant collaborates with energy industry clients by helping them anticipate where the energy industry is headed and how they can improve performance, grow, and address consumer and regulatory demands. *Our Values** + We are inspired by a steadfast commitment to excellence and strive to earn the lasting trust of our clients by consistently exceeding their expectations  + We are committed to the continuous development of our people and celebrate our individual and collective growth and achievements  + We build our firm with an entrepreneurial spirit, fueled by dynamic teamwork and collaboration, and founded on trust and respect for each other  + We believe integrity, dedication and perspective are the keys to ensuring our enduring prosperity and success.  This role can be based in any of the following locations: **Boulder, CO; Verona, WI; Burlington, VT; Chicago, IL; Burlington, MA; San Francisco, CA; Washington, DC**  We are seeking candidates to join our Clean Energy Programs group as part of the Process Evaluation and Customer Experience Team. As members of our team, consultants work with clients involved in a wide range of energy-related activities, particularly in the field of distributed energy resource (DER) strategies including energy efficiency, renewable energy, and demand management. The consultant will perform a wide range of activities including DER program evaluation, program and policy planning, and market and technology assessments. This includes involvement and interaction with utility companies, program implementers, government agencies, industry representatives, trade organizations, end-use customers, and efficiency advocates. *Specific activities may include:** + Providing detailed fact finding, research, and analysis  + Continuous improvement evaluation of DER programs  + Assessing utility customer experience with DER technologies and programs  + Developing customer engagement strategies for utilities, government, and energy companies  + Analyzing technology trends with a focus on how utility customers experience said technologies  + Communicating solutions and new strategies to clients through reports and presentations  + A degree with an emphasis on human-centric research and design, analysis, logical reasoning, and/or problem solving (e.g., social science, economics, market research, etc.)  + Experience conducting primary and secondary research such as surveys, in-depth interviews, and logic modeling  + Strong interest in energy efficiency, renewable energy, and sustainability  + An inquisitive nature and desire for continuous improvement  + Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills  + Excellent verbal and written communication skills  + Superior interpersonal skills  + Highly developed organizational and management skills  + Ability to manage multiple time-sensitive priorities without diminished effectiveness  + Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, as well as SPSS or other statistical software is ideal, but not required  + Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills  + Work as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independently  + Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment to coordinate work  + Frequently travels by airplane, train or car as necessary to perform work at another location  + Regularly uses close visual acuity and operates computer equipment to prepare and analyze and transmit data  + Generally works in an office environment  The company offers competitive compensation packages including an incentive compensation plan, comprehensive medical/dental/life insurance, 401(k) and employee stock purchase plans. *_Navigant does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Navigant and Navigant will not be obligated to pay a placement fee._***Navigant** is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation. Navigant will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law or ordinance including the Fair Chance Ordinance of Los Angeles and San Francisco.

This role can be based in any of the following locations: **Boulder, CO; Verona, WI; Burlington, VT; Chicago, IL; Burlington, MA; San Francisco, CA; Washington, DC**  We are seeking candidates to join our Clean Energy Programs group as part of the Data Analytics & Modeling Team. As members of our team, consultants work with clients involved in a wide range of energy-related activities, particularly in the field of distributed energy resource (DER) strategies including energy efficiency, demand response, renewable energy, electric vehicles and energy storage. packages), Python, Analytica, Matlab, SAS or Stata.  + Demonstrated proficiency with spreadsheets, databases, word processing, and slide presentation software  + Experience with SQL database queries and development, web-based data viewers (PowerBI, Shiny R, and/or Spotfire), or GIS platforms (QGIS and/or ArcGIS) is a plus  + Proficiency in linux shell scripting, git, cron scheduling, MS PowerShell and similar tools for automating data tasks and pipelines is a plus  + Ability to self teach using internet searches, forums, stack overflow, and by reading help docs and source code on github is a plus  + Academic background and/or practical experience in Hadoop or Spark big data analysis, statistics, machine learning, System Dynamics, linear and nonlinear optimization, Monte Carlo analysis, risk analysis and decision theory, or consumer choice analysis is a plus  + Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills  + Work as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independently  + Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment to coordinate work  + Frequently travels by airplane, train or car as necessary to perform work at another location  + Regularly uses close visual acuity and operates computer equipment to prepare and analyze and transmit data  + Generally works in an office environment  The company offers competitive compensation packages including an incentive compensation plan, comprehensive medical/dental/life insurance, 401(k) and employee stock purchase plans. *_Navigant does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: About the Company Cardiac Science is located in Deerfield, WI and designs, manufactures, and markets Powerheart® automated external defibrillators (AEDs) and related services that facilitate successful deployments. Our guiding principle is to develop automated external defibrillators that are at the heart of saving lives™ – a commitment we take very seriously. Are you ready for the opportunity to say that you save lives every day? Job Role Essential Responsibilities:  Prepares and files financial statements to regulators and financial executives. Performs financial analyses and generates reports and recommendations for management review. Creates reports for Senior Management and other stakeholders  Advises senior management on changes to financial reporting requirements  Studies trends and reports on depreciation, working capital, investments, rates of return, and financial and expense comparisons based on profit and loss statements and income statements  Assists senior level staff with various financial functions such as budgeting, auditing, forecasting and analysis  Perform ongoing analysis of budget variances and expense trends and Ensure management understanding of rate and budget issues  Reviews, classifies, examines and analyzes data and records of financial transactions  Collects and reviews financial data from various sources  Maintains and updates financial databases and spreadsheets, and generates financial reports as required  Creates financial databases and spreadsheets, and generates various financial reports as required  Maintains appropriate records and documentation  Provides assistance to management and customers, interpreting financial reports and identifying and resolving problem areas  Ensures compliance with internal policies and procedures, as well as, government regulations  May interface with auditors and provide audit support to ensure understanding of financial data, methodology and applicability under appropriate regulations  Assists in performing internal audits  May participate in team efforts to improve functioning of the department  Comply with company policies and procedures regarding employee health, safety, and conduct Qualifications Required Qualifications:  3+ years of Financial Analysis experience  Bachelors Degree in Finance (or equivalent combination of education/training and experience)  Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze and solve problems and clearly link financial results to operational performance drivers, generate alternatives and drive positive change  Solid verbal and written communication skills  Excellent attention to detail  Experience with Microsoft Office, especially Excel Benefits/Culture We recognize the importance of taking care of the people who are dedicated to saving lives each and every day they come into work. Our philosophy is based on the belief that every employee is valuable and the development of our people is a key component to the success of Cardiac Science. We work to cultivate leadership, recognize achievement, and provide a rewarding work environment for all of our employees. We are a progressive and evolving organization that is focused on attracting and retaining best-in-class talent. Some of the benefits we offer in our total rewards program are: Medical, Rx, Vision, and Dental InsuranceHealth Saving Accounts with Company paired money up to $1250 on annualized basis.Life and Disability Insurance12 Paid National HolidaysAdditional PTO for vacation timeCompany sponsored events such as a holiday party and summer picnicEqual Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.
